Title:
My wife and I went to Egypt to celebrate our 28th anniversary. We flew Turkish Air 👍 from our home in Miami, FL to Cairo, EG. Within Egypt we booked our flight from Cairo to Luxor and from Luxor to Rome with connection in Cairo on Egyptair👎.

The staff is very rude and they have very poor communication skills. The airline doesn't have much handicap resources. On our trip from Luxor to Cairo international airport we flew on a 737-800 aircraft. Almost at the end of the boarding process, the flight attendant close the forward aircraft door and the aircraft started taxing while passengers were still getting seated.

When we arrived in Cairo for our connection, there were little or no staff help to direct passengers on where to go for their connection. We finally made it to our gate from CAI (Cairo) to FCO (Rome). We were 25mins from take off and nothing was happening at the gate. I walked up to the an male agent at the counter and waiting there for about 8mins and he never once looked at me or attempted to facilitate my question.

I simply walked away after he wouldn't acknowledge me. I also noticed two more passengers walking up to the counter and was treated the same. I will probably never travel on Egyptair in the future. My wife and I travel a lot within the US and international and spend a lot of money on air, hotels and car rental. I hope Egyptair reads these reviews and take take to steps to better improve their services.
crvsd: Shiva Raghunanan wrote a review Yesterday
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I was somewhat concerned reading reviews about bad service, lost luggage etc. However reality turned out to be completely different. Yes, the planes and the amenities are not super modern and high tech but both flights departed and arrived on time, luggage was not lost and delivered promptly, the crew was polite, hospitable and helpful, food was plentiful and tasty, and security procedures put in place are commendable. I wouldn’t hesitate to travel with EgyptAir again. Thank you!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I traveled with them on the Boeing B737-800 from Amman to Cairo ( Flight Number: MS702)
Although the flight was short (about an hour and a half), the level of service on board was more than wonderful, the food on board was very tasty and at the level of five-star service, and although I had recently traveled with Qatar Airways and Cathay Pacific Airlines, I found that the level of food service on board EGYPTAIR is better.
The flight crew was excellent and very nice.
The flight ended with a very smooth landing.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We unfortunately had no choice but to use this airline to fly back from our honeymoon. We chose to do a layover in Egypt to see the pyramids and we could not be happier to be back home. However there were so many hiccups flying back. The washrooms were filthy and not maintained during the flight. There were passengers smoking in the washroom and no flight attendants enforced the no smoking policy. Then during the 7 hour delay due to fog, we were not offered any food nor water. It wasn’t until a passenger started screaming, did they finally go around offering water.

We were starving during this delay, which was no fault on the airline. However they could have offered food and water. I can’t imagine if I was diabetic. Then when we asked for food, they only gave food to Egyptian passengers. It seems there was some discrimination.

I will never fly with this airline again. Nor visit Egypt again for that matter if it means flying with them.
crvsd: Gary Morris wrote a review Nov 26

Title:
I have to admit I chose this airline because it was the cheapest way of getting from a to b so I wasn’t expecting much. However we were delayed for over two hours sitting on the tarmac at Heathrow due to missing our slot after a delay in boarding. This made the connection at Cairo for our onward flight to Johannesburg dicey.

Once onboard the flight crew were dismissive and uninterested. The food was dire and exactly the same on both flights. The inflight entertainment was very limited and yes I know Egypt is an Islamic country, but the drinks offering were completely dry. If Etihad and Emirates can offer a wine menu, so could EGYPTAIR.

The only thing I can say on a positive note is that the legroom was good and both landings were textbook.

Unlikely to choose this airline again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I booked my flight 8 months in advance, so I got a decent price. I have had 3 time changes in the space of two months, I was a travel agent for 7 years so I can deal with that. The last time change, they moved and confirmed my flight from Cairo to Abu Dhabi so it landed after my other flight had already left, I called to fix this and was told it's the only flight, I went on their website and they had plenty, so I called back and three times, everytime I was hung up on, they kept telling me my only option was to cancel, as soon as i mention their flight availability then they'd hang up. Now I have no option but to cancel and rebook something 4 times the price I paid.
I also flew Egypt Air to Luxor and Aswan and their boarding process is just chaos, there is no structure, instead of one line it's just a whole bunch of passengers nearly fighting to get on, so safe to say the boarding took well over an hour and we were an hour and a half delayed. The service on board is non existent regardless if you're in business or not, then they somehow ripped my lock and zipper off my luggage, it had a TSA lock so there's no excuse to not be able to open it, if need be.
I would steer clear of them if at all possible.
qwuub: Worst airline I've ever dealt with
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I would not recommend flying Egyptair unless there was no other option available. I paid to upgrade my seat to "business" class, however as you can see my seat was completely destroyed and disgusting.

There was gum on the armrest which got all over my clothes and the sleeping area was completely ripped apart and everything was filthy. There is clearly no sanitization, cleaning or inspection of the aircraft interior.

Furthermore my remote for the entertainment system did not work. Staff on board are unwilling and unable to help. Post travel customer service is non-existent.

777s are old and in desperate need of an overhaul. Food (including special meal orders) is inedible especially for vegetarians. 0 out of 5 stars and would not recommend.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I had travelled once before with this airline and had an average travel experience so i thought to to try again. The flight was more than one and a half hours late and no one notified the passengers of the delay and what was happening. Safe to say the passengers with connecting flights (me included) were overly anxious. Just before boarding they brought in a group of about 10 families that was very rowdy. In flight, the flight attendants were very overwhelmed and kept skipping people during service and asking for options for meals.

I had purchased two extra bags for a total of 250 USD and one was lost on arrival. I reported to the Swissport office that managed such claims and they assured me that they would be in touch as soon as the bag was found. I had to keep following up, after numerous emails almost 2months later i still haven't received my bag and have little hope for doing so. No one has appeared apologetic or caring for my requests until i make email threats which take forever to be responded to. Now I am following up for a claim for insurance reimbursement from the airline. I have little hope and i wonder how passengers can be protected from such airlines in such a case.
crvsd: Mary G wrote a review Nov 1

Title:

Title:
YOU SKIP THIS HEADS-UP AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Do not ever board Egypt air from UAE to any part of Africa.

By far this has been the most humiliating and embarrassing moment of my travel life as a blogger.

It might cost you a little extra but its worth it choosing other airlines over Egypt air.

Title:
I booked 4 flights with this company, one to Egypt, Cairo from Tunis and 3 within Egypt.

My first flight, Tunis to Cairo was the first problem and the most stressful situation, I was denied boarding.

The reason? My flight to Cairo was with EGYPTAIR, but my return flight was with Aegean. They did not like this, some bull**** company policy. First time EVER IN MY LIFE I HEAR SO RIDICULOUS POLICY. Of course I wouldn’t settle with this crap, I’ve traveled a lot, and see a lot and they would not succeed with their “hidden scam” of making me buy another return ticket with them. So I demanded immediately a supervisor. So the checkin person told me go to the office and complain there, without doing much more.

At the office the guy first reaction was “yeah it is impossible to get into Egypt with different airlines” both need to be EGYPTAIR. I told him that this was nonsense, that they can’t do that. My passport was in order, my VISA was approved, and I had my girlfriend on the same conditions as me, flying from Frankfurt with Lufthansa and returning with Aegean. The guy started checking my documents until he asked “are you European”, and started looking at all the stamps on my passport. So I’m Hungarian. What if I was from somewhere else? Is this discrimination from EGYPTAIR to some people?

Anyway, he started making calls and asking the Egypt or Cairo migrations. He told me go to the checkin and wait there. After 10 minutes he came and my ticket was printed. I don’t know who this guy/supervisor was but without him I don’t think I’d have travel, so thank you!

The whole situation was just unbelievable, I contacted the agency that sold me the tickets and they reacted with “we never heard of such thing”, “they can’t deny boarding if your visa is approved”.

So for me was a happy ending, if you are reading this be prepared to deal with this non-sense policy or choose other airline. Maybe you’d pay a bit more but at least you won’t need to deal with this during your vacations.

At the time writing this, I’m awaiting a response from the booking company which promised me to go deeper into this matter.

Safe travels!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
In our Egypt trip we had booked 6 flights on EGYPTAIR, including international and domestic. And 5 of the 6 flights were a minimum of 20 minutes late. They don’t even announce on the boards that the flights are delayed, they just change the departure times every time and keep it as on time. It’s so bad for international travelers who don’t know the country because our transport in Luxor had left when we arrived and there was no-one willing to help us. Also, the food is really basic on the international leg, we got a roll with 1 slice of cheese for breakfast, like it didn’t even have butter on the roll and the cheese was so small that I was mostly a dry roll. The female air hostesses also need some serious training in people skills, they are simply OBNOXIOUS! I had one literally scream at me for the whole plane to hear that the toilet I was waiting in front of was for Business class only, this was at the end of our flight and my seat was at the front of the economy class section, and throughout the flight other passengers from economy kept using that toilet with no issues. I mean there are no signs either way. But you would never be spoken to like this by hostesses from Qatar, Emirates or Singapore Airlines whose staff are so excellently trained and friendly. I was appalled. I hear other hostesses shouting at other passengers for other things throughout the flight as well, how do you treat your guests in this manner? To make matters worse, the aircon in the plane does not work properly, we were all boiling hot in the 7 hour flight back home trying to fan ourselves and not being able to breathe. I felt like I was on a cheap tour bus honestly.
We only used this airline because it was best for the trip to Egypt, but I will never recommend them or use them again. I will stick to the other brilliant Middle Eastern airlines even if it means I have to travel for a full 24 hours to my destination.
crvsd: Rochelle V wrote a review Sep 2022
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

I thought they were pilots doing some sort of punishments as they seemed to hate their jobs. Of course the plane was a 777 or something like that so it was old and the infotainment system was a disaster. it hardly worked for a start and when iot did there was nothing but old shows and rubbish to watch.
The plane did not have individual aircon and it felt like I was in a Sauna for 12 hours. Being hot as hell they do not offer drinks, only water and juice and only 1ce in a 12 hr flight.
I had to get up, waking the old man next to me, just to get water, and when I asked the guy for water it was like I asked if I could sleep with his wife.
Oh My word what a horrific flight.

Then, flight 2 from Ciro to JHB, the plane was a 787 so it was up market, but we had a 1 hr delay on the plane before take off, with only the captain coming online telling us we have a 15 min delay and he was sorry, well he is quite clearly not aware of how time works.
Again, only male flight attendants and the same thing, we got someones soggy sandwiches for food wrapped in plastic and then no fluids on the plane.
Then offering coffee they ran past us not even giving you a chance to ask, when I did finally catch them, again, I could have been asking to sleep with his wife.

Mornings breakfast was an unbuttered role with a thick slice of cheese and some stale fruit.

I can say in over a thousand flight internationally, this may have been the worst experience in travel in all my years, we will never book EgyptAir, they need to be grounded until they sort these things out and remove these rubbish old men from their planes.
qwuub: Travel cannot get an worse than this - EgyptAir should not be in operation
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: From the check in to boarding, the most miserable staff I’ve come across on any flight. No welcome off the captain, in fact we never heard a word from him the whole flight, we did begin to wonder if there was a pilot on board or was it being flown remotely. If I can avoid flying with them again, I will.

Title: Let no one ever get excited by Egypt air providing hotel accomodation for transit passengers. A family travelling with kids, no consideration whatsoever. And we had to be at the airport the next morning by 6:30am latest. Can someone explain me what the use of the hotel accomodation was to us???? To me this is rather punishment. Most horrible experience I've ever had traveling.

Title:
I was on a vacation with my family consisting of my mother, father and my grandmother. We were on the plane and the doors had closed when my father and I realised something horrific; we forgot the handbag at security check. Unfortunately the plane had already took off, and I had gotten into a panic attack with the staff calming us down especially me, crying hard while my the wonderful stewardess told her they would do everything they can to track the bag down. In the midst of my tears i could hear him say the captain would take matters into their own hands, that reassured me. What also assured me was the measures they told us they’d take and the security services of the airport.
“No one who works here can ever touch an unattended bag, don’t worry we will find it”
I had placed all my faith in God with these words, praying so hard.
The steward and stewardess gave us their numbers so when we land we’d know how to contact them, the security on the plane was on the mission of contacting the head of security in sharm el sheikh airport. After we landed, we were held back a short while for questioning of how the bag looks and its contents. I had them memorised and there were marks that show that it is indeed our bag. We rejoiced when we heard they’d found it and it would be on the next plane to us. I will never forget this experience with EgyptAir and probably might never fly with any agency except there’s. They kept reassuring us and truly helping us calm down and get to the bottom of this. Even checking cameras to see how my father looked and double checking it is indeed him with the bag.
i’ve flown with many agencies before but none have proved this efficient, caring and professional like egyptair did today. I thank them with all my heart.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Check in at Cairo airport was smooth with a very friendly staff , domestic business class lounge was very clean with WiFi , fresh bakeries , sandwiches coffe , tea and more , boarding was smooth, the aircraft was Boeing 737-800 ( new version) very clean and well maintained, I was lucky to fly with captain Heba Darwish ❤️ , very friendly cabin crew, food was very good for 1 hr flight , the return flight check in at sharm el sheikh airport was smooth with a very friendly staff , business class lounge was a partition with a fresh food and polite staff , at boarding they didn't ask for business class passengers for priority boarding, but when I informed the staff they let us pass with priority, aircraft was Airbus A220-300 3 years old aircraft was very clean just need some care for Windows , it has WiFi which worked very well , cabin crew was very good and smiling but need to be more active , food was very good , both flights was on time

Title:
Flew economy from London Heathrow to Cairo and then Business Class on the return leg.

Enjoyed both flights, check in was no hassle on either occasion and the planes were clean and the staff did their jobs. The business class lounge was quite pleasant at Cairo airport and had a relaxed atmosphere.

Had zero issues with baggage at any stage and the booking process worked fine.

Only slight complaint is that we sat at the terminal for almost an extra hour - which was a pain with everyone boarded and ready to go. We were eventually told there was an issue in the luggage area which was no hassles really - just would have been nice to have been told before 45 minutes had already elapsed!

But other than that small hiccup there were no hassles and given the huge network this airline has I'll probably fly with them again.
crvsd: Paul L wrote a review Sep 2022

My advice to everyone, pay extra money for your convenience, it is worthless to travel with EgyptAir as your plans will get missed, and you will have bad times getting ignored by a careless airline team who doesn't understand the basics of customer service and compensation policies.

Title: Great business class price from a two destinations Journey . It was easy to make the booking on Egypt air website . check staff ( from airport not Egyptair ) at Johannesburg airport were late opening checking , slow unprofessional , which impacted the length of time for my pre-flight meal in the business lounge . Onboard crew were welcoming taking time to explain all the seat and light settings . the flatbed seat configuration was comfortable I did manage to get some sleep though I wish other passengers tried to do the same instead of talking . The meal was very good better than other business class service on other European airlines . The flight departed as few minutes early and arrived early  . it was great service going through dedicated business class passport control at Cairo  airport . priority luggage promptly delivered on arrival. Overall it was a good experience well done Egyptair.

Title: I have been flying in aeroplanes for 30 years now (flying more that a dozen different airlines in that time). However the recent experience with Egypt Air was the worst of my life (which includes low cost carriers like Spirit Airways, Air Arabia, etc). During my recent vacation in Egypt, I flew with them 3 times. And it was the common experience all the times. First off, the checkin process (if you can call it that) is a mess.              They dont put the correct flight details in the counters at the airport, so finding them is a challenge in itself. And if you ask anyone for help, it is like you are scolding them and they shout back at you (rudeness of the staff is a common theme with them). Then once you board the aircraft, the experience worsens.               The airplanes themselves are in a bad condition. The entertainment systems do not work. To ask this, I pressed the "Steward help" button and waited. Nobody turned up for 20 minutes. So I walked up to the attendant and asked her what the problem was. She just rudely asked me to go back to my seat and wait. "It will work soon" is what she shouted back. Well it did work, after almost 1 hour that is. And this is on their international route between Cairo and Mumbai.               And this rude behaviour was from all of the staff onboard. The aircraft was almost 45 minutes delayed, and there was no "Sorry for the inconvenience".              And when one child sitting next to me spilled some popcorn on the floor, the attendant came and rudely scolded the boy. And she just pushed the popcorn on the floor to under the seat where the child was sitting.Overall this was the last flight I will ever take on this aircraft. And I would suggest nobody else to book on this carrier again
qwuub: Worst airline experience of my life

Title: PLEASE DO NOT FLY THIS AIRLINE. I cannot state this enough. Please do not. Their flight leaves Nairobi for Cairo everyday at 4.25 am. On July 09, 2022, I arrived at JKIA at 1am, went through check in. The checking officer struggled with her system for a while, but managed to board me for the flight from Nairobi to Cairo which was my connection to Madrid. She did not provide a boarding pass for Cairo to Madrid, her excuse, she couldn't access the systems in Cairo to issue one. BIG RED FLAG! I proceeded to the business lounge. At 3.40am, I stood to go to the gate only to be stopped by the lady at the reception to say that the flight had delayed and would leave at 7am instead. Mad is an understatement. I had no choice, I waited, at 6.30 am, headed to the gate and we boarded. Their business class is not anything close to it. It's economy with bigger seats. They served a glass of fruit juice. At this point, I only wanted to reach Cairo. We arrived and of course the connection flight had left. They said that is such nonchalant way that it's just baffling that they're still in business. They catered for all the costs and we caught our flight the next day to Madrid. Did I add the racism? Since we're black, it meant we couldn't afford business class, right, the boarding officer came around in Cairo looking at us saying that economy class queue was the other one. I, of course, knew why we were being picked out of the crowd. Same old same old. Old aircraft, bad bad (profanity) business class and overall bad service. To say that I WILL NEVER USE EGYPT AIR EVER AGAIN, is an understatement. I wish I could say it in Klingon as well. THE BOTTOM OF THE BARREL (profanity)!!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Most people who work for Egyptair really try to help, but a lot are limited by the organization that makes things weird.
The plane out of NBO was delayed by almost 3 hours and most people would miss their connecting flight. The Nairobi staff could not make decisions, but had to wait for Cairo instructions. But Cairo was overwhelmed and didn't react to calls, creating unnecessary angst. Just before departure, most of us got a solution, which we accepted by that time. Arriving in Cairo, the staff from Transfer desk and Customer service were very helpful and put me up at "le Passage" for 22 hours. The next day, I took my flight to Brussels. The plane was quite new and I was looking forward to watching a film, after having spent 18 out of the las 22 hours sleeping. I requested earphones, but the staff said that they were unavailable for economy class. How weird is that?
In conclusion: I will forget this experience, but I feel sad for the people who have to work for such a strange organization, which seems to be too top down. It must be very frustrating for their staff.

Lesson learned: Egyptair - never again.

Title:
I have traveled the world with multiple international airlines but this is one of the worst flying experiences I ever had in my life. Everything from getting the boarding pass, to customer care, to taking the flight, to transit at Cairo airport is the worst experience. They are not bothered about passengers.

I am a vegetarian and emailed them to pls arrange for veg meals on flights but nothing was done.

I tried to call the call center in London and no one answered the call for 25 minutes. Finally, I hung up.

I requested the staff issue boarding pass, at the boarding gate and also the hostess inside bit all went on deaf ears. Though the hostess on the other aircraft (Cairo to Dubai) accommodated my request because she was willing to help not like all her other counterparts.

My Flight from London to Cairo was delayed for more than 1 and a half hours and I had a transit flight from Cairo to Dubai. I told this to multiple hostesses on the flight and everyone assured me that it will be taken care of and someone will assist as soon as I land in Cairo. But to my worst nightmare, no one helped. Help is very far no-one was even willing to answer properly. I was on my own running at the airport as only I was bothered that I shud not miss my flight. Noone else. Bad staff bad people, worst airline.

The Check-in gate at London was hell. It took passengers more than an hour to drop off their luggage. What's the point of doing web check in? Their luggage escalators were not working. They put all luggage in front only and it was looking like a fish market. Passengers had trouble even walking there but they were not bothered. Highly untrained and non-empathic staff.

The same thing happened at boarding gates. Passengers were treated like a herd of cattle. Kids are crying but they are not bothered. This is the only airline in the world I have seen who doesn't let families with kids go first inside the aircraft.
Poor parents gave to be in queue with crying kids.

Lastly, they missed my luggage in Cairo during transit. How careless an Airline can be? I didn't receive my luggage at the belt and was delivered 2nd day despite a promise of same-day delivery. Honestly, they were not bothered. I didnt get any help from anyone at any step. Even D-nata is not bothered

All in all, I will never recommend this airline to any traveler unless it is absolutely necessary.

Title:
Solo female traveller. I had an Easter holiday trip all booked from Abu Dhabi to Cairo, round trip tour from Cairo and then stopping off in Sharm El Shekh for a week with return flight from SS to AD.

Went to check in at AD airport to be told that check in had closed despite the people in front of me still checking in and it not yet being the given time for last checkin. I tried to make this clear to staff and was told no. I ended up having to book with a different airline.

Internal flight from Cairo to SS was fine, but unexpected stop at Hurgadha which then confused my pick up people who were left waiting at SS airport for two hours wondering where I was. No notification and no announcements made prior to checking in.

When going to take return flight from SS, I arrived at airport to be told that airline has cancelled my flight. Was given no warning but reason given was that I was ‘no show’ at AD airport on outward journey. Didn’t get told anything or sent any notification that return journey had subsequently been cancelled. I was left at SS airport alone, with no access to cards to book a flight again online (verifications needed by AD phone number) and two smiling check in attendants asking for my cards to rebook the flight without explaining first the situation with what I had already booked.

I booked a single flight from SS to Cairo so that I could arrange for someone to help me further when I got there. The treatment at Cairo airport was appalling. No help offered, people shoving past me, two security guards hassling me for my boarding passes and taking passport off me and holding for long periods numerous times in the interest of ‘checks’.

In the end I booked with airarabia but such a shame as the rest of my visit to Egypt had been fantastic and had felt safe as a solo traveller. Will not be using airline or Cairo airport ever again.

qwuub: Will not be using this airline again!

Title:
The toilet was filthy, and I was the first passenger to use it immediately after take off. It had not been cleaned at all and there’s was dirty tissue paper on the floor. Complete indifference and borderline aggression from the crew, enough to put me off asking for some water for the 4 hours I was on board.

This is not the first issue I’ve had with this airline. Last year, my Covid test results were delayed and I needed to reschedule my flight on Saturday. Nobody answers the phone, no customer service over the weekend. I even tried calling them in Cairo and couldn’t get through! I resigned to the idea of going all the way to Heathrow to try and find someone to speak to but luckily my test results were emailed to me in good time.

Not to mention the poor quality of the food, stale bun and menu that hasn’t changed in over 15 years.

It is beyond me how this airline charges the prices they do and how they’re still surviving. Do better!

Title:

We were scheduled to be on the flight from Bahrain-Cairo-Johannesburg last night MS921 but we denied access because of a PCR test. Title: I don't usually write reviews, but I think I have to warn people about the awful customer service they will experience if they fly Egypt Air. I recently flew with Egypt air during a trip with family. We were meant to have five flights: one from the US to Cairo, two from Luxor to Amman, and two to get us back to the US. Before our trip, we were notified that the second flight from Luxor to Amman had been cancelled, and we had been rebooked for a flight five hours later. Because it was a connecting flight, this meant we had a layover five hours longer than we had planned. We were given no reason why our flight had been cancelled, no apology for the change, and no compensation offer. While this was frustrating as it changed our travel plans, we did not complain. However, in the middle of our trip, we were notified that the first of our flights back to the US had been cancelled, and we were rebooked for a different flight 2 DAYS later. Note that the second, connecting flight, was still booked for the original date and egypt air had not changed that. Again, there was no explanation, apology, or compensation. After hours (of vacation time) spent on the phone with and in the offices of Egypt air, we learned that both our cancelled flights were cancelled simply because they were not fully booked. Egypt air said the only thing they could do was refund the cost of the flight that we had not yet used (the return flight). This could not possibly cover us booking flights with a different airline for our original date, as this happened only a week before we were flying and all flights were more expensive at that point. Egypt air refused to provide housing for us or rebook us on another carrier. I’m not sure how they expected us to make our connecting flight that was still for the original date. In addition to all of this, at the airport, we approached an Egypt air help desk to ask about our flights and try to get compensation. After being ignored for several minutes by 6 agents not doing any other work, we were finally helped. However, in the middle of us talking, the agent took a cell phone call and ignored us again. Finally, we were told they could not help us at that desk, the only desk that we could be helped at was outside the terminal (which we couldn’t get to), but they couldn’t do anything anyway so not to bother. Overall, this was by far the worst flying experience any of us have ever had. Horrendous customer service. Egypt air has guaranteed that none of us will ever be flying with them again, and I urge anyone else who wants even a halfway decent flying experience to avoid Egypt air at all cost.
qwuub: The worst flying experience I've ever had
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I rarely write reviews, especially negative ones, but this review needed to be written. EgyptAir is the absolute worst airline I have ever experienced. Staff that absolutely don’t care about travelers. I’m absolutely disgusted by the way I was treated. I had a flight from Luxor to Alexandria via Cairo. I showed the attendant my boarding passes while checking in my bags. He told me that the boarding passes were no longer relevant because the flight changed. Without any explanation of what actually changed. Then he gave me boarding passes to Cairo only, and marked my luggage to arrive in Cairo. I stopped him and tried to explain that I’m going to Alexandria. He corrected me and said that I’m mistaken. That my flight was only to Cairo. I explained that I have proof I have two legs on EgyptAir from Luxor to Cairo and then from Cairo to Luxor. He insisted that I was wrong, despite the ticket I presented. Then another attendant started searching for my ticket at the next counter over after seeing how frustrated I was. New information emerged. My flight from Cairo to Alexandria was apparently canceled and I had supposedly received an email. No email was received. The attendant then proceeded to explain that I needed to stop in Cairo, pick up my luggage and then file a complaint. No attempt to book me on an alternative flight was made or secure accommodations for me. I’ll be landing at night, around 9pm. I don’t live in Cairo, and don’t have a hotel reservation there. I argued that this isn’t how airlines should handle cancelations. I asked to speak to a manager, and Mr Kamal Mohammad Ahmed (my attempt at reading the scribbled name he gave on a torn piece of paper), the first attendant, ridiculed me by saying he’s the manager and that there is nothing further to discuss. Just like those comedy shows where everyone is the manager. I picked up my boarding pass to Cairo and walked away. I felt humiliated. I felt ashamed to be an Egyptian. I felt disgusted by the staff at EgyptAir. So much for Egyptian hospitality. I plan to drive from Cairo to Alexandria. I will be making no attempts at booking another flight with them. In any event, be careful when booking and safe travels!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
For my vacation to Egypt I flew Egypt Air from Johannesburg to Cairo, Cairo to Aswan, Hurghada to Cairo, and Cairo back to Johannesburg. Great experience on all FOUR of my flights. Leading up to my trip, I’d read terrible reviews about Egypt Air- people had lost luggage, damaged luggage, delayed flights, unpleasant staff experiences… I experienced NONE of those things.

My bags, which I checked through on every flight, were never lost. Damage to the bags was minimal. Staff at check in and even on the flights was friendly and helpful. Only on one of my flights was there a flight attendant who wasn’t as helpful as the others. All of my flights arrived and landed on time. The planes were perfectly fine. I flew economy.

Seats comfortable enough for a ten hour flight
Food OK. Bland but enough for a meal
Stewards don’t all understand English. Can’t object to that. This is not an American airline.
Seats in the 40’s not over the wing so you can see more

Entertainment system a little funky. Touch screens didn’t always respond. Navigation could be more intuitive. There is not a great range of movies. Enjoyed West Side Story.

Plane arrived within 30 minutes of ETA.

I easily bought a oneway way ticket $551 USD purchased the day before flight. All seat selections had some price, but not exhorbitant. $15 for a window seat.

I had to reload website a few times to get it to work. The date function on the first screen does not always work.

The day of the flight the website stated that they do not have updates on departure time. That is an easy to develop and useful function for flyers.

Overall a good experience in contrast to what I expected from all the negative reviews.
qwuub: Pleasantly surprised/ better than I had expected
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Absolutely terrible. Worst 10h 20 mins of my life. I asked for water several times for 2 hours straight, I felt like I was gonna faint. They kept telling me they were coming back and never came back. Don't get me started on the bacteria, stains and dirt everywhere. I had to clean everything myself. The flight attendants always seemed like they hated their job, except for one of the male flight attendant. Some movies and music to watch and listen. There's no wifi on the plane. I appreciated the packets they gave that had socks, wipes, toothbrush and sanitiser, but thats about it. The pilot freaking landed so bad, it felt like it had crashed, everyone was off balance. Now, arriving to the airport was just confusing, there were such vague signs of where to go for what. I needed my visa and I did not know where to go, the visa sign was what seemed like 1,000 steps away from where the actual place to get your visa was. We got there at 5 am they took 2 hours till they brought back my luggages, everyone was waiting for so long, some were still there after I got my luggages. Again no wifi in the airport. To give you advice, please improve your airline, stop neglecting travellers because you are not only losing customers, but you're making Egypt look bad. Title:
I took an 11 hour non-stop flight from John F. Kennedy Airport in New York to Cairo International Airport, and then back from Cairo to JFK almost a week later. Never have I had such an utterly miserable experience with an airline as this one.

I tried to call to help schedule my flight and then to confirm it. They never answered their phones either time. The flight times of both the departure and the return trip were changed without me being notified. I was not wearing a mask when boarding the departure due to the United States mask requirement for public transit no longer being in effect, but I was not allowed to board the flight without a mask and was told by an airline worker at the gate that masks were mandatory. "It will be better for you," he said to me, quite obnoxiously. However, on the flight, several flight attendants were not wearing masks. I eventually took my mask off, along with more than half of the other passengers, and nobody said anything. The flight departed for Cairo 90 minutes late. No explanation was given to the passengers.

The return flight was also terrible. A relative of mine called to confirm the departure time. Unlike me, he managed to get through and speak to someone on the phone. However, the person refused to verify the departure time unless the call came within 24 hours of departure. That does not make any sense to me. On the flight itself, the cabin was very warm and we were given an insufficient amount of water. I was told to close my window almost immediately after takeoff. That was ridiculous. It was a day time flight and hardly anybody was trying to sleep. If someone elsewhere on the plane was trying to sleep, they would probably have been able to do so simply with the lights of the plane turned off. I opened the window a crack so that I could read and then was told to close it, again, even though hardly anyone anywhere on the plane was attempting to sleep. I was later told to open the window before arrival. For what reason, I wonder? There were children on the flight playing a computer game without earbuds and with the volume turned on. Several flight attendants walked right by it and did nothing. It wasn't until another passenger got up to complain that something was finally done about it. Me having a window open a crack to read was a problem, but this wasn't, apparently. The flight took off about half an hour late, but was somehow still early. On both flights, announcements were made in Arabic and English. This ought to be expected, as I was travelling between an English-speaking country and an Arabic-speaking country. However, for some reason, there was one announcement made on the return flight which was made only in Arabic.

These people don't care about their customers. They are terrible. Only fly EgyptAir if there are absolutely no other choices.
crvsd: William P wrote a review May 2022
qwuub: Two-way 11 hour flight between New York and Cairo

Title:
Let me start by saying you definitely do not care about your travellers and definitely not about customer service.

I had been travelling with EgyptAir several times and every time something goes wrong, but this last trip was just the deciding factor to avoid your Airline as much as possible and try to let people know about it.

On Friday, 6th May I had a flight booked from Hurgada to Cairo ( MS 049, scheduled for 20.40 ) and then to Duba ( MS 910, scheduled for 22:45 ).

Because of the delay of the first flight from Hurghada to Cairo, we have arrived in Cairo a delay and after waiting for customs to actually appear on yet another security check to enter International Departures, running to the F5 gate, and actually arrived there to find your staff laughing at me that Aiport doors are closed and I need to wait for another flight, which was scheduled to 5.35 in the morning hours of 7th May.

Of course, they have sent me to the wrong information desk and after finally reaching the Customer information desk on the level below, a very rude employee shouted at me that I am not entitled to anything not even a basic voucher for food or drink like it was my fault that I missed the flight. All of the people seating there doing nothing just being on their mobile phones were willing to do anything about it. He said I need to get to Immigration to get my stamp cancelled and leave the International space to go talk to the Customer Centre of Egypt Air in the outside office of Terminal.

After the heated argument, I got my new boarding ticket and headed to the Lounge where I paid 40$ for the worst service and selection of food and drinks possible. Internet speed was the only good thing.
To my surprise there was a couple coming on the same flight from Hurghada, they did not pay for the lounge, they got complimentary food from outlets outside Lounge, and they were fluent in Arabic.

Boarding the morning flight was OK and after coming to Dubai, of course, my luggage was not on the flight, DNATA services ( DXBMS95140 ) could not even trace it and advised me to wait for the next flight in the afternoon. Of course, again, the luggage was not there and only got information that my luggage came with the flight on Sunday morning, I finally received my luggage on 8th May at 23.15.

Definitely, I was treated as bad as possible, your airport staff do not even have basic English knowledge or any kind of customer service skill, definitely would make a difference if I would speak Egypt Arabic but at International Terminal you should have people with some common sense to at least pretend to be nice.

EgyptAir does not care and I am avoiding it in future definitely.

Title: My wife and I arrived at Cairo Airport on 4th May at 1300 hrs for our flight at 16.35. After arriving at the head of the security queue, before being even allowed to get to check-in, we were told by the police our flight had been cancelled and to go to Customer Service at the far end of the concourse. After queueing there for about 15 mins we eventually got to the head of the queue to be told the flight wasn't cancelled but was delayed to 0300. No explanation was given. After waiting a further 40 mins, we were told we would be taken to a nearby hotel and to return at midnight. We were  bussed to a Novotel and allocated a basic room where the tv didn't work. We were told someone would come to see to it when they were less busy. No one came. At midnight we took the shuttle bus back to the airport. Exactly the same happened again, ending up at Customer Services after being sent there by the police. Again we could not get any explanation for what was happening. Eventually we were told the flight would go ahead at 0500 that day (5th May). At that point we were told the police would let us through, but even then confusion reigned until the police got the message and we proceeded through to check-in. As 0500 neared we were informed our flight was delayed yet again to 0600. We were allowed onto the plane at 0530; but did not take off until 0700. This was a total of 19 hours from first arriving at Cairo Airport until take-off. When we got home I complained to EgyptAir: their "Care Team" apologised, but still gave no explanation and offered a discount of 30% off my next international flight within 12 months. As this was intended to be our last long-haul flight due to age, health and other reasons, I said that the offer, though appreciated, could not be accepted and asked for some monetary compensation. This was refused. I strongly urge anyone considering flying Egypt Air in future to think again and use them only as a last resort.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew from Johannesburg South Africa to the Netherlands with my transit being in Cairo Egypt.
The flight was fine, food was not good at all, raisins in lasagna and unflavoured chicken with rice isn't really my thing, however that I could handle.

Upon arrival at my final destination (Amsterdam) I waited 1. 5hours at the baggage belts( the only on left from the flight) awaiting my luggage, my suitcase NEVER arrived!
I reported the "delayed" luggage immediately and was told it would be delivered to my home address within 1-2 days.

After 3 days, I checked the Worldwide tracker, where details of your luggage was loaded on and you can see if there has been anything found, still nothing... keeping in mind that literally all of my clothes, toiletries and sentimental stuff and camera is in the bag! PANIC! I did relocate to the Netherlands so pretty much everything I needed was in there!

I called and sent emails regularly, the only response is wait until 21 days and keep invoices of items bought so I can be compensated later... people at the airport in Amsterdam had told me that the chances of finding my luggage decrease as the days go by (we're at day 12 at this point) how does this airline expect you to magically catch money from the sky to go on shopping sprees for underwear, work clothes, shoes and make-up???

Like, I'm baffled!

I'm all the rage for cheap flights, but WOW! I will definitely throw the coin going forward.

Yes! This could happen to any airline but atleast have some dignity about it, show EMPATHY and try to be a responsible airline.

It's been 12 days, and nothing! If anyone has experienced this with this useless and embarrassing airline please let me know! Or if you have an idea of what I can do next please feel free to email me at; que.anissa30@gmail.com.

Please spend the extra cash on an airline that will help you when they actually mess things up and not sit back and make it look like its normal for your valuables to go missing when its within their control. I am beyond upset over this.

Title:
I recently flew EgyptAir from Dubai to Canada via Cairo. My experience with them has been stressful/ traumatic at best.
During the 1st leg of the trip, at Dubai airport, Egyptair check-in staff (they're from an outsourced company called Dnata) took my phone to verify my COVID vaccination proof and ArriveCan forms and never bothered to return it. As the phone was not in my line of sight, after a bit of back and forth with the woman on my trip and baggage info, I forgot to ask her to hand me my phone back. I then proceeded to Security check, immediately realized I don't have my phone on me. This was like within 10 minutes from when I left the check-in desk in Terminal 1, Area-2. I requested to talk to the police, hoping who may be able to escort me out back to check-in desk to retrieve my phone. But the security woman on duty was downright rude, and yelled at me asking me to go to the boarding gate and then report it at Lost & Found (you have to take a train to get there. Very far way from the check-in desk). At this point, I knew this was getting nowehere.
Without a choice, I hopped on the train, proceeded to boarding gates, located Lost & Found and reported there. They called some numbers and said there's no phone found anywhere. I took the L&F person's number and kept it touch with him from my business cell phone (luckily I was carrying it). I had an hour to board at that point of time, and hoped I may get it back.
When the EgyptAir staff got to the boarding gate half hour prior to boarding time, I let them know the situation. Again, nobody tried to help. They just said the check-in desk is closed and they don't know how to follow-up on this. Also, I was told they'd check Vaccine proof and ArriveCan again in Cairo, so it is not a good idea to travel without them there. I did have a copy of those on my business phone, though no hard-copies.
Long story short, Lost & Found updated me that nobody handed over such a phone to them, and EgyptAir has no idea about these check-in staff as they're from an outsourced company called Dnata. Their staff seemed inexperienced from the way they were conducting business. Probably experienced workers were replaced with newbies for cost savings.

Moral of the story: Please do not rely on your mobile device for important travel documents.
Even if it's a momentary slip on your part, when something valuable is lost at Dubai airport, no one - Airport staff, EgyptAir, Check-in staff - will do their part to help you with the situation. You'd be stuck in a limbo in places like Cairo where there's no free wi-fi (sms passcode was never sent to an international number) or an option to pay for wifi, if you don't readily have Vaccine Proof, PCR and other covid related documents. The officials may treat you with suspicion if you tell them you lost your phone with these myriad forms, rather than trying to help you.

Be extremely careful with your belongings including gadgets and travel documents at Dubai Airport. You'd be in for unpleasant surprises once things get lost.

qwuub: Phone lost at EgyptAir check-in desk in DXB

Title: I flew them as I had no choice!  Believe me I would not have bothered otherwise.  Direct flight to Cairo easiest option.  Cheap.  Staff were very unfriendly and rude.  Really poor customer service.  Planes were very basic.  I was not expecting anything five star anyway.  Reasonably clean.  Food was awful and bland.  Thrown at you.  If you did not make eye contact with the staff, you may not get a meal as they assume you don't want it!  Might be a good thing as it was awful!  Limited choice of drinks including very sweet juice.  Limited in-flight entertainment.  Leg room was not great and seats were tight.  Thank god, as I had a seat by the window, the middle seat was empty and then there was a gentleman on the isle seat who decided to pick his nose the entire flight!  On my return flight where I had to change with no choice from Luxor to Cairo and then to London, the flight was delayed which meant I missed my connection and ended up landing in London nearly ten hours later!  Annoying.  The only good thing they did was put me and the other people in a nice hotel in Cairo Airport with a free meal.  This was the only well managed part!  To be honest, I would have rather been home earlier.  If you are desperate as I said and want a direct quick flight to Egypt.  Flight time from the UK to Egypt is short so this was fine.  I would not do a long flight with them.  They also have a bad safety record and planes are quite old which made me nervous.
qwuub: If you are really desperate and want a direct flight to Egypt!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I'm back and forth between 3 and 4 stars here. I was concerned when I read prior reviews but glad to say my experience was better than the consensus. In Egypt as well they saw the QR code and ignored it (bring some written proof of test date!). Food was good both ways, not great. Flight crew was friendly, when they were available. The in-flight entertainment was outdated. Hopefully you can sleep on your overnight, lack of legroom made that difficult. In flight they turn off the seat belt much earlier than usual flights. Seat map was 3-3-3 both ways.

Title:
Everyone has that ONE place that always wanted to go. Place they dreamed about their entire life. Egypt was that place for me. Seeing the pyramids , swimming in the Nile, my childhood dreams, finally were about to become reality. JOURNEY OF A LIFETIME I told my friends. As they sighed in envy wishing they could join. Everyone wanted “ton of pictures and videos “ and of course a piece from the Grand Pyramid. As I started searching for airline options, Egypt Air seemed to be the perfect fit. Direct flight out of JFK. I get to experience the culture and the language even on the plane. It is part of Star Alliance, which meant I can use some of my 1.3 MILLION miles to upgrade! Is googled the number and called the NY office immediately. After waiting on hold for 2.5 hours finally someone answered. I asked her how so can purchase a ticket and use my miles to upgrade. She told me the steps, I paid $2400 dollars for an upgradable Economy ticket , got my confirmation number and hang up. I then called United Airlines to upgrade. Entire process took less then 10 minutes. I am done ! Well, so I thought.

Fast forward to September , original tickets were purchased in July for December 26th departure, I call Egypt Air back. I am trying to confirm my flight and pick seats but the system will not let me. Same person from the first time answered the phone after another 1 hour and 45 minutes wait. By the way , I am pretty sure she is the ONLY person who works in that office. She said “ I do not see your reservation at all. Must have been canceled. “ After my heart skipped couple of beats, I asked .. How could that be possible ? She blamed UNITED and told me not to worry! We just have to repeat the same process all over one more time. So we do …. Nope. It’s not over ! December comes and I want confirm my ticket and my reservation one more time. YES. You are right ! System once again lost my entire reservation after multiple e mails from Egypt air confirming flight and upgrade. Now I am in complete panic mode. I am literally supposed to fly in 10 days !

Does anyone want to guess her response ? If you are thinking she is about to say “ Don’t worry we just have to repeat the process one more time “ you are CORRECT but there is a caveat, they no longer have upgradable seats. I have to fly Economy… I ask for a manager , who seemed to be on vacation repeatedly every other day , he gets on the phone and says I need to contact the main office in Cairo. They very next day, he forwards me an e mail from Cairo stating there is NOTHING they can do because it’s a system issue. I called him back as soon as I finished reading the e mail, no response. So call the main office back to ask for him and the same person told me he was on vacation AGAIN !! His system must have automatically forwarded the e mail. Who knows considering how terrible their entire system seems to be. Finally I call United. They take over the issue and fix it. It’s December 26. It’s THE DAY. I arrived at the airport with incredible excitement having forgotten about all the countless problems. I go through the line , get to the gate and there is a 2 hour delay. OK. Fine no big deal right ? We are all used to airport delays.. I am not going to let a minor delay ruin my dream vacation !! NO WAY. Remember, UNITED fixed the issue got me a window seat in Business class from the very front of the cabin .. REMEMBER? Well my assigned seat was a middle seat , next to new born baby and the very last possible row in the business class. As I started to wonder, is this a message from above ? Is GOD telling me NOT to go on this journey ? I see bunch of flight attendants and supervisor , obvious from the way they were dressed, I run over there to explain my dilemma. Frustration and at this point pure anger obvious from my behavior and attitude , one of them says. “ Do not worry , I will get someone for you”. Boarding process ends. Cabin door locks. No one shows up. This might have been the only vacation I have ever started crying in disappointment. Disappointment in how an airline representing EGYT , a bucket list destination for many around the world , can so clueless and careless about WHAT THIS VACATION MEANS. Not JUST for me but for millions who visit ? How can they not understand THEY set the tone for what is to come ? How can they be so indifferent to a nightmare they created ?

So dear friends, my journey of a lifetime unfortunately became the biggest nightmare I have ever had in 20 years of travel.

Take my advice. Find ANY OTHER WAY to get to Egypt. At least they won’t be able to ruin your dreams.

By the way , 11 hour flight , they had NO WI-FI service and brought out plastic utensils in Business class. I know I could not believe it either so I took pictures. Enjoy them.

Title: I think my title says all. Having travelled in 52 countries and total having done 179 flights before using Egyptair I was struggling to find something that was a serious issue in any of them. Finally this week i used Egyptair for the first time in my life and unfortunately 4 times in a week because of the needs of my trip. My review might be long but worth to read it as to know what you are about to face. On the first flight from Athens to Egypt one passenger as we were waiting at the bus to take us to the aircraft went out and light a cigarette. Crazy!! The aircraft was old, dirty and a total mess inside from the passengers because staff didnt care to say or to do anything. Not any announcement from the pilot either on departing or landing or during the flight. This first flight delayed almost 20 minutes and the so called food was bad quality of empty sandwich, no coffee, no tea. The second flight from Cairo to Aswan we had to pass so many controls that they didnt know what they want, they were asking different things in every control and staff of the airport those with red shirts asking for money to pass you from the control. Be aware of them. Staff very rude. They didnt check electronic devices or liquids but their problem was our shoes. The aircraft was the only new one that we used but were flies roaming inside. First time in my life happened this. The flight delayed for 20 minutes again and only water was served. The airport of Aswan was old and no staff to assist you if you needed anything. Luggages delayed also. On the third flight from Luxor to Cairo the only good thing was the airport of Luxor which was new one but the same mess situation with the control. At the gate was noone most of the time and 25 minutes before the scheduled take off nobody said anything and suddenly announced a 40 minutes delay on an airport with two flights only!!! At the gate was passing everyone during that time with any control or security. Finally when we entered the aircraft we realised again that it ws again old and dirty and you might guess it with flights inside. There happened something extremely crazy thing. Passengers they argue that they didnt like the seat and they didnt want to sit, shelves abpve us where open, many were standing and the aircraft started to taxi. A completely chaos. Local passengers were talking on phones without anyone saying anything. Finally on last flight there was an adventure. On the fisrt control they took us back and forth 4 times trying to find if we had something on us without reason and still the guys with the red asking for money. After we finally passed the first control, the check in lady was very rude asking to connect our phones on the internet which cairo airport didnt give us access because we are tourists. then was the second control which they send us back to fill a form that noone said we had to fill it before. then was a third control right after the second. Why? Proceeding to the gate a staff member of a restaurant literally begged for money. Then it was a fourth control and after this a fifth. All rude and talking arabian only. Finally we reached the gate were again was noone there even 30 minutes before the flight and ofcourse many people passing the dorr of the gate again. Suddenly we saw some staff coming and we were amazed that we will not have delay. No not at all. When we entered aircraf the same total mess situation, flies again, old and dirty aircraft and then as door closed they opened them again for other passengers and on that time they started to load the luggage and some othe packages by throwing them, some of them also fell down but they were laughing. The delay was again 20 minutes, food again was crap. This company is the worse of all that I have traveled. I hope that I will not need to use it again. Many things have to change especially on their attitude and mentallity.

Title: I was in Egypt when Canada banned flights from Africa due to Omicron.  My flight to Toronto was cancelled.  Egyptair was very accommodating and switched my flight to arrive at JFK in New York so that I could return home through the United States.  I ended up in the Cairo airport at the gate with what I had researched as the recommended PCR Covid test but the United States had changed the rules to the 24 hour Antigen test the day before and unfortunately I was unaware.  I was denied boarding due to the new rule.  Egyptair booked me on the next flight in two days and did not charge me to change it again for me despite it being due to the test error.  All of the staff at the airport were so helpful.    I have flown Egyptair for years and have always found them to be pretty good but this time they really went above and beyond to help me in this frustrating and stressful situation.  I can't say enough about how great they were!

Title:
I had the worst experience ever with Air Egypt and I highly DO NOT recommend it as an airlines.
I was travelling with my 2 and half year old baby to USA via Air Egypt from Lebanon; I have called the airlines 2 days prior my flight and they have confirmed that my son doesn’t need a PCR test for the flight. (The call is recorded and can be checked by Air Egypt)
While checking in, I was astonished that a PCR test is required for kids under 2 years old and I was obliged to take my son outside of the airport without any car seat with a complete stranger to do the PCR and have the result on time in order to catch my flight.
After all the rush, our flight was delayed for 1 hour in Beirut.
On our way back, I was shocked; I have received a phone call from my husband in Beirut telling me that our connection flight from Cairo to Beirut having a layover of 3 hours was cancelled and the first available flight from Cairo to Beirut was after 10 hours .
Imagine having a 13 hours delay in an airport with a kid! I was once again forced to buy another ticket with another airline to avoid w huge layover of 13 hours that I had no fault in it.
The travel agency has filed a claim hoping for refund but till today I haven’t received any reply.
crvsd: christelle E wrote a review Dec 2021

Title:
To whom it might concern,

My name is Zorana Vucicevic, my booking reference is 24CFI2 and on November 16th I had flight with your company from Budapest to Cairo, and then from Cairo to Jeddah.

They refused me when they checked my passport. Gentlemen from their office upstairs get down and said I can not go because there is some big restrictions for travellers going from Cairo to Jeddah.

My husband in Jeddah wanted to make some arrangement for me to land there. But it did not work out.

Later on, gentlemen said I did not have PCR ready and that is the reason they refused me and everywhere said even on web page and my visa restrictions it is enough to have vaccine or PCR up to 72 hours before flight.

Budapest office is offering me new ticket and they said it is going to be free of charge but I get bill on $120 for exchange of ticket.

Route is the same Budapest Cairo Jeddah but honestly I do not feel safe with your company it is super unprofessional what happened to me on airport and now you asking for more money.

I have AirBnb reservation too and I can not cancel it, so I payed for no reason and I lost money here too, then on my transportation from Osijek to Budapest and back.

Title: My experience flying in business class, on my outbound flight on EgyptAir, was disappointing to say the least.  I was expecting a friendly, inviting atmosphere, however it seemed to me the attendants were more interested in sitting and talking amongst themselves than attending to their customers.  They literally ran to their gathering place to continue talking and sitting.   Not one time did anyone greet us personally, I asked for a menu of the meals, which is typically already at your seat on international flights, and was told it was coming.  Instead food in aluminum containers marked A, B and C were served from a rolling cart.  Do you want chicken, beef, etc.  I was stunned.  The place setting was amateurish! I forgot, no place setting.  I understand caution with COVID but the service wasn't even from training class 101.  My return flight was much better, service, smiles, food and settings.  Sorry, if there is a next time I will fly your competitor.

Title:
Flying to Egypt had been my 40th country I've visited in the past 10 years. I say this in order for you to be aware that I have been on numerous flights, coming and going on various airlines.

My flight home from Cairo was horrendous. I have never been on a flight where Flight Attendants were so lackluster.

Many people on the flight were not wearing their masks and were not approached by the staff to rectify. There was complete disregard for any of their COVID regulations. As more of an annoyance, one person's alarm went off for a series of minutes, to the point where I had time to get up and ask the Flight Attendant to address the issue, alas I was deflected.

As we were approaching landing, there were 4 people in scope from my seat who were not in their seats (three in a row were missing, left their backpack in the one seat, and showed up after we landed - where could they have been??) One family, with two young boys, were in the row near me and weren't even seated during landing!

Upon landing, there was no tray check, no seat belt check, no reclining and armchair check, no walkway clearance, nor was there a garbage pick up - all of these are fine reasons to not recommend your airline. Egyptair clearly has very little concern for the safety of your passengers.

As we were deplaning, I was disgusted by the amount of trash left behind on the flight. There was very little regard for passenger's comfortability, with the complete lack of removing garbage from peoples seats.
crvsd: Katie P wrote a review Sep 2021
qwuub: Horrendous - lack of care for health and safety of their passengers

Title: Here I tell my experience today with EgyptAir, as usual: Not the cheapest company, of course, and it is definitely the most expensive. I have a very important commitment in Cairo for one and half day and I have no time to drive to Cairo for 7 hours and go back 7 hours and alone, so I booked a flight from Sharm to Cairo, The flight time was supposed to be 3:25 in the afternoon, and arrive one hour later, I got surprised when I arrived to the airport that the flight was delayed to be at 4 pm without and notice, At 3:55 in the afternoon we got on the bus and moved to the plane and stood on the front of the stairs, after 5 minutes locked in the bus and we would die from the heat, the bus back to the gate again, when I asked why we back they told me the Cabten ask engineer to check the plane, what they didn’t checked yet  I asked the counter of EgyptAir to register my complaint in the presence of the tourism police and without any interest or consideration for anything and in a very bad manner. He told me to go outside the gate and lock for it and do what you want to do. I asked the gate guard to ask the tourism police in the airport hall to come to see him and of course without any  Attention and procrastination in the hope that I will be bored and forget and walk away, I called police emergency on 122, and the world turned in one minute. The airport police, tourism, the official of EgyptAir and the official of civil aviation all attended and tried to reconcile the matter, claiming that is normal, but with my insistence the airport officer say its your right and he brought me a paper and wrote my complaint and it was registered in five minutes and they stopped the last bus for a while  until I finished everything, The take-off was supposed to be 3:25 pm, and the plane actually take-off at 4:55 pm.Also all Egypt air stuff in the airport and the flight attendant don’t ware face masks and the safety procedures in flight was not presented and they just said all safety information on the the paper in front of you in seat pocket. The question to EgyptAir is that; your price is very expensive, with no quality, system, or anything good. Whoever wants to be a large, respectable and expensive company offers what suits that. The worst company, as usual, and its employees do not have any knowledge of how to serve customers. I am going to fill a complaint with EgyptAir itself, Star Alliance Group and Civil Aviation here.

Title:
Flight MS 996 July 24th 2021 2:05 pm from Toronto to Cairo was AMAZING.

I coukd see hiw much effort they put in making their meals so delicious and full of variety. We got an amazing hot dinner choices of chicken, beef or fish and dessert and fruit as well as soft fresh breaf, once we took off wer then got multiple drinks across the 10 hour flight. Then we were served a very delicious snack like a club sandwich of turkey and cheese. We then got a yummy breakfast before landing, fresh croissant, cheese, fruits, butter, eggs....i felt like i was in a hotel.

Seats were spacious and extremely comfortable and the crew were out of thus world especially Iman El Khouly if I remember correctly. She kept checking on my 17 year old daughter who had a terrible migraine and offered her srunks then said she can ask for a doctor. They all had an amazing smile on their faces the whole time very decent and professional.

Thank you Egyptair!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Before I start just keep in mind that my experience with Egyptair is simple: I call them, book the flight, pay for it, and go to the airport on my departure date.

Traveled with the airline on four occasions (international flights), never regretted it!

The staff are very friendly (I was sleeping on one flight & the attendant left me the meal on the seat beside me)
legroom is good (I'm 183 cm), never had any problems with it.

When there is an onboard entertainment system, it is great, although they will probably have any sex scenes removed 😂 , but my most recent flight didn't have it, instead, it had Wifi, but I didn't really use it, so I can't help with that.

They don't usually serve alcoholic beverages on-board, but they said I could buy duty-free items (which are usually alcoholic beverages) on board by credit card, but I don't really need to drink on an airplane, let alone pay for it.

Do remember to ask about the cancellation fees, because I have seen plenty of reviews by people upset about not getting a refund.
crvsd: Fady A wrote a review Jul 2021
qwuub: Great experiences, just know what you want before you book

Title:
I booked with Egypt air through their own website on the 1st of May my business tickets for me and my family, total of 4 business tickets, one way route from Johannesburg to Dubai. My booking reference is RNGZK2. Attached is pictures of my booking and email I received cancelling my tickets.

On the 6th of May, only 24 hours before departure, I received email from Egypt air cancelling all my tickets without obvious reasons and without informing me or calling me. I called the Head office in Johannesburg where they told me that flight is still on, but my tickets is been cancelled without them knowing whats going on. I called the head office in dubai where I was told that my tickets been cancelled because its coming from South Africa and we are not allowed into dubai. But I told them that I'm  Emirati citizen and its stating in Egypt air website that all Emirati are excluded and we can enter UAE without any problems. They agreed on that and told me my business tickets were taken by someone else and only economy seats ane available for the 7th of May! Or I can reschedule my flight for the 14th after Eid! 

I told them that I booked and fully paid my 4 business tickets for the 7th as its even more expensive than the 14th because of Eid season and I would like my business tickets back as I didn't cancel or request cancelling and I still wants my tickets.. long story short, I wasn't given my business tickets and I had to fly economy class despite paying full amount a week before for business seats. 

This was my first booking with Egypt air and I'm totally disappointed on how this turned out. I was asked to sent this email to get refund of my money.. but the trauma I went through with family and disappointment I had, will never be reimbursed

Title: On March 30, 2021, I arrived at Washington Dulles airport to catch flight #MS932 to Cairo Egypt  (booking reference # M4GU0D). When I arrived I observed a chaotic situation without any social distancing and barely any resemblance to crowd control or customer. There were many passages that, did not have their Convid-19 negative verification certificate printed out. Because we are in the digital age I can understand why passages would assume that they would be able to just show an agent digital results on a mobile device. The agents were requiring passages with their results on digital devices to print them there at the counter, Egyptair had a single laptop with a malfunctioning printer at a counter that all of the passages had to share. Again, there was not any social distancing, no hand sanitizer, no assistance for passengers who were not computer literate and the male ticket agents had extremely bad attitudes. This created a situation of chaos. As a result of all of the chaos, some passages miss the closing of the boarding gate including myself. I was told that I would not be able to board the flight and I was offered to have the flight rebooked for free. The gentleman at the counter whose name was Mohammed told me that I would not have to pay a change fee. When I got to the counter to arrange for a new flight the attendant who was making arrangements for other passages was charging what he called an upgrade fee. I watched him as he did this to three different passages, with each of the fees being different for each passages sitting in the same section. It was now my turn. He told me that I had to pay a fee. I asked, "What is the fee for". He said that it was upgrading the service. I then asked him what are the upgrades and what do I get. He looked surprised that I asked that question and had no explanation for it. I then asked him will I be getting something extra and what I will be able to pick my seat as I did in my original booking.  He said no. He seemed to be angry and told me if I did not want to do that then I should call customer service in New York. I left the airport and called New York customer service and I was on the phone stuck on hold for approximately two hours before I was disconnected by their telephone system. I had no better luck with their customer service. Today March 31, 2021, I once again tried to contact the ticket agent and customer service by phone with the exact same results. I now have a return flight two weeks from now which I will not be in Cairo to on. This has been the worst customer service experience I have ever had. I am so grateful that this was not an emergency travel situation. As of today the situation is still not resolved.
crvsd: Tyrone W wrote a review Mar 2021
qwuub: Stuck without a flight/ customer service nightmare.
