Title: The flight from CMN to CAI (2.15 pm on 12/08) was delayed by 5 hours. The connecting flight from CAI to ADD on 12/09 was cancelled. It took them 4 hours to give us proper information. They told me they would put me on the CAI to ADD flight the next day (24 hours later). 45 min. before departure the Egypt Air transit desk told me that I could not board because my Covid-PCR test had expired. 30 min. before departure they realized that it was a mistake, because they had confused the day of the test with the day of my birthday. By that time, the boarding of the flight had closed. It took another 6 hours for Egypt Air to figure out where I could do a new test. I got a special permission to do it within the terminal and had to pay EUR 90. I never received a receipt for this test although I asked several times. By that time, I had spent 34 hours in the transit terminal, without proper information, without accommodation, without communication (there is only 30 min. free internet). It was very cold and they did not even give us a blanket. On 01/10 at 12.30 pm I was put up in an airport hotel. I was rebooked on a flight CAI – NBO – BJM 2 days later. I left CAI on 12/12 9.30 pm and arrived in BJM on 12/13 10 am. The scheduled arrival was 12/09 1 pm, 4 days earlier. Of course, my luggage did not show up and I put in a claim. It finally arrived in BJM on 01/21, with a delay of another 8 days. Egypt Air (in the transit terminal in CAI) was not helpful at all. The staff was extremely rude, impolite and incompetent. They took our passport “to process the new tickets”, they let little children sleep on the floor without even a blanket, and no warm meal in nearly 35 hours, not able to communicate with anyone with only 30 min. free Wifi. No one listened to us and no one ever apologized. Of course no refund for anything was given. You cannot reach anyone by phone and e-mails are being left unanswered. A disgrace for the airline industry.

Title:
First, I want to make clear that my one and only experience with EgyptAir was during the COVID pandemic ( 03 flights in November 2020 and December 2020). Therefore, I believe that the context of the pandemic should be taken into account for what I will report below.

My wife and I have read on the internet a couple of times that EgyptAir frequently cancels flights or changes them very often sometimes without giving the passenger enough time. For that reason, we were advised to buy tickets through our travel agency that we've hired for our trip in Egypt because in case of cancellation or flight changes, the agency would do everything and there would be no more headache.

Well, we used EgyptAir on 03 flights:
1. Cairo to Aswan - Boeing 737-800
2. Hurghada to Sharm El Sheikh (via Cairo) - Airbus A220-300
3. Sharm El Sheikh to Cairo - Airbus A220-300

We were warned and it actually happened: 02 of our flights were canceled. As they were morning flights, I believe that the cancelation was due to the lack of passengers. And again, I don't want to be unfair: we are in a pandemic time. But the cancellations occurred two days before the flight. Thank goodness we had extra time planned, so that didn't hinder our trip at all. So take that into account.

Now, details about the flights in general.

The Check-in process was very quick and our checked bags were not weighed anytime during the trip.

We used Boeing 737-800 and AirBus A220-300 aircraft. In both cases, the flight was very smooth. The cleanliness of the cabins was reasonable. There was no dirt on the seats or on the ground, but on the LCD screens and windows, there was a lot of grease and fingerprints.

There were only USB-A (common USB) ports, with no other ports for charging devices.
Good legroom.

On all flights, we received 01 bottle of water of 300 ml and 01 sachet of hand sanitizer. Nothing else. Consider that flights in Egypt are always very short, due to the size of the territory.

Even though there was space left in the back of the plane, we were not allowed to change seats. They said that it was forbidden due to the pandemic. It doesn't make any sense to me. Because it is much riskier to squeeze passengers all next to each other at the front of the aircraft than to let people sit with social distance. What's the point?!

On a single flight, from Hurghada to Sharm El Sheikh (via Cairo) there was a passenger who refused to wear a face mask. The cabin crew requested repeatedly, but he said he would wear it but he didn't. In the end, nothing happened. The only thing I think should have been done was to tell the passenger that he would be removed from the aircraft if he didn't wear his mask. But that did not happen. Not only did he not wear his mask, but he also walked to the toilet without it. Well, I think that airlines should be more rigid in cases like this.

The overall experience with EgyptAir was good. Two flight cancelations could have ruined our trip if I hadn't put aside extra time for this unforeseen event. But for the third time I want to make it clear: we are in a time of the pandemic. And I just wasn’t too bothered because traveling in COVID times can really bring about these hassles.

So plan your trip and reserve extra time for surprises if using EgyptAir.
crvsd: Kadu Carrasco wrote a review Dec 2020
qwuub: Watch out for cancelations and changes to your flight (Dec 2020 and pandemic updates)

Title:
Pros:
The inflight service was great on Cairo to DC route. The crew were very nice, they gave a lot of disinfectant supplies, the meals were well-portioned (small) for a night flight, and were generally very good. The EgyptAir’s brand new 787 is cool! I disembarked totally wowed in DC. The airplane was only 20-30% filled (probably due to covid), and so I had 3 seats to sleep on (and so did everyone!), it almost felt like business class flight. In 10
hours of flight, I had a good night sleep as if I slept at home in my comfy bed (thanks for spaciousness of the airplane and the increased pressurization) - I didn’t feel tired at all in the end. The price was also very attractive, and I also did not become subject to Europe Travel Ban, and that’s why I went through Egypt in the first place.
Domestic flight from Sharm-el-Sheikh to Cairo was fine also, although I wasn’t as wowed as on US-bound flight. I still found it above what I expected. Ground crews in Sharm-el-Sheikh were very polite and truly helpful - they even waived the box packaging fee because I had no cash on me at all (I had a box not a bag). They also waived excess baggage fee (I had 2kg overweight) to show Egyptian kindness!
After a 6h30m flight that I had earlier that day with SCAT (Kazakhstan-based low-cost airline), the EgyptAir made me feel like a truly valued customer and get from A to B with minimum stress and maximum comfort - all kudos to them, they went above all my expectations!

Cons:
1.) They never pick up their call center phone. I wanted to make an upgrade to business class, but they did not pick up. I tried both US and Egypt call center.
2.) Airports in Egypt are terrible (cleanliness wise, and bureaucracy-wise: they make you go through X-Ray 4 times in Cairo) - not airline’s fault. I found both Sharm-el-Sheikh and Cairo airports to be terrible.
3.) If you go to their airport ticketing office and try to pay with your credit/debit card - be sure to really prove you are who you are, they will ask you 100 questions about it, I guess they have credit card fraud problems in Egypt, and that’s why they are so suspicious about it.
4.) Their flights are unfortunately only bookable at their own website at the lowest fare. If you try third-parties, fares are much higher. I saved $$$ by booking at their official website.
crvsd: Jean K wrote a review Nov 2020
qwuub: In flight service was great on a CAI - IAD flight, not so great on the ground

Title:
It was my first time flying with Egyptair plus it was at corona time. As for the service on board, it was really good and all flight attendants were wearing medical gowns and surgical masks. They distributed an amenity kit which contained a toothbrush, toothpaste, socks, eye masks, and earbuds. The other kit that they distributed contained 3 surgical masks, 3 hand sanitizers, 3 wipes, and 3 gloves. The food they served was authentically Egyptian with Egyptian spices. The flight itself went smoothly and we did not experience any turbulence during the flight, thanks God.
The plane took off almost half an hour later than its scheduled departure time; however, the captain could make up that time during the flight. The surgical masks were kinda weak and their straps ripped off easily.
Overall, the flight was smooth and comfortable.

Title:
I rarely write reviews but I simply have to share my experience with EgyptAir for those who are choosing between two options - EgyptAir and other airline. Please choose the other airlines, it surely can't be as bad as Egyptair.
Simply stop replying - that's how Egyptair's customer service solve issues and it didn't happen to me once, not twice but three times therefore I'm not exaggerating. I won't be naming the individuals as I don't want them to get fired during these difficult times but Egyptair won't be providing a good service until they learn how to value each and every customer. I could be a potentially loyal customer as I have a family in Egypt and I grew sick of stopovers but I will rather stick to Turkish Airlines as it never disappointed me in any way. I fly at least 3 times a year, this means six flights in total every year and let's say I'll be probably flying for the next 20, 30 years as I'm young. This is around 41000 euros approximately over the course of 30 years - at least. May not be so much but if every disappointed customer did the same Egyptair would eventually run out of business.

Now to the issue which the CS team hasn't resolved in 14 days. I was adding my frequent flyer number into the section but it didn't work so after few attempts I just took a screenshot so I can resolve it with the CS, I had other issues with the information but that was resolved. So I contacted the CS, unfortunately, the first employee did not read the email so I kindly replied that she already received all the info in the previous email, her reaction was simply to stop replying. I decided to contact her again in two days, I got an immediate response from someone else - yet again not resolving my issue and providing me no help whatsoever. As I've been working in the CS myself I made a few suggestions on how we can deal with the situation but unfortunately, I didn't get any answers. I sent another follow-up email before my flight which hasn't been answered. I'm deeply disappointed and I will rather waste a lot of my time on stopovers than flying with Egyptair.

Title:
We had round trip flights on Egyptair via JFK New York – Cairo Egypt. Typical coach class comfort. We always use disinfectant wet wipes on every airplane, and it was good thing because we saw lots of dirt on the wipes after wiping down the entertainment screen, tray tables, armrests, and seat belt buckles. Egyptair provides typical long-haul flight amenities such as, in-flight entertainment, pillow, and blanket. In addition, they give each flyer a little pouch containing a toothbrush, toothpaste, eye mask, socks, hand sanitizer, fresh-wipe, ear plugs, and earbuds (two-jack style) for the entertainment
The flights were uneventful and on-time. The food was decent. No alcohol. Flight attendants were okay, but not as friendly as US flight attendants. The only negative things about the flights were 1) the restrooms became very dirty – it looked like the only things done were adding soap and towels – water (I hope) and toilet paper littered the floor, and 2) the flight attendants did not come around very often to offer water or anything else. We had to walk clear to the rear of the aircraft and ask for water quite regularly.

Having filed a complaint w/United (the original ticketing carrier for this travel) requesting that they credit my MileagePlus account w/ 195,000 miles as compensation for me getting my wive & me home, they have refused and offered 100,000 miles for the United flight that wasn't taken and 2 $100 travel vouchers (unacceptable since I had also paid an additional $2069 in fees to United for my MileagePlus award tickets). Title:

The first surprise was that they cancelled my flight and postponed to the next flight at 7:15 , ok maybe because of bad weather which is just some heavy rain by the way.
They called for the flight on time, we got on buses, suddenly they asked us to return back to terminal as they discovered there was no crew on the plane.
It is 10 am now and I had to ask them when will they solve the problem , though I think professionally they should announce what will they do .

Really they should review their process and performance which is very much away from any professional customer satisfaction.

Title:
I flew Egyptair flight number MS759 on February 28, 2020 from Cairo to Copenhagen. I boarded the Boeing 737-800 just before 10:00 a.m. which happened to be the scheduled take off time. I was received by very friendly and extremely polite hospitality staff. My seat 9A, second row window seat. Business class seats are roomy and very comfortable and is much better than business class seats in other international airlines. I requested air hostess to move to a window seat in the first row. I was moved to the seat after takeoff. First row is usually blocked for a reason that I cannot understand. You can read my previous posts on the same issue: https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g1-d8729067-r731932060-EGYPTAIR-World.html

Actual takeoff time was delayed about 10 minutes, which is not bad, and arrival was on time.

A welcome drink was served before takeoff. About 20minutes after takeoff a snack, a small pack of small cookies, and drink were served. Lunch was served halfway through the flight. I got to choose from a menu that had limited but good selection of food. After main course a desert was served. Selection of bread and drinks were offered during and after the meal.

Flying conditions were very nice. It was mostly sunny and no turbulences. The flight arrived to Copenhagen on time with no delay.

In short, Egyptair offered wide and comfortable seats on this flight and served yummy meal. Staff are very friendly and polite.

This review is based on my personal experience.

qwuub: Egyptair Cairo to Copenhagen MS759, Comfortable business class flight

Title:
I was a bit hesitent about booking with Egyptair initially but needen't have worried.
Booked all the flights online with Egyptair themselves and the process was just as easy as any other airline. Booked flight to Cairo, then a seperate flight to Luxor and then a return fight from Aswan to Heathrow via Cairo and it was very easy to package everything together.
The flight out to Cairo was very comfortable in the normal economy seating. The flight back was on a much smaller aircraft and felt more like an economy service than a regular flight. Bit disappointed there. Certainly not as comfortable.
The internal flights were all fine and as you might expect.
Although it's a rather tortuous process to get a visa in advance it might be worth it as it's a real "bun fight" to go through the process at Cairo airport.
It's worth noting that no alcohol is served on Egyptair flights but the food is fine and soft drinks may be had at any time.
On-board entertainment is good with recent released films as well as a quantity of others. Headphones are supplied.
If you book economy you might find that your ticked is listed as "restricted" but don't panic. On the international flights you're allowed two checked bags but on the internals, only one. So you could still do the main journey with 2 checked bags but you then have the problem of what to do with one when you travel on.
Overall our experience with Egyptair was Good and I'd have no trouble flying with them again.
crvsd: David J wrote a review Mar 2020
qwuub: Good way to travel to Egypt

Title: I am updating from my review last week. I purchased my husband ticket with Egyptair online with my debit card. I was worried that he would have issues because after I bought the ticket,  I then seen on the website that the credit card holder had to be one of the travelers on the flight and that Egyptair had the right to refuse the traveler boarding if they could not present the card the ticket was purchased with. I called Egyptair and explained the situation to them. The rep told me to make a copy of the front and back of my card & driver license and to write underneath that I was the owner of the card used to purchase the ticket and I authorized the use. He said that way if they ask to see the card, my husband could just show the copy I sent him. They didn't ask him for it though. Thankfully my husband had a smooth transition and will be landing tomorrow morning
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I was really happy with this trip on EgyptAir because everything was smooth-sailing, from start to finish. This was a refreshing change from the previous flight that had taken me to Cairo, (but that's a whole nother peculiar experience! 😄). Check-in was fast and there were no delays. I think we took off at exactly 9:30 a.m, with boarding commencing at approximately 9:00 a.m prompt. In fact, by the time I arrived at the gate, (9:10 a.mish), boarding was complete! I think I was the second to the last person to board the plane.

One of the crew told me it was a Boeing 737-800 plane when I asked. Hallelujah that this type of plane has a T.V!!! 👏💃🏾The series of planes that fly to and from this itinerary almost always never have a T.V, so I was quite chuffed that I would get to enjoy some in-flight entertainment! The seats are unfortunately the ones that don't convert to 'bed-like' flatness. They just recline back a little, but the seats are comfortable nevertheless. This, and the fact that no food menu was provided, were the only issues I had with this particular flight. Apart from this, I had no problems on Egypt Air this time around.

The food was very impressive. A yummy shrimp, dill, lemon and cherry tomato appetizer was served on a bed of greens. A nice cheese selection, (3 types) came with an apricot and de-seeded prune. The salad, (with a 1,000 island dressing pack) had quinoa, sundried peppers, cheese, cucumbers, walnuts, cherry tomatoes and crisp iceberg lettuce. It reminded me of, and tasted like a Waldorf salad- which I absolutely love. For the mains, it was a choice between shrimps with fettuccine pasta, lamb chops with mashed potatoes & vegetables and chicken with rice. Since I had had chicken on my last trip and I had had my fill of pasta in Cairo, I decided to go for the lamb chops. Besides, I hadn't had chops in a while. They tasted amazing! Cooked to perfection and glazed with a hearty and robust rosemary flavoured gravy. The chops went so well with the roasted carrots, eggplant, marrow and creamy mashed potatoes. This is easily one of the best meals I've ever had on EgyptAir! 😋

For dessert, it was a choice between what looked like a plain New York cheesecake and a strawberry tart, plus a selection of exotic fruits and of course, tea and coffee. I went for the tart, because it looked so appealing, and it did not disappoint at all! The pastry was excellent, and the dainty treat had all the 'custardy' goodness that I love about tarts. The toilet was very clean. Service was also really good on this flight. All of the staff did a great job, but most notably, GHIAN GAMAL was excellent. I've had lackluster experiences in the past, (to say the least) with EgyptAir's service on business class, including, but not limited to a stewardess removing all her clothes and changing on a seat across from me, to another sleeping on the floor, and hence obstructing the aisle, etc; but this time around, everything was on point! They seemed to be very interested in the quality of the service because 2 air hostesses came to me with a clipboard and asked about the service on the flight, to which I gave them very positive feedback. I hope all my future flights on EgyptAir will be this enjoyable. This makes me look forward to flying with them again. Kudos to all the staff for providing awesome service on this flight. Keep up the awesome job and PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, endeavor to maintain this very impressive standard!!! 👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽
crvsd: Naija Babe 2016 wrote a review Feb 2020
qwuub: A significant improvement from my last trip! 👍🏽

Title:
My trip didn't start well at Amsterdam due to some confusion as to which lounge I was allowed into. The KLM Crown lounge 52 sent me to the Aspire lounge 41. They then sent me back to the KLM Crown lounge who then sent me back to lounge 41 before they agreed to let me in.
On boarding the plane I found what were to be the worst business class seats I have ever had. They are not electrically adjustable and several did not recline. I couldn't get the footrest to extend, but neither could anybody else. At least it was only a 5 hour flight.
You get a welcome drink (no alcohol) and hot towel. Once the seat belt signs had gone off and the screens unlocked to the movies I went through the selection and only found a couple that looked interesting. There were many I had never heard of. Again, at least it was only a 5 hour flight.
Dinner consisted of 5 courses: a salad, starter, main, cheese selection and dessert. The main was meant to be chicken, but didn't appear to be any part of a chicken I recognised. It was ok and I finished everything as I had not had lunch.
On landing, I saw passengers recline their seats, continue to watch movies and even get up to open the lockers! This was right infront of the stewardesses who did not seem bothered by this.
It was quite an experience and one I would not want to repeat anytime soon.
qwuub: Leaves a lot to be desired
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Seats are old and dirty, hardly recline when not broken, aircraft is an old 737.
Food is bad and no wine, beer or spirits at all.
Boarding has no priority for business class. Pre-boarding means you stay an hour in a boarding room. No WiFi in terminal.
Toilets are disgusting with urine on seat, floor AND walls.
Pillows had old pillow cases on. I had to cover mine with a t-Shirt. In flight entertainment is very limited.
Business lounge in Cairo is a joke. Still no drink (and this applies to all airlines), food looks like you should stay away from it. Seats and floors are old and dirty.
I will never fly Egypt Air again. My Turkish airline fight was canceled last minute and Egypt Air was the only airline to get me to destination on time, which meant arriving in the middle of the night. Flights leaving just slightly later (but too late for me) with KLM, Kenyan Airways or Ethiopian were all cheaper. Nothing justifies this price for this low quality service.

Title:
ローマからミュンヘン経由でカイロへ行く路線で、ビジネスクラスを利用しました。
まず、年配のエジプト人女性と思われる客室乗務員の態度。明らかに欧米人の客を優先的に対応し、アジア人の私たちには「Hold on」のひと言。
2点目は、サーブされたサラダがかびていた。写真を投稿したのでぜひ見ていただきたい。最初は凍っていて霜がついていると思ったが、オリーブとパプリカに白カビが付いている。客室乗務員に指摘しようと思ったが、先ほどの態度を思い出し、まともに対応されるとは思えなかったので、カスタマーサポートに写真と共にクレームすることにした。
3点目は、白カビ付きのサラダを見た私たちは、他の食事を取ることを拒否したのに、先ほどの年配の女性客室乗務員は「Why not!? All of these are beautiful. Take it!」と強要。面倒だったので料理は受け取ったが手をつけなかったら、皿を下げる時に大きなため息をついて睨まれた。

こんか最悪な気持ちで乗った飛行機ははじめて。しかもビジネスクラスでこれはありえない。

さらに最悪なのは、カスタマーサポートに送ったクレームにはひと言も返信がなかった。

エジプトで良いサービスを受けることは至難の技だけど、これはない。エジプト航空は数千年前の先祖の遺産に甘えすぎだ。
qwuub: The worst service in the air! 最低最悪なサービス
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I should start by being fair as this was only my second business class flight on EgyptAir. The first occurred 3 weeks ago flying from Toronto to Cairo. If I was to review the first flight I’d give it 3/5 only because l got what I expected for the price I paid! But then came flight 2! I wish I could have given 0 stars!! Check in was a mess even on business “ gold track”; one hour before we were in our seats. The plane was a 777 and they had only 2 scanners. But let’s for fun not blame them rather the airport; if only I could. As I sat down in 15 A and C and our companions in 14 A and C we were visited by Ms cranky pants (CP from now on) who angrily it appeared , offered juice and her mood worsened if her tray didn’t have the kind you wanted. The remote didn’t work, table not clean, servers almost invisible, food horrible because for BOTH dinner and breakfast they ran out of choices of meal ( leaving an almost inedible something)and even at breakfast ran out of that rarest of juices , orange. The bathroom had NO PAPER of ANY kind in it 2 hrs prior to landing; a whole other story. CP was angered when my wife asked for extra milk in her coffee and when she returned frowned as I requested a refill but she had to go back and get the pot. In her frustration she knocked my cutlery on to the floor then picked it up and dropped it on my unfinished plate of food. Mind you then I had another reason not to eat it. The entertainment selection of movies was horrendous by any standard. The pretty close to lie flat bed did afford some restful sleep on the 12 hr flight when the 2 children seated across the aisle weren’t running around unfettered. I suppose the parents are more to blame than EgyptAir. Departure from the plane went smoothly. Well done EgyptAir :( I hope this was a one off as some on the flight looked like they enjoyed their job and cared. CP may have lost her dog that day ; who knows.

Title:
I arrived to Sharm El Sheikh abut 2 hours ahead of my afternoon flight (MS306). After I passed the security check and checked in my small suite case, I headed to the business class Lounge. I was very disappointed as the receptionist told me that being an Egypt Air traveler I am not entitled to access to the lounge. I was told I have to pay 750 Egyptian pounds in order to gain access. I decided I will skip the lounge as I had about an hour for boarding. I thought it is not good value for money.

My seat 20K is a window seat in the first raw of the small Embraer 170. The flight was full. We were served ready packaged juice as welcome drink. A modest meal of 2 small bite size cheese and salmon sandwiches, cake, cold and/or hot drinks were served after about 10 minutes of takeoff. The flight duration to Cairo Airport was 44 minutes.

In short, this flight was a very short flight in a small commercial jet that was almost full. Business class seats are small. Given that and with no access to the lounge I do not think that traveling business class under these conditions would be very good value for money, but if you can afford it why not. I have to mention that business class passengers were given priority upon arrival as we boarded a separate buss to the terminal before the economy class passengers, but we had to wait about 15 minutes for the luggage anyway.

This review is based on my personal experience.

qwuub: Sharm El Sheikh-Cairo Egypt Air Business class, is it good value for money?

Title:
Arrived at Nairobi Airport to take flight MS850 to Cairo and when I was going to check-in, they informed me that my ticket was cancelled. Why? They did not tell me.

Hours before checking-in, I called the Nairobi Egyptair line, and they told me that I had my ticket confirmed and should show on the airport for check in. I also received Egyptair’s e-mail regarding my booking.

When I asked Check-in agents for a customer service number for Egyptair to solve my issue, they did not give me any number, moreover they did not have an Egyptair office in the airport who could assist us with my situation.

When I asked if I was able to purchase a new ticket, they told me it was possible but I only had 45 min to decide. Once I told them that I wanted to buy a new ticket, they told me that it was not possible and they only accepted cash. Check-in agents showed no empathy to my problem and their only answer was “we don’t know, call your agent.”

I showed them proof that I have received an e-mail confirming my reservation, and they said it was cancelled and could not board the plane.

After trying to reach Egyptair phone number for customer service on their website, the numbers provided did not work. 5 hours later after trying to call 50 different phone numbers that are listed in their website, I was able to get connected with a phone number in Abbu Dhabi.

+97144358444 this phone works.

Their phone service was cold and did not accept any responsibility on their mistake and only blamed AIR CANADA(Agent who issued ticket)

DO NOT FLY with Egyptair as they lack professionalism and lack of empathy when their customers have a problem.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I flew black from Cairo to TLV .Actually under Airsinai name. It is a relatively short flight . The plane wasn't full, so I had 3 places for myself. I asked for more juice and she brought it.Comparing to the second airline I flew with, the plane was relatively clean.Remember, the economic situation in Egypt is far from being good . I guess it isn't the airlines fault , but be aware that I  took 4 flights during my 6 nights tour in Egypt (TLV-CAI-LUX/ASW-CAI-TLV), all of them were late to took of in an hour or even more. Which means, seating in the plane and arriving late...  So plan ahead.My advice , is to arrange yourself a head something to eat and drink. Always have on you Moisturizing cloths/ tissues. Have a nice flight!

Title:
I flew business class from London to Cairo and the service experienced was as expected.
The interior design of business class is dated and in need of modernisation.
The seats recline, but not fully therefore leaving you in a limbo state.
Food was ok, but food in flight usually leaves little to be desired for me.
In flight entertainment wasn’t the best, and I preferred to read a book rather than watch any shows.
The cabin crew were lovely and helpful and no issues there.
qwuub: Nice flight but business class is a little tired
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We took flight from Aswan to Cairo. I ordered some coffee on board and I put it on the table which is the place to put drink. When the guy in front of me moved chair, the chair hit the coffee and I got burned my leg because of coffee falling down. How come the chair is designed hitting drinks even I placed the coffee where to put drink on the table? I asked cabin attendant to help, and she just brought so much paper napkin and say nothing to me. I sent email to customer center in Egypt about this incident but no reply. I also contacted customer center in Japan but she (Ms. Tateiwa) says that "Please contact customer center in Egypt. Nothing I can do." You have customer center in Japan for what? This is the worst airline that I've ever experienced.
qwuub: The attitude of cabin attendant and service quality of customer canter in Egypt and Japan is the worst!!

Title:
My sister and I travelled with Egyptair to go to and from Toronto to Cairo this month and it was the absolute worst flying experience we have ever had. We have travelled countless times through out our lives with many other airlines but I could have never imagined prior to booking with Egyptair that we would experience such discomfort and disappointment.

Let me start with the lack of hygiene on the airplane, both to Cairo and back. It was beyond obvious that the airline puts no time or effort in sanitizing the seats or bathrooms prior to take off, as the seats were tainted and smelled very foul of body odour from previous flyers, and the booklets stored in the sleeve in the seats in front of us were sticky and dirty. They do not provide any paper bag or anything of that sort to store your garbage so if you had garbage and needed to store it somewhere your only option was in the sleeve across you. I had required tissues during the flight, and not only did it take forever for the flight attendant to respond to the assistance light I had turned on but it was when I realized the only place available to put any garbage was in the sleeve in front of me I was mortified at the idea of all the built up germs and dirt from previous flyers.

The bathroom. Now it is expected to walk into a horrifyingly dirty bathroom especially during a 12 hour flight, but what blew my mind away is that when we were returning from Cairo to Toronto, there was a delay in boarding and take off and so by the time we got on the plane I needed to relieve myself. My sister and I were one of the first people to board the plane and the flight attendant lock the washroom before take off so I had kindly requested for them to unlock it and they did, and I could not believe what I had walked into. Initially I had thought I was privileged to be the first to use what you would THINK is a clean washroom before a flight, but instead I walked into dry pee literally ALL over the toilet, tissues and dried up God knows what on the counter and floor and soap that you felt you needed to wash your hands after using before the dispenser was dirty and half empty from the previous flight. I wish I had my phone in my pocket at the time because the first thing I thought is Oh God I need to take a video of this but unfortunately I had left it with my sister. In addition to this the seats were so uncomfortable and the tv's are so outdated and not all of them work properly. Even just picking up the remote you can feel how dirty they are, so unacceptable.

This is absolutely unacceptable in my opinion, especially given the fact that there is deadly virus going around right now and just because we are flying economy it doesn't change the fact that we are still paying thousands of dollars to this airline and the very least that they should be able to deliver is acceptable hygiene.

The food. Oh God the food... I have never experienced such a lack of quality in airplane food, especially for a 12 hour flight. Let me include that we had travelled to Egypt for a 5 day transit, then continued to Lebanon on Egyptair where we spent the majority of our stay, and then came back to Cairo for a 5 hour transit before returning to Canada. On the way to Cairo initially, the food was awful. For the main course you pick between chicken or beef and we always feel chicken may be the safer choice. We received half of a very old tasting chicken breast, along side pasta with no sauce that tasted overcooked and like it was boiled in unclean water as it had a strange flavour to it, and a couple of boiled carrots and broccoli that tasted just like the pasta. The buns they provided were so stale and old that I had to really put my tricep into trying to cut it and it was literally crumbling on the inside because of how stale it was. The desert was the only part of the meal that was acceptable and that's because it was very clear they were some commercial brand cake. On the flight to and from Lebanon, being only an hour and half long they serve you a simple sandwich and garden salad, and from Cairo to Lebanon the quality of the bread was acceptable, but I kid you not coming back from Lebanon to Cairo, they had served us the exact same lunch they did on our way to Beirut, except the bread was so stale that we couldn't even eat it. The cucumbers were so old that just by smelling them I knew there's no way I was eating that and both my sister and I were certain that they were serving us whatever was left over from the flight we took 10 days ago. How in the world is that acceptable at all? Even the breakfast that they served us during both 12 hour flight from Toronto to Cairo and back, were so gross that we kept returning our meals as they were served and only eating the stale bread and desert. Imagine eating a rice pudding desert only to witness stains on the bowl you've reached the bottom of... disgusting!!!! This took place on our way back yesterday as there was no commercial desert served that time.

On top of that the I kid you not there were only TWO friendly flight attendants during all 4 flights we took. The rest were mean and so unapproachable that you couldn't help but feel anxious every time you had to communicate with them. Being someone who has travelled countless times in my life, I have never felt so discouraged to communicate a need or request with flight attendants before. They act like you've bothering them or asking for the impossible. From the way they look at you to the way they respond.. where is the customer service??? I can't help wonder is the lack of effort and hygiene and quality all due to the fact that we flew economy? Because I have never experienced such things on any other economy flight I've taken before. I paid thousands of dollars to hold my piss in, skip my meals and sit in B.O. smelling and extremely uncomfortable chairs for 12 hours.

Honestly I am not one to put time or effort into writing such a detailed review and this is my first time spending this much time doing so but that is how shocked and disappointed we were with our experience on Egyptair and I will NEVER EVER do business with Egyptair ever again. I have already warned all of my friends and family not to bother wasting their money on this Airline either.
crvsd: Rand B wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: Our first and absolutely last time flying with Egyptair
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Delays and lost luggage all along; below for more details.
Well, this was the first time I ever travelled with Egypt Air. I was super excited to be stopping over in Cairo even if it was just the airport and had good expectations for the airline. My sisters however, weren’t happy at all, given their last experience flying with this carrier.
In Nairobi, our flight was delayed 4-5hours. Obviously we missed our connecting flight to Madrid. So we were put on a flight to Rome from Cairo and then a local Spanish airline to Madrid. (The aircrafts to Cairo and Rome had no televisions, but there was a common television that played Lion king during one sector so that was do-able). Once landed in Madrid, mine and my sisters bag didn’t show. Eventually mine turned up but my sisters didn’t and couldn’t be tracked on the world tracker for 5 days - poor thing had all her winter stuff in that bag and we went straight from Hot to cold weather. The bag turned up one week later.
On the way back to Nairobi from Madrid, our flight was delayed for 45 minutes and almost missed our connecting flight to Nairobi. Once landed in Cairo, we were given the wrong gate number; after rushing to this gate, we literally ran across the airport to the right gate.
Once landed in Nairobi, my luggage didn’t make it - luckily, it was found 2 days later and was delivered to my preferred address.
My aunt was very familiar with the lost (& damaged) luggage procedure, as it has happened to her and my sister on their previous trip to Amsterdam via Egypt air.

The service is somewhat good, so is the food. The seats aren’t the worst and I found this aircraft to have slightly more leg room compared to the other carriers I’ve flown with.
crvsd: Shaira M wrote a review Jan 2020
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I've flown EgyptAir many a time, but never got to write a review till now. This particular flight was delayed due to so much fog, which made visibility terrible, so the plane couldn't land. They landed in another city and returned later in the evening, so we took off the following day. This is a short haul flight, so the seats on the plane don't convert to bed-like positions because of the type of plane. Since I've flown EgyptAir more than I can count, this time around, service wasn't good at all. And to top it all off, there was a lot of turbulence, so it interrupted the flow of things. The crew forgot to serve drinks and water! The food was bland and boring. I picked the fish as my main, (from a chicken and beef option), and got served a meal with frozen rice! This is understandable given what happened with the delay of the flight due to unforeseen circumstances, so the food must have been kept overnight in the freezer, thawed and reheated on the day of our flight. The crew lady did exchange my plate with another dish which was hot. The dessert was also nothing to write home about; a dry and tasteless mass of fluff pretending to be a chocolate cake. Like I said, I've had far better experiences on EgyptAir, but this flight was bad on so many levels. I'll continue to fly EgyptAir because I know that all the aspects of this flight that were negative can sometimes be a lot better than what I experienced this time around.
crvsd: Naija Babe 2016 wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: Delayed flight because of bad weather. ☹

Title:
Whilst the aircraft is perfectly fine, large and maintained, comfortable at exit seat row (except for in-flight entertainment), the service leaves much to be desired. Interior is grimy and dirty however, making you want to disinfect everything around your seat.

We did on-line check-in, as we'd booked and paid for exit seats up front. So all we needed to do was drop our bags at the fast track bag drop queue, right? Wrong....... this queue took nearly two hours to serve 4 people in front of us "dropping" bags. Pathetic to say the least. This was at OR Tambo in JHB. The automated bag drops in Munich are WAY faster and better, so the gripe here is more aimed at the lack of tech at OR Tambo (and a little at the slow ground staff employed by Egypt Air in JHB)

So on the topic of in-flight entertainment, almost none of the new release movies to be seen anywhere, it's more a bunch of old movies dating back to the 70's and 80's with a smattering of newer movies (circa early 2000's maybe?), plus a bunch of foreign language films. Egypt air desperately needs to bring their entertainment standards into the 21st century!

Food is dismal, beef that can crack a tooth, chicken drier than the Sahara desert! Can't say much more, except, food is horrible.

The air hostesses all look miserable, as if they don't want to be there. The stewards are all as friendly as Charon taking payment for crossing the river Styx! They bark at you when asking if you want to eat or drink anything, and heaven forbid you ask them for extra water, it all seems such an effort to them. If you choose this job, at least have the interpersonal skills to make your passengers enjoy their uncomfortable, "stuffed-inside-a-metal-tube-for-9-hours" experience.

And yes, I know that the staff on board are there primarily as Safety Officers and NOT as waiters and waitresses to heed your every beck and call, but it takes nothing to be pleasant and polite to your passengers. If other airlines can do it, nothing stops Egypt Air from trying to emulate.

We flew Jhb to Cairo and from Cairo had a Lufthansa operated code share to Munich. The staff on board this leg were SO much more pleasant, smiles on faces, engaging with their passengers.

If Lufthansa and even Emirates and Qatar can smile, why can't Egypt Air?

But then if you book the cheapest ticket around, I guess you get what you pay for.

My recommendation - pay a few pennies more and fly with one of the other airlines who at least make an effort.

Waiting at Cairo airport for our return journey home - 2 hour delay standing in the boarding queue, with ground staff standing in front of us, watching us getting more fidgety by the minute and not ONCE having the decency to at least do an announcement as to why there is a delay, to apologise for said delay and to give us a time-frame. They stood there ignoring us completely. Apparently Egypt Air has a reputation for always being delayed, go figure.

Oh and airport security at Cairo! A joke. We left JHB with our rechargeable AA camera batteries and cigarette lighters in our carry-on luggage. Not questioned once about these, as they are part of the "allowed items" (I've checked and double checked this subsequently) but must be in carry-on.

Arrived in Cairo for lay-over en route to Munich, all good. When going through security at Cairo to catch the leg from Cairo to Munich, we had to give up our lighters, as these were "not allowed" according to staff. We did so, not having much choice in the matter. No issues with the batteries here, please note.

In Munich, obviously bought new lighters. So now cue return flight Munich to Cairo a week later, again went through security with lighters and batteries in carry-on, no issue.

So after our lay-over we find ourselves again at Cairo security check for leg Cairo back to Johannesburg. No surprise, we were asked for the lighters, which we again handed. But here's the kicker, now they suddenly demanded I hand over the rechargeable AA batteries I had loose in my bag PLUS the ones in my camera. When I questioned why, as these were brought into the country and out again en route to Munich, I was met with "not allowed!"

Now I don't normally fight or put up a scene at airport security, as the last thing I want is to be taken into a room somewhere and subjected to heaven knows what, but this time I was not prepared to have my expensive batteries seized so I simply told the security officer that I was not prepared to relinquish these, that they were expensive rechargeable batteries for my camera. He shrugged, and let me through! What gives? Was this an attempt to score some expensive goods for himself?

Needless to say, arrived back in JHB with my batteries I subsequently also discovered the second lighter I had tucked away still in its packaging, in my carry-on. So much for their security standards!!!

Flew with Egypt Air twice before, once in the early 90's and once in 2009, and both times we had very pleasant flights. However their service standards have worsened since, making me never want to fly them ever again.

Title:
The online check-in, ticket booking and payment process are a mess. I'd recommend a different airline to be in the safe side. Below you can find more details.

Keep in mind I'm not a frequent traveler with them (twice per year), therefore, it's quite astonishing that I alone encounter these issues.

Here's my latest problem:
Nowhere on my ticket does it say how many pieces of luggage I'm allowed on board (apparently, you see it once when booking the flight which happens months in advance), but I like to be on the safe side and called several times to make sure with the customer service on the phone, in which 2 times I was assured that I'll be allowed 2 pieces. I call for the third time on the night before the flight, after having bought all of the stuff that I can use for the second piece of luggage, to be told that I am only allowed 1 piece and the second piece will cost me around 100 euros. I'd like to empathize again that nowhere on the ticket (and I'm already checked in) does it say how many pieces I am allowed, only that I need to contact them to ask.
Like I said above, safe yourself the trouble, and just go with a different airline.

I had another incident in which it was not accepting my Egyptian passport details because of a bug on their booking system, which always gave me a very clear feedback that my ticket was consequently not booked, only to discover later by my bank that I had made 3 purchases with the same details, which means I triple booked the ticket that was always giving me an error.

Another time, me and a friend (German passport holder) couldn't manage to do online check-in, which means you have to wait more than an hour in line until you can reach the counter to perform check-in before the flight. Yes, more than an hour!

Your luggage gets broken, but I guess that is expected, so I don't need to add more here.

I once didn't find place for my carry-on luggage (because they didn't regulate the carry-on specifications for the rest of the passengers), and had to give my stuff to be divided randomly somewhere on the plane.

Again, I can't stress this enough, it's not worth it with all the hassle that you might encounter. Just book a different airline!!
crvsd: Hassan A wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: Russian roulette of an Airline's incompetence
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Given existing online reviews of Egyptair Business Class flights, I was nervous! However, I was pleasantly surprised with the high caliber of service. The airline staff were super nice and attentive. Food quality was excellent and plentiful with lots of choices. Two meals were served but snacks were available any time. And yes, Egyptair does not serve alcohol, but you can bring your own aboard- bring your own corkscrew or bottle opener though.

The Dreamliner has the business class pods with the fully reclining seats. The enclosure has lots of room and a USB port in addition to a power socket. A pillow and plush blanket were provided as well as headphones. The amenity kit was much better than other reviews noted, containing a wooden tined hairbrush, a sleep mask, earplugs, socks, lotion, lip balm, refresher spray, toothbrush, and toothpaste in a blue textured vinyl case.

The toilets were clean and fully stocked.

Great experience and definitely recommend.
crvsd: DC Traveler wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: Egyptair Business Class nonstop from DC to Cairo was lovely
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I took a flight from Bangkok to Tunisia for 2 adults and 5 months baby. all was okay from check in to luggage handling. the moment we set on the plane we knew it is going to be the worse experience. Seats were literally dirty and not hygienic, dust was everywhere including the bag's cabin, Rust was on each and every single metal thing on the plane. Preparing the take off, i asked for the extension seat belt to adjust the baby but they said that they DO NOT HAVE ANY, Means in case of emergency the baby can easily fly away!! Could you Imagine???

During take off, The plane was shaking, the engine sound was so strong in a way we thought we are falling. half of the bag's cabins were opened.

When i asked the crews about the sound, they said it is normal because the aircraft is overloaded with passengers and their luggage.I was under the shock because we talk about 10 hours flight from Bangkok to Cairo flight and then 4 hours from Cairo to Tunisia.

Thanks God we arrived safe to Tunisia and we just change our ticket way back via Emirates. we did not even claim for the money or for a refund (more than 2500$). Guys be careful, your Life matter.
crvsd: Ahmed Bronji wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: DO NOT EVEN THINK FLYING WITH EGYPT AIR
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Many of my friends (and online reviews) had warned me that flying with EgyptAir is a mistake. Based on their own experiences, some of my friends laughed when I told them who I was flying with and said "You might get there in one piece, but your luggage probably won't" or, "Add at least a day to your expected arrival date- you'll definitely miss your connection". I naively thought that everything would be okay, we couldn't all have such bad luck. My error, of course, was assuming that the poor experiences of my peers with EgyptAir were anomalies and not (largely) unbroken rules.

In the interest of fairness, I will attempt to begin with the most positive elements of my trip. After thinking for a long time I have come up with 3.
1. The seats were similar to other airline seats - they were very standard seats of an economy class budget airline.
2. The food tasted like airplane food. (On the menu was a miscellaneous brown meat, which the crew optimistically referred to as 'chicken'). My expectations were low here, so I could not be disappointed.
3. I arrived at the destination eventually (albeit 26 hours later than intended).

- No alcohol served on the flight to take the edge off what will inevitably be a terrible experience: instead, they have warm fizzy drinks and juice, many of which ran out quickly.

- The second leg of the flight (Cairo to Nairobi) had no personal inflight entertainment. The safety announcement was shown on overhead screens and was difficult to hear.

On my first flight (Heathrow to Cairo) the cabin crew were reluctant to help with requests. After realising that the 'call' button, had absolutely no effect on the crew, I quickly learned to walk to the end of the cabin for any assistance. The cabin was freezing cold, and when I asked the crew for a blanket, I was told, with a snigger that EgyptAir does not stock enough blankets for everybody on the flight. Though I find it odd that for a fairly late and cold flight, they only have a few blankets, I take more issue with the fact that I was spoken down to for even having the audacity to ask.

There was absolutely no communication on the flight that there had been a delay on the first flight that would mean that some of the passengers would miss the second flight. When the plane arrived, I was not aware that there had been a delay. It would have been so simple for the crew, in the knowledge that there were passengers that would be missing connecting flights, to have announced that there was a delay. I was so stunned by the lack of communication, that I checked my clock 4 times before fully comprehending that my connecting flight would be boarding. A large part of me assumed that perhaps I was confused about the timezone. Expecting a higher level of customer service, in my naivety I still assumed that the airline would not close the connection without communicating something. When running to the gate, I was met by an Egyptair representative who somewhat helpfully (though not entirely in an organised way) was calling out to the crowd “connections to Nairobi?” He then asked me to follow him. We stopped several times for him to speak in Arabic and shake hands with airport staff. I had to ask repeatedly what was going on before finally being told with a casual and broad smile, that I had missed my flight. I was left as a single young woman in Egypt, surrounded by people who were not speaking English to me or explaining what was going on. I felt completely vulnerable.

When I reached the ‘missed connections’ desk, to my relief I was informed that I could stay in 5* accommodation in Cairo for 24 hours. However, the on ground crew were rude, and aggressive-mannered and once again gave very little clear communication throughout. After waiting for around five long hours (including a 20 minute wait outside in the dark, alone) our shuttle bus finally arrived at the airport to take us to Novotel Cairo hotel. Following a long wait at the hotel reception, we were escorted to our hotel rooms. My room had dirty tissues strewn across an unmade bed, and dirty coffee cups on the side. I had not hoped for Egyptair to provide luxury, but I had expected a clean and safe room. Whilst at reception later, I met a woman who asked me what room I was in since she had been given the key of my fellow passenger. Upon realising that they had the same room, this woman handed back her key; but somebody else may have not been so honest. This was an extreme breach of safety, leaving us feeling even more vulnerable. I informed the hotel of the untidy room, and was thankfully moved to another room after a wait. However, on arrival in the second room, I discovered that the bathroom floor was covered in pubic hairs. I was absolutely destroyed by tiredness by this point, and keen to avoid moving yet again, in the full knowledge that I would have to try and get some work done the following day. However, if there was such visible human filth, I was uncomfortable sleeping on the probably equally unclean sheets. After over 30 minutes, I was finally moved again and able to sleep. The next day, I checked under the bed to see if I had forgotten anything and discovered that under the bed was absolutely covered with balls of dust. So, yes- if you miss your connection in Cairo, you will be provided with a hotel room and below average meals but don't expect safety or cleanliness.

When I arrived back at the airport, we were moved between five different desks before finally being given our passports back. Once again, there was no respect, no politeness, no communication.

Once through passport control, I asked at the “PR desk” if it was possible to claim compensation and what my rights were. I was told, with a smirk that I had no rights to anything.

I have not ever made a public complaint like this before but in this case I think it is necessary. I urge you to either lower your expectations significantly when flying EgyptAir- or spend a little bit more money on another airline to ensure that you are safe and well-cared for on your flight.
qwuub: Do not fly EgyptAir! Rude staff, no communication, no customer care!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We planned an awesome vacation to Egypt for people on one confirmation code/itinerary. I would typically have flown a US mainline carrier like Delta but instead I was convinced by one of the party to use Egypt Air because of the non-stop from IAD versus a layover if flying from our preferred DCA. NEVER AGAIN.

I bought the tickets through Expedia. Four of us were traveling together. I created a login on the EgyptAir website so that I could select our seats. I also joined their frequent flyer program. The separate websites weren't that great but not the worst. I was able to figure it out. I selected seats for the four of us for both legs (going to Cairo and returning). It is a 10 hour flight there and a 12 hour flight back. The hassle of creating id's on their site to select seats together was worth the effort. i selected window and middle seats on neighboring rows going and coming. The plan is a 3-3-3 configuration. I get the checkin email a day before the flight. I discover that EgyptAir as reassigned us to two rows in the middle seat of 3 seats farther back in the plane. No notice, nothing. Completely overrode the seats I selected over a month in advance. There were no other seat selection options available at this point. Needless to say, the same thing happened on the way back. Except this time one of us was put in a middle seat on one side and the other 3 in a middle set of 3. Absolute disregard for the fact that we went through the hassle of selecting seats in advance via their website.

Let's talk about the in-flight service. There's not much to talk about because it was mostly non-existent. The crew acted as if they had a checklist of things do do, checked them off, and spent the rest of the time lounging in the back chatting. I honestly felt like they didn't want us to hydrate so we wouldn't be up and about. For a 10 and 12 hour flight they service a meal that comes with a small foil covered cup of maybe 5 oz of water and they offer another drink,in another very small cup, maybe 6 oz of water/soda/juice. Then again on the end of the trip. Does this airline not understand the basics of keeping passengers hydrated on long trips?? On standard carriers I'm used to walking in and being handed a big bottle of water for a shorter trip to Europe - PLUS they come through the aisles often with more fluids. We were offered maybe half a bottle of water on the whole 10/12 hour flight. On the way back we planned to buy a bigger bottle to take on with us - NOPE! The boarding gate is in an extra-secure area that doesn't allow liquids through security with no shops to buy more.

A final note, on the way there it look like someone had spilled water (I hope it was just water) in the bathroom shortly after take off. So much so that it pooled along the wall. The entire floor was wet. It stayed that way the entire flight - I guess the water seeped out but no one ever took time to clean the floor.

The food itself was ok. Fairly standard. It was economy so I didn't have high expectations of food quantity. Obviously, water quantity on a long-haul flight was a major issue.

I haven't had such a bad experience on a flight in a long time. Probably the first time I've ever taken the time to review an airline. Thankfully one of our party is Star Alliance Gold so we were able to board early. I'm Sky Team Platinum myself. This experience certainly tells me that Star Alliance has little regard for providing consistent quality.
crvsd: Herschel C wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: No regard for customer service - horrible, long flight. Never again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I don't even know where to start.. our flight was delayed an hour and then when we finally got on the plane they had us wait before take off for and hour and a half ..and didn't tell us what was going on, we were so panicked that we were going to miss our next flight it was insane..the food was not bad.. obviously chicken/beef option (I wish I could roll my eyes in this review) The seats were horrible getting on the plane was a mission.

Our seats didn't work at all they couldn't go down they were stuck, so we asked the staff to help us to adjust them. And she looked at the seat said no sorry it's stuck and we had to sit in an upright position for 9 something hours.. and avoided us for the rest of the flight.

If you have to fly with EgyptAir please also be sure not to stop over at Cairo for a transit flight.. what a disaster we felt so unsafe.. the ladies cleaning the bathrooms were terrifying.. asked us for money and were trying to look in our backpacks and tried to take them so ofcourse we tried to avoid the bathrooms and cleaning ladies.. fun ... This is only the half of it. If you are going to fly with EgyptAir or if you stop over in Cairo... GOOD LUCK!!! Pay a bit extra for any other airline it will be worth it.

Title: When you review an airline I guess you can not just review after 1 flight. So now after 4 times BRU/CAI/BKK/CAI/BRU i guess can give a fair review. Over all price /quality it is my preferred carrier. Their frequent flyer program is very interesting/ fast gold status and at least 200% miles flown distance in business class.Out of the 16 flights there was 1 flight when experiencing the flight crew not that friendly,  but all the other 15 flights staff was utmost friendly and helpful!  Very happy with their service. Inflight meals were on all flights good, ok, not 5 * but for me they were certainly ok! On time ? Not really...but never got a delay of over an hour, so for me it's really acceptable. Lounges in Cairo,  they were below expectations,  unfortunately.  Staff are friendly but the food on display is just a 1 on the scale of 10. Customers service, hard to reach. But after all, most important for me is the flights...and they were all fantastic.  I can't understand the negative reviews here on TripAdvisor

Title:
I’ve read very mixed reviews on here about Egypt air. Today is the first time I’ve flown with them in around 15 years. Out flight from Cairo to Istanbul is being operated by an A220 which is almost brand new. It has i flight WiFi, you get the first 5mb free!

There is sufficient legroom and the seats are 2 and 3 which is an interesting configuration. The service at first seemed non existent but after 30 mins or so I was served a delicious meal, from a choice of chicken with pasta or grilled meatballs with rice. I was also offered non alcoholic drinks.

There is free in flight entertainment too, which you can stream to your phone or tablet.

I know not all flights are like this, but this one is great.

Title:
Check in desk at Hurghada airport very helpful. Security check was very thorough. Couldn't have been more reassuring. Cairo airport connecting flight directions not very clear. Arrows pointing at most awkward directions and passages to the security X-ray point very vague and obscure. Most frustrating especially when a passenger is rushing to connect to a flight in hurry. Egyptair staff directed me the wrong way . Her colleagues in her defence said she didn't understand !! Imagine ??!!Surprising that staff are not trained to deal with passengers paying huge sums of money to travel through Cairo Intln airport .Refreshments and restaurants didn't live up to the expected standard of a very important international airport destination.
Check in at departure lounge was quite disturbing as the main officer checking in didn't even know which barcode to scan until I had to point out his ignorance.
The entertainment available for a 6 hour flight was shockingly limited with overhead TV monitors dropping down that seem so outdated and archaic ! Only two movies were shown and one had to view it whether you liked it or not. The sound was very scratchy due the loose socket connections on the arm rests. Egyptair has to review its treatment of well paying customers and the type of aircraft used on international service.
Learn from other airlines .

Title:
My family bought cheap tickets we very much regret.

- So many EgyptAir staff were aggressively rude to us, we were baffled and lost count. Eg I was flying economy, and as a star alliance gold member, I can check in at the business counter and get priority tags on my luggage. The check-in agent kept demanding to know WHY I wanted priority tags. To get our bags our first. WHY! So we can get through customs and immigration quickly. WHY! ...what?

- Customer service doesn’t pick up the phone or answer email. Multiple times we’ve waited on the phone for literally hours—only to have the line cut off. My sister couldn’t come and her ticket was supposedly refundable, but you can’t get a refund if they won’t communicate with you.

- They lost my bag two weeks ago. When they called for more information, I asked if they had found my bag and the agent yelled, “WE HAVE CALLED YOU MANY MANY MANY MANY TIMES! YOUR PHONE IS BROKEN!” Neither is true, why would anyone say that? My insurance claim requires a note from EgyptAir, but they do not respond.

- On our Nairobi-Cairo leg (5 hours), the passenger behind my parents was violently ill and kept throwing up. The flight attendants were so disgusted they refused to touch the bags and left them on the floor the whole rude, wafting the vomit stench through the plane. Unbelievable.

Title:
We were a group of five couples who flew from India to Egypt
We had a confirmed booking for 18/12/2019 from Cairo to Aswan by flight MS391 0700am. Were at checkin counter at 0540to 0550 & after issuing boarding passes to two couples they realised that they had over bookings & made us scape goats & bumped us.
They did not follow the basic rules of bumping that first they should call if anyone would be voluntarily interested, a group should not be bumped, a family should not be bumped. All our explanations were of no use. For 0700 flight they gave us 1425 flight and offered us 40$ per head as compensations. Our best efforts to explain that we had to travel to Abu Simbel by Road immediately & had already paid were of no use.
I certainly feel it was discrimination & would never advise someone to fly by Egyptair.

Title:
Copenhagen-Cairo flight, December 9th, 2019

Flight summary:

Carrier: Egypt air
Equipment: Airbus 320-200
Flight number: MS760
Destination: Cairo
Origin: Copenhagen
Duration: 4hours 15 minutes
Class: C-business class

Seating:
2+2 wide seats
Seat 9A

Staff: Very friendly and helpful from the start to the end of the flight.

Food and drinks: we were served a welcome drink before take-off. Preparation for dinner started after 1 hour after takeoff. Started with serving juice, then appetizers and finally the main course. I was offered one of three choices; pasta with fish, oven baked chicken with rice or beef stew with rice. I chose chicken. Rice had a very plain taste. It could use some spices, but chicken tasted good. Food portion was big, so if you are a big eater the food will be more than enough. Coffee, tea and soft drinks were offered. Fresh fruits were also served and I chose chocolate mousse for desert. One hour and a half before landing, we were served some muffins and offered drinks.

On the negative side: I requested to move to a seat in the first raw. I was informed that these seats were blocked and subject to availability. Then air hostess informed me later that deadhead crew will occupy these seats. For me I thought that I should be given priority over deadhead.

There was quite a number of them on the flight. Imagine about 7 of them in the front galley, where only two are usually there, which limited access to the toilet.

Personally, I felt that they moved freely and actively in the business class area which was somehow disturbing.

Seats had no individual monitors. Movies were displayed on ceiling hanging units. Even then the quality of the movie shown was very poor.

One more thing, toilet was not in the best condition. It seemed old, the toilet seat was loose. Toilet and toilet sink were stained, looked like coffee stain to me. Whether it is coffee stain or not it should look clean.

In conclusion, I flew Austrian airlines, Swiss air, Lufthansa, KLM and Turkish airlines in business class to Cairo and I can say that Egypt air is better than some of the European Airlines. It was a good experience and I enjoyed my flight.

This review is based on my own personal experience.
crvsd: Salah Farag wrote a review Dec 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Cairo airport has so tight security that you go through the same checks (bags, shoes, belts) with 30m of each other. Savvy travellers know not to put things back but as first-time travellers to Cairo, we went through this rigmarole each time we went through Cairo. I am grateful for this security but within 30m of each checkpoint?

We travelled as a tour group and all of us were seated separately from our spouses/travelling partners even though we checked in together. However, it did give us the opportunity to get to know other tour members.

We did a Cairo-Luxor, Aswan-Abu-Simbel and Cairo-Amman on Egypt Air. As flights were short, we were given a small snack (biscuits) and a drink. Leg room was tight.

All flights left and arrived on time. Service was perfunctory.

Title:
EgyptAir has struggled a lot since 2011. 2018 was their first year to not make loss. They have even and still even updating their fleet. I flew from Frankfurt in one of their B787 which is in an amazing configuration and considering that EgyptAir has this all aisle access in business class. The food was good and the stewards did their job to the point. Unfortunately we had some delay during our approach to Cairo. Never mind I made it to my next flight to Dubai which was on an 8 year old A330-300. This aircraft shows its age but still flies like a babe. The service on this flight was even better and we arrived to Dubai 20 minutes ahead of our time.
I can recommend EgyptAir recently
They still got some issues regarding the massive security but I can understand these procedures after they had some bad records in the past years with terrorist attacks emerging to and from Egypt.
At the end the security is made for the passengers safety and of we know what to pack everything will be more than fine.
crvsd: M B wrote a review Dec 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew business class on this air line and didn't enjoy my experience. It started with security at the airport which will anger you. Egypt air have flagged 90% of the flight as random check (SSSS) on boarding passes. We can clearly all see that they are just doing a 100% inspection. in security you are supposed to go through steps that filter out candidates so that not everyone goes through a lengthy process but not with these cats. The first guy interrogated me very aggressively as if I am a suspect at a police station and he knows that I am guilty but he just wants to catch me lie and I am a US citizen flying home to the US!. Very disrespectful approach. Then from there we waited for an hour in line which was poorly managed. Several agents went through our bags using the wipes for chemicals detection and even would open the laptops to check. It truly was hilarious. Then other stations would again go through the bag and hold items out to feel them which disorganizes things for you just in case you enjoy repacking. This is already after the bags got X-Rayed and after every passenger went through both the metal detector and the millimeter wave scanners. Which makes you wonder what was the point of the questioning if you were going through everything anyway! From there the flight left 45 minutes late because of security. Now they may claim that this is not Egypt Air's problem but it actually is, because both the security and Egypt Air belong to the same pocket. I don't have to fly out of Cairo. If you want the transit business then you need to improve security services. So Security gets F-.
The air hostesses on the plane were fantastic. They were kind and attentive. They get an A+. The pilot however gets an F because we left 45 minutes late and arrived 45 minutes late. I have never met a pilot that can't make up the difference over a 12 hour flight. Except apparently this guy. This will affect you if you have connections.
The food on the plane gets a B. Not quite on par with Emirates or Qatar airways but better than the American airlines. The plane actually is good but there seems to be an AC problem. I struggled to sleep on the plane and was sweating. If you are a woman this will not bother you but for men I think it is hot. So B+ for the plane. For me I am not sure about this airline. It can be better if they can fix some of these issues. But for me overall it is so-so and not worth it just for the security process.
qwuub: A mixed bag with terrible security processes
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Fantastic experience flying with Egyptair. Good service. Flight was on time and early arrival. Highly recommended when visiting Egypt.
crvsd: Norman D. wrote a review Dec 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We arrived in cairo at 1.30 am in the morning, restless . Our next flight to Washington DC wiould be in 22 hours later. We expected that we would get a free hotel, had a good sleep and warm shower at a hotel.
But NO, we did not get any free accommodation nor any help to arrange a hotel.
The ground staffs were very root, arrogant and showed no interest to help at all!!
Right after I bought the ticket, I called Egypt air and asked about the free hotel, the employee who received my call said that We will received a free hotel during our transit. Based on that conversation I didn’t make any hotel reservation for our stop over in Cairo.

We traveled a lot with different airlines, such as Turkish airlines, Emirates and Maroccon airlines,they gave us free hotel when the stop over more than 8 hours and their ground staff were always respectful and helpful. Totally different from Egypt air ground staff in Cairo!!
They were very un professional!!
They were a nightmare!!!
I will NEVER book Egypt air.
crvsd: Love to travel wrote a review Dec 2019
qwuub: Worse nightmare to fly with Egypt air
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We had seats 9. (3 seats between 2of us).  Plenty of legroom For a 6ft 2 man.  The crew were very casual but nice. Didn’t wear a specific uniform on the way out, but a lovley brand new one on the return. No alcohol served, which is fine. A snack trolley came round with a small selection of goodies.   Very good all in all.

Title: Very nice and comfortable plane,it was on time, they gave us full course of meal for just a few hours, which is very nice. Plenty of leg room and spacious, just the people sitting behind us is very noisy.

Title: We booked a package holiday to Egypt, flying with Egyptair.  We were a little concerned when we read the reviews about this airline.  However, we were pleasently surprised to find ample leg room and really nice on board meals.  We didn't have any problems with lost luggage or customer services and would happily use this airline again.
