Title: Travelled to Cairo and back on Egyptair. First time to use them for a while. Planes were grubby, no leg room and food was awful. On both routes the seat arms were broken and on the return route there was no water in the toilets to wash your hands.  The only things that worked were check in and I got my suitcase. Next time I go to Cairo I think back to BA - although the flight time is not so good - I took the 14.00 Egyptair flight.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Flight from IAD to Cairo offers good pricing and very convenient direct service. Our experience on Egypt air flight is over all fair to good. The only disappointing point is the cabin crews' attitude and their poor customer service' skills. They look exhausted , are lacking a smile on their face and are blunt in their offerings. Even if you try to say "Thank you", they rarely respond or welcome your compliments. They show up for meals and they threw the snacks on you while you are sleeping. Through a 12 hours flight from Cairo to IAD, they never walk with water or drinks except in the 2 meals or the mid-flight snack. If you walk to the back of the flight to ask for water they point it to you to fill it while they are sitting. Overall they make you feel guilty if you ask for something. Lastly, I have collected the trash in a small paper bag from our seats and waited for them to come around but no body did, as I asked one of the crew to take it, she respond with " keep it on your seat for now". I hope see some attitude improvement on future flight!.
crvsd: sameh Y wrote a review Nov 2019
qwuub: Convenient schedule but poor on board service.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Since this was a long flight (Toronto to Cairo) we decided to upgrade to Business Class.
The good news was the seats went almost flat so sleeping was an option. The bad news was the in-flight entertainment was from the eighties. No recent movies. The food was mediocre and this airline does not serve booze, ie. it is dry. Fortunately, I had read that you could bring on board your own bottle of wine and the flight attendant was provide a glass (albeit not a wine glass) if asked. This turned out to be correct on both the out bound and in bound legs. Service was attentive but only slightly above average for business class. We tried both business class lounges in the Cairo airport and both were barely acceptable. Of course, neither had any wine, beer or liquor.
crvsd: Mac S wrote a review Nov 2019

Title:
OMG, I thought that Avianca was the worst one before I have had the experience with Egypt air. Star Alliance was the best in the world of my mind but since I have the experience with Egypt Air, I think that Star alliance is not that great in my impression.
First
Flight attendants are terribly not friendly and not well-trained plus bad-educated.
Second,
Food was horrible
Third,
No alcohol serving, yes NO, NO NO alcohol serving
fourth,
Since there are not fully booked, we don't have choice to switch the seats because their cabin crews want to stay in business class to sleep well, what the hell?
They arrange at least 5~6 pilots and cabin crews to occupy business class space for their own self?! which means before I book business class seats,, 5-6 seats always being booked by Egypt air.

If I have any chance to Egypt again, I do not think that I should take Egypt air again.

Title: Toronto-Cairo (Oct 28), Cairo-Toronto (Nov 9) on Boeing 777-300ER: very long non stop flights (over 11 hours), Economy felt very cramped, planes were full which surprised us given time of year, food was not great, exception was breakfast on both flights, lounge in Cairo was about 5 degrees Celsius and we were delayed leaving so hundreds froze for over and hour before being able to board the plane. Landing in Toronto on Nov 9 was scary as plane veered/tipped to the right, then the left , then the right again until all wheels were on the ground together. I would still recommend over having to change planes. Non stop flights are the best.

Title: Booked with egyptair through a package nile cruise. Plane had delay and was old and tatty. First freezing cold, then horribly hot. Scruffiest flight attendants I have ever seen. Food poor and gave me dreadful stomach upset so I missed my first day holiday excursions. I had hoped the bad reviews were just being a bit harsh but it really is not a great way to start your holiday and don’t get me started on Luxor airport arrival experience....but my boat and the nile are wonderful!!!

Title: We had a direct outward flight and needed to change flight in Cairo on the return journey.  Be prepared for high level security checks and the consequent stop/start progress through airports in Egypt.  They are very careful indeed and although irritating in the middle of the night most passengers recognise the need for the process.In flight films and audio available.  Refreshments pretty good - no alcohol.The business class and first class cabins didn’t seem worth the high premium a passenger might pay for the extra facilities and space.  We flew eco only and had good service.   Would thoroughly recommend Egyptair.

Title:
WE, a number of relatives and friends, flew to Cairo and toured Egypt. The flight to Cairo and return to Mumbai were with EgyptAir. The flight was comfortable and the entire process was smooth and comfortable.
On the return flight there was a problem with the seat allocation as we wanted a through flight for our luggage. Their dealing official had to re-do the procedure and my wife and I were given front seats in the Economy seating space. We appreciated this and the Hostesses on board were exceptionally helpful.
Thank you EgyptAir.

Title: The entire flight was awesome, the in flight service was great, the food was really good. Title: Egyptair's flight crew was surly and borderline rude.  Food was poor.  It was a daytime flight and the lights were dimmed for most of the trip.  No beverage service except with the 2 meals although if you went back to the galley, they would supply coffee and water.    Some food was spilled on me during the tray pick up.  The flight attendant's first words were "It's not my fault."  She then proceeded to stand there while I attempted to clean up and the gentleman sitting next to me apologized.  Most of the rice was contained to the blanket I had over my lap.  I folded it up and handed it to the attendant.  She proceeded to shake it out in the aisle and hand it back to me.  Disgusting.  I will avoid Egyptair in the future.

Title:
It has been four and a half months since Egyptair lost my suitcase. Since then, I have not received my suitcase or any compensation. This all happened after my husband and I experienced delayed flights and cancelled flights without any prior communication. In my dealings with Egyptair, my communications have been ignored most of the time. The service I have received from Egyptair throughout my entire experience with them has been extremely poor and very disappointing. 

Egyptair eventually came back to me with an offer to pay only 68% of my missing suitcase claim. Except for the things that Egyptair can never pay me back for (the three days of holiday in Rome that we lost and will never get back, my wedding earrings that I took with me on holiday, the sentimental souvenirs of the places we visited), they are not even willing to pay me the full amount of the missing items in my suitcase. Shame on you Egyptair. I will never ever fly with Egyptair again. I would rather pay double the price anywhere else, as you lose a lot more by flying with Egyptair anyway.
crvsd: Ruani Smit wrote a review Nov 2019
qwuub: No Compensation for Suitcase After Four and a Half Months (Plus Cancelled and Delayed Flights)

Title: Our flight was delayed and basically no communication was sent as to why. Then we were asked to change gates. An hour later we were told to go back to the original gate. Then boarding streets 2.5 hrs later with no announcement what so ever. On board no better. No smile from the crew, coffee served cold. Overall just the poorest experience.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My recent (and first) experience with EGYPTAIR was nothing short of disastrous! I strongly advise you stay as far away as possible from this pathetic excuse for an airline, and here’s why:

I was traveling from Toronto to Lagos on 28th October with a 3.5 hour layover at Cairo. First they reschedule the flight from Toronto to 2 hours later, and then there’s another 45 minute delay for take off! I was terrified that I may miss my connecting flight but thankfully that didn’t happen as I literally ran to the boarding gate at Cairo airport. Unfortunately, my checked in bag didn’t make it. I landed in Lagos but my checked in bag was left behind in Cairo. When I approached the airport authorities at Lagos they took down my complaint and informed me that my bag would arrive the next day. So here I was without my bags, or any extra clothes or toiletries in Lagos for more than a day and as if that wasn’t enough when I finally got my bag the next day I find out that the LOCK WAS OPENED and much of my STUFF WAS GONE! I had been ROBBED!

Next, I did what I had to do and e-mailed EGYPT AIR regarding the stolen items from my checked in baggage on 31st October. They responded to me the same day asking for details of the missing items along with their prices and receipts. I obviously didn’t have the receipts handy but somehow managed to retrieve them and e-mailed them back with all the necessary info and documentation the very same day. It’s been more than a week now and I have not received any acknowledgment/update from them, even after multiple follow ups. I also tried contacting their FaceBook page but the only response I got was ‘please get in touch with the concerned department’. A locked checked in bag being opened in transit and stuff being stolen from it is in no way a small issue and the complete lack of apathy on part of EGYPT AIR towards its customers is absolutely appalling!

So in nutshell, STAY AWAY FROM EGYPT AIR! If you value your peace of mind (and belongings), please make sure you avoid EGYPT AIR at all costs!
crvsd: Sneha N wrote a review Nov 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We flew with Egypt air in October. The plane was clean and comfortable. The cabin crew were excellent. Pleasant and efficient. The food served was very good. We would certainly fly with them again
crvsd: Vickie H wrote a review Nov 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I used egypt air (Business class) in August 2019, Accra to Tokyo with a transit in Egypt only to arrive in Narita Airport in Tokyo with no luggage. I filed my missing luggage as soon as possible and received a mail indicating it will be worked on. That was the last I heard from the airline, I followed up with calls in Tokyo by myself and the concierge but never any response. There were hardly any attendants to even pick the call. I returned to Ghana still with no luggage or a credible response. I go to their office in Accra regularly only to be met with Empty desks. Their manager Mr. Taha is barely in office and I still have no information on my luggage. It’s been almost 4 months now with no update or compensation. To think I was a business class ticket holder and experienced this mismanagement is appalling. I will never use this airline or recommend this airline to anyone. Very rude attendants in Cairo when I asked to follow up on the luggage during my transit. Worst airline ever
crvsd: Khadija A wrote a review Nov 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

They are thieves, your baggage will be stolen, and you will never be compensated for it.

Title: Our flight was delayed and basically no communication was sent as to why. Then we were asked to change gates. An hour later we were told to go back to the original gate. xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My recent (and first) experience with EGYPTAIR was nothing short of disastrous! I strongly advise you stay as far away as possible from this pathetic excuse for an airline, and here’s why:

I was traveling from Toronto to Lagos on 28th October with a 3.5 hour layover at Cairo. First they reschedule the flight from Toronto to 2 hours later, and then there’s another 45 minute delay for take off! I was terrified that I may miss my connecting flight but thankfully that didn’t happen as I literally ran to the boarding gate at Cairo airport. Unfortunately, my checked in bag didn’t make it. I landed in Lagos but my checked in bag was left behind in Cairo. When I approached the airport authorities at Lagos they took down my complaint and informed me that my bag would arrive the next day. So here I was without my bags, or any extra clothes or toiletries in Lagos for more than a day and as if that wasn’t enough when I finally got my bag the next day I find out that the LOCK WAS OPENED and much of my STUFF WAS GONE! I had been ROBBED!

Next, I did what I had to do and e-mailed EGYPT AIR regarding the stolen items from my checked in baggage on 31st October. They responded to me the same day asking for details of the missing items along with their prices and receipts. I obviously didn’t have the receipts handy but somehow managed to retrieve them and e-mailed them back with all the necessary info and documentation the very same day. It’s been more than a week now and I have not received any acknowledgment/update from them, even after multiple follow ups. I also tried contacting their FaceBook page but the only response I got was ‘please get in touch with the concerned department’. A locked checked in bag being opened in transit and stuff being stolen from it is in no way a small issue and the complete lack of apathy on part of EGYPT AIR towards its customers is absolutely appalling!

So in nutshell, STAY AWAY FROM EGYPT AIR! If you value your peace of mind (and belongings), please make sure you avoid EGYPT AIR at all costs!
crvsd: Sneha N wrote a review Nov 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We flew with Egypt air in October. The plane was clean and comfortable. The cabin crew were excellent. Pleasant and efficient. The food served was very good. We would certainly fly with them again

Title: I used egypt air (Business class) in August 2019, Accra to Tokyo with a transit in Egypt only to arrive in Narita Airport in Tokyo with no luggage. I filed my missing luggage as soon as possible and received a mail indicating it will be worked on. That was the last I heard from the airline, I followed up with calls in Tokyo by myself and the concierge but never any response. There were hardly any attendants to even pick the call. I returned to Ghana still with no luggage or a credible response. I go to their office in Accra regularly only to be met with Empty desks. Their manager Mr. Taha is barely in office and I still have no information on my luggage. It’s been almost 4 months now with no update or compensation. To think I was a business class ticket holder and experienced this mismanagement is appalling. I will never use this airline or recommend this airline to anyone. Very rude attendants in Cairo when I asked to follow up on the luggage during my transit. Worst airline ever

Title: Very smooth and nice flight from Paris to Cairo. New plane with single seats next to the windows. Very caring and helpful staff. I had a low fat meal (new on Egyptair) nothing fancy but good. Choice of films is still a bit limited. A strange thing also is that the table is very high, especially when you work on your computer. However, there is a clear improvement of Egyptair which used to be far behind what you would expect from a Star Alliance airline. Just make sure to choose the right time. The late flight is with an old plane, the seats are very old and unconfortable, TV is the type you pull out from your seat etc.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The whole trip to Luxor via Cairo went smoothly.  The staff were friendly and helpful,The food was delicious, and it was refreshing to have a flight without alcohol.  This made for relaxed and happy customers without the usual problems relating to alcohol.  There was no pushy selling of products or scratchcards which I also appreciated.  The business class area was spacious.

Title: In the last 2 weeks flew from JFK to Cairo and return. Yesterday on the new Dreamliner, 787. Airplane was dirty. Service almost nonexistent, lousy at best. Tough to get a cup of water. Food was just terrible even using typical airline standards. Toilets filthy and had to tell personal to put in toilet paper in the bathroom. Seats really close to seat in front even when flights 11.5 hours flying west. If possible fly another carrier.

Title:
Let me start with the positives. Price was considerably lower than competitors, crew were excellent, flights were on time and food was plentiful. And the overnight kit was one of the better ones.

Now the downsides. Seats are rather tired (ashtrays), not very comfortable, but with incredible leg room on the leg from Geneva to Cairo and return. Food is below average. No alcohol is served. On the Cairo to Joburg and return the seats recline to a near flat bed. Food was better, but only marginally and still below average.

Lounges in Cairo serve no alcohol, the food while plentiful is not very good and hard to relax in the seating.

Not a bad experience at all and the price reflects the quality. They need to get better food. Experience was slightly below average, but I graded on value and it was very good.
qwuub: Price was right, and service excellent
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flying Being 737-800 which the major plane in Egyptair.
Service is moderate and the seas are not that comfortable !!! Still the arrival was earlier than expected thanks to the captain. Check In in Malpensa airport is not the best and the ground crew are not the best and the manager is always trying to keep the front seats for his favorite people!!!
Carrying the gold card entitled me to go to the lounge but the gate is located far from the lounge !!!

Title: Dubai to Rome via Cairo.. The check-in as well as the boarding process was smooth and the staff was efficient and helpful. The cabin crew for both flight were nice and kind. For the in flight entertainment, the touch screen was responsive but quite slow and the movie content was not so up-to-date. The food was okay. Both flights arrived on time and there was no delay in the luggage as well. Overall, it was a pleasant journey.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
The good thing about this flight is its consistency. It always operates on the dot of time. The crew are also up and doing and very friendly. The catering services are very good too except that they do not provide options. However, I enjoyed the delicious meals.
Luggage is on the belt as soon as you arrive at your destination.
The toilets are enough and neat.
The Airline also took us to Novotel Hotel in Cairo for a transit night but really wasted a lot of time. We arrived Cairo 9pm but were only taken to the Hotel at midnight. We didn't have enough time to sleep. Their on-board services are a lot better than the Airport services.
Generally, I like the airline and salute their consistency and on-board services.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: This was really the worst flight experience I have ever had and I fly a Lot. We was supposed to depart from Sharm el Sheikh at 15:55, only 10 minutes before the flight we was shown on the board that the flight is delayed for an hour with no further explanation and nobody was there from the staff to ask for any information or help. Then the flight time changed 2 times again and we was delayed now till 17:55. When finally someone came there was no apologies, and on the question what will be with our conecting flights we was just told "My college will bring you new boarding pass". That was all they had to say. So since we missed the flight at 18:05 from Cairo to Hurghada, we was put on the next flight at 22:25 ( which was in the end also delayed). After spending 3 and half hours in Cairo airport it was time to board the flight to hurghada, in the control than they told us we have to throw our lighter away, after talking him that we was flying with the same lighter just 3 hours ago we got no reaction. And what made me more angry..... The Guy behind us was allowed to keep his lighter. Seriously that was my worst experience ever. Very disappointed!!!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Very late leaving London, 80 minutes, because the previous flight was late into London, which I don't think was entirely true,  the plane was already waiting at least 45 minutes before departure time. Because of this we only just got our connection to Sharm, but Egypt air left all our baggage in Cairo. We had to take a taxi to Sharm airport the next day to get our baggage, an unexpected expense. They changed our return flight from Sharm and this reduced our stay by about 10 hours, only to find they had re-established the original flight after we had committed to a much earlier flight, not impressed.

Title:
My husband and I used EgyptAir for all of our flights within Egypt. Honestly, we have no complaints! The service from start to finish was excellent. They checked our carry-on suitcases at no extra cost. Our boarding passes were emailed to us two days prior to each of our flights.
They always had pillows and blankets on all flights and the seats were decently comfortable. No matter how short the flight was (1 hour flight from Cairo to Sharm for example), they still had time to serve snacks and beverages.
If you plan on visiting Egypt, we definitely recommend using EgyptAir when flying within the country.
crvsd: Christy T wrote a review Oct 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Worst airline  even dangerousSafety is not in their concern My mum took their direct  flight  Cairo /Toronto last July and their wheelchair service assistant left her in the middle of the Airport alone I found my mother who is 78 years oldAnd diabetic after 2 hours in a very bad shape that she had to be admitted to the hospital next day and I have a medical report as a proof When  I contacted the Airline ... They were very careless and they just apologized and they promised a recompensation  that I never received for sure

Title:
I took this flight for Cairo and then back to Amsterdam.
Both times the flight was on time.
The seats are normal size and clean enough.
The food (a vegetarian meal) was ok, nothing special and nothing bad.
The staff was always kind and polite.
We could choose from some movies and music, the catalogue is not big but more than enough for a 4,5 hours flight.
Overall not the best company / airplane that I've used but good enough.

Title: lovely flight, on time , friendly crew members, enjoyed a soft drink and lovely cookies, clever captains with smooth landing and the same for the return flight too.

Title: We live in NY and spent a long vacation in Egypt touring the sites.  We arrived in Egypt via Lufthansa which included a stop over.  On the way home, we found a star alliance member flight, Egypt Air, which served a non-stop route from Cairo to JFK.  We thought this 12 hour flight would be ideal as we would likely be exhausted from all the sightseeing.  THIS WAS A MISTAKE.The captain smoked cigarettes throughout the whole flight.  The aircraft smelled of smoke and flight attendants acknowledged this, confirmed it was the captain smoking, and proceeded to spray a hideous perfume around the cabin to help mask the stench.  This made it worse!  The entire aircraft was coughing...ironically the no smoking sign stayed illuminated throughout the whole flight.I find it ironic that the entire airline is dry (no beer, wine or liquor), but the captain can fill the air with cigarette smoke for a long haul flight.  Google other reviews as this is not the first time.If you have any choice in airline...opt for a stop over and avoid this airline at all costs.
qwuub: NEVER AGAIN.  Captain chain smoked cigarettes for the entire flight!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We flew with two kids to Cairo on EGYPTAIR and the airline had such poor service. They did not have infant safety belts on board and as such I just had to hold onto my 1 year old during take off and landing. Title: Flying from Barcelona to Cairo and next to Luxor, the baggage was lost somewhere. During all days staying in Egypt we were repeatedly told the baggage was at Cairo but couldn't reach us, then when we were in Aswan they said it was in Luxor, then back to Cairo... In summary they were cheating us every day to avoid face the fact they lost the baggage. Back at home we tried to request the compensation but after more than one month Egypt Air failed to respond to any of the multiple requests via their advertised email addresses and phone numbers. I think is the worst experience I have ever had from a service provider. It's really difficult for me to understand how this terrible behavior and horrible customer care can be part of Star Alliance. Obviously I will try to avoid as much as possible flying again with Egypt Air based on the customer care sensitivity and I will recommend NOT to do to all my friends ...

To top it off, the cabin where we were seated was uncomfortably hot for the entire trip. Could not find cabin crew to complain. They were there only for food service and no other time. Title:
So, i was ready for a s%$t show when I got to the desk in Toronto. A number of reviews I had read had contained horror stories about everything from attitude to cleanliness.

When I approached the check-in desk, after spending quiet time in the Air Canada Lounge which Business Class entitles you to, the lady behind the counter was very pleasant. she appeared to be seriously overworked, but smiled and made a bit of small talk. Definitely a good start.

So, back to the boarding. Apparently some of the passengers felt that they could crowd the entrance lines at will, without regard to their ticket group/number/class. I did have to politely inform one gentleman that there was a line for Business Class and that it required him to go to the end. He looked sheepish and tried to mime not speaking English, until another passenger seconded my request in his native tongue that he remove himself from the head of the line.

So that experience, while irksome after waiting half an hour in line, had nothing to do with Egyptair, and they worked diligently to make the boarding process smooth. The process went smoothly and once on board it was easy to find my seat.

So the seats are NOT "dreamliner" type seats with individual cocoons that isolate you from other passengers. However they do have privacy screens, and that kept me isolated enough. Service by the cabin crew was very good. I have been on some flights where they virtually anticipate your every whim, and this was not one of them. However, the attendants circulated regularly, and contrary to other reviews I have read, they do refill your non-alcoholic drinks, although on request.

The food was very good, and service was efficient. the blankets were fluffy and the seat recline suited me, although I have heard some say they are not lay flat, it seemed to let me lay flat and stretch out nicely.

Two interesting tidbits. They give you stickers to put on your seat showing if you want to be woken for meals, are interested in duty free, or want to be left alone. What a great idea for a business class experience where one might need to sleep and have no interest in duty free. I chose to wake up for meals since I was hungry and sure enough they got me up and served. The second tidbit is they have a "star ceiling". they project stars on the ceiling of the cabin to help you sleep I guess. Cool.

I watched a movie, and the inventory was good not great. Games worked well, and I used my own music, so that was not evaluated.

Overall I have to say that the reviews I had read had me ready for a grumpy, ill mannered crew, old outdated equipment, and terrible food. I found this flight to be anything but!

Kudos to the crew and staff for making a very long flight to Cairo very enjoyable.

The second leg was Cairo to Riyadh. this was more of a circus when trying to board, until the boss called for Business Class in a separate line. The gate in Cairo was a mess, and no one seemed to care.

The airframe was older, with seats I remember from 2001ish. However lots of room, and again good service. Again the crew and staff did their job and flight was very good.

I don't know what these other reviewers were on about. I hope that the dates of their reviews had something to do with the vitriol they heaped on Egyptair. I can only say, that as someone who flies regularly in the US, and frequently worldwide, this was NOT a negative experience. Given price and schedule considerations I would certainly fly Egyptair again in the future.

I will be updating this for my return trip in nine days so watch this space!
qwuub: Good experience on Egyptair after hearing horror stories!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I acutally flew Egypt AIr three times.
The first was Johannesburg, South Africa to Cairo.
The second, Cairo to Aswan.
The third, Hurghada to Cairo.

All were economy class flights. Except for the first flight, they were all short and not worth upgrading. They were all pretty basic. Some of the seats reclined better than others. A seat in front of me kept reclining whether or not the pax seated there wanted to lay back or not.

Cleanliness was OK. Restroom cleanliness was OK too.
I prefer window seats because I like the view. However on 2 planes, I saw more window scratches than anything else.
Also, there are still ashtrays in the armrests - at least they don't smell of cigarettes still - although one kind of did.

If I were back in Egypt, I would use them again though I would stick with my other preferred carriers for international travel heading in/out of Cairo when possible.

Airport check in:
In Johannesburg, there is no permanent EgyptAir desk. So you have to wait for those to open up. If you go too early you will wait for a while before you can check your bags. If you've got no bags to check, then you might be able to get through security to relax in a lounge.

in Cairo, relatively painless check in due to early morning flight.

Hurghada to Cairo - easy check in as we were early. But even though the concierge at the hotel said we wouldn't need that much time, earlier is better. Later, the line was really long and slow. Even though it's a small airport, it's just nicer not having to rush.

In general, service at check-in was very simple. Nothing too friendly, nothing too rude.
In flight service was more friendly but nothing extravagant.
crvsd: Kumi M wrote a review Sep 2019
qwuub: Egypt Air. If you're traveling around Egypt.

Title:
Honestly, I wasn't expecting much from a 3-star airline like Egyptair at first, but my flight from Bangkok to London with a stopover in Cairo was fantastic!

Firstly, the check-in counter of Egyptair at BKK is very organised, as a frequent BKK airport user I can tell you that this is one of the fastest check-ins I've ever had, only second to Thai Airways.

Security was of course, slow, but I guess you can't blame it on the airline.

Boarding was very professional, flight attendants came around to make sure that bags are stowed and passengers are seated, just like a regular full-service airline.

Upon arrival in CAI, there wasn't really anything special, the flight landed at 4am in the morning and passengers were escorted by bus to the terminal for arrivals/transfer.

However, upon my departure from Cairo, there was a crying baby onboard! Passengers sitting nearby had no choice but to move to the already-full rear section of the plane, the crew did absolutely nothing to help this situation, the baby stayed on the flight until landing. All passengers from rows 21-30 all had headaches throughout the flight! Not a pleasant one.

I also would like to bring up that my suitcase was RUINED (in every possible way - from the wheels to the deep scratches on the surface). I don't know if I can blame this on the airline because it's usually the airport's fault, but I've contacted Egyptair and no response was given one week after the incident. Not a very responsive cx service in my experience!

I am extremely devastated because everything in that luggage mean so much to me, they are my personal journal, notes, cards, gifts and jewelries that has been with all my travels in the last decade. I am extremely devastated because no one is speaking to me, I haven't got any written reply from Egypt Air, they are slacking and not handling their passengers' belongings with care, and my time is running out here in Cairo. What more do I need to do?

Please Egypt Air, you really screwed up here. And now you are ignoring your passenger, leaving me hanging without a single clue of what's going on. When I left the airport without my luggage you said I would need to wait 3 days for someone to respond to my emails, I have sent out all the info about the luggage and it's contents, and receive ZERO reply!!! Title:
Recently took a flight from the US to the Middle east. The long haul flight was pleasant with business class seats resembling semi private pods. great service by the air hosts and hostesses and very service oriented. clean bathrooms during the flight was a relief. A bed service as is offered on other major airlines was not offered. Great food and snacks.

This great service was not however provided during transit in Cairo
After being herded towards the transit lounge we were informed the destination we were going to was from another terminal and we had to wait for the transport to take us there. Without being told when or how we would be going to this terminal we were made to wait for close to 20 mins without being informed on progress. Afte an 11 hour flight this was certainly not ideal. We were eventually transferred to another gate and had to wait for transport to take us to the other terminal. when we arrived at CV sias 'other terminal' we had to go through security into a large waiting haul...one had to use ones intuition to find someone to ask where the lounge was...only to find a lounge where we were informed that we were to be transported to yet another lounge and would have to wait for yet another form of transport to take us there. The lounge had wifi and a full buffet with very attentive staff. No showers and only one abultuon facility that was mostly occupied...again hardly ideal after a 11 hour flight.

The handling of passengers and informing them of the process especially after 11hours would be a first step instead of blindly informing passengers to wait. Also it would be prudent to have the staff go through security at the lounge instead of transporting them to two different buildings.
crvsd: Intrepid Traveller wrote a review Sep 2019
qwuub: Good flight but poor transit information

Title: Flight from Sharm to Cairo was appx 90 minutes late and check in chaotic . The Cairo - Joburg leg was on a very tired and old A330 - which went technical at Cairo for 4 hours after embarkation & which was announced as "changing the landing gear" - not reassuring - the take off sounded like parts were falling off the ceiling - the flight was dry ( no alcohol)  as was the business lounge which was also spectacularly uncomfortable - the inflight entertainment system was baggage-bin mounted not individual and was terrible quality for an 8 hour flight  and then only had 30 minutes at ORT in south africa to make my connection - far too tight. Title:
I had to change last minute from Emirates. Egypt air was available and £1000 cheaper.
The plane was old, the seats an old style and over spaced verses new airlines, this worked for me as I am 6'4'' and i could stretch out in the nearly flat seats, so big tick for sleeping. The entertainment kit is old, so the remotes intermittently work and the screens are a little low in resolution but ok.

The food is really poor, as an example cheese would be cheddar that has been in the open air and dried out and say brie similarly dry. Breakfast a plain tasteless omelet, coffee warm not hot, no alcohol, but the fruit juices are the cheapest boxed type.

Service staff are nice and helpful, but they have little they can do with what they have to offer you.

Title:
There is a lot to say. In summary for those not wanting to read too much, the staff members are incredibly rude and refuse to communicate during and after a delayed flight. I was delayed both ways and therefore it is obvious that they are not reliable. The food is pretty terrible, the drinks were unavailable and the entertainment is shockingly boring.

I definitely understand flight delays. I am sympathetic towards Airlines that have to delay their flights. However, I can't stress enough how important communication is in these situations! My flight was delayed by 21 hours. I am a female travelling alone and therefore made sure that my stop overs would be maximum 4 hours. When my flight was delayed I was not told what was going on, only that 'I must go home and come back tomorrow morning'. What time? No one could give an answer. So I went home. and arrived at 7am the next morning. I then got informed that EgyptAir offices will only open at 10:30am. So I waited.
When I eventually got in contact with an EgyptAir employee, I was rudely told that I will board the next flight that leaves at 2:30pm. I asked about the rest of my flight, when will I leave Cairo to get to Paris? Turns out they wanted me to have a 12 hour delay in Cairo! I specifically booked a flight with a 3 hour stop over, I am not willing to wait in an airport for 12 hours alone. As a matter of fact I paid more for my flight ticket just for the short layover.
After a lot of begging and a massive delay, they ended up putting me on a direct flight at 7pm.
Because of this delay, I missed accommodation and transport that had been paid for. I also had to catch up with my tour which was a massive expense particularly with the exchange rate. I was promised compensation for all of that. It is two and a half months after my delay, I have emailed every single day almost like it became a religion. The result?
You may have guessed - I have been ignored blatantly for these past two and a half months. Until now.
Today they finally responded, they would like to offer 20% discount on my next flight. First off, that's nowhere near the amount of money I lost. Secondly, did they really think I'd ever fly with them again? And third, a discount results in me spending more money not gaining the money that I lost. Common sense.

It has taken me a long time to write this review only because I wanted to give EgyptAir the benefit of the doubt. But they have showed me over and over again that they do NOT value their customers. I'm disgusted and plain shocked at how people are not willing to do their one job. They get paid to ignore the people paying them, great EgyptAir.

Additionally, their flights are way over-priced for what you get. Much prefer to pay R2000 more and get a proper non-delayed flight with great entertainment and good enough food through Emirates.

Enough said, I hope.
qwuub: SHOULDN'T CUSTOMER SUPPORT BE A PRIORITY?
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Short story: I will NEVER fly EgyptAir ever again. I would not recommend anyone to fly with or waste their money on this airline.

Long story: I flew with this airline twice in a 2 month span. Once at the end of June 2018 and again in early August 2018. Both flights were roundtrip JFK-CAI.

The first flight at the end of June was my first experience with the airline. First my husband and I were not seated together for an almost 12 hour flight. We tried to ask for this to be corrected prior to the flight via phone, via the check in desk and they all said there was nothing they could do.

Once on the flight we managed to sit beside each other near the window. Which brings me to my second point, DO NOT SIT near the window. Worse decision ever. The plane is very old and doesn't have individual air vents. The way it's set up, it doesn't blow towards the passengers seated near the windows. So as you can imagine, it gets outrageously hot.

On that same flight, we noticed the flight attendants fighting with one another and one of them actually walked passed us crying!

Also, the tv for my seat was not working for the entire duration of the flight. I asked multiple times for it to be fixed and different attendants would say they would restart it to no avail. On request number 4 and 5 I was told they would do something extra to make it work which obviously did absolutely nothing. That is they did anything at all. Not to mention the heat the tv screens emitted only exacerbated the hot and poor air circulation situation.

In early July, on the flight back from CAI to JFK we again were sitting near the window which meant we were sitting in a sauna. I'm pretty sure the temperature was cooler in Egypt than on the plane. It was awful.

When they brought my food out an ant was walking across my tray. That aside from the fact that the food is subpar made me lose my appetite.

Also on this same flight a passenger a few seats ahead of us started yelling at the attendants because she had asked for water multiple times and no one had provided any to her. She also complained of the heat that we were all experiencing. It should not be normal for passengers to be sweating on a 12 hour flight in such conditions.

I even personally asked one of the attendants to turn on the a.c. which she said she would do. Instead, they went down all the rows and asked all the passengers to close their windows. What year are we in?? Why did I pay a ridiculous amount of money for makeshift solutions??

In early August we unfortunately had to take the same JFK - CAI again. We had booked all our flights at the same time otherwise I definitely would not have taken the same airline.

This time we had my father in law with us who needs additional assistance on and off the airplane. We were assigned the middle row this time (not near the windows) and I must say, now I know where all the cold air was going! While I was very cold the people near the window were still complaining about how hot the plane was.

Unfortunately for me, my pillow was already dirty and my blanket had a dead bug in the plastic wrapping with it. I showed them both to the attendant and asked for them to be replaced she said okay and took them away. No one returned with a replacement so I followed up and they said they didn't have any more. So, ironically enough I was now cold without a blanket.

On the returning flight the 3 of us were seated apart even though we requested to be seated together. Additionally, I was very nauseous at some point and urgently requested some water from an attendant multiple times and he just looked at me and rolled his eyes! This same attendant was also the same one who was giving my father in law, an older man, a hard time for asking for anything.

In summary, the few hundred saved is not worth the treatment or conditions on these flights. If you need to travel pick another airline. Dont waste your time or money on this disaster show. For me to complete this review a year later is a testament to how bad it was.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The Egypt Air airplanes between Lagos and Cairo must be the shabbiest and dirtiest in their fleet.  Not only do the seats look so terribly worn out but the two main levers to adjust them - foot rest and incline simply do not work.  In addition to the dodgy airplane seats, flight MS 876 of 22 August that departed at 14h20 had horrible service.  Business class passengers in particular (I was in business class) were served their whole meal on single blue plastic disposable meal trays and thin  disposable plastic cups for drinking. For cutlery, we were given white disposable plastic spoon and plastic fork (no knife - plastic or otherwise). We were served with a choice between fish, chicken and beef.  I chose beef.   The beef was a single roundish lump of meat sitting in some indistinguishable and unnamed liquid. When I asked for a knife, the flight attendant said she had none and suggested I change my choice of food - which I did.  The one harried attendant who served the business class passengers during the 6-hour flight seemed to have little or no experience in serving on a plane.  Even on a scale of one to one hundred, I would still hesitate to give the business class of Egypt Air flight MS 876 of 22 August 2019 that departed at 14h20 from Lagos murtala muhammed international airport a one!  I certainly will never fly Egypt Air business class again and advise whoever cares to read this review not to either.
qwuub: Horrible, cringe-worthy Egypt Air Lagos/Cairo flight MS 876 of 22 August 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We had to stop over at Cairo airport since the layover is over 11 hours but we check with our handler and also with Egpyt air if we can stay at Meridien Hotel right off the terminal 3 without a Visa. The answer is "yes" no problem. We book the hotel for an overnight stay when we got to Cairo airport, the Egpyt air said we need a Visa since they have another plane arriving at Cairo in 4 hours and they can not arrange a hotel stay or a Visa for us. We said we provide our own hotel at the Meridien and we pay for our own hotel but you guys said in Queen Alia International Airport that we don't need a Visa and now we have to get one to leave the airport to get into the Meridien Hotel at Terminal 3. My final conclusion to this issue is bad communication and no one can give a correct answer before we book our hotel. My other note to Egpyt air is that the stewardesses on the plane don't pick up any papers on the aisles and half the restrooms were stuck with paper towels in the toilets which cause the restrooms unusable thru our 11 hours of flight time. When we landed at JFK the stewardesses did not give direction on not to get up until we fully stop at the gate. A lot of passengers started to get up and get their pieces of luggage from the overhead. It is a badly run airline as far as I am concern.

Title:
I’ve recently used Egyptair to fly to Kenya
I don’t usually write any reviews but I wouldn’t want anyone to suffer too
The flight is the same as Ryan air all cramped and the connecting flight I wouldn’t even try to rate as it’s terrible
The connecting flight we are rushed so that it leaves on time
But our baggage handlers are relaxed and didn’t bother to load onto the connecting flight.
2 days no luggage and the worst flight experience ever
Then to top it off at London Heathrow we got all our seats confirmed with our meal plans only to find out that there were no vegetarian meals on flight
To try and accommodate we would have been happy with fruit
But again nothing onboard

On our return journeyed tried to confirm our meal plan and seats which egyptair sorted for us in Heathrow
Again they could not accommodate us
And the manager blamed it on the British government which is ridiculous

To top it off our luggage was delayed again on the way back to London
It seems like the staff were all sleeping
As we found a few staff sleeping behind our seats in departures,
And immigration staff had to wake up other staff sleeping to let us through
No finger prints, no photo just a quick stamp and off he went back to sleep

I wouldn’t fly with Egyptair even if they offered me a free flight as the quality of everything is very low,service is slow and I don’t want to get frustrated so the best thing is not to think of Egyptair at all
We’re the staff very helpful ahh....... No

Title:

2 passengers, 1 bag allowance per ticket and yet they won't help.

That's not the issue for over a year now we get NO HELP, NO CARE. They are the worst company I have ever dealt with.

It's so simple yet no one replies and no one can just make the decision.

Their form says 21days, we have 400days and counting.

SHAME ON EGYPT AIR!!

Title:
I tried to book a flight with Egyptair from JFK to CAI with Egyptair website but the payment got denied so I called my bank in the US to check what the problem is and they confirmed to me that my credit card is in a good shape and Egyptair didn't request the payment so I saved the reservation pending to the payment and called the Egyptair in NY +1 2125815600
A lady answered and said "yes" ,didn't even introduce herself ,so I provided her with the pending reservation number
she was very aggressive with me and didn't even give me the chance to talk and explain my booking situation .
She asked for my address ,so I gave her my street name and number and zip code connected to my credit card ,but she aggressively said "just answer what you been asked for ! " when I offered to provide the City and the state ! then I gave all the info she asked but she came back to tell me that the purchase has been denied
I did my best to go to the next level of support and she keep raising her tone for no reason and keep telling me "that is it"
I asked to transfer me to another department like billing department ,but she were very rude
She don't know how to handle or troubleshoot a booking issue
That's when I told her I need to talk to your supervisor when she said " You are talking to one right now !!"
I asked her for her name ,I got no clue .
I asked again "may I speak to your supervisor please ?" She started insulating me and then forced me to be on hold with without even asking ! Then she ended the call with no notice
Got a call later from someone called himself Charles he refused to help after I kept asking who overview this office and refused to provide me with any answer and not even an apology furthermore he said he tried to use my card for the booking after the lady employee hang on me at the time I wasn't even on the call with them without my consent "That's called in The US "identity theft "and told me he will put me in hold to talk to someone who didn't even identify his name or position even after I kept asking "as he said because he is going to be nervous on me !!"
After couple of minutes somebody said his name is Ayman the supervisor of the reservation which add nothing new except the lady name which he claimed to be "Radia"
After this customer services I received I don't even believe all those names to be real names !!
It is a shame the ancient Egyptair which is one of the oldest Airlines in the world to let unprofessional group of employee to treat their customer that way not only in a rude and unprofessional way ,but also by getting involved in identity theft activities.
I didn't receive the minimum level of respect .

Title:
While booking on line it was confusing how much checking in luggage weight allowance was. At the checking counter at the airport It was 2 x 23 kg bags and 8 kg hand luggage. All along while booking online it showed 1x 23 kg and 8 kg hand luggage.
Had a 13 hours layover in Cairo. Hotel was provided by the airline as per Faa rules. However it took 4 gruesome hours wait at the airport to get a room and 1 hour to check in after a 20 minute drive to the hotel. Further, the room had to be shared with a total stranger. Breakfast and lunch was provided. The hotel was good and clean.
No exit visa was required, though the passport was retained by the airport immigration and returned.
Things to note, no time to sight see or shop, no alcohol given on plane.

Title:
I bought a couple of souvenirs at the airport in the Egyptair shop. They had to cost 6 euros but the cashier (a man) tells us 7 euros. I pointed out that the price had to be 6 euros but he repeated 7 euros. He makes us pay and tells us that we have to wait a few seconds for the receipt. After giving us the receipt we immediately run to the gate because the plane was about to leave. Only later did I see that the receipt had been made of 6 euros and not 7. In practice the cashier pocketed 1 euro. Surely it is a scam repeated very often during the day. In my opinion the cops are also involved in the scam, since there was one to hear them.

Among other things, the scam is compounded by the fact that it is an important egyptair store! Don't buy or at the end report! The cashier is a man, unfortunately I don't have a picture of him but I attach the receipt so that the company can trace the malicious cashier.
qwuub: Repeated scams at the egyptair Marsa Alam airport Shop. Do NOT buy or report!

Title:
The flights from ORT to Cairo and then to London were on time. The cabin crew were outstanding; unfortunately leg space was an issue which most definitely could have been solved by upgrading to business class. The wrapping of the luggage was very costly at Heathrow. Then the flight from Heathrow to Cairo was delayed. The captain had a very bumpy landing at Cairo. Uncomfortable bumpy. To my surprise the cabin crew from Cairo to ORT were the opposite to what I had experienced the previous three flights. My wrapped luggage was extremely man handled and subsequently severely damaged.
The in flight food was tasty. The coffee and tea were nasty. I unfortunately will not make use of EgyptAir again.

Title: I flew Egypt Air from FRA-CAI, CAI-LXR, LXR-CAI and CAI-TLV (the last leg on the Air Sinai subsidiary) on a trip from NYC.  The flights themselves were fine.  Unfortunately, my luggage was lost on the CAI-TLV leg and was not recovered before we returned home to NYC.  While they responded to my initial emails during the first couple of weeks as they were still searching for the luggage, they stopped responding to my emails after the luggage was officially deemed lost.  Egypt Air did not provide compensation for the luggage or the purchases I had to make while traveling as a result of the lost luggage.  I had outside insurance that provided supplemental coverage for delayed/lost luggage but they needed a settlement response from the carrier.  Egypt Air did not respond to requests for that either  (even after sending a complaint on their website) so I am stuck with nothing.  Terrible customer service.

I was told by the 'PR" DESK THAT MY OPTIONS WERE~ BRIBE ONE OF THE TOILET CLEANERS TO GO AND BUY THE LADY PRODUCTS or option two : Cancel my ongoing flight so I could exit the transit area!!!Well you can imagine! Title:
I have traveled domestically with Egypt Air and the first experience was good. The second was horrible - the AC wasn’t working from Luxor to Cairo and it was 45C outside - it was so hot and stuffy - babies were screaming, it was a nightmare.

From that flight, I had to connect to Egypt Air onto Toronto. We were supposed to board at 12:35, they didn’t open the boarding security until 12:45 and it was the most insufficient, unorganized process I’ve ever seen.

Three desk agents hanging around talking while three others are all on one side herding people through. They need to make two lines - one for Canadian passport holders and one for everyone else. Having to check visa and residency info takes forever and congests the process.

Finally, we went through our THIRD security point and were told we couldn’t bring our water that was purchased passed security, passed customs, IN the terminal! No amenities were past their final check - not even bathrooms. I was incredibly angry with this and so were parents of small children forced to throw out their just purchased drinks for the flight.

One agent tried saying it was Egypt law but that’s a load of crap since we came through 2 other checkpoints with water AND in Luxor they jet us go through with huge, sealed bottles. Major inconvenience to fliers - wouldn’t recommend for long haul flights.

Lastly, on the plane, we were filling out customs forms and the flight attendant came by telling us we absolutely had to put our tray tables up because we were landing ..... in 45 minutes.

Please figure out your organization!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I traveled through to Egypt Air airlines . 1. MS 652 (RUH - CAI) 2. MS 647 (CAI - RUH) ......Both Flights were on time
MS 652( RUH - CAI ) :
Check in and boarding was very easy from Riyadh.Customer service was helpful. The food and beverages were great. The seats were comfortable.There was LCD on every seat for entertainment.Headphones were given by airline.From RUH - CAI the journey was excellent .
MS 647 ( CAI - RUH ) :
We went through terminal 1 which was only for Egypt Air flights. Check in was hard. There was no luggage booking counter for flights to Riyadh . We booked are luggage through counters for London. The waiting lounge was small. An hour before time of boarding they sent us to another lounge which was just after the previous one.That lounge was closed at start.

On board :
Unlike MS 652. In the aircraft the entire section shared only one LCD located on the ceiling Which gave only Routing,distance left to destination and other flight info . So their was no entertainment system.
The positive point is that The food and beverages were excellent..
I travelled through 2 Flights one was excellent while other's rating on airport is average while on board is good .

Title: The agent who had booked us in Istanbul on EgyptAir expressed more confidence than we felt in the airline choice. My first thought was that the confusion thereafter must be IST airport’s issue, until I met other passengers who had flown on EgyptAir. Our experience was confusing from the outset. Gates and ticket counters should be listed on screens, once inside the terminal. No signs of EgyptAir were present or displayed, until very late. Checkin was delayed, as was the flight. The passengers we met who were returning or connecting through Cairo said their checked luggage had been lost for a week, so we did not check in any of our baggage before flying EgyptAir. Once at the gate, there were no signs or agents. The last-minute gate change was not announced or shown, so I nearly missed the flight. (My husband had called the lacking level of Egyptian security “frightening.”) Once on board, the flight attendants were fine with a knowledge of English and mostly fluent in Arabic. Mushy Halal food and beverages were served quickly, which was the best aspect of our flight experience. The odd thing was that passengers could not choose their inflight entertainment; entire sections shared one ceiling screen that played a children’s movie. Our landing was bumpy, but we were just glad that we had arrived safely in Cairo. Our return flight would be booked and arranged on our own, via other airlines.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Let me first explain my reasons why I may choose not to travel by Egypt Air ever again. On the London-Cairo leg, the cabin crew were supercilious and uncaring. Ridiculous, right, for hospitality staff to consider themselves superior to dark-skinned passengers? At least that’s what I thought. Then, on the flight to Mumbai, the passengers were uncouth. The loos were filthy. The guy before me left shoe marks on the seat so the awfully long time he took was not just to relieve himself but maybe also to do some kind of dance inside. Both aircrafts were ancient, cramped, and lacking inflight entertainment. At the same time it must also be said with respect that on the second flight, after serving dinner, the cabin crew walked up and down the aisles calling out ‘chai’ and ‘coffee’ and serving these beverages for quite a long time, so with that and the crappy toilets, it was a bit like travelling by train in India in the old days.
And now for my reason why I would *always* look for a good price for London-Mumbai on Egypt Air! We had booked the cheapest flight we could find that suited our timings, and realised too late, only as the return journey approached, that Egypt offered no facility for visa on arrival or e-visa for Indians. It seemed like we would have no choice but to spend our 12-hour daytime transit in Cairo’s very uncomfortable airport. However, to our surprise and delight, Egypt Air provided us accommodation at the lovely Le Meridien Hotel inside the airport. And the hotel staff recommended a good taxi driver who came exactly on time, drove us to Giza, arranged for a local guide to spend an hour and a half there. The driver then took us around downtown Cairo, dropping us back at the hotel to have lunch and get ready for our flight home. Thank you so much Egypt Air, we love you very much and completely forgive all the discomfort!
crvsd: Saaz Aggarwal wrote a review Jul 2019

Title:
Had one of my worst flying experience.
We were group of 16 (4 families 2 adults and 2 kids each)
When we tried web check in there was no option to select seats.. seats were preassigned and scattered all around the plane so we chose not to web check in.
When we reached the airport on check in counters we were again given seats scattered all arpund the plane. 2 2 seats in 8 different rows.
When we protested on counter the staff was downright rude and racist (seeing we were indians they were extra rude and pretty much accommodating to others).
Others in my group after a bit of protest gave in as they had 2 2 seats in different rows, so one child can sit with one adult. But my family had 4 seats in 4 different rows. When i kept on protesting the guy on counter was downright rude and almost started shouting.
We decided to proceed towards boarding gates. At boarding gates i told ground staff that how u expect me to seat my children( aged 5 years and 9 years) all alone in the flight. I told ground staff (and my wife recorded a video) that if anything happens inside the flight airline staff is solely responsible. Finally one guy budged and took my boarding passes. He requested some other passengers and finally arranged 2 seats + 2 seats in 2 different rows so atleast one adult can sit with one child.
What could have been easily done at check in counters was done at boarding gates after a lot of ruckus
Fianlly we boarded the plane mentally exhausted.
It has been the worst experience in my life.
The flight was good. Food was nice.
Entertainment available on board was good.
Over all it could have been a good experience if not for horrible check in experience.
Must look into this matter.
My flight details
MS 968
CAIRO - MUMBAI
19 june 2019

Title:
The aircraft was a new Boeing 787, reasonably comfortable and very clean. The flight attendants seemed to struggle to smile but they were smart and very professional. The food looked ok and fellow passengers seemed to be tucking in quite happily. I don't eat airline food so cannot comment personally. The do not serve alcohol but lots of soft drinks, juices etc. I flew out with Lufthansa and would say that flight was no better than Egyptair.
The biggest downer was the check-in experience, but i am not sure that was the airlines fault.
Arrived at T3 and was told departure had changed to T2.
Went to T2, my flight was showing on the screens.
Tried to go through through security was told to go to T3.
Asked 'official' he said there was problem with 'the system' and wait 15 minutes.
After 5 minutes he said all was sorted and OK to go through security.
Tried again and again security said no, go to T3.
Went to T3 and check-in desks now open but not for my flight.
Used self check-in but no bag drop desks open. Eventually one opened and dropped my case off.
Went through passport control and more security and followed the signs to my gate BACK to T2!
More security.
Went to gate when plane was ready for boarding.
Let two passengers through then stopped for 15 minutes.
Still left on time though.

Title: a horrible airline that should be shutdown or will probably go bankrupt or cause some disaster and be forcefully shutdown... i have never encountered an airline with such untrained, unprofessional and rude staff. without fail every flight i had to be on with egypt air the past 6 months have be delayed or/& cancelled... i missed 3 connecting flights so far in 2019 and this airline seems to use timetables as a suggestion rather than a schedule... whenever a domestic flight doesn't fill up they cancel it a bump everyone to the next flight... without prior warning, no apology and not taking responsibility for any inconvenience or missed connecting flights of other airlines... this country should be straiving to secure and increase its share in the tourism sector as it represents a large chunk of their gdp... instead and as if intentionally they operate one of the worst airlines in the planet... what a shame that such a country has an airline comparable to chicken bus services in central america... no self respecting people should accept such imbiceles to operate their nation airline nor represent them in any shape, way or form.

Title:
I flew from Cairo to Dubai round trip with EgyptAir.

The outbound was in May and the return was in June. Both trips were almost perfect.

My first flight online check in they gave me a middle seat on the last row which I was able to change it later on (online) and on my return I was able to choose my seat during the check in (online).Both seats were free.

Punctuality was perfect on the return flight and about 1/2 hour delay on the outbound.

Airport check in with smooth except that they took my cigarette lighter 😥for security reasons on cairo airport but not on Dubai airport😂.

Blankets and pillows were provided during the flight. Good entertainment on flight.
First time to see the electronically dimmable windows on both flights.

Food was good, staff were a little bit old but they were friendly anyway.

Price wise EgyptAir is like 10-20% higher than there competitors in almost any route (which isn't nice).

Title:
The flight going from Toronto to Cairo was very good. We were given essentials like eye mask, socks, ear plugs and earphones for in seat entertainment etc. Our meal which were pre-booked as "Hindu meals" were on the dot, with quality Indian food served, like Chicken tikka masala, yellow rice and eggplant bharta. The attendants were also very attentive even in economy class.
However, all this was very different on the flight from Cairo back to Toronto. The essentials were not given, we had to ask for them. The flight attendants were least interested. The "Hindu" meals were just dry baked and tasteless chicken served with some salads. The only comfort was, we did not have anyone between me and my wife, so we could sleep on the 3 seats we got for ourselves.
The check-in procedure was good both ways.
We also had 2 flights from Cairo to Amman and back to Cairo. These were good and on time. The food quality can be improved, but it's only a 1 hour 20 min flight, so it's not a big deal.
qwuub: Mixed experience while flying to and from Toronto to Cairo

Title:
Appalled by Egypt airways.

Without any notification they allowed passengers to arrive at OR Tambo for check in before informing us as baggage drop that our flight was cancelled. At this point we were given the option of returning home or getting a hotel, I had to specially request assistance to get a new flight. At this point I was directed up to the Egypt airways office, on the first floor with no elevator access. Lugging a 23kg bag up the stairs.

I then stood in a disorderly queue in an office with 5+ members of staff and only 2 assisting. I add, one member of staff sat on his phone playing videos at full volume. Service was slow and disorganized as they tried to assist 10 or so fellow passengers to get redirected flights. A couple in front of me we're told they could only get them to turkey on Thursday and that they would not reimburse them for their additional internal flights they'd miss or for 3 days of accommodation and tours they'd be losing. Another girl burst into tears as they told her that despite the fact that they were meant to have her in Rome yesterday, they'd now only have her there on Wednesday and she'd miss the start of her tour and some how have to rejoin her contiki group in a foreign country, without assistance.

I had little hope that assistance would be in my favor having witnessed the tears and frustrations of those passengers before me. The truth of the matter is, they took so long to assist me, that by the time I was seen to - every alternate flight for the evening had closed it's gate due to take off. There was one KLM flight remaining at 11.15pm. but as only business class seats remained, Egypt air refused to put me on it. This left me in JHB for another night, flying this evening with a different airline.

The most helpful member of staff was infact NOT an Egypt air staff member and infact a contractor.

I would not recommend Egypt air - for flight security and coverage by the EU aviation laws, pay more and fly a reputable airline.

qwuub: Cancelled flight without notification. Couldn't accommodate on alternate flights.

Title:
Egypt Air was the worse flying experience we have even had. They are equivalent to Spirit airlines in the US. Every flight in the terminal for them was delayed or cancelled. Our flight was delayed by more than 11 hours causing us to miss our connecting flight. When rebooking our connection the Egypt Air manager ensured us that our flight would be at 10pm and we paid our rebook fee of $250 per person (different airline). Long and behold, the 10pm flight did not depart until 12:45am causing us to miss our connection. The response we received from Egypt Air was that it is not their responsibility for another airline. We ended up losing 2 days of our next leg of travel and costing us over $1500.

For a place that constantly reminds tourists that a man is only as good as his word, the irony disgusts me. We were treated so poorly, airline personnel gave us attitudes, and as the only Americans in the airport, we were also the only passengers they did a thorough security check on.

Save yourself the headache and DO NOT USE THIS AIRLINE. We will be reporting them to the department of transportation and Star Alliance to drop them from their service.

Title:
We traveled 4 sectors in May 2019 - Mumbai Cairo, Cairo Athens and then reverse. We have mixed feelings about the airline. Initially we went in with very little expectations as we had heard a lot of negative comments of the airlines.

However we were pleasantly surprised to see that the planes were reasonably neat and clean, the entertainment system and the movies and other entertainment on offer was quite new and the flights was on time on the Mumbai Cairo sector.

Since we had taken the emergency row seats so the space was also very good. However on this sector the staff was extremely RUDE - the service was very poor as they did not pick up the dishes after the service and left them lying on the trays, any request for water was met with a rude reply and in fact in the night flight one of the pursuers almost had a argument with my friend who was traveling with us. My friend folded the tray and kept the food tray under neath the seat in front of him as he wanted to sleep and the staff had not taken the tray for almost 2 hours and this staff member came and had a mild argument for the same.

Thankfully the other 3 sectors had better quality staff ad were more friendly. However the other negatives of the airline are as follows :

1. The food is not so great

2. The bathrooms are MINATURES - you cant even stand in them easily and the sink is just a small tray where the hands dont even fit

Overall I would not fly egypt air if I have a better choice for the same price -
crvsd: Vinay Kumar wrote a review Jun 2019
qwuub: Difficult to Grade This Airline - Inconsistent Services
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My wife and I took five flights with Egyptair in a one week vacation to Egypt.

First, we flew to Cairo from JFK. The plane was an older, well used, 777. There was nothing bad about it, but you can tell the aircraft is getting old. In the near future they are switching to new 787s and that should improve the situation. Crew were fine, did the basics, but nothing extra. The return from Cairo was similar, older 777 and mildly interested crew. If I had more time I probably would have flown another airline to Europe and then connected to Cairo, but needed the direct option to make the most of our week long vacation. Inside Egypt we flew with them down to Luxor, and then roundtrip to Sharm El Sheik. These domestic flights were fine, no issues.
qwuub: Five Flights in One Week on Egyptair
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Munich connection from Lufthansa to EgyptAir flight was a breeze and flight departed and arrived on time. Aircraft was a modern, clean 737-800NG with USB ports at every seat and a good selection of free entertainment options. Attentive in-flight service; meal was quite good -- well above average for economy class. Only downside was that the cabin was kept uncomfortably warm throughout the flight. Title: Way below expectations.  Boarding process was messy.  We had Business Class and boarding zone with "priority" but there is no actual priority. Title: We flew Johannesburg-Cairo-Tel Aviv return.  All flights were on time.  Seating very comfortable and spacious, and food was great.  They do not serve alcoholic beverages.  Staff were friendly and helpful all the way. Choice of movies on the entertainment system was limited, but an excellent choice of music made up for it.  Connections were seemless and without hassle.  Between Cairo and Tel Aviv they use a subsidiary called Air Sinai, but it's basically still the same as Egyptair, just using two unmarked Embraer 170 jets on this route for political reasons.  Very good flights that exceeded my expectations, and I will definitely fly Egyptair again in future.
qwuub: Exceeded my expectations, comfortable flights and very good service

Title:
EGYPTAIR from/to Cairo flies via Bangkok so the wonderful city of Cairo is now a direct flight away from Hong Kong. However, beware of EGYPTAIR’s cleanliness and service! The business class seats are really dirty, blankets and pillows have not been washed after use from the incoming flight. The cabin is absolutely filthy. The toilets are disgustingly dirty. The crew does nothing to keep the bathrooms clean and do as little as possible to serve the passengers. The food is so bad it’s inedible.
And a word of warning about Cairo. It has not recovered from the revolutions of 2009 and 2011. A week after our stay in Feb 2019 there was another bombing of Khan el-Khalili market. Security is extremely tight. Many International Hotels have closed up leaving the buildings derelict. Cairo remains a wonderful destination with wonderful people but sadly still has problems.
qwuub: Uncomfortable, dirty, poor service and hygiene standards!

Title: Well, having just had an incredible experience flying business class on Turkish Air, Egyptian Air just did not come close at all. We booked four business class flights domestically around Egypt and we were actually in business class on the first two flights. On the third flight we were several rows back and the plane had a moveable curtain to separate business class from economy. The seats and food service were all the same throughout the plane so I’m not sure why they even sold business class flights on this type of plane. The flight attendant pulled the curtain closed and we were not on the business class side of it but in the first row of economy. We didn’t say anything because it seemed sort of silly to complain and make the flight attendant pull the curtain back one more row when we were all treated exactly the same otherwise. On our fourth flight, we were in the back of the plane and very definitely not in business class nor were we seated together. We are still waiting for a refund of the fee we paid for business class. In addition, the business class lounge for Egypt Air at Cairo’s Airport was a tiny room with only a few seats available and a tiny snack bar. It was crammed with people sitting on the floor and eating soggy pastries with coffee from a vending machine. I would not recommend flying business class on Egypt Air. It isn’t worth the uncharge at all. Oh - and to top it off, we had booked four domestic flights in Egypt but when I checked in for the first flight, I noticed we now had only three flights on our itinerary. There was no return flight to get us back from Aswan to Cairo. Unbelievable! So, we called our travel agent who worked miracles and got us on a flight hours later but at least we made it back to Cairo so we could get on our return flight to Istanbul. Awful experience. No way are we ever flying on EgyptAir again. Even if we hadn’t recently had a phenomenal experience on Turkish Air, this review would still be exactly the same. I fly internationally multiple time per year and domestically in many foreign countries for work and often into the heart of Africa and every other airline has been much better than Egyptian Air.
qwuub: Flight missing from itinerary was the worst of many mistakes.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.
