Title:
When I learned that I would be flying to London via Cairo from Abu Dhabi at the conclusion of a cruise I looked the airline up to check it wasn’t flying the Boeing 737 Max 8 (my nephew lost his life on the Ethiopian airline.) I was relieved that it did not, but was underwhelmed by a TripAdvisor review that read: “if you’re thinking of flying Egyptair, don’t”.
I was hugely and pleasantly surprised to find it a very comfortable experience. The staff were totally professional and attentive, the flights were both on time, there was plenty of leg-room, the food was good and nicely presented (better than Qantas short haul). I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Egyptair - on time, clean, efficient, 30kg baggage allowance and a very competitive price.

Title:
I am trying to compare like with like. In December, I flew from Larnaca to Bangkok via Amman. A newish Embraer on the first leg with a decent club class, followed by an excellent club class service on a long haul Boeing to Bangkok. In March I flew Egyptair from Larnaca to Johannesburg, again an Embraer on the short leg, but a much older plane, at least 40 years old, with no club class at all and very narrow seats. The longer leg was in a much older Boeing, with a considerably lower level of club class service.

That is not the only comparison however. The only competitors to Egyptair on the identical Larnaca to Johannesburg route are Emirates and Qatar. Both take 5 hours longer or more, allowing for stopovers, and are the best part of double the price in club class.
Comparing time and price on one side against quality of service on the other, I think Egyptair just shaves it.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We flew Egyptair from JFK to Cairo in early April for a Gate1Travel tour of Egypt, then flew quite a few domestic flights with Egyptair within Egypt, and finally back from Cairo to JFK with them. We were totally pleased with all flights. I'd read some bad reviews about them, but they were really great. On the short, domestic flights, we were sometimes on an Embraer 170, sometimes on a larger 737(?) and the legroom was fine, even for my 6'4" husband. We were greeted with a smile and an offered juice box for the very short flights from Aswan to Abu Simbel and back, or from Luxor to Cairo, and we were well fed and taken care of on the longer international flights...….the food on the international legs was surprisingly good, the legroom in Economy was better than we expected (3-3-3 configuration), and the flight attendants were great. The bathrooms were kept up better than we've seen on many other flights. We experienced very little turbulance. The entertainment systems had plenty of movies and shows to keep us occupied, and the little ammenity pack given out (even in Economy!) was unexpected and very nice (toothbrush and toothpaste, ear plugs, mask, ear buds and slipper-socks). We would very happily fly with Egyptair again!
qwuub: Transatlantic flights AND domestic flights on Egyptair
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: This is the 2nd time I fly with Egypt Air on a long haul flight. Luckily this time the airplane is Boeing 777 while the previous time it was 767. As this plane has individual entertainment screens and a newer plane, this trip was much better than the previous one. The direct flight from Toronto to Cairo is long (approx. 10.5 hours) but it is worth it as I avoided the burden of stopping in an airport in Europe. No delay for both flights and the return flights. I know that they will start using Boeing 787 for the Toronto-Cairo flight this summer. The movies are little dated but O.K.

Title:
After reading a mix of reviews about Egyptair, I wasn’t quite sure what to expect. For my flight to Egypt, I flew direct from JFK in New York to Cairo. There was no wait in the business class line when I arrived to check in. Going through the business class security line was also very smooth. From there I went to the Swiss Lounge which was pretty quiet at about 3:30pm on a Saturday. While the food offerings were not expansive, they had a decent healthful spread. I enjoyed the fruit salad, olives, cheese and Chex mix. I even splurged and had a couple of mini brownies. The restrooms were comprised of small water closets rather than the typical large restrooms. The seating was pretty comfortable with sufficient charging outlets located throughout the lounge. Since I arrived early for my flight, this was a nice place the spend 1 1/2 hours before boarding.

The boarding process went pretty smoothly. Passengers line up per the designation on the boarding pass. Business Class passengers are in the Gold Track line and are the first to board after pre boarding. I was cheerfully greeted by the crew and escorted to my seat. Before takeoff, I was able to enjoy a delicious glass of guava juice. Shortly thereafter, the menu was handed out which provided dinner and breakfast selections. The starters came out first and were wrapped in plastic. I particularly enjoyed the fruit and slices of blue cheese and cheddar cheese. Part of the dessert was quite nice—fresh fruit served from a cart.

The Business Class cabin is not very large when compared to other business class cabins I have flown in. However, the seat was comfortable and was an “angle flat” seat. I found the seat area lacked storage for devices, though the overhead bins were quite spacious. The cabin was very clean and comfortable, including the restroom.

During my journey in Egypt, I also flew in the economy cabin from Cairo to Aswan and from Luxor to Cairo. I was again impressed with the comfort and quality of these flying experiences. There was more than adequate overhead bin space and the economy seats were reasonably comfortable. Even on flights of a bit over an hour, snacks and a beverage service were provided.

Similar to my flight to Cairo, my return flight to New York was just as impressive. My only disappointment were the business class lounges at Cairo airport. There was no available seating, the interior of the lounges were dark and dated and the staff were not very welcoming. However, my overall experience of Egyptair was one of being surprisingly pleased. I was very impressed with the boarding process in Cairo. There was a dedicated lane for business class at the gate which resulted in no waiting in any line at all once boarding commenced.

This was certainly not among the top of my business class experiences, but for a direct flight to Egypt for a price that is a fraction of many business class flights, I was very pleased with the service.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Well, luckily I'd read reviews before taking this trip so I had a good idea what to expect.  Sadly I wasn't disappointed.  Talk about lacklustre.  The flight attendant serving our side of the plane was downright rude.  She dropped a wet towel on my computer keyboard at the beginning of the flight - no apology, just an arrogant stare.  Rolled her eyes when I asked for mint tea, despite the fact that it was written on the menu, and gesticulated at my dinner tray because she didn't like the fact that I'd stacked some of my daughters plates on my tray (done in order to help her so that she wouldn't have to lean over so far!). Food is served covered in plastic wrap which they don't take off.  They didn't collect our pre-take off drink glasses so we were left clutching them as the plane took off or they would have rolled down the aisle and smashed.  The seats are angled and you can basically put them in that position before take off and they won't ask you to put them in the upright position - anything goes apparently.  The last straw for me was when I got up to go to the bathroom and the flight attendant was sitting on the jump seat with her legs crossed, she made no attempt to move them so that I could get to the door.  I had to step over her legs!  On leaving the bathroom, I had to stop myself from purposely slamming into her legs I was so angry.  The attitude was extraordinary.  I don't expect that at any price, but in business class when you're spending thousands of dollars it is completely unacceptable.  Ironically, we flew Egyptair domestically a couple of days later and the flight attendants were very nice.  Perhaps this flight attendant had seniority to get the JFK-CAI flight and no longer felt the necessity of being nice.  Also, don't expect any drinks, including water, to be served after the initial food service.  Luckily I was able to grab a few bottles from other seats that didn't have passengers.  Otherwise it could have been a thirsty 10+ hour flight!  If Egyptair management should care to read this review, we flew on April 23rd in seats 9H & 9K.  Your flight attendant needs to be fired!!
qwuub: Awful!  Business class JFK to Cairo

Title: I just flew on egypt air four times during my trip to egypt.  Things to expect:  Your reserved seats to be changed with no responsibility from the airline.  Don’t expect anyone to answer the customer service lines and to get an emails response for 6-8 hrs.  Said response will fail to clarify the problem and leave you in the lurch.   So check in early -48 hrs.  This happened to my group twice.  Both times they gave away my window seat and one of the times they even split me and friend up into middle middle seats at the back of the plane.  We had reserved tickets 5 months in advance but told said reservations are not guaranteed.  At the airport, you may find a lack of order in the boarding process that leads to a chaotic cattle call.  Don’t expect alcohol on transcontinental flights like you would get on emirates, Jordanian, Qatar, etc...  Our Flight  home didn’t even have Diet Coke.  Attendants twice put off our requests and failed to follow through later.  Also served juice and water comes in dentist office spit cups.   The meal will have metal utensils but they mostly consist of  plastic wrapped carbs.  Egypt AIR also skimped on their movie entertainment licenses.  Perhaps 2-4 western new releases.   Cairo seemed to be the only airport with lounges. Customer agent wouldn’t let us use lounge bathroom with business class ticket on arrival from luxor that didn’t have lounge. Priority boarding also didn’t seem to be a thing even if you paid for it.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: First time to use Egyptair, which was the only company that offered the cheapest ticket with a straight connexion. The flight from Brussels to Cairo left on time. We had a lot of rough turbulences making some passengers (including me) a bit uneasy but everything was fine and after our 4h25 min we arrived on time in Cairo.  Crew members were very polite and helpful. We all received headphones, blankets, pillows, plenty of free refreshments, cake, food tray. The crew comes by regularly with free coffee, tea, juice,..All seats have tv screens from which you can choose music, movies in different languages, documentaries, kids program, also the progress of the plane toward your destination. I always find this function useful. Being tall I found that the seats had more leg space than the companies I used in the past. The food was not bad, chicken, rice, vegetable. The flight back from Cairo to Brussels was great, I came back during Easter break and the plane was not crowded, the flight was on time, no turbulences, staff very friendly and attentive to all the customers. I can recommend this company and will not hesitate to use Egyptair again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flying from Cairo to Hurghada has got to be better than a seven hour bus trip, doesn’t it?
Sadly no. I could have got back home quicker if I’d walked.
Flight MS339 was due to take off at 17:45 on Thursday afternoon and as I arrived at check in, the departures staff told me to “Hurry up, take off is in forty-five minutes!” So, up I hurried, jumped down several flights of stairs and practically threw my boarding card at the unfortunate gate guardian.
“You going to Luxor?”
“No, Hurghada, look, your display says MS339 boarding now.”
“Oh, that’s wrong, this is the Luxor flight, yours has been ‘rescheduled to 20:30.”
“But Check in just told me to hurry up, and I did.”
“No they didn’t.”
“Er.... “ What’s the use, I’ve experienced this kind of pig-headed denial of the obvious too many times to think its worth arguing.
So, I waited until 19:50 when the flight was delayed for “ten minutes only” then at 20:15 we were told, definitely take off at 20:30, at 20:27 the gate was still closed so, “What time is boarding, when do we fly?”
“Nine o’clock, for sure.”
“Are you certain?”
“Yes.”
By 21:15, so many lies had been told it was becoming a farce. When the next boarding time of 21:35 was given, nobody believed it and some had gone off for a smoke hoping that somewhere in this benighted airport they could find a lighter. That was wishful thinking as only one of the display screens was working, only one of two coffee booths was open and it only had a few shots of espresso left and a solitary, fluorescent red and yellow cake which throbbed in the fridge like a particularly painful pustule right on the end of your nose.
Finally we had liftoff at 22:00 and a comfortable flight to Hurghada.
It was only in the morning when I unpacked my overnight bag that I found that my mobile Wi-fi box and an Apple battery pack had been stolen from it.
I wonder if anyone else on that flight had their bags raided while we held in undignified, ill-informed purgatory at Gate F31, CAI?
crvsd: Alistair N wrote a review Apr 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
With some delay on Amsterdam due that it seemed to be rather busy with flights, took off wit half an hour delay which was almost made up during flight.
Nothing to complain about !
Friendly staff bringing drinks and food and although it is aircraft food it was “ok”.
Arriving at Cairo, not for the first time, you have to know the drill. Get your Visa, go inline for customs control and just wait until your luggage arrives.
This time everything was ready within half an hour but this can easily be an hour or more. If you’re not used to these kind of delays, don’t go to Egypt because it not only happens at the airport ;-)
Just observe and go with the flow !
Enjoy your stay, Egyptians do their best to please you and of course try to earn some money from you.
Small tips are appreciated!
Always go for half the price they ask and end up somewhere in between. Everything is cheap but it’s a sport !
qwuub: Friendly, good service and reasonable food

Title:
I have never been treated so badly in my 22years of flying.
My flight was delayed in Sharm thus making the connection flight very short.
I asked the Egypt air representative to confirm that Pi would make my flight.
I was advised on 3 different occasions that the flight would be waiting for me and 8 other passengers.

LIE number 1

Upon arriving the 9 passengers were told that the flight did not wait for us.
So you can expect that we were all very unhappy.
No effort was made to find another airline, we were told that we had to wait until the next flight which was 7 hours later.

We asked to sit in the business lounge but a number of excuses were given - they were not authorised to provide access.

By this stage we had been given the run around - standing around given a number of options and excuses.

The lack of empathy, complete lies from all the staff, asking to speak to a supervisor being ignored and a simple request to sit in the lounge for 7 hours was like pulling teeth. I would say pulling teeth would be much more pleasant.

I have travelled extensively around the world and this has been one of the worst experiences with an airline.

Title:
Only fault was a long wait for refreshments on one leg of a return trip to Sharm via Cairo. The first leg of the return was delayed, risking our missing the 2nd stage from Cairo, but we were virtually met at the gate on landing and guided and assisted direct to the international area and onto our plane that had been held for the critical extra minutes to allow us (and others also transferring) to catch the plane.
A Kindle was also left by my partner on the way out and after a few emails it was found and is being returned to us in Heathrow.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My wife and I lived/worked in the Middle East for 10 years and were recently Cairo visiting friends prior to our flight to BKK. As we have done many times in the past, we flew EG to Thailand in Business. If the flight does not fall out of the sky, then Business Class on EG is pretty good. The planes are relatively new, the service is adequate, in-flight entertainment is ok, and the food is palatable ... but you must BYOB as they do not serve adult drinks on any flight.
The absolute best attributes of the CAI-BKK flight are the user-friendly departure and arrival times at a very competitive cost, and with fully reclining seats the ME-to-SE Asia journey becomes a simple overnight direct flight. No tedious stops at some major Gulf State hub at 3am to face throngs of people bathed in bright white light, while being assaulted with loud ambient noise mixed with elevator music.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
One person with special status 'gold', was boarding with four passports and passes in his hands. The other three persons stood quite far away from the counter and got through without proper identification. Anyone in the terminal area could have boarded our plane. It happened at terminal 2 in Cairo airport when boarding the Egyptair flight to Amsterdam.

Overall the service with Egyptair from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi to Amsterdam was good. Staff was correct. Food was okay, except for the breakfast buns (very dry). Inflight entertainment for me was sufficient (watched two movies) and read an Egyptian newspaper in English. Modern terminal 2 in Cairo is definitely an improvement if you are in transit.

Would fly Egyptair again. Hope they improve security procedures. Passengers with special status of whatever kind should not be exempted from strict procedures.

Title: Pray God you don't loose your bags with Egypt air. Their lost baggage personnel are terrible.  We had to wait until we got back to Cairo from Aswan. Then began our nightmare and hassle with their personnel to get my wife's bag back. She was   worst than a stray dog. They where outright rude with her and our tour guide who was doing his best to help since we don't speak Arabic and they didn't speak a word of english. It was a three hour ordeal just to get the bag back from them which was already in possession. My wife had to empty out her bag because of "security concerns". The bag never the airport.

Title:
The option of flying direct from South Africa to Egypt is great.
The A330-300 going from Egypt to Cairo had inflight entertainment but the return flight, also A330-300 had the old radio next to an ash-tray and random small screens on the ceiling of the centre aisles. There were no personal entertainment screens and no USB ports for charging a phone or tablet. For an 8 hour flight in 2019 competing with global airlines, this is quite sad.
On a positive note, the older plane was more comfortable with softer seats and a foot rest.

The food was good, however, the service was poor. The young flight attendants assisted as best they could but the older male flight attendants were rude and were as if they were fed up with their job and forced to be there. The old guys also seemed very scared when the plane went through minor turbulence and rushed to their own seats very quickly.

The allowable luggage for Economy Class is only 1 x 23kg piece and 1 8kg hand luggage. Its not very clear online (the egyptair website does not work) and they do not respond to emails when asked the question.

I pre-booked my seat and paid extra for it. When checking in at OR Tambo International (South Africa), I was first given the wrong boarding passes (someone elses) and after trying to resolve the issue, my wife and I were given random separate seats. Fortunately the Egyptian manager who was very friendly and accommodating assisted and arranged seats for us together even though hit wasn't what I booked. We were placed at the row with extra leg room. This is normally at an additional charge so we thankful for the assistance. The downside was it was located in front of the toilets so lots of traffic and a stench throughout the flight. This should be noted for those wanting to pay extra for leg room.

For an international airline, Egyptair lags behind others and should address service, cleanliness and the internal plane services.
qwuub: Old, dirty yet comfortable flight with no in-flight entertainment and poor service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Long ago, when I was young, flying was exciting, with the Canadair vibrating with the power of four Merlins, the stars dancing in unison at night, the navigator making his way through the passengers to climb up a ladder to the astrodome to take star sights with his bubble sextant, and the steward cooking a four course dinner on board. No classes in those days. It was an adventure, but now the only thing one can say about flying is that it is efficient, but boring. Egyptair is no better and no worse than any other airline. This plane showed it's age, rather shabby and a little elderly, and of course, there is no alcohol on board. I have had worse flights, but it was a pity the steward couldn't get the entertainment working.

Title:
We rose at 5 am on February 9/2019 to arrive on time for our flight from Luxor to sharm el Sheik After we arrived at the airport, we where notified that the 7 am flight had been canceled and that we where placed on the 7:30 am flight. No problem until that flight was delayed for almost an hour. We arrived into Cairo for our connecting flight just as they closed the gate, while we we where rushing down the hallway. Yes, they apologized, but the next flight wasn't until late that evening, at that time. After a very blunt discussion, we where placed on a flight that was scheduled for around 4 pm. They also agreed to put us up in an airport hotel as we where very tired. Well, it took a hour for the hotel shuttle to arrive, even thought we where repeatedly assured it would be along in moments. The room that was provided to us at the Cairo Novotel was the most disgusting room I have had the misfortune to stay in for a very long time. The mattress was worn out and stained. The pillows where also stained from body fluids. No other room was available for us to move to as it was still before noon and non of the overnight rooms had been cleaned.. Very little sleep was achieved. The meal that the hotel provided was very good. When I addressed this room with the Egypt air attendant, nothing was offered for compensation.
We arrived at our destination 8 hours behind our schedule and where put up in a very nasty room, all at the hands of Egypt air. This is by far, NOT my favorite airline.
They did attempt to provide us with a room, but these rooms are NOT the same rooms that I would be provided with as an overnight customer, but rather airport standby rooms. Cheap and far below a normal standard. I take that as the company's attitude towards its traveler. For the record, I am a Super Elite traveler with Air Canada and I do know the difference in customer service.
crvsd: John P wrote a review Mar 2019
qwuub: Their rescheduling of my flight cost me a lost day

Title:
I,ve flown on Egyptair many times.I have accepted that their flights are always late-it seems it is just their way!Despite late departures,they always seem to make up the time and arrive within half an hour of scheduled arrival.
The actual flight was very good.The plane was full,but the staff coped admirably with delivering drinks,snacks and food.Even though this flight arrived at 12.30p.m,customers were given a full hot lunch before arrival,which was a pleasant surprise.
There was a good choice of entertainment available-recent current films which easily passed the time.My seat was very comfortable,I had a Emergency Door seat so lots of legroom-it wasn,t booked,just happened like that and I was more than happy as I am a tall person and appreciated the comfort.
As I was transferring from a flight from Luxor,I was checked in at Luxor and given 2Boarding passes for both flights-this made the whole process much easier for me.

Title:
After reading all of the reviews for the direct flight from JFK to Cairo, i was so hesitant.
Yes, after 9 hour flight, the aisles were littered. This was due to the people on board who were pigs not the airline's fault. You can not take bottle water on board. They serve water in very small cups.I suggest taking an empty container and have them fill with water after on board.
The service is routine with no 'may i get you something". There are foot rests. Food is OK. Personnel do not smile easily but that is their culture. Movies limited so load up that ipad. I was told exit rows are no extra charge. if exit rows are free, you may want to check on bulkhead. Egypt air is a DRY flight with no alcohol. The flight was no where as bad as some reviews so don't be hesitant. We took two flights inside Egypt on EA and they were very nice (about 2 hours long).

Title: Egyptair is actually a very friendly and reliable airline. In all the years, I have used them I can not remember a delayed flight. The long haul product on this flight was on the A330 airbus. The check in was fine and the EVA air lounge was excellent. The Business class is full flat beds which are comfortable. It was a late night flight and I was surprised that they insisted on serving dinner at 0230 !! Unfortunately, the catering nearly always really lets them down.  it is always poorly presented and the main dishes are always rank. So I ignore all food when on board. However, i will give them there due that they leave you alone to sleep for the entire flight until landing. Announcements are minimal but the actually working staff, if you need them, are always engaged and friendly.   The atmosphere is more of a 70's  retro airline.. where staff are clearly selected from Egyptian elite society. I rather like that. A quirky plus is their inflght entertainment choice of films where often I have seen films that I have never found elsewhere on other inflight systems and some of them are refreshingly rather good. The airline is cheery, comfortable and fine for the odd friendly but respectful chat But make sure you dine elsewhere.
qwuub: Friendly staff and comfy seats... but forget the food
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Let me start with the plane itself - old, worn out seats, 2/3 USB ports were broken on my set of seats. The cabin crew lack basic customer service training. They are rude and impatient with travellers. Walking backwards down the isle, shouting "coffee, coffee, coffee" ... instead of politely asking if anyone would like some coffee... Usually don't turn up if the crew member button is pressed, but when they do - it's more than a few minutes later and they are usually quite annoyed by the fact you are bothering them with something. Toilet got blocked mid-flight and started flooding and stinking because most people would throw their papers inside it although there was a clear sign not to put your paper in it...

Now, to main part of my journey. I witnessed how Malaysian special forces police CARRIED A HANDCUFFED MAN with blindfold and earplugs on the plane + 3 other arrested men. And for every arrested person(with handcuffs, earplugs and blindfold) there were 2 police officers. They sat at the back of the plane, didn't interact with anyone.
The cabin crew tried to explain that the arrested people had overstayed their visa in Malaysia and got transferred to Bangkok where they were sent back to Cairo, but noone really believed her words... Why would anyone be handcuffed, blindfolded and with earplugs if they overstayed their visa. You must have done a lot more than that to deserve two police officers guarding you on a flight... The fact itself that crew member tried to lie to more than 200 other people on a flight was shocking...
qwuub: If you have other options - don't fly Egyptair
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
When after many hours of waiting in Abu Simbel, Egypt for a flight to Aswan on to Cairo and beyond, two tour groups and several couples were told that a bus would be picking us up, taking us to lunch and that a plane was flying down from Cairo to replace the plane that was having mechanical difficulties. After lunch at the only available hotel, the Seti, we were hoarded back onto buses which we assumed were going to the airport. As it turned out, we were DRIVING to ASWAN from where we had come the day prior. No one told us anything. Had it not been for a tour company leader, we would not have known we were on the wrong bus going to a boat tour on the Nile. Calls were made and the bus stopped somewhere along the road, letting off a number of passengers as well as ourselves. Next thing we know, after asking untold questions receiving no answers, we were told that we would be stopping overnight in ASwan and at 3 the following morning, we would be driven to the airport for our flight to Cairo. Not only were we traveling business class and requested a refund for that portion of our flight that never happened, we were put up for a couple hours over night in a sleasy hotels where people complained of bed bugs and bugs in the shower ( which we did not take.) Response from EGYPT AIR was that in the future we would receive a 10% discount on our next flight. Did they seriously think we would fly Egypt Air again living in Phoenix, AZ? The only correspondence was through email and there has been no attempt to reach us via customer service and a voice on the other end of the line.

A different experience with British Airways had excellent customer service when a mechanical issue arose, a stay at an excellent hotel overnight, apologies, and calculated payment for all the inconvenience and loss of a day flying from London to Cairo on the second leg of our journey which amounted to over $1000.
crvsd: G and P Cohen wrote a review Mar 2019
qwuub: Extremely poor, frustrating service and no resolution on Egyptair
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I was on a double connection from Jeddah back to Boston. I had a long layover in Cairo and rested in the Egyptair lounge. It was one of the worst Star Alliance lounges I have been in, it was super cold inside the lounge and only one of the areas were opened at 5am in the morning. Having had a miserable lounge experience, I learned to lower my expectations when boarding MS 9010 on a A320 with 16 seats in J class.

The boarding process was relatively smooth was two lines for economy and star alliance gold and business class passengers.

The seats were creamy leather however still looked quite new and were a bit more comfier than the A330 flight from Jeddah. The seat controls were more sophisticated than North American carriers flying narrow bodies for regional flights with recline, lumbar, legrest and footrest extend options.

For this 4 hour flight there was even a Cerutti amenity kit, how awesome was that. It came with a comb, eyeshades, socks, toothbush and toothpaste, Aigner white lotion - a full kit, very impressed!

The flight attendants were very nice and hospitable throughout the entire flight, no alcohol is served on Egyptair. Once the flight was in the air, we were served our choice of juice along with biscuits. For the menu, they have a rather tacky, elementary school designed menu however there were 4 choices for main and appetizer and dessert. I had the meat and it was fairly standard. At the end of the meal, they passed out Egypt air 4 square chocolates.

The movie selection was quite extensive and the IFE was very easy to use. I finally had a 30 minute nap before landing.

All in all, it was a fairly comfortable flight with good service. Is it my favorite Star Alliance carrier? No - but I wouldn't object to flying it to/from Cairo for short distance for a narrow body.
crvsd: Amos Travels wrote a review Mar 2019
qwuub: CAI-MUC -  Exceptionally good flight without expectations

Title:
I got a really good deal on a flight to Dubai so took advantage of the promotion. It was my first time flying with Egyptair and I have no plans to travel with them again. The customer service was non-existent. I would try to ask a question and numerous times the staff looked at me and walked away. Some were nice but most of them had very poor customer service. I gave it back to the flight attendant who did not apologize or anything. He gave me a new one but I didn't eat it. I complained through email and they offered a 20% discount. The boarding process was unorganized but the flight was smooth.

Title: We had 5 Egypt Air flights during a 2 week holiday in Egypt and Jordan.  All flights left and arrived on time.   On the short flights we were bused to/from the terminal.  Flights to Luxor had no films etc, but the Cairo/LHR films were dreadful in any case.We had confirmed seats before we flew for all of them.    My ticket came up as stand by at Heathrow and took a while to sort out;  we were given different seats, not together on two other  flights and we witnessed a row at Amman airport when one guy (this was in arabic) was furious as he had a confirmed seat and something had gone wrong - 3 Egypt air staff got involved and it got quite heated.Food was airline average but we were pleasantly surprised to get food plus a drink on the three short (max 94 minute) flights.   No alcohol available.Transits were reasonable - water removed at Cairo and long queues for checking hand luggage at the gates.    We had binoculars in our checked luggage.   This was held back entering Jordan and after a delay, we had to let the security people check their strength before we could claim the luggage.   This happened to 2 others on the flight.

Title:
I have nothing negative to say about EgyptAir. My experience with them was as good or pleasant as with any major airline on a lengthy flight. The plane was clean, bathrooms supplied, flight attendants polite and attentive. Food was plentiful, drinks including tea and coffee always available.

True, the entertainment choices were somewhat limited, but enough to occupy you during the journey.

I read horror stories about EgyptAir, and because of numerous complaints about lost luggage I brought two carryons. But to the best of my knowledge, nobody in our group had their luggage lost with EgyptAir. One couple received their luggage four days later, but it was AirCanada's fault.

Overall - a fine experience, would definitely travel with them again.

Title: The flight there and back is on a Boeing 777  The aircraft was clean and neat the crew was ok but there is a bit of a language barrier. The big surprise was the fact that they don’t serve alcohol on the flight or in their dedicated business class lounges. Not a deal breaker but a surprise non the less. The business class lounge in Cairo is abysmal. The lounges in Amman and Toronto are great because they are shared with other Star Alliance airlines. The seats in business are side by side and recline to flat but if you’re looking for a pod they don’t have them. The big advantage is they go direct and there is no big long connection somewhere in Europe. They don’t go every day of the week so check your dates carefully. 9hours and 20 minutes eastbound and about 11 and a half hours westbound enroute times. I would use them again just because they go direct from Toronto to Cairo

Title:
Ok, I rarely review airlines. In fact, most airlines I've traveled with to USA, inside Canada, and out to Europe have either been a disaster or just ok.

I was preparing myself with very low expectations to avoid disappointments but ended up going on flights (to and from Egypt and internally within Egypt) that happened to be the best flying experience of my life.

The planes themselves were a more modern open head-space design, the entertainment system had both touch controls as well as a remote (though not that many good movies), there was way more leg space than a typical flight and the seat in front had a leg piece below it for you to rest your feet on during the flight. Seat were comfortable and a little pillow was provided to everyone which could have been placed behind your back to give you lumbar support. For the first time ever I didn't feel uncomfortable with backache in a flight and this was actually one of the longest direct flights I've been ....8.5 hours.

Food was amazing! Breakfast, lunch and dinner tasted great. High quality utensils (metal not plastic! and a smart spork!) were provided along with wet towels and good quality cups for tea/coffee. The meals were presented in beautiful individual containers that were ergonomic and aesthetically pleasing.

A high quality support bag was provided to everyone with amenities such as a portable brush, ear bugs, ...

Overall I found the attention to detail for customer experience impeccable so much so that I would gladly right this review. I actually wish I could fly with egyptair to other places.

Only downside is that for some reason the airline doesn't allow printing of the boarding passes when you check in online and forces you to do it in person at the airport.
crvsd: Bruce A wrote a review Feb 2019
qwuub: One of the best flying experiences of my life

Title:
We chose a package holiday in Egypt that included a cruise down the Nile from Luxor and a few days at the coast. The tour operator chose Egyptair to provide the flights.
Our outward flight direct from Heathrow to Luxor was on time, comfortable and relaxed. Food was OK and the plane (737) was nearly new.
Return flight was from Hurghada to London via Cairo. The first leg was in an old Embraer - no problems but the usual signs of wear with frayed seat belts and worn seats. But no worries and the flight was on schedule.
Cairo airport was busy and lacking in refinement, but acceptable. Egypt is in Africa, after all.
The second leg from Cairo to Heathrow was again in a modern 737. No problems.
Overall we rate Egyptair as a viable mid rank airline - certainly not in the low cost bracket. We would fly with them again.
crvsd: denis y wrote a review Feb 2019
qwuub: How well do Egyptair rate against European airlines?

Title:
Simply put, Egyptair is a good airline now. Things changed dramatically after their Star Alliance experience. And during the past few years, Egyptair has taken strides in passenger service and luggage handling.
And I can tell that they have progressed dramatically in overall safety. The Star Alliance inclusion saved Egyptair. They are a different carrier now.

But what didn't improve yet?
The Food.
If I fly from Cairo, and I only fly Business Class, dining is the last thing I want to do. God help those in economy.

Another item Egyptair must improve is the toilet. Maintenance and overall hygiene are average.

So, what is my final verdict?
Sure you can fly Egyptair. It is a hard working carrier trying to compete with the big boys. I do recommend Egyptair.

PS: if you are flying from Cairo...bring your own sandwich.

Title:
Traveled by EgyptAir while visiting Egypt for a 2 weeks holiday, from Mumbai ( Flights MS 969 & MS 968). Scores well on timelines, comfortable seats & legroom, especially the adjustable foot rests, the blankets & pillows add to the comfort. But the grumpy faces of the Air Hostesses on both flights are a dampener & so is the food. We had selected Spl meals from the list offered by EgyptAir itself ( e.g. Indian Vegetarian Meal - IVML ) but the most annoying part was when the Air Hostess feigned ignorance about this in spite of being mentioned on boarding passes & asked us the meaning of this abbreviation. They totally messed up with all 3 meals in our group. Also, Cheese & Butter was served only when we demanded as only bread was served in the plate. Request for addi juice or tea/coffee were not fulfilled. As a policy this airline does not serve hard drinks as a part of their culture & religious beliefs, but such religious beliefs should not be enforced on international routes. The In-flight entertainment on the new aircraft B-737-800 on return journey was a pleasant surprise. We traveled on EgyptAir as this was the only option of flying Non-stop between Mumbai & Egypt. Overall fares charged are a bit higher than other airlines in Asia & North Africa.
May be considered only when no better options are available.
qwuub: Scores well on timelines, seats & aircrafts, but Air Hostesses need to avoid grumpy faces

Title:
My wife and I flew back on recently on EgyptAir. It was not my first trip with the airline, nor am a novice traveller. So, my views have a varied baseline and stems from view airlines...compared to EgyptAir.

The cabin was clean, neat and we got what we paid for - economy size everything. Leg room is as good as most flight in this category. Sadly, we were delayed for an hour ( & some change). Very little announcements were received and passengers were mostly tired, frustrated and in need of sleep. It was passed midnight when we finally took off...homeward bound.

The crew on EgyprAir are always militant and serious when serving you. This crew were no different. Very little friendliness was shown, unless you were from Egypt...Yip, it was obvious that some smiles and friendly chats were reserved for their fellow countrymen. I got the usual, "yes" when asking for an extra item or simply water...but didn't always got it... This cam from the crew lady who was driving the food cart down the isle and serving - no - dishing out our food. My View is, if you work in a services industry and you know you are expected to serve passengers - at least try to smile and to be friendly.

The quality of the dinner was good. Beef or chicken still has not gone out of fashion in these budget sections. As long as it is good quality food, we are always happy.
Breakfast was cold, sold croissant (cannot call it old) and some cheese and fruit. I gave trying to neatly cut the croissant after it was easier to break it by hand.... Seriously no apology not remorse for serving us this bad meal. Desperate and hungry passengers ate what they could - i drank my juice and ate the cheese slice....

As for comfort = none to be found. Entertainment system - we had some good items on menu to keep us busy while we tried to ignore our legs cramping up.

Overall, I hope I do not have to choose to fly EgyptAir again. If ever I do, I pray i get better services and food and of course, crew members too.
crvsd: Suleiman S wrote a review Feb 2019
qwuub: Not the best in it's class nor the my first choice

Title:
Flew from London to Bangkok via Cairo in Business Class this February. The main points why I chose Egyptair was the attractive price, flight and transfer time plus Egyptair is a Star Alliance Member which I collect miles on. Moreover the Egyptair Business BUSINESS fare was almost half the price of British Airways or Thai PREMIUM ECONONMY i.e. £1200 vs £ 2200 on BA or TG for an inferior product.

Highs:
- Easy checkin in London offering Air Cananda Lounge Access in T2
- Fast Track Star Gold Lane Security in LHR
- Easy and quick Priority Boarding
- Friendly welcome on Board their B777-300
- Clear and good security briefing
- Luxurious amenity kid
- Spacious setting with almost fully flat bed, large screen and good VOD
- Priority Lane vouchers for BKK immigration (took me 10 minutes from plane to luggage)
- Efficient luggage delivery respecting priority luggage
- 150% miles credited to my Star Alliance Account within 24 hours (LHR-BKK 10.000 miles)

Lows:
- Service is prompt but not consistent and not the most charming. Once meals are served there is not much to expect by inflight personnel
- Food is not great but plentiful
- Egyptair do not serve alcohol (bring your own is possible)
- Planes are not the newest and cleanest but feel safe
- Cairo's Egyptair Lounge is not up to Star Alliance standard, Once more: no alcohol
- When buying your own Alcohol in Cairo make sure it is in a sealed bag, security are confiscating it right before you board in Cairo (security screening)
- CAI-BKK A330-300 Business Seats are not fully flat but manageable

Seen that there are several flight-options between London and Bangkok, direct or indirect Egyptair beats all fares on Business by far and is excellent value for money. Connection time is 3 hours each way making the trip slightly longer than a direct flight. The most important is that I felt safe and therefore my 4-star rating.
qwuub: London - Bangkok via Cairo Business Class
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We flew Egyptair because it was the only way to get from Amsterdam to Cairo. It wouldn't be our choice in future as there were more cons than pros.

Cons
No staff at the departure gate until well after advertised boarding time and no announcements made
Left 20 mins late, not the pilot's fault
Aircraft uncomfortably hot all the way
We had a crying child 2 seats from us for 3/4 of the way (unfortunate for all of us)
2 young kids running and squealing up and down the aisle constantly! Uncontrolled by staff or parents.
Entertainment selection was dreadful - "popular movies to watch" John Wayne for goodness sake!
Seating was airline average - cramped economy seats.

Pros
Meal was nice enough, service was quick but snippy
Boarding was fairly orderly
Arrived early into Cairo

Title: The whole experience of Egyptair was poor. The seating allocation meant that seats were double booked. At the airport the flight was delayed but we were kept in a holding room after security with no water and the need to go back past security to the toilets. The seats themselves were broken. The earphones for the entertainment system were for another aircraft. The cabin floor was wet. The roof showed signs of water stains. The equipment for inflight catering was insecure and rolled around during takeoff and landing. The number of toilets was insufficient for a full aircraft on a 6hr flight. It was not possible to use Smart phones for entertainment even in flight mode. The staff were rude to passengers. On this basis I would not recommend this airline to anyone, however having said that they have a monopoly in Egypt so if you want to see the sights you have to travel with them. This was only one of 3 flights we did and the others whist not as good as some other airlines, e.g. easyJet, were acceptable.

Another felt compelled to point out that a few cups of water had already been poured when I took the liberty of pouring a cup fresh from the bottle.  Movie selection was terrible. Title:
We were a little hesitant about traveling with such an unfamiliar airline, but we ultimately decided to fly with Egyptair because it is the only airline offering a non-stop flight from the US to Cairo. We had a great experience, and we are glad that we made the decision to fly Egyptair. The airline offers essentially the same service as an American airline. The planes seemed up to date and well- maintained. The flight crew were friendly, spoke English and offered good service.

During our trip, we flew Egyptair for both the international flights and for flights within Egypt, and we had good experiences with each type of flight.

For the international flights, a bag of toiletries such as toothbrush, toothpaste, socks, eye mask, ear plugs and earbuds were complimentary plus a pillow and blanket for each seat. In flight entertainment is available on the international flights, and there was a fairly good variety of movies but very few TV shows. The monitor and video system seemed a little dated as several of the button labels had worn off. WiFi is not available. Two meals were serviced on the international flights, and they were as good as meals on any other airline. One major difference from other airlines is that Egyptair is a dry airline, so alcoholic beverages are not available.

Our only complaint of this airline is that they don’t provide much water unless you ask, and even when you do ask, they only give you about 4 oz at a time. This is especially a problem on the return flight from Cairo to JFK because the Cairo airport doesn’t allow you to bring water on the plane even if you buy it after going through security. The bottom line is to be prepared to bug the flight attendants to bring you water.

Egyptair is a member of the Star Alliance (United airlines and Lufthansa are some of the other partners), so your travel with Egyptair will help you accumulate Star Alliance miles.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

As an example I paid for 2 tickets on British Airways what I was charged for one on Egyptair on that same route, same time of year!! Title: If you're used to flying Delta, Southwest, or other US domestic airlines, you'll find this a bit different. The flight itself and back (to Cairo) were actually very good and I have no complaints about that. The service, however is a different story. The flight attendants are cordial, kind and efficient during meal service, but not particularly attentive at other times. Mind you this is a 12 hour flight so there's plenty of down time. People need things and the staff is pretty much off duty after they've served meals (it seemed). the isles got pretty cluttered and dirty after a few hours, and nothing was picked up (paper, straws, etc) so trash just accumulated on the floor for the whole flight. We learned early on that if you want something, you have to go back to the galley and get it. Not really a problem for us because we needed to stretch and walk around a bit anyway. We also met and talked to a few of the staff members who were very friendly. The other plus about this airline, and one of the reasons we chose them was that they have a direct flight from the US to Cairo. Other flights stop in Jordan or Dubai or other places which makes for a longer day and more chances for luggage to get lost as far as I'm concerned. Basically you just need to be aware that if you fly this airline, it's a different bag than most US flyers are used to. Planes are old, and audio systems are average, Some movies but they aren't great. Our seats in coach were roomy enough for us and we are tall. If you travel internationally you have to be prepared for anything........in the US we're spoiled!!
crvsd: Barbara K wrote a review Feb 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Booking the ticket was not easy (even through Expedia) since you see a fare that you cannot get once you try to pay for the tickets. The checkin was smooth without much of a problem. The boarding and the takeoff were not. The plane started moving on the ground while several passengers were still standing and getting to their seats. This was a first for me.
Now to the poor quality of food items. One of the flight attendants bragged about how he avoided the airline food in 23 years of service with the company.
The plane did not have individual monitors for each passenger making it difficult for children to watch something suitable for their age. Everyone can only watch one movie.
For our return flight the checkin staff in Nairobi insisted that there is a rule (which we never heard of before on any airline) to plastic wrap the child stroller in a nearby stand...l suspect she was trying to benefit that stand with the $7 wraps...very strange.
crvsd: abdelghani e wrote a review Feb 2019
qwuub: An airline missing the love of its staff
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
NO wonder Egyptair has the reputation for being one of the worst airlines there is!
It is difficult to put into words how I felt about this flight experience except to say I was delighted when we landed.
First the good news. Both meals I had with Egyptair were good and staff were unswervingly friendly and helpful.
Now for the bad news. You can trot out any joke you like about old aircraft but this one should have been pensioned off years ago.
Powered by the very latest in elastic band technology, this plane could well rank as a museum piece.
Even though the flight was nearly six hours long there was a choice of one film to watch -- take it or leave it. The one I drew was a comedy about a dog, very fitting as this plane had gone to the dogs.
There was no personal screen in the back of the seat in front of me. In fact no-one had personal screens but had to try and follow the film -- if they bothered -- using a small screen which came down from the overhead luggage area. Naturally it was only one screen per two or three rows of seats! I haven't seen that way of operating in-flight entertainment for many, many years.
All the upholstery in almost every seat I saw was worn, my seatbelt took real effort to adjust and click into place and my meal tray was of the variety that folded away into the arm of my seat. It folded away easily enough but grimly refused to come out unless brute force was exerted.
Not only was there some questionable vibration from the aircraft but shortly after take-off I had water dribbling down the fuselage wall from above the window!
And as for going to the toilet?!! Well, with my early experiences it didn't take rocket science to work out that getting to the toilet before mid-flight might be a very good idea and it was. Still clean and relatively dry mid-flight but towards the end of the flight it underlined exactly what you can let yourself in for when you travel "Cattle Class". I won't give specific details. Let's just say it was unpleasant.
Even the public address system didn't always work and had a tendency to hum, whir or scratch for the first few seconds which obliterated the beginning of ordinary messages such as "Please assume the crash position"!
And did I mention the delay flying out? Nearly an hour....because the incoming flight was late and had to be cleaned and refuelled. Perfectly reasonable excuse....unless more experienced passengers tell you that this is happening all the time!
Overall, the next time I fly in this direction I will take the financial hit and opt for a bit more comfort, better facilities and better timekeeping. None of that is available with Egyptair.
qwuub: Back to the Wright Brothers...and they were better
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The tour company booked this airline. From the 1st time that I called them their offices were closed - almost like bankers hours. When they finally answered I was transferred to another department and it took at least 28 minutes for them to answer. Now the flight over to Cairo. After the meal is served that's the end of the flight attendants. Not once did they come around to offer water - which is essential not to dehydrate on long flights. And the garbage is thrown all over the planes cause they didn't come again not once to collect the garbage. Very unfriendly crew. Luggage took forever to come out. And on top of it all the planes are very old and falling apart. I even tried to send Egyptair a compliant online and it can't be done. All 4 flights that we took were never on time and for no reason. Good luck flying them.

Title: We had checked in 7 bags for 6 passengers at Cairo airport for flight to Luxor on 2 Feb and only 5 arrived. Instead of rushing to get the bags to us on the next several available flights like any other airline, they continually lied about the estimated delivery time including telling us a flight that the bags were supposed to be on was cancelled when that was easily verified to be untrue on the airline website and completely disregarding the fact that we have elderly travellers in our group who need access to medication in their missing bags and hence, putting their physical well-being in danger. I was told by local Egyptians that the only way to ensure bags arrived on time with the flight you are on was to tip the airline staff. Absolutely crazy sounding but unfortunately I suspect this was the case in our situatiom. I would not visit again Egypt given this is the only domestic flight choice and I would discourage everyone I know from visiting given the level of outright incompetence and corruption.
qwuub: Not kidding when they say this is worst airline
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Their service is completely different depending on which country the plane is boarded at. From Accra to Cairo, service was crap. Flight attendants were rude! You ask for a blanket and they tell you it’s finished! Air craft was crap. Very unstable especially in turbulent areas. From Cairo to UK, it was still sub standard but much better service and aircraft. Quite discriminating! And oh if your flight has an overnight layover, please prepare to be held up at the airport in Cairo for long hours before finally being taken to a hotel after midnight! I practically finally settled down in the hotel and had to wake up in 2 hours to head back to airport. Everything was just so disorganized! And it was a return flight so I experienced this twice. Never ever again! Tickets are cheaper but I’ll rather pay more next time for a better experience with another airline. Trust me, it’s not worth it at alllllllllll
qwuub: Worst airline I’ve ever taken. Not worth it

Title:
Travelled from London Heathrow to Bangkok via Cairo, Egypt in business class, sat in seat 9a for the first leg and 11a for the second. The day started well enough using Canada Airs lounge in LHR terminal 2, nice clean well appointed facility.
Boarding for the flight went well, I was aware prior to booking that Egyptair is a dry airline as are their lounges in Cairo, so this wasn’t a problem. The seat configuration was 2-3-2 and then 2-2-2. The seat design meant that I had to disturb the person next to me when I wanted to access the toilet, very old cabin design. No menus were given for the flights just trays of very unappetising meals brought round, I just ate deserts on each flight. The flight attendants were pleasant enough. There was no fast track facility through security in Cairo airport which was one of the most depressing dirty dingy airports I’ve ever experienced. The lounge I used was depressing, the hot food cold, the staff unhelpful and the selection of soft drinks poor. I have the return flights to ‘look forward to. 😭you get what you pay for I guess and I would have preferred to have flown economy with Etihad or Qatar for half the price with the benefit of hindsight. Never again!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I picked EGYPTAIR because it was nonstop from the US and what better way to get excited about Egypt by flying the national airline of the country.  I was expecting incredible service and great hospitality.  I have recently traveled on British Airways, Air China and Royal Jordanian and wanted to try another international carrier.  I realize now that not all International airlines are better than standard US over the water.   Check-in at JFK was a little confusing but I have status with United with the Star Alliance so I was guided to a better situation than the average person. But I felt bad for the average person.   EGYPTAIR flies a 777-300 from JFK to Cairo and I was in seat 29A, the plane felt old when I got onboard and the seats need more cushion filling for such a long flight.  Seat 29A is a good window seat.   The entertainment is limited (maybe 25 movies) with only a few first run movies onboard and the rest where old.  Only 3 western style TV episodes total onboard.  Let me start off by saying the boarding at the gate is just ok, they form lines and people for the most part gather in each grouping.   When I walked onto the plane I handed the flight attendant a box of chocolates (I do this for all international flights to try and set the mood for the flight) and the gentleman flight attendant took the box and set it to the side and never said Thank You or anything.  The crew never acknowledged that I had given them anything so not sure who ate the chocolates.   Overall Impression of the flight crew - Just there to do a job, not overly friendly even when I would smile and say Thank You and Please.   Now don't get me wrong, not bad service just blah service.  Crew uniforms need to be updated along with the interior of the planes and some better attitudes would go a long way.    Meals and Service: For a 10 hour flight (12 coming back) you receive a drink and a hot meal (roll was cold and hard) about 1.5 hours after take off and then nothing until 2 hours before landing and you get another drink and a hot meal (croissant was very cold and not fresh) .    I have traveled on BA, Air China  and Royal Jordanian recently and was expecting at least the same type of meal and service but no, very basic.  No one walked around during the flight with water or refreshments.   They completely did not come around with any Duty Free items during the flight.  I guess you had to request it.   I would suggest EGYPTAIR mainly for the non-stop aspect of the flight and early afternoon arrival into Cairo (BA through LHR you arrive late in the evening) but go into the flight not expecting a "wow" factor or you will be disappointed.     I found the people of EGYPT extremely warm and friendly and appreciative to have me visiting and maybe EGYPTAIR should try and bottle some of that for the flight crew.  Now I will also say the flight crew from Cairo back to JFK was a lot better in attitude but still felt somewhat standoff (ish) to most people on the flight back.  One nice thing was we all got amenity kits, sad part is the Business class passengers received the same amenity kit.
qwuub: JFK to Cairo and back - Good non stop and basic airline

Title:
We booked 4 flights with Egypt Air mainly on the basis that no other operator had flights available for when we wanted them.

Having seen the reviews, we were a bit concerned, however we didn’t need to be. Our first flight from London to Cairo was fine and landed in time for our transfer to Luxor. We then took another internal early morning flight back to Cairo a week later and a final flight back to the UK.

Ok so Egypt Air are a tad no frills, but we found delays minimal, service and food ok and we had no issues with suitcases. Online booking was excellent and no charge to change seats. We did have a few flight time changes before our trip and communication could be a little better at the airport and during boarding.

Overall well worth the price you pay.

Title: We flew with Egyptair to South Africa in December.  They were the cheapest option when we booked, but I was slightly apprehensive beforehand. In fact, the flight was fine.  We were an hour delayed in departing from LHR (on Cairo leg) and about 45 mins delayed on return JNB-Cairo leg; but in the grand scheme of things with long-haul flights, I don't think that's too bad.  Certainly I've had far worse delays with British Airways and South African Airways.The food on the flight was fine, again not dissimilar to our experience with other economy flights.  You're not there for the food.  Our stopover in Cairo wasn't too long and fairly seamless.  The air stewards were efficient and friendly enough.  Choice of movies inflight was fairly limited compared to other long-haul airlines, but that just forced me to try to sleep more.  I would fly with them again if the price was good.

Title: On the flight TO Rome, the food was average (though I feel you get slightly better meals, and are served first, when you choose a specific option, such as seafood or vegetarian).  Unfortunately, the pilot felt it was OK to smoke in the cockpit during the flight, so we had to smell his nasty cigarette smoke from before the meal started.  :-(  We complained to the steward, but there wasn't anything he could do about it at that point, he just apologized and said it was the pilot.  On the flight back FROM Rome, we had some of the best food we've had on EgyptAir (we definitely prefer when they're stocked in European destinations over flights from Cairo).  However, this isn't a high standard and it's still very average food for airline flights.  Thankfully, no smoking this time. It was one of their older planes, with no screens in the seats.

Title:
As a new resident of the UK and first time flyer of Egyptair I am extremely disappointed at my most recent experience with them.

I arrived two minutes late for my original flight on Dec. 28th and had to rebook and spend over 700 US to catch the next flight and extend my trip to Accra, Ghana. While paying for my rebooked flight the agent said she would email my new flight information and to this day haven't received it. I then proceed to check in where the next employee me states that the flight is overbooked and I need to check in my carry-on bag and assured me that it was going straight to Accra and would not be in Cairo where I had a layover.

I finally reach my destination and wait two hours for my bag that doesn't show up. I file a claimant in Accra and make sure to call and take a cab to the airport for a week straight just for them to give me no information, no contact information to Heathrow, and for them to only send out one email to all airports. I then have my partner call the JFK support number to see if they'd be better help. They sent him to three different departments before getting a contact number that I could only call during the week.

Here is where my frustration reaches its peak: I am in a foreign country, on a solo trip were I had to extend my flight with no protection/medication, or feminine products. As I'm reaching out to social media, calling all offices connected to Egyptair, and emailing, absolutely no one has reached out until I called JFK. Upon arriving to the terminal, I visited the main airline office in Accra and the manager there took down my information and told me he'd contact Cairo upon my layover arrival. I finally reach Cairo and they tell me they didn't receive any information from the other agents.

At this point I'm utterly disgusted by the level of miscommunication by your staff and their lack of urgency to help me find my bag. I finally arrive at Heathrow where I have to wait two more hours because they finally find my bag that NEVER left the airport and was placed in the tag-less department. On this trip I fell ill with the flu, my menstrual cycle started, and I had no clothes for two weeks, all because you team didn't do its best of communicating.
crvsd: Tahirah Tea J wrote a review Jan 2019
qwuub: The worst expeirce of my life.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flight to Cairo, internally Cairo to Luxor, and Hugarda to Cairo and then Cairo to Frankfurt. Both international flights left late and neither made up the lost time which is annoying with connections. Whilst our luggage arrived others on our flight and in our group didnot arrive which led to a further hour and half delay leaving Cairo airport.
We were unable to check in on line and there was no option to order a vegetarian meal.
Service on board was average for the International flights and good for the hour long internal flights. Food on the international flights was better than some of the larger airlines flying long haul Australia to Europe etc. Limited entertainment package , hard to beat Emirates on this. Would fly with them again. No entertainment on internal flights and basic planes with less comfortable seating. At Hugarda checking in for the return flight to Cairo was a very slow process and they were very disorganised.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Took a total of 6 segments (JFK-CAI, CAI-LUX, LUX-CAI, CAI-AMM, AMM-CAI, CAI-JFK). Decided to fly economy since the Business Class product looked so outdated & not worth the extra cost. Luckily got exit row/bulkhead seats for JFK-CAI flights for only $50/flight, so great deal & fantastic legroom. Unfortunately, that was the only good thing.

Plane for JFK-CAI flight was so tired looking that I actually felt a little unsafe. Things throughout the plane were broken & left unrepaired. In the bathroom: toilet seat pivoted because only 1 of 2 bolts in place, broken storage bins that wouldn't close, broken soap container bracket (no soap), no tissues (paper towels put into tissue container). It continued at my seat: the flip-up tv monitor wouldn't stay in place so I couldn't watch anything for the 12 hour flight, the tray wouldn't stay level so I couldn't use it for food or drink (had to share tray with neighbor). On the return flight 10 days later, the tray table was fixed & the monitor was slightly better (it was the same plane bc the same things were still broken in the bathroom, although it's possible that the bathrooms are consistently horrendous across their fleet...).

All that would have been bad enough, but the crew's attitude made it even worse. Although there were some good attendants, the majority were surly & rude. Except for the 2 meal/drink service, they never made made an appearance. The unfriendliness extended to many of the ground crew (check-in counters). The crew had a very erratic application of rules. They yanked away our pillows & blankets in the exit row & also refused us to use electronics during takeoff/landing. Yet they didn't make people put up their seatbacks during takeoff/landing & let people get up & open overhead compartments during taxiing to the gate. Crazy!!!

Surprisingly the AMM-CAI flight had the most advanced aircraft, but that had mechanical difficulties. We had to return to the airport after we took off & sat on the tarmac for an hour + without any explanation. Eventually we took off again without any explanation.

Hopefully will never have to use Egyptair ever again.
crvsd: L C wrote a review Jan 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We had a lot of EgyptAir experiences, we flew JFK-CAI, CAI-Luxor, Aswan - Abu Simbel, Abu Simbel - Aswan, Aswan to Cairo and CAI - JFK.  I can say that at no time did I feel unsafe.  The planes seemed mechanically well maintained.  The short domestic flights within Egypt are on some wonderful little Embraer jets, which were very comfortable, US needs more of these.  My biggest complaint is the CAI-JFK leg.  First, there are multiple security screenings, that's great.  But, they do not allow any water on board at all.  Anyone that purchased water at the airport prior to boarding had it taken away. That's fine, I appreciate extra security measures.  What wasn't fine was that the beverage service aboard a 12 hr flight back to JFK amounted to about three "shots" of fluid, under 8 oz total.  Just not enough for this long of a flight.  Seats on the 777 were 3-3-3 and had a leg rest that went up or down, that was nice.  The seats were fine, I was unable to sleep.  Entertainment options were dismal, bring your own entertainment options unless you like straight to video movies.

Title: Chose Egyptair but wish we’d have gone with BA, as only 5 hr flight we went economy. Checkin at London was impressive, chap was very humorous and made us feel really good. On board seat is as you would expect, entertainment is poor, very few choices, not nearly as much choice as other airlines eg BA, Emirates, Qatar etc. Blanket provided was of terrible quality and on leaving plane my shirt was covered in fibres (made sure i didn’t use on way back). Food was ok. Airline is completely dry, no alcohol served. Toilets not clean after a few hours in flight and suggest you avoid at all costs. Flight on return was a small 737 and packed, surprising given it was flying to LHR. My biggest concern was on the way back all the overhead lockers were full and flight attendants couldn’t fit passenger across aisles bag, so used one of a few unused seats. Placed bag unsecured in the foot area of the centre seat, i thought this was a real safety issue, having been on flights with much turbulence not to mention the poor person by the window having his access restricted. I made my concerns known and was brusquely brushed off by attendant. My recommendation, Fly BA or any other airline.

Title:

Was a day flight all the way so a good part of the flight the window shades were pulled down. Someone was sitting in my seat when I got on board but eventually got that straightened out as I paid in advance for a window seat so I could take some videos sitting at the window.

Passenger in front of me had his seat all the way back. It never bothered me until lunch was served. That's when I could not fit the tall cup on the tray. I tapped him on his shoulder to tell him to move his seat up a bit so I can place my cup. He seemed a bit annoyed that i would even make such a request. Had he not done it I would have called one of the flight attendants over. The nerve of people to think it's okay to have a seat all the way back into someone's face as if that is how we go about sitting at work and in public spaces.

Title: Recently flew 4 legs with Egypt air (JFK to Cairo, Cairo to Dubai, Johannesburg to Cairo, and Cairo to JFK) and overall they were pretty good.  Legroom was decent, food was a hit or miss, and the entertainment was a hit or a miss as well.  Movie wise there was an adequate selection but when it came to music download your own playlist because this was horrible.  All of the flights were clean and all were on time except for our flight from Cairo to Dubai.  Somehow, we were severely delayed because our flight doubled as a cargo carrier where pallets of stuff required loading.  Due to this delay I actually missed my first night in Dubai and instead arrived in the early morning. The one thing I noticed about Egypt air is that the air pressure on these planes is almost painful. I’ve never had this problem with other flights but on each one of their segments my ears felt as if they were going to explode.  Every baby on each of these flights were crying which was understandable but found it odd that this pressure was so noticeable on each of their flights. Luggage was delivered to the carousels to each of the carousels in under 30 minutes at each of the airports except JFK.  For some odd reason, it took over an hour for the bags to begin to appear and then it would be maybe upwards of 15 minutes before the next batch would appear.  Mind you two planes had landed and distributed their luggage on conveyors next to us and cleared out by the time we finally got our luggage. One thing worthy of a mention is that Cairo airport’s TSA will not allow you to bring beverages/water purchased within the airport on to their planes.  So make sure you open each of your bottles then take a swig before you hand them over otherwise these guys have drinks for days at the customers expense.  With that said – Egyptair should hand out a bottle of water to each of their passengers after takeoff.  I was so parched on the Cairo – JFK lag that I was grateful for keeping chewing gum on me.  The moisture in the air just got dry and the flight attendants issue you water in these tiny cups.Egyptair is very similar to Turkish Airlines which I also flew – however, I preferred the Turkish for the entertainment selection and normalized air pressure in their cabins.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Soon after the first announcement to fasten the seat belts and that smoking is strictly forbidden a strong smell of cigarette smoke spread inside the cabin. When mentioned to one cabin crew member, he commented: 'Oh, really? I don't smell anything!' The Egyptian lady on the other side of the aisle told him she also smells it. That was when the man then said that he'll look to it. Well, nothing changed. All the way until Cairo the smoke was there, sometimes so strong the cabin air got gray. We never got to know where the smoke actually came from, if it was the cabin grew themselves smoking or allowing someone to smoke. I don't recommend Egyptair to anyone with allergies or asthma.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.
