Title:
My wife and I recently travelled with Egyptair from Cairo to Luxor and back. It's around a one hour flight both ways. I had made sure we had rides setup back and forth from the airport with either the hotel or tour company. It's a 50min drive from Cairo airport to Giza, if you take Uber it will cost you less then $10 USD. From Luxor airport to Luxor downtown its only 20mins but no Ubers run in Luxor so make sure you have your ride setup.
The Airports.
First off there are too many security checks at Cairo airport everyone wants to look at your ticket and passport so be ready. Also I found the people at the airport are generally rude. They don't smile courtesy doesn't exist and they are always rushing. My experience with both airport wasn't that great but we made it on time and catched are flights. Once you get out of the airport you will find alot of taxi drivers trying to offer you a ride. Stay away don't follow them and don't hand them any paperwork.
Egyptair.
For a one hour travel time Egyptair was just fine they offered baverages the crew was generally nice. The plane were not fancy but it's 1hr you'll get over it. The main reason I recommend take the flight is because you waste too much time on a train. To save a few bucks it's not worth the hassle. If we would of taken the train that's almost a day and a half wasted just travelling. So take the flight look for cheap deals on Egyptair website search in there local currency and save yourself the time.
qwuub: Save time with Egyptair and a little about Cairo and Luxor airport.

Title:
Started on a very sour note. My premium seat had been given away. When the Toronto Station Manager was approached, he bumped us off from the exit aisle seats we had paid for ($50 each), citing his arbitrary assessment that we were unfit for the seats. Never mind that the web-site had accepted our payment and the airline HAD allowed us to sit on these seats on the leg out. He told us to apply for a refund!

The cabin crew on Egyptair need training. They act like bureaucrats - dispensing service as favour. A small example is asking for a drink. The lady on our aisle had run out, so I was advised to hail the service on the other aisle for it. No 'Sorry, I'll get it for you'. Similarly, asked for a blanket, and the response - 'We're all out!'

Not a pleasant experience and the prospect of the fight for a refund looms ahead!

Title: As usual, a good journey with lovely, friendly and efficient staff and a good flight overall - and on time  Sadly, this service only runs once a week, which is a shame as Luxor is a fantastic holiday destination that the holiday companies from the UK are still not including in their options, due to fear mongering. A great pity as they would find a huge demand for it should they have the business brains and common sense to start the route up again. Security at Luxor airport is excellent, extremely thorough, and Luxor is a very safe holiday destination as the locals are so friendly and welcoming, with a wonderful sense of humour. The food is also superb.The Egyptians in Luxor are missing - and badly need - our tourism pounds and with the superb weather and fantastic antiquities, and is, in my view (and extensive experience of the country), a much better holiday destination than the resorts on the Red Sea, which lack colour or originality and do not give a flavour of the 'real Egypt' at all; in fact they could just as easily be any resort in the Mediterranean. Good for diving and snorkelling but not a whole lot more.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Warning: if you want to enjoy your flight, keep your sense of humour up.

The web page for booking seat did not work 48 hours before, as announced. For some reason, access to the seat booking was possible 24 hours before the flight. After booking seats, the check-in staff at airport just did not find trace of it, and had to book again the seats: an IT system forgetting about bookings?

Boarding was late some 15 minutes once, some 30 minutes another flight leg, which made no staff member any more reactive. This was not an Egyptian version of zen, just passivity. When transiting, expect to wait some 20 minutes in the plane whilst buses are ready but wait for some Godot, or some Osiris to come back.

Recommendation: do not sit too comfortably, as seats do not hold upright. Do not use earphones for entertainment, as the sound is barely audible anyway. Do not look too close at the picture, as the image freeze for 1 s every 4 seconds on a regular basis, or in some instance can be snowy-spotty and hardly visible. Do not try to enjoy colours if you do not like blue-tainted screens. Do not look too much at any subtitles, as these are too small and blurred. Do not be too choosy with any film, as the choice is quite limited. Do not expect much service, as cabin staff are there not to serve, but more to establish a presence.

After these recommendations for self-restrain, let us recognise that the food was ok.

A significant area for improvement is found in the way this airline organises transit in Cairo. The unwritten theory is that passengers with more than 6 hours to wait in Cairo are put into a nearby hotel, with no necessity to get a visa. A few blogs and fora bear some indication that the airline provides a hotel. The company itself is mute about it.

The experienced practice is that, in true Egyptian fashion, passengers have to negotiate the Egyptian way to get theory applied. Read: haggle, maybe lie, cheat and insist. The rule about transit hotel is not announced when booking a flight. Another rule, announced on-site as a IATA rule allegedly due to safety concerns, is that hotel is provided only if the company does not have any flight, available or not, that would reduce the transit connection time. Would it be too much of a challenge for the brilliant management of this company to communicate in due course (read: before flying, preferably when booking a flight with a connection) was the score is: passengers either spend the night at the airport, or in a hotel. Leaving such uncertainty until the last minute of a connecting flight is not the best way to handle passengers.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Have flown with EGYPTAIR many times in recent years using the route London - Cairo- Sharm El Sheikh return whilst the direct ban is on from UK to Sharm El Sheikh.

Generally I find the service from Egyptair average at best and the cost is quite high (around £500 return).

On my return last time in November I went to use the rear toilets ( only two toilets allocated to economy class meaning at least 150 passengers. )

Having stood for over 20 minutes I realised that only one toilet was in action and so I asked a steward if I could use the toilets to the front of the aircraft . He seemed horrified that an economy passenger would be allowed to use the front toilets and said no. I pointed out that there was a queue behind me and the average time waiting for the loo was about 30 mins and suggested that I would use the other toilets even if not allowed. He rushed off to consult the “flight manager” .

As I reached the toilet I heard a stewardess saying that the out of action toilet could, in fact, be used , but only as a toilet! Fortunately the argument was taken up by some younger Egyptian men in Arabic asking what else would we want to use the toilet for!

It transpired that the wash basin was not working and so one was unable to wash hands after using the loo. It was clearly preferable for passengers to have access to a toilet than not and surely hand wipes or other arrangements could have been made.

As I reached my turn to use the one toilet the steward to whom I had complained said he would escort me to the front of the aircraft to use the toilet. He received a less than polite response from me!

The second toilet was reopened and the situation improved , though I’m not sure what arrangements were made for hand washing.

The point of all this is that the measure of good service is how the supplier adapts to unexpected problems ( though a toilet out of action must happen fairly frequently) .
I was left upset by the rudeness of the steward and disappointed by the understanding of the crew to solve a fairly simple problem.

Now considering flying via Turkey as it’s cheaper and the service can’t be worse can it?
qwuub: Average service but crew seem to be unenthusiastic and unhelpful.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I took MS792 to Cairo. Excellent service from check in to the flight. The Lounges at Rome Egyptair use Alitalia. There are a number of lounges. I used two, I didn't realise gate E had a lounge beside it. Good food selection, fine quality wines and spirits as Egyptair is a dry airline I filled up at the lounge. Excellent service. On board the hostess took my overcoat and hung it in the Wardrobe, I notice a lot of European carriers don't offer this service anymore. The flight had very comfortable seats for a two to three hour flight. Cradle type, just two seats beside each other in business much better than the usual tight European business class. The meal was very good, I had steak and the drinks even though non alcoholic were nice fruit juices. Relaxing flight and my bags were first off at Cairo Airport ready for my onward journey to the hotel. Overall a great service, friendly smiling staff and uneventful flight.
crvsd: Oliver S wrote a review Dec 2018

Title: Okay, to be fair, I took a long and indirect route to get from London to Hong Kong with Egypt air. The good stuff - very efficient check in desk, the flights tended to take off and land on time and the seat space was adequate and on par with other budge5 airlines. There is the nice addition of giving out a free travel bag with toothbrush, eye mask, socks etc. However, as a vegetarian I found the food very dull and uninspired and on the 5 flights I had, I pretty much got much the same meal. They also don’t serve alcohol which is expected with an Egyptian airline but I do like a glass of red to send me off to sleep. The onboard crew aren’t the friendliest and I thought it sad in this day and age the male attendants were dressed as though they could fly the plane and the female ones were dressed in tabards.

Title:
I chose Egyptair specifically because it has direct flights from Toronto to Cairo. This saved a great deal of time and hassle compared to connected through somewhere like London. I didn't regret my choice. The whole process was seamless from the time I checked in to landing. The same on the return flight, which was from Luxor through Cairo back to Toronto. The only downside of that is the late hour of the flights - but that is to be expected on this kind of a journey.
My only complaint has nothing to do with the airline. Seated on the aisle, at my request, I nevertheless had a very annoying passenger beside me in the middle seat on the return journey. She hogged the armrest and generally kept me awake with her constant shifting and shuffling around. Ahh well.
I would defintiely choose Egyptair again next time I fly to Egypt.

Title:
About 240 USD (total) for a one way flight from Cairo to Dubai (about 3 hours airborne). Comparable to mainline carriers in the US, Canada for one-way domestic flight of that timeframe.

The flight itself is quite good for a red-eye flight.

Departure time around 22:45 (Cairo time) and arrival about 4 AM (Dubai time). There is a full meal service. Taste and presentation are very much acceptable, but given that it's around midnight perhaps the choice of time when the trolleys roll out and the attendants start to plop meal trays over aisle passengers really needs re-thinking.

AVOD was the seat-back with WIRED control handle with the four "play", "stop", "fast-forward", and "rewind" buttons (the sort you see back in the early 2000s). The aircraft itself was an A330 and may be from that era. The upshot was that the seat upholstery was thicker and more comfortable to lean & sit on.

Flight crew were pleasant to deal with. Smiles and sufficiently quick service.

The airport staff and generally the airport in Cairo (not entirely an issue one airline can control) were less pleasant. And for reasons which completely befuddle me, Terminal 3 of Cairo airport has the building exterior (i.e. not the flight boarding phase) security screening done INDOORS of the terminal building, where all the shops & eateries are, before the check-in counters. Since it was indoors and very bright, it was more comfortable. But I can hardly suggest that I felt safer in the knowledge that the security screening, which was supposed to keep out of the terminal building all sorts of dangers, actually happened INSIDE the very terminal building it was meant to keep away from...

I would recommend the airline, but I would strongly suggest flying it without the Cairo airport terminal check-in (i.e. maybe as a transit).
crvsd: Kat T wrote a review Dec 2018
qwuub: not bad but is arguably expensive for one-way flights
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

There aren't many options if flying within Egypt. After reading poor reviews about Nileair - the only other option for direct flights from Cairo to Aswan - I decided to go with Egyptair. Most importantly for us the flight was on time. Check-in and boarding went without any incidences and the staff behaviour was polite enough.

I thought the inflight food could have been better. The small juice pack and cake was tasteless and I couldn't finish the juice even though it was hot weather and I was quite thirsty. I mean, the tickets were not cheap so it's not unfair to expect palatable food on the flight.

The flight crew were friendly and no complains there. If flying again inside I would probably choose Egyptair but probably due to lack of better options.
crvsd: Tawseef Khan wrote a review Nov 2018

Title: Seamless, easy, from check in through arrival.  I have been traveling on EgyptAir since the 1980s and am a big fan of direct flights so the EgyptAir NY to Cairo is perfect for me.  I had a several year break in travel and traveled again in Nov 2018.  Check in was painless and prompt if you get there early(like 4 hr early) and get online immediately so you are near the front of the line. Security check likewise.  I was pleasantly surprised the we actually boarded by zones and passengers were cooperative with the process.  Flight was on time and service was excellent.  The little pouches with travel slippers, eye shades, earphones, toothpaste, toothbrush and pen were very helpful.  We arrived at the state of the art terminal 3 in Cairo and it was a breeze to deplane, navigate through customs and pick up luggage.

Title: There are two parts to my negative review.  On my flight from London to Cairo I unfortunately left a pair of shoes on the plane, besides being expensive they were one of my favourite pairs.  I remembered while still at Cairo airport, I had only just gone through passport control when I wanted to quickly run back and get them off the plane. I was stopped from doing so and told that I would have to travel on to Johannesburg and contact Egyptair in Johannesburg and get the offices at JHB airport to send a telex to Cairo airport to have them sent to me.  Only they failed to tell me that the Egyptair office at JHB airport is NEVER, EVER OPEN.  I've been to the airport seven times during working hours.  The Telephone numbers in South Africa just ring and ring and no-one ever answers them.  I've sent at least 20 emails to every email address on their various websites, and not once have I received a reply to any of them.  Just for reference I once left my duty free purchases on a British Airways flight, and I didn't even remember until the following day, I phoned them, they answered the phone, tracked down the bag and sent it all the way home for me, all within 48 hours - maybe I should just pay the little extra and travel with a decent airline in future.So many will say that I left my shoes on the plane so it was my fault.  However, I did have time to retrieve my shoes in Cairo I'd only just approached the security, additionally I had a 3 hour layover before my next flight so there was no chance I would miss my connection by going back to retrieve my shoes.  But worse is that you can send 20 emails to an organisation and not receive a single response.  That an office which is advertised on your website is never ever open and no-one answers the phone.Added to the above I have a crisis at work in the UK and need to return early and cannot find a single person at Egyptair to assist me in changing my flight details.  I have phoned eight various numbers on the Egyptair website and if they answer the phone they cannot help me and the number they give me to phone to speak to someone who can assist me just rings incessantly.I will never fly Egyptair ever again.....
qwuub: Shocking - no other word will do
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Flew with Egyptair on their 737-800 direct service London to Luxor (circa 5.5 hours) and while you couldn't say it was exceptional it was certainly better than many budget and charter carriers. Leg room OK. even in economy (we were lucky and had an emergency exit row on the outbound trip which was even better). It benefits from no alcohol on board, so no rowdy fellow passengers. Meal was OK. Limited at-seat entertainment in economy (overhead screen showing a movie + audio channels) Cabin service OK. Used their iPhone app to check in from our resort and that seemed to work fine. Business class seats looked good. Travelling through Luxor is less stressful than Cairo International - quieter and shorter queues - but multiple security checks mean you should travel in slip on shoes and trousers without a belt!
qwuub: Convenient & Less Uncomfortable Than Charter Carriers

Title:
Egyptair used to be way better.

Cons

1) Lack of maintenance: The chair in front of me was broken, the earphone plug didn't work at all and my table was half broken. In addition to that, we experienced a technical failure after approximately 30 minutes after takeoff and we were taken back to Cairo airport( this cause approximately 2 hours of delay). All the above-mentioned issues clearly show that there is a lack of maintenance.

2) Unprofessional and grumpy cabin crew: most of the cabin crew seemed very upset and there weren't helpful at all. A lady that was sitting across of me got her seat belt stuck in between the chairs. When she asked one of the stewards to help her solve the problem he tried to help her for few seconds and then responded saying that it wasn't working anymore and he left. The Stewart didn't do anything to solve the problem nor did he care about the woman's safety.

3) Food wasn't fresh at all. After eating the food that I was offered ( rise and meat ) I got food poisoning and got sick for two days.

4) There was a smell of smoke that worried me a lot.

Pros

Egyptair is one of the few airline companies that allows a great deal of baggage allowance.

Check-in was very smooth and the people who checked me in were very efficient and very professional.

It is well connected and it goes to plenty of countries.

Please note: this comment is based on the last experience I had. I have had some good experiences in the past.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Flying anything these days that's short of business class (excluding Emirates), can be trying. My experience with most US and Canadian carriers is they're "service" is very, very, average when it comes to economy, and that's being kind. Flight attendants on North American flights now tend to be overly officious and not particularly friendly, due in large part to 911 no doubt. However, the Egyptair folks by contrast are far more relaxed and easy going than most other American and European carriers. Their service is proficient enough and friendly, the food is not fantastic, but it is palatable, and they're pretty relaxed about letting people get up to wander about and stretch their legs (I'm sure the lack of booze on the plane probably helps with this).The planes are not the newest, but they're not the oldest fleet I've flown either. In the end, I'd describe my experience as just a bit above the North American carriers - so 3 1/2 stars, not 3.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew Egyptair on three different occasions during this trip. I was a little nervous for the first flight since I never flew it before. Afterwards I felt at ease. Flight to Luxor and back from Aswan were good.
I was worried about ride to the hotel from the airport since I read about different fare ranges, need to negotiate, quality of cars etc. I was fortunate to have it settled quickly at the airport when approached by a man who provided a clean Toyota Corolla with a reasonable price. I used the same ride several times. Then I found out using Uber was the best, reliable and cheaper.
Have a pleasant trip !!!

Title: I flew Egypt Air from Jeddah to Cairo.  I was impressed with the leg room and the food was decent.  I had an excellent experience because of the airline employee in Jeddah named Mr. Hisham. Title:
Be aware that no alcohol is served on Egyptair.
No relaxing cocktails.
No wine with dinner.
No drink to help you sleep.

Other than a nice, tender, small piece of steak with dinner, the food was well below Business Class standards.
Breakfast included a dish of dark brown glop called "fool". I think that I was the fool for trying it. Made from ground up beans ( I think) it looked like something I would avoid while walking my dog. I covered it in honey to give it a flavor.
The other food was uninspired and not fresh looking. Definitely below Business Class standards.

The movies and videos were old and bland. The only recent movie was "The Meg". All violent special effects and zero plot. Sleeping was more entertaining.

The crew were most pleasant and helpful and gave us full attention. Thanks.

Would I fly Egyptair again?
Only if the alternative was walking.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
There are certain expectations in Business Class.
Egyptair fell short.
This airline does not serve alcohol.
No relaxing cocktails.
No wine with dinner.
No drink to help you sleep on a long flight.
Will the exception of a delightful, small, tender piece of steak, the food was below par. For breakfast I had a dish called "fool". I think that I was a fool for trying it. A dish of dark brown glop made, I think, from mushed beans. It looked like something I would avoid stepping on while walking my dog. Total Drek. I had to coat it with honey to give it any taste at all.
The other meals were also uninspired and looked like they were not terribly fresh.

On the other hand, the crew were pleasant and helpful.

Movie and video choices were limited to old, and bland shows not worth viewing. The only recent movie was "The Meg", with zero plot but lots of violent special effects. Sleeping was more entertaining.

Would I fly Egyptair again?
Only if my only other option was walking.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Check in at Heathrow was good,the boarding process at the gate was poor could not hear P.A. so was a bit of a scrum.Once on board the plane was fine plenty of leg room,good entertainment system,average plane food,no alcohol served on Egypt air flights.Had to change planes in Cairo and had 1 hour 45 minutes to play with which in most airports would be plenty,but Cairo airport is total chaos,after buying my visa from the bank found the queue for the domestic terminal and there was about 100 people in the queue and only one officer on the desk.As the departure time for both the Sharm and Hurghada flights came nearer people were getting very fractious and verbal,eventually some Egypt air staff turned up and said they would hold the flights as they were the last flights of the day.Eventually got through and boarded and the flight left 35 minutes late with many stressed people on.The flight was fine but badly tainted by the airport experience.Wont travel this way again rather pay more for Turkish airlines and go via Istanbul.

Title:
It always helps to have little to no expectation when flying a carrier not really known for much except the fact it’s Egypt’s flag carrier.

My Egyptian holiday began in Sharm el Sheikh. The town is very seasonal so the only two international carriers that fly year-round are both EgyptAir and Turkish Airlines.

All EgyptAir flights operate out of Cairo’s Terminal 3. Note there are two security processes: one before entering the ticketing area and another before your gate. For the former, present your passport and flight details (I had mine on my phone and the guards had no problem with it).

Once past, I made my way to the ticket counters. There was a queue, but it moved swiftly. They checked my bag in because it weighed more than 8 kg (the bag was free anyways).

Once I had ticket in hand, I made my way to the domestic area. Note the domestic and international departure areas are split. To say the domestic zone is barren is an understatement. There’s one coffee place and an Egyptair Lounge. If you arrive early, prepare to not do much.

My flight to Sharm was operated by Egyptair Express. As such, we had to take a bus to a remote terminal. There was no rhyme or reason for boarding: everyone just boarded the bus and the aircraft.

Pitch is average, but tight if you’re taller than 5’7”. The flight attendants professional if not stoic. Announcements were made in both Arabic and English.

After doors closed, we taxied for about 15 minutes before taking off. For a short flight, I was surprised they served a snack (my flight was prepackaged butter cookies).

As soon as the FAs made their rounds, we began our descent.

I paid USD$117 one way. For a short flight, Egyptair is totally serviceable.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Our travel company had booked us into Business Class - don’t bother. Travel economy - same seats and same service.

Upon our check-in at Aswan to go to Abu Simbel we received 3 boarding passes. The first for the flight from Aswan to Abu Simbel, the second from Abu Simbel to Aswan and the third the ongoing flight from Aswan to Cairo (same Flight No. but different seats).

We had checked our large luggage in on the flight to Abu Simbel and were told that it would be kept at Aswan until the plane returned and then would be loaded for us to pick up in Cairo - thankfully this process worked well and we gratefully picked our bags off the carousel in Cairo airport.

Shambles at Abu Simbel airport - huge queue out the door trying to get through security screening which was not helped by some very uncooperative travellers who waited until they got to the X-ray machines before rustling in their pockets etc to see what they had.

When we finally got inside the terminal the green light for “boarding” was flashing for our flight but as we got up to the next security screening, at the one and only boarding gate, we were told our flight was not boarding yet as they were still boarding the previous flight. No priority boarding.

Finally boarded (bus out to the parking bay on the tarmac) and received our fruit juice from the same stewardess who was on the same aircraft, the Embraer 170, that we had caught from Aswan to Abu Simbel some 3/4 hours earlier. It had been from Abu Simbel, via Aswan to Cairo and return whilst we had been touring the magnificent temples at Abu Simbel. The stewardess said they had already done 5 sectors that day.

Same shortened safety briefing - seat belts, exits and safety card at front of plane if you want to receive more. No announcements from the pilots as we took off over 40 minutes late for our short 35 minute flight to Aswan. Good flight and nice landing.

Some confusion then as to whether we were to get off or stay on the plane. Eventually advised that we should stay on the plane but sit in our new seats which were also in Business Class. The Business Class section on the flight from Abu Simbel to Aswan had been restricted to the first 2 rows but whilst on the ground at Aswan the dividing curtain was quickly moved back an additional 6 rows and presto! An extended Business Class section but the same seats. A ground crew member then checked our boarding passes whilst we were on the plane and shortly thereafter the new passengers joined us. We ended up taking off from Aswan only about 5 minutes late.

New safety briefing - seat belts, exits and this time oxygen masks plus the safety cards.

New carton of juice. Still no pilot announcements either then or on the approximately one and a half hour flight to Cairo. We did though receive a small tray with 2 small open sandwiches (one meat and one cheese), 3 pieces of cake, 2 olives, water and coffee/tea during the flight.

Smooth flight and smooth landing.
qwuub: Egyptair Express Business Class Abu Simbel to Cairo via Aswan. Save money and travel economy.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Our travel company booked us into Business Class. Not sure of the cost but not worth it. No lounge, no priority security, no priority boarding and the seats on the plane, a 76 seat (2 x 2 configuration) Embraer 170 aircraft were exactly the same. Seats OK but an old plane.

Security screening at Aswan incredibly slow such that all flights were delayed. Bus from the gate to the plane in the parking bay on the tarmac. Packet of fruit juice to everyone on boarding.

No announcements by pilot re flying time etc. Safety briefing limited to seat belts and exits and consult safety cards kept at the front of the plane for the rest.

Smooth 35 minute flight along the edges of Lake Nasser.
qwuub: Egyptair Express Business Class Aswan to Abu Simbel - don’t bother with Business Class.

Title: My wife and I flew r/t Biz class from JFK to Cairo, plus 4 domestic flights within Egypt.  We had read some reviews beforehand and were prepared to endure whatever, especially since earlier this year we had flown Biz on a 787-9 r/t LAX to Sydney with American.   Were we ever surprised!  Egyptair's Triple-7 was a little tired looking and cannot compare to the new 787's, but neither could the service.  ALL the flight attendants on ALL our Egyptair flights could not have been more friendly, attentive, and efficient.  We have flown international not only on American, but Asiana, LAN, and United.  I would choose the service we received from Egyptair's crews over any of these.  Perhaps not the services available, but certainly for the staff.  No Bose headphones, no pj's, no alcoholic drinks, but friendliness and willingness to please makes up for that.I'll also say that all the plane interiors and restrooms were clean, the seatpockets were clean of debris, and all the seats, lights, etc were in good working order.
qwuub: Better Experience than on US Carriers!

I did not hear safety information in English. I wasn't asked to stowe away my table whilst I was writing my notes on the service, even though we were advancing onto the runway. The plane does need an upgrade for sure.

Title: Not sure why they have first class on these smaller regional jets. They just move the curtain back and there is no one in the middle seat. That was about it, the legroom was non existent; which for an hour flight i was OK with the lack of room. The plane needed a little TLC... the knob for the vents broke off in my hand and my tray table was not attached to the seat in front of me. I had to rest the tray table on my legs. The food was OK and the service was nothing spectacular. For short trips in country, this airline is fine, but would not have been my choice in airlines

Title:
I will never fly with EgyptAir. Rude staff, nasty food, uncomfortable seats and they also stole my baby monitor.
I recommend to fly with another airline because you wouldn't want people talking down to you.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: My original connecting flight with Air France was cancelled and they booked me on a flight with EgyptAir and I can say I was very disappointed. I had paid for a premium offering through AF and this flight only had economy and business class but was pretty much all booked. I was given a seat in row 33 but not an aisle or window as I always pay for. I was told repeatedly to wait to the gate opened and they would fix my arrangement. I was even directed to the EgyptAir desk at CDG (which meant I had to "leave" the airport and then be subjected to 45min of wait time to re-enter). The flight had been sold out as passenger from mine and another cancelled flight scrabbled to reach their destination. The flight boarded late and was full of screaming children and newborn babies, making it the worst flight of my life. The family of children behind me kept repeatedly kicking my seat and the 3month old baby cried the entire 4hr flight. Somehow I was one of the last people to be serve a meal and I received something that looked like vomit and vegetables. They said it was chicken but my vegetarian companion(who had been finished eating for over 30 min because they were served right away) said it looked and smelled of beef. Which if that was the case, I did not eat, would have been a disaster for someone who doesn't eat red meat or has food restrictions. My luggage was late and throughout the flight I was constantly being jostled. This flight is an example of what is wrong with the airline industry.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

I'll have to continue flying with them as their timings are convenient, but I'll provide my own entertainment and probably food!

Title:
Good service once again on Egyptair from Cairo to London.
Flight left on time and arrived on time. Seats reasonably comfortable in Economy - I had an over-wing window seat. Good in-flight meal and entertainment facilities (not that I use the latter much). Friendly staff and good value for money.

Helpful tip: Cairo airport terminal could be a wee bit better. They have a final round of hand luggage security at the departure gate - so even if you have bought water in the terminal you will have to jettison this before boarding unless you have bought it in the DUTY FREE outlets (not the food hall outlets) and have kept the receipt.
I think this is a bit of a con!
crvsd: Alexander C wrote a review Oct 2018

Title:
With regular travel it is easy to get stuck in always booking with the 'regular' airlines. This was the case with a recent business trip to Egypt.

The 'regular' airlines would take me from South Africa, via Europe, to Egypt. Although not a bad routing, the option was there to take Egyptair, for a more direct routing, and a business class ticket for a similar price to the economy on the other routing.

I took the Egyptair option, as so many other holiday travellers do, and I was pleasantly surprised.

From check-in to good-byes, everyone had friendly smiles. I've just booked my next trip with them for next month
crvsd: Barry D wrote a review Oct 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Tour group we booked with organised business class seating. Would not bother on this short flight of just on an hour.

There was no separate business class queue for the first security check and x-ray of bags, which is before you even get to the Check-in/bagdrop. Once through this there was a separate business checkin/bagdrop - one of the few priveleges afforded.

Business class gave entry to the domestic Egytair lounge - don’t bother. 26 lounge chairs jammed into a tiny room with a few pastries, hot water for tea and coffee and a minbar fridge with water and soft drinks. They don’t call flights. Much more room outside in the general terminal.

Went to the gate and an additional security checkpoint for carry-on. There were signs for a separate business classs queue but the x-ray machine for this queue was not being operated. Once through into the boarding area we waited for the call for who boarded first. No such call. They opened the door to the gangplank entry area and it was a free for all.

Boeing 737/800, but obviously an older model as there were ashtrays in the seat arms.

On board service consisted of a popper of guava or apple and a pack of about 6 sweet biscuits.

Only other benefit was a separate bus just for the business class passengers from the tarmac to the terminal. Didn’t matter as bags then took over 30 minutes to come through to the carousel.

Not worth the money for such a short flight.
qwuub: Very average business class service on domestic flight.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Boeing 737/800 with large business class section and economy from aisle 20 to 30 with 3 by 3 configuration.

Boarding orderly - by business, children etc and then by rows. Pulled back on time.

Cabin service OK. Choice of hot meal either beef or chicken with small salad, bread roll and tiramisu. Tea or coffee and one serving of drinks on a 3 hour 30 minute flight.

No announcements from the captain but flight good. Smooth touchdown.
qwuub: Reasonable flight and service. Left and arrived on time.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I had 2 reservations with EgyptAir on 26.08.2017 from BOM to YYZ having PNR as RAC6OQ & RAYM3G. to be frank it was unpleasant flight and your staff behavior was very rude and i felt that we were being discriminated every time at all point of contacts. talking about our first connections Mumbai - Cairo

1) Flight was delayed by more than 1.45 hours. At check-in counters i was told that refreshment is provided at the gate and there was no one to even guide at which cafe the same is available? we are not god to know everything. had to wait for your staff to let us know where the cafe is.

2) Your staff at the check-in gate always used local arabic language which was discriminating as we could hardly understand anything. and after boarding the flight below is the experience

3) we were not provided blankets for our seats and all other seats had blankets with them. when requested the staff bluntly said we dont have it, you have to adjust it. i was like why should i adjust you are responsible to provide blankets to all passengers. Airline had the information before hand that how many passengers are travelling with them they should have made the arrangements before hand to avoid any inconvenience to fellow passengers. what amazed me was only Indian national passengers were not given blankets, other nationalities had the blanket. One of the passenger was travelling on student visa and the staff didn't even bothered to wake up the passenger for meal or breakfast. what kind of service is this??

4) after we landed at Cairo we had to nearly wait for 30 mins for a passenger bus to arrive to take us to the terminal building. its your main hub and the airline is expected to be prepared for all the incoming & outgoing flights. again your staff was least bothered to handle passengers.

5) we were told that we will be provided transit visa so that we can take day tour nevertheless it was so time consuming that at one point of time I decided not to go anywhere and just stay at airport. You are doing a good job of providing free transit visa but at the same time you are not doing any extra ordinary favors as passengers travelling in transit are also contributing to tourism revenues.

6) Hotel was not even prepared to handle transit passengers. we were not even picked up on time from the airport. after reaching hotel the room took almost 1.30 hours to handover the room keys and cited reasons like its not ready as yet.

7) now coming to more serious issues, i was not provided food for my flight from CAI-YYZ?? can you imagine? how racist can you be? and till what extent you can go to harass passengers?? i was told to eat non vegetarian meal just because they didnt had the veg meal available?? what non sense you are talking? they said because you didnt book the veg meal online we dont have it with us. While i did for one of my booking i was not able to do it for other booking as your site didnt process it. i was just not given any option neither to crew tried to make any arrangements so that they can help me have food. this is ridiculous of all. what if passengers dont have access to internet and cannot book the veg meal? you will not provide them meal at all?? its the responsibility of the airline to provide meals as per passengers request. now i got one meal which was only boiled spaghetti, boiled aubergine, boiled carrots without any taste or even a salt. this is seriously hurting bad now. i simply gave back the only veg meal given to us between 2 passengers saying i cant eat this food. when i asked the serving staff for a drink he is like my colleague will help you. Racist, simply discriminating us as we were Indians.

8) now coming to breakfast again we were given only one veg meal, again it was the same meal that was given last night? what do you expect us to do now? for a flight lasting more than 11 hours you want us to stay hungry?? height of inefficiency of your staff. we stayed on 2 bread pieces and 2 pc of cake for the whole flight and had to stay on soft drinks such as coke, water and juices. I wouldnt be staying on just drinks for the whole flight.

9) i had to go through 3 security checks at Cairo airport, what for?? being a permanent resident of Canada I was asked for my COPR copy, my visa stamp, i asked on what ground you are asking for this documents? you are not canadian authorities to ask such documents and i have already cleared immigration at Mumbai airport before i could board the outbound flight to Cairo. why harass us again as were merely transit passengers. a student with us was held for documents like student permit, proof of college admission, and what not? please understand you are merely an airline not a immigration office to request all such documents. we already had a valid visa to travel to the country of destination. despite having a valid visa we were being asked such documents which at first place are irrelevant on your part and your staff is least trained on to handle these issues.
crvsd: Heman S wrote a review Oct 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: My flight to Cairo from JFK was exemplary. When you treat the staff with respect, they treat you the same. 777-300 all the way was very comfortable and as luck would have it, I was in the middle three seats with no one between myself and the other person. Flight was pretty full. I watched movies all the way except for when I nodded off for 15 minutes only to wake up with a beautiful flight attendant bending down to face level asking me what I wanted for breakfast. Boy what a treat. Thought I was in heaven. Service and food was outstanding. There were 20 people in our group and everyone loved the on board grub. Check-in at JFK to baggage claim at Cairo, was flawless. A great Fve Star Alliance airline that I would fly again and strongly recommend.

Title:
It is admittedly the only airline that directly flies to Barcelona from Cairo and that was the route we had taken on our way to Spain a week earlier.
We do not eat the hot meals on board, when the catering is outbound from Egypt. Usually ask on the way back where was the catering fetched from before taking the risk...
This time around the flight had advanced screens on the back of each seat in front of you, whereby each passenger can independently choose from a vast array of movies and other entertainment features, which is a perk for economy class. The take off and landing times are punctual and landing is efficient. Prices are not the cheapest but it is a direct flight, which has its advantages. Recommended based on route and direct flight advantage.

Title:
A great flight for the price. Two free bags and no one quibbled for a second when my first bag was 5kg over. The seats had a bit more room than other economy long hauls and had that lay back where the bottom slides forward that I think is a much better idea.
There wasn't a great selection of movies, but I had been flying a lot recently, so it was probably just because I'd seen them all.
The food was not fabulous, but no worse than any other and INCLUDED. They also gave you a blanket, pillow, and little kit with headphones and eye mask, etc.
People were very friendly and most everything went just like it always goes with every airline.
The only complaint I could register was that there was no alcohol served on this airline (?), certainly this flight. Not the worst thing in the world.
Also, I waited almost 2 hours for my bags to arrive on the carousel. I am not sure if that's the fault of Egyptair, JFK, or US customs, though.
I would definitely fly them again.
crvsd: Cheda M wrote a review Oct 2018
qwuub: A good value for the low cost

Title:
Travelled to Luxor from Cairo on 24/09/2018 in a party of ten.
The aircraft was unfamiliar but probably based on a 727.
Seating was pretty good with more legroom than your average UK or European based airlines. No alcohol is served on any Egyptair flight, international or internal, but there is a good range of soft drinks, tea or coffee.

5 of our party had bags not show up at Luxor, plus another 6 bags from other PAX.
Rather strangely, nearly all the bags that went astray were from couples, one bag per couple not being loaded at the Cairo end.
I am informed that this happens on a regular basis and the reason is usually to make room for freight, so I was told from a reliable source.
All the bags turned up a few hours later, but the delay caused at Luxor meant our group and a couple of other people travelling to the same destination missed our dinner and a reception on board the boat we were staying on for a cruise.
VERY ANNOYING EGYPTAIR, STOP DOING IT.
crvsd: Chris M wrote a review Oct 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: This is my second review of Egyptair.  We traveled to Cairo from JFK that's on another review.  This is for our Aswan to Cairo flight. We arrived at the Aswan airport along with 18 other travelers on a tour heading back to Cairo.  We were all booked on this flight by our tour guide company and had printed confirmations and had confirmed our flights.  My wife and I were denied a boarding pass as the flight was overbooked. While our fellow travelers proceeded to the gate we stood at the ticket counter for over 45 minutes while the Egyptair agent kept entering information into his computer trying to figure something out.  Finally he gave us the bad news that we will not be leaving at 7pm with our fellow travelers but would be on the 10pm flight.  He also said we would get a voucher for $30 each for our troubles.  In addition we could have a slice of pizza and a "coke" on Egyptair.  Aswan airport has very limited food choices. While waiting at the ticket counter  I asked the agent if anyone who was ticketed for our flight was asked to get bumped for compensation like you see at most airports.  He assured us they asked but no one wanted to take the bump.  We took our tickets and voucher met up with our fellow passengers who had not yet boarded the 7pm flight.  We asked if the airlines had asked anyone waiting for the flight if they would take a bump for compensation and they said no one from Egyptair had made any such offers.  The next day as we arrived at the Cairo airport to fly back to JFK we tried to cash in our $30 vouchers.  No one was able to do that at the Egyptair desks.  Since then we have contacted wecareEgyptair asking for more than the $30 offered.  We sent copies of our vouchers but at this point nothing has been resolved.  Still waiting to hear back from Egyptair.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We flew from Luxor to Healthrow, with a couple of hours' transit in Cairo with our two sons aged 7 and 9 - and at first, I was slightly apprehensive as we were given seats in three different rows (a single in one row, two seats together in the row behind, and a single in the row behind that). However, when we got on the plane, we were reassured as we had the seats at the very back of the plane, and they were just double seats instead of in a block of three. My 9-year-old was happy to sit on his own in the very back row of the plane, and we had a comfortable and uneventful flight, with great service and enjoyable services from the in-flight entertainment console.

Title:
This was the 5th flight with Egyptair. The check in was super flawless in fact they gave us our seating assignments for the next leg from Cairo to JFK at the same time. We were really worried about the overweight issues with our bags but they did not worry about a few pounds over weight. Again the service on board was great.
The only issues we ever had with flying around Egypt was with security checks getting into the airport etc. Seems like they are all thinking up their own ideas about what can go through and what can't. A lot of people go there to dive and a lot of the security personnel don't have a clue about basic scuba gear such as regulators, safety sausages etc. Someone needs to educate them and stop the stupid checks. This is probably the number one thing that most of our group (23) experienced throughout our 23 day trip. Traveling on five different flights with Egyptair some people had stuff taken away that made absolutely no sense. One had dive reel taken away because they said they could hang someone with it yet the 10 lb. laptop could not kill someone by beating them over the head. A lot of people said they would no come back because of this main reason.

Title:
We travelled with Egyptair on a flight to juba via Cairo. Usually we travel
With Ethiopian airlines via Addis to juba
On arrival at Cairo at 20:40 we had a 7.5hr stop over 04:00 and at booking in London were toldcwe’d ve given a hotel room.
We arrived and were directed through security to second floor after some time in not finding desk we were eventually redirected back down to arrivals. After another lot of misdirections we were told that we were now too late to claim our room. As a result we spent the night in a cafe as lounge which we offered to pay $30 for was full!
On way back things were no better. We paid extra to guarantee seats but someone else was in my seat! Cabin staff were very dismissive of my complaint
Would I travel with this airline again? No!
qwuub: When an airline lets you diwn

Title: I had the most amazing flights with Egyptair. After reading reviews, I was hesitant to fly with Egyptair, but I am glad i did not listen. The flight was only half full, so i got my own row in economy. The flight attendants were all incredibly kind and helpful. Even if the flight was full, it would still be an enjoyable one. The food was good for airline food. The flight took off and landed on time. Some people complain that the planes are a little older, but older planes provide more seat cushion and leg space. With that being said, I did notice some wobbly tray tables, but nothing horrible. The entertainment was lacking a bit (as compared to other star alliance airlines), so be sure to bring your own. Or you could be open to watching some arabic movies with subtitles (many of them are wonderful). I also took several local flights around the country and i'm not sure how one can complain about a 1 hour flight. It was over by the time my cup of tea was finished. All in all, Egypt air provided me with some of the best flight experiences i have had in a long time! Thank you Egypt air!
crvsd: Candice K wrote a review Sep 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I recently flew Business Class in two of EGYPTAIR's aging Boeing 737-800s, one from BEY-CAI and one from CAI-BRU.  The business class experience on EGYPTAIR is solidly average, offering dated but comfortable semi-reclining seats and reasonable overhead space.  Underseat space is limited because of the mechanical kit of the seats.EGYPTAIR lounges are barely adequate. I visited three of them whilst at Cairo Terminal 3, four if you include the smoking lounge which I quickly exited.  There are few snack and food options and drinks are limited to a few machine coffee selections, tea, and fizzy drinks.
qwuub: Business class is nothing special--dated but comfortable seats, so-so service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Seat width and leg room was adequate (but could always be larger).  We selected our seats months ahead of time on their website, and selected a special meal.  We did not get the seats we selected OR our special meals.  Other than that, everything went smoothly on the way TO Cairo from JFK.  They do not have an Economy Plus cabin, which is the class we typically prefer to fly in, so it was a little tighter than we are used to.  The flight attendants came regularly with drinks to keep us hydrated, and the food was actually pretty decent (for airline food).  In-Seat Entertainment was sub-par.  There were very few American movies from which to choose, and while I didn't mind, they were all severely edited for content (swear words, drinking, sexual content, etc...)  The ISE was also very difficult to work and glitchy.  There was a USB charging port on the headrest, which was very nice. They provided a little care packet including headphones, socks, eye mask, ear plugs, toothbrush and toothpaste. I'm actually glad for this tidbit, but most Americans will not be... there is absolutely no alcohol on board.  The bathrooms were a disaster the entire flight.  Completely disgusting.  Overall, it was 10.5 hours of flying, but it was doable and uneventful.  On the way back from Cairo to JFK, I felt like we were flying a different airline!  It was pretty rough.  Again, we had selected our seats, which we did not get, and selected our meals, which we did not get.  We were told it was a completely full flight and we could not move.  However, that was not the case.  There were plenty of open seats and others were allowed to move seats.  But we were good and stayed put.  Food was not as good this time around & was somewhat unrecognizable.  Flight attendants stayed in a group in the far back of the plane the entire flight and did not come around with beverages to keep us hydrated.  If you walked the length of the plane to the back to get a drink, they acted like you were bothering them, and they only gave you 2 sips of water in a tiny cup, not enough to even wet my mouth, let alone quench my thirst.  We were painfully dehydrated by the time we landed. Add the cacophony of crying babies, and coughing and sneezing passengers, and we were extremely bedraggled by the time we reached JFK.  I was disappointed in the lack of service on the flight home.  We got there and back safely and inexpensively, and relatively quickly, and we got to see Egypt in between, so it wasn't all bad!
crvsd: Alyssa Kathryn B wrote a review Sep 2018
qwuub: Roundtrip from JFK to Cairo on Egyptair
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Took several Egypt Air flights during this trip (Cairo to Aswan, Aswan to Abu Simbel and back, Luxor to Cairo and Cairo to London).  Our flights were nice - they did give our a pack of sugar cookies instead of the peanuts or pretzels you get on other airlines.  I had booked our flight from Luxor to Cairo and Cairo to London on separate tickets to save money (about $1,100 when flying to the US).  The gentleman at the check-in was a bit disgruntled and asked us to take a seat while he figured it out, but once the long line behind us was gone, but he ended up being able to check our bags all the way through to our final destination, and came and found us at the gate in order to give us the rest of our boarding passes.  Our flight from Luxor was delayed by about 90 minutes, so we only had about 20 minutes to make our flight in Cairo.  When we got off the plane in Cairo, we started running to the passport control (transfer desk) and someone from Egypt Air met us half way and asked us if we were going to London.  He helped us jump the lines at security and passport control and made sure that we did not miss our flight.

Title: This plane seats 3-3-3 in coach.  Seats were a little wider than our last atlantic crossing with AA.  Dinner and breakfast served.  Good entertainment system in the headrest in front of you and hook ups for computer flash drive etc. Also ac plug under the seat. The planes are showing wear and tear.  No liquor served, if you want a drink buy it at duty free at least 90 minutes before boarding and they will meet you at the gate with your purchase.  Then pour yourself a drink on board. I don't think they had ice.  For JFK to Cairo they pass out a pouch with ear plugs, eye mask for darkness, ear bugs for audio, tooth paste and mini tooth brush.  A nice touch.  Staff was fine nothing to complain about.  Pillows and blankets are provided. They do not use TSA pre check!  The return trip only ear bugs given out.  The airport in Cairo is a bit of a hassle not very orderly and numerous security checks to fly out.  Plus one especially for flights to JFK.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Boarding in JNB was pleasant, Business Class and Star Alliance Gold members received preferential treatment. On board, I was not convinced that the crew was excited to serve us. It was standard, they did they job. Opposite to other airlines from the Muslim world (i.e. Qatar or Emirates) Egyptair does not serve a glass of champaign to great business class passengers. No alcohol is allowed on board.

The flight equipment is old, but serves its purpose to get people from A to B.

I consider the overall experience as standard, which is far away from African competition like Ethiopian, or competition from the Middle East like Qatar or Emirates.

Title: our flight was late leaving anyway but it was a 5.5 hour flight. This was a very small plane a 737. The seats were very cramped, close together with hardly any room between the back of the seat in front and my seat. You had to be a contortionist to be able to eat your food from the tray table without spilling the food or elbowing the person in the next seat. Our tv screen that was 3 seats ahead, was almost black for most of the film and I noticed that others on the other side of the plane were similar. We could see in the distance that a screen further down looked brighter. We were only offered a hot drink with the meal and then only once. Most flights offer a 2nd cup. The food was typical airline food so nothing to report there. We were given blankets and a pillow at no cost, which was good. It was needed as the plane was very cold. The staff only came once to collect rubbish so missed mine which ended up in the seat pocket. The light in the toilet was very dim. The sink was grimey and dirty, not just soapy. I got the impression that we had all been put on a small plane as the tourist numbers were down.
qwuub: small plane was too cramped for a long flight
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Flew Egyptair from JFK to Cairo as part of a group tour to Egypt. Also flew this airline 3 years ago on a previous tour to Egypt and it was not the best but better than expected. This time it was terrible. No rules enforced or selectively enforced. We were in row 42 an exit row. We had to stow our bags in the overhead for take off and landing which is normal but the Egyptian woman sitting next to me didn't have to. She was asked once to stow her huge tote but never did and flight attendants just looked at her and the bag and never enforced the rule. This was for both taking off and landing. Same with others around us. No enforcing seats in upright position for take off and landing. Food was pretty bad- no in flight water service- you had to walk to the back and get it yourself. When landing, several dozen people jumped up and opened overhead bins as soon as we touched down and was still moving. Others got up and ran to toilets. Children running up and down aisles all during the flight. Screaming babies everywhere.  Flight attendants didn't do anything to enforce anything and could care less - no personality either- movie and game selection was terrible. I have flown to 140 countries and travel all over the world and this airline ranks in the top 2 or 3 worst I've ever been on. The flight from JFK to Cairo was bad and the return from Cairo to JFK was even worse with more of the same violations and lack of caring and service.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I am a frequent international traveler.  Have flown all over the world with various large and small carriers.  The unprofessionalism of the flight crew, from the female flight attendant to her male cabin chief for flight #747 from Cairo to Athens on 9/15 was reprehensible.  The incident occurred when an unruly male passenger, seat 21H, in front continued to recline and bounces his seat backwards denying any room for my tray to be down for meal service and injuring my knees. When I sought help after not being able to eat, nor have my iPad open without it being abruptly slammed upon, I received no help, but was first ridiculed by the female flight attendant when I asked her to ask the passenger to put his seat upright so I can put my tray down to eat.  She told me that I should only eat when that passenger signals me when he is ready and that to not try and eat or use my iPad. She then joked in her language with two passengers next to me and they started laughing and thought my plea for her help was funny.  Soon after she left, passenger 21H, bounced back even more and reclined further, digging the bottom of his seat and hitting my knees and popped my iPad out of its standing case.  He then had the audacity to yell at me and said I was digging my knee in his back. I called for help and the cabin chief  took a while to come. While waiting for help, apparently, in the back of the airplane there was an assault between two female passengers and I heard the cabin chief refusing to help the victim press charges or take control of the situation.  When he reached me, I explained the problem, even showed him how my knees were injured and still had dents/bruising, passengers across my seat even spoke to be witness to the facts; he told me that I was not injured and that passenger 21H had a right to assault me with his need to fully recline his seat while I have no right to even have any space in front of me to eat my meal, put my tray down, and open my iPad.  He then spoke to 21H, laughed about the situation, and told him that I was going to make trouble for him since I asked for his name and am filing a file a complaint and that he better back him up when the complaint surfaces.  The cabin chief never once asked passenger 21H to bring his seat up or try to remedy or mediate, but instead, being the male chauvinist he was and his entire racist crew was, dismissed my injures and simply denied me my basic right as a passenger.  I would caution anyone to fly with this carrier given that especially as a female, non Egyptian or Arabic speaking passenger; you may not receive any help and be subjected to ridicule and merely be dismissed.
qwuub: Worst Flight Crew- Male Chauvinism at its finest!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Me and my wife took Egypt Air flight from Mumbai to Toronto via Cairo (MS 969 & MS 995). We had a long layover at Cairo (20 hours).
The check-in counter at Mumbai airport opened almost 5 hours before. They will give you paper luggage tags for check-in luggage. They didn't charge us for 5 extra kgs of check-in luggage.
The boarding was almost 15 minutes before scheduled departure. Ensure you board early since space for overhead luggage space is limited and almost everyone carries a trolley bag. People who boarded last didn't have any space to stow their had luggage.
The Mumbai Cairo flight was a horrible experience. People were still looking for space for their hand luggage and the flight took off. Crew members were rude and didn't care. Aircraft was old and some seats didn't recline. Food wasn't that great.
After landing in Cairo (6 hour flight), at ARRIVALS we went to a counter called "Transfer Customer Accomodation Service". We were given a free transit stay and transit visa. Stay was arranged at Hilton with all meals included. Passports were kept by the Egypt Air officials but they give you a receipt. You get your passport once you produce the receipt at the Departures. Totally safe.
An official also arranged for Pyramids tour for 50 CAD or 40 USD (rates vary depending on group size)(USD, CAD and Egyptian currency accepted only and in cash). It includes AC coach and guide. Tour lasts for 4-5 hours. Ensure you take a receipt and contact details of the tour operator.
We were taken to Hilton and checked in. Had our Breakfast, took a shower and waited at lobby for the coach driver to arrive. Take water, umbrella and sunscreen when you go. The guide will show you Nile river, 3 Pyramids, the spinx, perfume shop and Papyrus Photo shop. You may enter the inside of Pyramids but at an extra cost. Tickets to be purchased at the entrance in Egyptian currency and in cash.
We returned back to hotel, had lunch, slept, got ready, had dinner and went to airport. At airport, we went to Egypt Air counter to get our passports and Boarding Passes back on producing the receipt.
Cairo-Toronto flight was much better. Service was great, no hand baggage problem.
Food was still a concern.

Overall it was a great experience. Cairo stay and Pyramid visit was great.

Carry Universal Adaptor and Indian food as safety measure.
crvsd: Saumyadeep M wrote a review Sep 2018
qwuub: Mumbai to Toronto via Cairo (MS 969 / MS 995)
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
On my trip to Eqypt, my baggage was damaged, Upon arriving at the airport in Cairo, I went to the baggage claim office and was told I would be receiving compensation for the baggage that was damaged and unusable. I was given reference number 19264. I was told the NY office would reach out to me within 4-6 weeks to receive compensation for my baggage. I emailed mybaggage@egyptair.com on May 23, 2018. This was approx 8 weeks after my travel.

I was told that my claim was settled with the insurance company with a reference 1872/2018 and that the NY office would reach out to me again. I was told that I can contact them at insurance@egyptair.com or Rania.gamal@egyptair.com.

I waited several months and never heard back. I emailed ALL of the email addresses I had on file on Aug 5th and AGAIN NO ONE reached out to me! This is now 4 MONTHS after they destroyed my bag.

I reached out again on Aug 16th and still no one has attempted to get this resolved.

Horrible customer service!!!

Title:
Our plan was to fly from Heathrow to Cairo, with a connecting flight to Luxor. The first leg of the journey was fine. Plane was a little old, but the food was good and the cabin crew were efficient. The transfer from the London flight to Luxor flight was fraught because of the late departure of the Heathrow flight. Transfer was achieved in the nick of time and both us and our baggage made it to Luxor, which was a positive.

On our return flight the baggage did not make the connecting flight to London (from Cairo). The staff at the desk at baggage reclaim in Heathrow were far from understanding. They made no apologies and lacked any sympathy whatsoever. However, once we started communicating via the helpline number, we found the staff approachable, knowledgeable and supportive. All of the information we were furnished with proved to be correct and our bags were delivered to us undamaged 4 days after landing which was within their 5 day target.

Whilst we werent happy that the bags were lost, we commend the reclaim process and off-site staff.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

I travel a lot but  I have never experienced that the  flight attendants cant speak English. How is this possible? The biggest problem with this flight is that they  leave about ten suitcases at the Cairo airport or a regular basis. They just simply don't put the suitcases in the plane. We had two suitcases each (medium sized, about 14 kgs each) and they did not arrive, they were chosen not to be loaded in the plane. We got them very late next night The staff that handles the delayed luggage in Budapest told us that this is a constant problem with Egyptair's Cairo-Budapest-Cairo flights. As soon as they finish the administration of the delayed suitcases at the arrival terminal in Budapest, they start the same procedure at the departure as well because Egyptair do the same when you travel from Budapest to Cairo i.e. they don!t take all the luggage. It is very outrageous because you pay 100% price for a 70%service. I don't understand how this is possible and how come that they have never been fined or condemned by the IATA or whatever association is there for airlines. One thing is for sure: I am going to lay a complaint at every platform possible because this is a very unfair business behaviour. On our way back to Cairo from Budapest, we had to buy a new ticket (Air France, via Paris) because we just simply couldn't stand the idea of the hassle with Egyptair and the delayed suitcases again.
qwuub: The most terrible, unprofessional, disgusting airline  - overall rating is below zero
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
1- Business Class Check in counter officer was absent
And after almost 30 min of starting check in at the economy counter allowed my checkin through that counter.
2- At the Receiption of the airport lounge the receptionist didn’t allow me to enter and told me that Egyptair allows only its Golden card members to use the lounge. Since I was very tired and needed badly to use the lounge facilities I used my Priority Pass card to enter and they charged my account 15 BRITISH Pounds.
3. Onboard of my flight 686 to Alexandria, the plane I boarded on was very old and it’s maintenance was terribly bad. Seats stuck, most of the business class seats were in miserable condition.
4- I filed a claim onboard using the Egyptair form and handed it over to the chief of the hosting team.
5- The food was okay, the service was a little below standard. I struggled hard to open the stuck tray.
6- Just yesterday I received an amazing e-mail from the customer care, with lies about my checkin time referring to the actual departure time which was delayed almost 30 minutes. And didn’t comment on my remarks except one about the lounge, that I used my priority pass to enter.
Bad handling of claims, very old badly maintained airplanes used for most of the flights from and to Alexandria airport.
Compared to the other airlines serving on the same route and some are not direct, Egyptair is the worst compared to; Air Arabia, Saudi Airlines and Flydubai
Hassan Abouraya

Title: It really wasn’t his fault. We had rebooked our trip to leave Ethiopia early (and paid handsomely for the change) I’d managed to develop a case of dysentery. The flight out of Addis to Cairo departs at 4:15 in the morning. No one is at their best at that hour but the circumstances were horrendous. For some reason there was a glitch in our booking and despite paying for business class tickets, the man at the desk wanted us to pay to check our bags. What??? It took an hour to get a manager, and it got to near bullying on both sides to get them to check 2 bags for 2 people without paying. Big bucks. (In Business Class you can check 2 PER person.) A week later when we boarded for JFK we were worried it might happen again. It did. But this time the problem was adjusted without fanfare. Im not sure why the team in Addis needed to make such a problem. The flight wasn’t full. There wasn’t an issue of weight. Is Egypt Air becoming a bargain liner? If you have an alternative, take it. Especially out of Addis. It was a shabby plane and the treatment embarrassing.

Title:
Egyptair - it's adequate. Gets you from point A to point B. And there's not much more to be said about this airline.

It is not the worst airline I have flown in my 40 + years being a travel professional. But it is far from the top of the list.

I took Egyptair to Cairo from JFK in Business Class. The service was adequate. Meal - so-so and the cabin staff were also, just adequate. Few smiles, little passenger interaction, seemed like they were not in the least bit interested.

At least that's what I came to believe when I was allocated a 'broken' window seat. I asked for assistance and got a 'no care' attitude. Could have offered to move me etc. but didn't. There are many ways to win a passenger. I wasn't offered one.

The aircraft was unnecessarily hot inside. I thought it was only me but came to realize that many passengers were very uncomfortable indeed.I began to wonder if the heated cabin was a tactic to get us acclimated for the soaring temperatures in Egypt.

Again - it's adequate. It stays up in the air. What more could one ask for. I have to travel to and from Egypt many times in the coming months so I simply have to bite the bullet and 'deal with it' on Egypt's DRY airline.

Title:
At the suggestion of our B&B host in Luxor, I booked our Aswan to Abu Simbel flights as soon as they became available. We went with the earliest flight from Aswan to make the most of our time at Abu Simbel, but still getting back to Aswan late morning (6:55am leaving Aswan, arriving Abu Simbel 7:40am, return flight leaving Abu Simbel 10:40am and arriving Aswan 11:25am). I then booked on a separate itinerary (because the flights were not available to purchase at the same time) a flight from Aswan to Cairo for the same afternoon, leaving Aswan at 2:30pm. This allowed us 3 hours between flights - plenty of time for domestic flights.

The week before flying, I was sent an email saying that the 6:55am flight had been cancelled and we had been moved to a later flight. This later flight had a knock on effect that basically meant we were arriving in Abu Simbel at the time we had previously been due to LEAVE, AND our time at the ancient site had been reduced to one hour. The later flight returning to Aswan meant that we were cutting it too fine to make our final flight of the day to Cairo, 45min between landing and take off, and with checked bags, the airline recommended we change our later flight, too.

The problem with changing our later flight was that it was full except for business class, and so with no choice, and refusal on their part to accept ANY responsibility and thus not provide ANY discount or assistance, we wore the cost. The change of flight also meant we were stuck at Aswan airport for 4 hours between the two flights. The whole thing was a complete stuff up.

Not only were we not impressed by this treatment, but the planes themselves were not cleaned properly between flights, and we boarded to rubbish on the floor and a general grubbiness throughout.

If given the choice, I would not fly with EgyptAir again.
qwuub: Flight changes left us out of pocket
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Trying to send my 14 year old daughter  over to my family who reside in Cairo has been one nightmare after another. We originally had a fare of £400.00 which has now in the space of a couple of weeks doubled and then some! If she travels as a minor they charge you an unaccompanied minor fare on top of the child fare, but she is 14, so suddenly no longer a allowed to be child, but an adult fare. Now we are up to £600. As she can’t travel as a minor, although paying an adult fare, I still have to pay for her to travel as a UM. Meaning we have to now pay yet another chunk of money on top of an adult fare. How is it possible to travel on an adult fare, yet have to charge a UM as well. How is that even possible. I’m fuming as this trip which originally had a budget of £600 has now ran into nearly £1000. The website is hopeless and the travel agent contradicted what we were originally told. So who the hell knows the regs???? Seems nobody does, but you are just expected to keep throwing money to cover costs at every level. I’m raging beyond belief. Avoid this airline of have very deep pocket!!!!!!
