Title: Online check-in opens 48 hrs before departure.  Be warned, at Heathrow you will be in for a good hike to get to the B gates which are not situated in the main terminal building.  Walking's the best form of exercise so see it as a positive.  The seats have power supply for UK 3 pin plugs & they have USB sockets also!As per most non-UK airlines you get a badly synced English voice-over for the flight safety video.  It was amusing to think that the young good looking lady in the video really has such a stern English voice.The plane is a Boeing 777 which doesn't have individual air conditioning nozzles for each passenger.  I found the cabin a bit warm to start with but it cooled to a comfortable temperature during flight.Leg room was 'normal' which for me translates to 'very uncomfortable' because I'm 6'3".  If I have a free seat next to me the journey is far more bearable as I can spread & stretch my legs out more.Staff were friendly and served a hot meal for all passengers.  Note, no wine or beer on the drinks selection.

Title:
First time with Egyptair, and reading reviews I went in with very low expectations. So experience was not as dismal as I thought but definitely not the business class you’d expect from an international flight.
Good parts: charging port in seat, and service is friendly.
Not so good parts: seats are in 2-3-2 arrangement so pick your seats to avoid getting stuck in middle row. First leg of my trip, the arm rest came unstuck in the seat next to mine. Wiped down arm rest with the warm towel and it was dirty. Seats are almost fully reclined but got stuck a few times and had to get staff to help straighten.
Headset is flimsy, few new movies available. Food arrives and hot meal portion comes quite later, placed open without any cover and pushed on a trolley. It’s edible.
On the way there, they had no amenity kits (they ran out of inventory 3 weeks ago). Return trip had a bag but oddly had only headphones, pen, etc
Not specific to Egyptair, but the Cairo business lounges at the airport are terrible (and I tried all of them). Wifi was hard to connect to and does not remain stable. Some lounges are smoking lounges and you can barely breathe in there (but those have the most stable wifi). Food in lounge is baked goods that are unappetizing and looks quite stale. Quite likely the most boring airport I’ve been stuck in. Had one duty-free guy near the F gates telling me credit cards system was down and asking for cash (and getting change back was like pulling teeth).
Would not pick this airline unless the price was really low (but know that you get what you pay for). And would definitely avoid Cairo airport or keep transit as short as possible.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Once you're on the plain everything is fine, but our trip with EgyptAir was far from perfect before then.
To start off with, we travelled form Luxor to Amsteram but needing a connecting flight in Cairo, the man behind the counter didn't want to label our luggage to Amsterdam directly so we needed to check those in again in Cairo. The bus that picked us up from the plane in Cairo to the arrival hall had wet seats, which was impossible to see until you sat down. When we picked-up our luggage we went to the 'connecting flight' location, unfortunately after 30 minutes waiting and passing by several airport employees we were told that we had taken the wrong queue, they also asked why our luggage was not labelled to Amsterdam directly. When we answered that they didn't want to do this we were told that we 'just had to ask for a manager there, as it's not the normal way of doing things'. Once we were at the right location, at the check-in desk in Cairo, we inquired if it was possible to buy an upgrade to business class, this was possible but only in US dollars, for some reason. We agreed and discussed that we had to change some money and go to the ATM, which was fine with him. After returning to the desk with all the agreed upon money the man behind the desk informed us that there were only two seats left (we were with three), as one was given away during our ATM visit. Of course we were not happy with this because we had already agreed that we would take the seats, plus we now actually lost money at the ATM (transaction fee) and the money change counter (changing EURO to USD).

Back in the Netherlands we filed a complaint but never heard back anything, I guess customer satisfaction is not important. I'd recommend to look for an alternative if possible.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Check in was not at all friendly even though we traveled business class. The staff at the counters are not courteous and least bothered about the comfort of the passengers. The trip started with an unpleasant experience when the flight was delayed from Mumbai and there was no announcement made by the airline. The passengers just crowded at the gate and were kept waiting without any information on the cause of the delay or the revised time. Next in store was the missing luggage at Luxor which arrived only after 12 hrs and we had to adjust our trip plan in Luxor to make an additional trip to the airport to collect the luggage (no, the airline didn't deliver the luggage at the hotel where we were staying). Things went worse in Aswan when we were not let to board the ASW-CAI flight as it was apparently overbooked! Imagine arriving at the airport 2 hrs ahead of the flight and not being able to board, and our trip plan went for a toss as the next day we were planned to start early from Cairo to visit the pyramids. And it turns out the only people who were left behind were us and another asian passenger - looked like a case of racial profiling (inspired by another Star Alliance member airline?). Finally we were put on an early morning flight the next day, which I had avoided in the first place while booking the tickets even though it was cheaper, as I didn't want the hassle of early morning travel with kids. Unfortunately, Egypt Air may be the only option for flying within Egypt (there may be other airlines, but very limited flight options), but wherever possible I recommend to avoid this airline.
crvsd: Somesh J wrote a review Jul 2018
qwuub: Unreliable on time, Missing baggage, Flights overbooked
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Our Egypt air experience was less than average. Check-in took forever and the staff kept blaming system issue for it. Once on the flight, service was nothing impressive. Pillows and blankets were only given when asked for, entertainment was dated, hardly any new movies or good TV shows. Seats and legroom were cramped.
The worst part was the food. We had ordered for asian vegetarian and all we got was boiled veggies. There was no snacks or other options available. We struggled on the 6 hour long flight.
Another unpleasant thing about flying egypt air was the change-over at Cairo airport. It was probably one of the most run-down airport I have ever seen. The food court was sad, loos were not clean and boarding was significantly delayed.

Title:
It was a milestone to fly back to Italy with Egyptair MS 705 on 25th January 2018 from Cairo to Malpensa .

After a business time of few days in Cairo and Ain Soukhna , the relaxing flight was capable to give me the energy spent in the many hours of car travel in Cairo and outside , and spent in very important meetings to recover the egyptian market . It was done . The plane was very clean ,
the chairs of the business class are very comfortable , more than european airways ,
the meal at a level more than the european airways ,
the media as music with wide choice , to an extent that I was involved with egyptian music , and movies were really exciting and accompanying me on the flight very softly .
But the main thanks I have to give to the very kind hostesses , for the accurate service on board , an expert lady very charming and two young lady very thoughtful , all with a stunning smile , unusual on the european flights .

I am convinced that many colleagues of them , belonging to other european airways , should learn from them how to treat a customer , as I was for them on the flight . And I was a normal customer for them , not a VIP , but I had a VIP treatment .
Thanks to them and to the crew , it will be for me a pleasure to take always Egyptair also for other destinations .

Title: We flew Egyptair to Jordan based on the recommendation of an acquaintance and because it was the most efficient way to get to Jordan from Toronto. Our decision to fly business class was worthwhile so that we could have an opportunity to rest comfortably on the long flight.  The leg room was excellent and the seat quite comfortable. The flights left on time.   The food quality was marginal for business class and the lounge in Cairo was comfortable enough but had the worst selection of food and beverages of any I have experienced.  My major issue was that our luggage was lost on the way to Jordan and that Egyptair was horrific to deal with.  Despite multiple calls and emails by us and our travel company and hotel staff no information was made available, calls were not returned ( despite promise to do so) leaving us frustrated and without any of our clothes.  We anticipated we would hear of our luggage arrival within a few days but ultimately got back to Canada 2 wk later without our luggage.  Ultimately it was declared lost and again after multiple emails and completed forms, I have just learned that the airline will compensate us for 1/5 of the value of the luggage and content and no additional compensation for the items we needed to buy for our 2 wk vacation( significantly less that agreed on at the "Montreal convention" re passengers rights) .  The frustration in dealing with the customer service and the lack of responsibility or follow through has been atrocious.  This experience will make it difficult for me to ever recommend this airline despite the initial positive experience.

Title:
We had our flights dramatically changed about a week or so before leaving London. This was very costly for us as:
1. We needed to pay for an additional nights accommodation
2. We needed to take additional not paid time off of work
3. I had to spend days worth of effort on the phone with the airline and hotel and tour guides etc to ensure our itinerary and everything was re-organised.

Egyptair has very poor customer service and was not helpful before or during travel. They were rude on the phone and after waiting for 30 minutes to get through the first time someone didn’t realise I was patched through and took a personal call I could hear so I had to hang up and wait in the queue for another 30 minutes only to get talked to in a rude manner. When getting our boarding passes we also had sub par customer service. We would’ve hoped they would have offered to pay for our accommodation but they said not a chance. At the airport we thought as a gesture since the flight wasn’t full that they may be willing to bump us up to business class (as almost all the seats were empty). And they just said no they gave us more than 24 hours notice so we could’ve cancelled the trip so too bad so sad basically. I find this really disappointing as we were being very fair and reasonable and it is unreasonable to expect us to cancel a trip a week out when other flights and tours are already booked. That would leave us incurring even more financial loss. In the end it was made clear that they’re not willing to do anything but the bear minimum despite any financial loss we incurred because of their schedule changes.

Title:
We travel a lot and not always to the most touristic locations, however this time it was Cairo, our home for the coming years.

We chose Egyptair because it was a direct flight, something that is quite handy if you travel with two young kids. It started fine, the flight attendants seemed friendly and helpful, however that changed later in the flight. My son got ill and of course that little bag was not where it should be... and no one to be found. Luckily one of the three had a bag, so he could puke without making a mess. When a flight attendant finally did show up she refused to take the bag (and seemed moody, perhaps she had been sleeping?!) and almost threw the new bag at me instead of giving it normally.

Also some issues with the earplugs, but other than that no real complaints.

Other airliners like Emirates, KLM and even Air Maroc have something for kids, to keep them distracted and simply as a small gift, however that was not the case... not a serious issue, but just a small thing that makes you feel that little bit extra as a customer.

No flight info was given during our flight, also non for those with connecting flights, again nothing serious, but just that little bit extra service.....

We will fly again, but simply because this is the easiest and cheapest option.

Not the worst flight I have had, but also very far from the best flight. Still they get you from A to B safely and without any delay.
qwuub: Had better service, but seen worse too
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We had booked to fly from Cairo to Luxor on Monday 30th April when a dust storm enveloped lower Egypt.  Our flight was the first delayed and we waited in the airport from 1500 hours until 0400 the next day - 13 hours.  During which time the only communication we received was a notice saying that more information would be given at 0100 hours.  It wasn't.  Mohammed El Hady of Egyptair told us that all flights would resume in the order they were delayed.  They weren't.  Flights resumed at 0200 hours and it was another two hours before we noticed people starting to move to the flight gate.  Lo and behold, it was our turn to go !  We could well have been left in the airport.                                                               To cap things off, another flight from Cairo to Milan was re-scheduled with no notification until 2 days prior to the flight leaving, in spite of us having an earlier connecting flight from Aswan which meant we would have missed the Milan flight.  This in spite of us being a member of their frquent flier program.We came across the re-scheduling by accident.As Aswan airport is so far out of town, I would counsel anyone flying from Aswan to Cairo to take the overnight train.  It will be far more reliable.
crvsd: Grahame F wrote a review May 2018
qwuub: NO COMMUNICATION - ROTTEN SERVICE - TAKE THE TRAIN
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew in economy class on the one hour and 25-minute flight from Aswan to Cairo. The aircraft, a Boeing 737, was clean, somewhat dated but appeared well-kept, and my window seat was comfortable and provided good legroom. Check-in and boarding both went smoothly and without any significant delay. I enjoyed the beverage and snack service.

The cabin crew members were friendly, polite, and helpful. Also, the members I spoke with, could speak very good English.

I selected EgyptAir based on it being a Star Alliance partner, and thus my gold status gives me advance boarding. I also considered price, its reputation, and that it is Egypt’s major airline.

I like its logo design. Very suitable for an Egyptian airline.

Based on my overall flight experience rating on this short flight, I would give EgyptAir a rating of 7.5 out of 10.

Title:
For me, Egyptair was just another airline, a means for getting from Point A to Point B. The inflight service was OK. The entertainment was not spectacular, but I was able to find a couple of movies I liked.

What really got me, and what will bring me back to Egyptair in the future, is how I was treated during my layover. I deliberately scheduled a very long layover in Cairo, so that I could go see the Pyramids. I figured, my suitcase is checked; all I need is my backpack with a few things. What I didn't count on is that, if you are laying over in Cairo for more than a few hours (I don't know what the cutoff is), Egyptair gets you a room in a 5-star hotel for the duration!!

That's right: I was able to go through passport control, check into a very nice hotel room where I left my stuff, go to the pyramids, and still come back in time for a nap and a shower in a first-class hotel. Breakfast and lunch buffet were included. Spectacular service.

Title: I went from Athens to Bangkok and back to Athens again n April this year. While on the way there we were flying on newer and modern machines, on the way back it felt like flying 20 years ago with a staff that was initially overwhelmed and actually not able to manage to fit in the hand luggage above the seats. Ground staff and finally manager themselves had to be called. Our seats (three of them) could not be placed backwards in "sleeping mode". The same happened to other people.  Some seats could not be moved upright, while this is required during takeoff and landing. Staff we're responding in an embarrassed way and acting as as if they were fully aware of the conditions but to ashamed to admit it and basically not doing anything about it at all. No individual entertainment screens on the front seats (even if in the booking it clearly stated otherwise). We filled in a complaint-form in Kairo but never have been contacted (which I was expecting already). Food was....well, you better wait until Kairo. There is a better place for food there.
qwuub: Convenient times if going to the east but nothing more

Title:
Travelled out to Cairo with Lufthansa. 4 hour flight from Frankfurt. Old Airbus, no entertainment, Once we had been served our drink and meal the Stewards disappered for the rest of the flight. At the gate my backpack, cabin friendly, was taken of me and put in the hold as the flight was full. This was for no reason as there was pleny of locker space with people still taking 2- 3 items of baggage on board.
Contrast this with Egyptair for the return to Munich, a brand new Airbus, superb entertainment system in multiple languages with loads of choice. Stewards constantly walking around offering drinks, good inflight foot, more legroom and comfier seats.
Next time i will be booking Egyptair from Heathrow direct.

Title:
This is what I sent to Egyptair in summary of my experience: I had the worst experience in my 30 years of flying with Egypt Air this past week. Just some of my issues flying business class: your Fast Track is slower than the other people going through passport control for economy class, so please advise the advantage of having FastTrack, on both entering Egypt and leaving Egypt. Your food (breakfast) was 3 dried pieces of meat curling on the edges (disgusting) and some dried cheese and fruit (no hot meal on business class?) I have never experienced this is 30 years of flying.

I was told when booking in, that they had to change planes so there was no longer full lying down seats - now I guess these things happen however I was told they would refund me $50, are they serious, is this what they think this downgrade is worth, $50, the difference between economy and business, shocking. Plus I have to, when I arrive home, go into their offices to get the refund. It will cost me more to waste my time to fetch this refund so how does this make any sense whatsoever? The online entertainment sẏstem was the worst I have ever seen, firstly the system is archaic, secondly, the flight info was not available on screen "error", one couldn't see what movie you were about to watch, all it said was video, so you had to start each video in order to see the movie before deciding, incredible for business class let alone economy class.

The poor hostess was so sweet and trying her best but this was a disaster.

I can't wait to see how they respond to this review because I have emailed them now 3 times to find out what they are going to do about this and they have responded as per below keep asking me who I am and what seat I sat on, they should be able to see this on their records and I assume they will do nothing about this.

"Dear our valued customer
First we would like to offer our apology for the inconvenience happened, Kindly send your ticket number, seat number and the kind of meal that was served to you in order to investigate this matter.
Thanks For cooperation."
They don't even know my name after I emailed them all my flight details and name and contact details and then again they email me

"Dear Our Valued customer,
We have inquiry concerning your case Number: FM201812713174
kindly send your ticket number " and still no resolve and still waiting.

To call someone a valued customer you should mean it.

To top it all, their business class lounges at Cairo airport would rank the worst I have been in. Food too was terrible and seating minimal, old and dated. Someone at Egyptair needs to take a flight to the middle east with Qatar Airways or other and visit Qatar or Bahrain airports and see what true service is.

As I stated the worst trip in 30 years of flying, so until they do something about their shocking service I highly recommend no matter how good the rate they offer, do not fly Egyptair.
crvsd: Leon L wrote a review May 2018
qwuub: The worst flight of my 30 year flying experience....such a let down grrrr

Title:
So obviously I was worried having a flight from Bangkok to London Heathrow with a stopover in Cairo after reading all of the bad reviews however it was that I got on this flight as I had missed my previous return a few weeks before with a different airline or I had to pay an extra £200-£300 to flight with a different airline. So of course.. I risked it.
However I really don’t know what everyone is complaining about. I agree it’s not the best airline, but definitely not the worst.
Flight from Bangkok to Cairo:
Downfall to this flight was that there was only One tv for everyone at the front of the seating sections, and only one film played. However it was a 9hour flight at 1am in the morning so I just slept most the way and read a little of my book. I would recommend taking yourself some entertainment or a book. Headphones were provided in the seat in front of you did want to watch the 1 film being played.
Dinner was not the best but you know airplane food. Choice of Fish or Chicken (I had chicken) & rice, bread roll, salad, desert and chocolate bar. Soft drink and tea. Tea brought round a bit too quickly after but maybe this is them trying to make up for bad reviews as people had written about waiting ages for drinks.
Metal cutlery with my dinner was a bonus!
Breakfast however I really enjoyed, possibly the best breakfast I had on a flight. An omelette, sausage, tomatoes & little potatoes. 2 bread rolls with butter, cream cheese & jam. Fruit bowl. Orange juice. Had to quickly ask for a glass of water before they ran away with the trolley but then she happily gave me one. Tea/coffee came straight after again.
One good thing about this flight experience, maybe because of all the bad reviews the flight wasn’t very full so everyone had a lot of space and extra pillows and blankets as there was one of each on every seat. We had 3 seats between two, some people were lying down with 3/4 seats to themselves.
Each seat had its own individual really good legroom.
Flight from Cairo to London Heathrow:
This flight had individual TVs was great for me as I was wide awake on this flight having slept most of my previous flight and in Thai time it was 2pm for me and my body clock so I needed some entertainment. Although I had my book 5 hours 25minutes of reading is a little bit too much for me. The leg space on this flight was slightly smaller than the last flight but average for a flight I would say. Plus I had three seats all to myself. I actually took time to read the Egypt air in-flight magazine before we took off and now have to make some plans to come back and visit and travel lots of Egypt that was unknown to me. About an hour into the flight we were offered a drink I got orange juice and a water. We were then Given a small cake. whilst others were sleeping I was watching a film one of the flight attendants came by personally to make sure I was okay and to check if I needed anything which I thought was nice service. Before we landed for lunch there was an option of beef or chicken (I had beef) & rice with salad bread roll and cake. I really enjoyed my lunch! Really tasty.. I also had water and apple juice. The air hostess that served me lunch was very nice.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Flew EgyptAir from Mumbai to Cairo and back. Both times there was limited blankets and pillows and I didn't get any both times. On the flight back when someone complained over the shortage of blankets, the staff increased the heat on the plane. Worked fine for me but some elderly folks did feel suffocated and sick. It was a lame idea .. instead just have blankets and pillows for all, at-least match the number of seats on your plane!! The in-flight entertainment was as good as not having any. Not sure if it was the plane model or what but both times I got the common TV screen and had to watch whatever was playing on it. They did not have the TV on the back of each seat thing and funnily the headphones I got (only during the return journey, the onward didn't even give that) had pins that did not match the socket on the handle .. I mean ... seriously ?! Not sure if all were like that or just mine as I didn't bother to check.Food was also strictly okay.If you are looking for an economic option and don't mind the things i mentioned then you can go for it. I would not mind flying again - its a good option for a direct flight to Cairo from Mumbai.
crvsd: Shagufta N wrote a review Apr 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Title:
I was flying on April 08 from New York. There was a mechanical problem in the flight and the airline had to cancel the whole trip. There is nothing they could do in regard of mechanical problems. I am a star alliance gold member. The clerk came to the lounge to inform the passengers about the Cancellation after 4 hours. The flight normally departs at 6.30 pm the clerk informed us at 10.30 pm. Egypt air employee was unaware of all details. Whenever I asked him a question, the answer was: " I donno!!! I am not an engineer to give details"!!! Luckily the airline provided us a stay at crown Plaza JFK with dinner and breakfast. The next day On April 09th I was informed at 11 AM that I have to check out in 5 minutes as we will be going to the airport to depart to Cairo. Too bad!! At least give me half an hour to get myself ready. However I was exhausted enough and wanted to go back to Cairo. The company provided a bus to go to the baggage claim in JFK to take the baggage and recheck-in on Egypt air counters. I paid 6$ for the cart to move the luggage from one floor to another. At the check-in Egypt Air provided a 10$ lunch voucher!!!! I paid 6$ for the Cart at the airport and the airline is providing me a 10$ lunch voucher!!!!!!! I have been in the airport since 1 pm and the flight was at 6.35 pm. Seriously? ??? I was admitted to the airport 5 hours and a half prior to my departure with a 10$ voucher !!!! Come on Egypt air you can do better, and please give your employees a training on how to deal with customers!!!

The good thing about the airline is that it provides 2 bags 23 kilos each for each passenger on this flight. It's a direct flight from Cairo so it's the shortest route. As for the service in such emergencies the airline needs to provide more comfort for passengers.
crvsd: Mona Elwy A wrote a review Apr 2018

Title:
I took a number of flights with Egyptair in the span of a month with mixed experiences.

My flights took me from Amman to Cairo, Cairo to Aswan, Luxor to Cairo, Cairo to Munich.

The planes varied from really old and wearing out to brand new.
The older planes had no entertainment, old worn out seats, and great flight attendants. The newer planes had seatback TVs, newer (but firm) seats, and grouchy flight attendants.

On the whole, I decided that it wasn't the plane that made my decided how I felt about the flight, it was the attitude of the flight attendants. If they were nice and kind, I enjoyed myself more.

On the whole my personal experience of Egyptair was average. Nothing stood out as particularly good or bad with the exception of one very rude flight attendant on our Cairo - Aswan flight.
crvsd: Where Is The World wrote a review Apr 2018
qwuub: Handful of flights with different experiences...

Title: No complaints. Boarding was easy and our flight was on-time. The seats were reasonably comfortable and there is more leg room than most planes in the U.S. the staff was not overly warm but pleasant enough. Like most airlines, the food isn't the greatest in the world but decent enough. It was better than most meals on airlines in the USA. They give you real silverware. You do not get to choose when to open or close your window shade. They dictate that. Entertainment was limited. There is a handful of movies but nothing wonderful- enough to pass the time. The landing and deplane went smooth. Overall, no complaints. It was the only non-stop flight from NY to Cairo so it was best option to get to Egypt. I thought it was a good value too. I booked well in advance and the round trip ticket was little more than 700.00 USD.

Title:
Absolutely horrendous airline. The plane itself was dirty, the seats falling apart at the seams and the tray tables were dislodged and wonky. It felt like a plane from the early 1990s and certainly wasn't what I was expected. There was no in-flight entertainment, magazine, anything offered. The seats did not even have jacks for headphones. Granted, I wasn't expecting a world-class service, but I did hope that the plane would be clean and that the chairs would be in one piece.

Service was essentially non-existent. It was almost a five hour flight, overnight, so I had hoped for a blanket, maybe a pillow to sleep. The steward/esses could offer none of that. There was no food, only available to purchase, and no drinks. It took about three hours for us to be offered a small plastic cup of water. That was all we had had to drink for hours, since arriving to the airport. After all, bottles of water are confiscated at security. We could have bought a bottle at the airport for 7 Euros 50, absolutely overpriced! Flying from a hot country, you'd have hoped that the passengers would be offered something to drink at the start and towards the end of the flight, and not ignored for hours with no service.

The only good thing, and I have to mention it is that we arrived ahead of schedule. Well done to the pilot for that. Otherwise, an absolutely awful experience.
qwuub: Beyond awful - lack of service, dirty plane, no entertainment
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Had the opportunity to go for umrah using Egypt air . It was the second time since 1997 I used the airline and thought highly of it until I actually boarded . On all legs of my flight both going and returning home I was highly disappointed with the lack of attention,friendliness and consideration from the air hostess staff. They are rude ,slow in responding if asked for anything and almost make it seem like you are doing them a favour by flying this airline. On my return leg from cairo to Johannesburg I had come down with a terrible fever and was getting chills.I requested an extra blanket and told the air hostess serving my side that I was not feeling well.she yelled at me as if I was a small child and said that they do not give any extra blankets out . I left it at that .Then as I was sleeping again due to feeling ill I was harshly woken up by the same air hostess to take my food. I mean really?! I have travelled on many airlines and not once in my entire life have I been so abruptly treated by staff on a flight . My entire family of 7 all were disappointed with their service as well. As a member of the Egypt air plus I doubt I will fly with them again. I would prefer paying more to go with airlines like Emirates etihad or qatar whom I have had exceptional service from

Title: My family of 6 took the flight from JFK to Cairo.  The plane sits 3-3-3 in economy.  We took up 2 rows.  For an adult, a teenager, and a tween, it was fairly uncomfortable.  The way back we checked the flight the night before and changed our seats to the very back of the plane to 3 row, 2 in each.  That helped quite a bit.The staff was fairly friendly.  Water is scarce.  If you ask for some, you only get a glass.  It was a real problem on the Cairo-JFK flight because you go through security at the gate and aren't allowed to take any liquid onto the plane.  I was very dry the entire flight.  The food wasn't too bad, depending upon your tastes.  My group of 6 had mixed reviews, half loving it and half-not so much.  It was standard airline food, with a middle eastern bend.  They always offer tea and coffee after each meal.  The entertainment was pretty standard, but not a large selection in English.  Plenty of action flicks, but don't expect anything sensual.  Overall it was a fairly standard, overseas flight.  Nothing special, but definitely tolerable.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
No frills, uneventul, decent price, good airplane. Traveled on a 737-800 from DMM to CAI T3 with Egypt Air.

Typical for DMM, it was a chaotic boarding but this is not only an attribute of Egypt Air but this airport. Luggage checked all the way to Hurghada so no issues with re-checking it at CAI.

About 3 hour flight, albeit at 4 AM departure, was comfortable, kids had their own meals which were pre-ordered and seatbacks hat screens (note: no seatback screens on the way back). Flight attendants very polite and with smiles on their faces despite the odd departure time.

The flight arrived on time and parked at a remote stand. Note that taxiing at CAI may take between 15 and 20 minutes and then another 15 minutes for a bus ride to the terminal. Had a 70 minute layover going from International to Domestic flight (both Egypt Air) and made it but had to walk fast.
qwuub: No frills, on time and without any issues
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: First the positive- flight was on time and there were no aircraft problems.  Luggage made it too. However—Flew home business class and not at all impressed. We chose this flight because it was non stop and left at a semi-reasonable 10 am.  Seats and business accommodations were fine but service and food was not up to industry standards.  Even the movie selections were tired.Flight attendants were indifferent at best. Hard to get service- even a coffee refill.  Any time I asked for anything- like water or another roll it took forever and they made me feel I had inconvenienced them.  (No wine etc even though it was international- not a plus)The food really was not good- mystery meats, mushy vegetables and only a “snack” service on a long flight.  FYI. after I got home my gut would recommend not eating the salad again.  We had been fine eating carefully on the trip.  I really thought an international Star Alliance flight would not be a problem....Just had the sense they didn’t care much about their passengers.  Really glad we weren’t in the back of the plane. Next time I’ll fly through Germany and enjoy the trip- even with a layover.

Title: I flew round trip from Toronto to Lagos, stopping in Cairo in December 2017, and returning in January 2018.  The flight to Lagos was not very memorable, though we were over 45 minutes leaving Toronto.  We seemed to make up for it along the way and got in to Cairo with time to spare to make the connecting flight.  I did find the food to be bland and the on-board entertainment to be less than entertaining with limited options for English speakers.  But it was an average fight all the same.The flight out of Lagos however left me with a sour taste in my mouth and I would try to avoid flying with this airline again as a result. Our flight was over an hour late leaving Lagos as the flight coming into Lagos was late.  We weren't informed of the circumstances and were left sitting, waiting and guessing.  As there was a substantial wait at Cairo for the connecting flight, the late departure was not a concern, except the lack of information.  But when we arrived at Cairo, we found ourselves having to go through EgyptAir's customer service area wher we all stood around feeling lost.  It wasn't until we got to the counter (after a 30 minute wait in line) that we were informed that our flight was delayed by 4 hours.  I was lucky in that I was able to get a visa to enter Egypt (my own cost) and was put up in a hotel for a few hours, though not long enough to get any real sleep.  As a result I was 2 hours late getting in to Toronto and missed the bus I had booked to get home to my city.  While we were put up in a hotel and provided with meals, there was no other compensation for the inconvenience of missing buses, etc.  Again on the flight I found the food to be tasteless, the entertainment to be poor (exact same shows I had already watched on my inbound flight) and the service crew seeming to just go through the motions with no real interest in their jobs.
crvsd: Nicole T wrote a review Apr 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Since several years I fly to BKK by Egyptair. Flight BRU-CAI is on a Boeing 737-800. Seat comfort (business class) is basic. Food and service have been improved since previous travel, specially the staff pay much more attention to the passengers.
The flight CAI-BKK was in an airbus 300-200. Such a plane should not be dedicated for long haul flights as the seat are only declinable and not flat. Service, food, attention of the staff was good but seat comfort was below expectation.
Return flight was on B777-300 having almost a flat bed. Service, food and comfort were very good.
Overall the entertainment programs have been improved in comparison to the past, and it is still a pity that no alcohol drinks are being served (keeping in mind that we past the Egyptian borders and such not longer are flying within the country). Difficult to understand that other Arabian airlines are serving alcoholic drinks even Malaysian airlines but here we have to wait until the plane is in the air. Why is that not possible for Egyptair?
Overall price/quality is satisfactory

Title:
This is certainly gonna be one of the most difficult reviews I have to make. Despite my low rating of the flight, there's actually a lot of parameters affecting it and not all were so unpleasant. First of all I should mention that the staff and cabin crew was trying their utmost to make it a real pleasant flight, so kudos for that.
The good advantage that Egyptair has in Heathrow airport is the access to Air Canada's Maple Lounge, which was to the expected standard.
I can literally stop at this point to mention any other advantages, but I have to explain my experience details. I was warned of the level of service on the business class of Egyptair by many, but I chose to try it anyway due to the following reasons:
1- Egyptair is a Star Alliance member
2- Egyptair is a well established airlines that goes back to 1933
3- Egyptair is the flag carrier airline of Egypt
4- Their fleet flies to around 70 destinations worldwide
HOWEVER, despite the astonishing history of Egyptair, it is utterly failing to meet any luxurious standards.
The business class seemed a lot similar to other competitors economy class service. The seats where not comfy and it made me wonder what the economy class passengers were suffering then. The cabin crew were "very friendly" and lovely, yet that was the problem. Apparently they were not professionally trained to understand the difference between being professionally friendly and friend friendly. The flight attendant kept making inappropriate jokes and talking in a very unprofessional way that made me so uncomfortable most of the time. The food was not nearly as expected, even though it is catered by Do & Co. The no alcohol on board was a bit annoying, but I can let that slide as I understand it's based on a religious basis. To top that all, arriving at the Cairo airport felt no difference than being in economy class, we waited in line for more than 30 mins which made me wonder if they realize what fast track means or that for some of us time actually is important and matters.
I have to mention though that I salute the crew for doing their best, but it's not their fault as obviously they were not given the appropriate essential trainings to do so. I hope that Egyptair wakes up soon and realizes that newly established airliners such as Qatar Airways is far beyond their tiers.
Good luck
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: EgyptAir provides a third-party option for a less-expensive upgrade to Business class on their flights via Optiontown.  Although I used this service with no repercussions on my outbound flight (JFK-CAI), I had no intention of making use of Optiontown on my return flight home.  Now here is the bad part: Egyptair's staff in its regional offices within Egypt is so incompetent that they are unaware of the nature of the Optiontown upgrade, and far from being adept at dealing with the intricacies, they are completely unsuccesful at handling them.  All I wanted to do was to change my return flight (purchased in Economy) to a later day in order to attend a wedding.  Egyptair regional offices told me and my colleague who is an experienced Egyptian travel operator that there "was nothing they could do for me" because my reservation was "blocked" by Optiontown.  Upon contacting Optiontown (which is not easy!), I finally discovered that Egyptair staff was incorrect.  However, Optiontown is not willing to make ANY contact with Egyptair on a traveler's behalf.  Finally I decided to have my colleague try at another office in another city in Egypt, and was able to make a change in my flight itinerary for a fee.  However, the amount of time and frustration wasted was not worth the tiny savings in the cost of the outbound upgrade in class.  I will use Egyptair again only because I have to, but I will not use Optiontown for anything further, as the Egyptian staff are too poorly trained to understand what it is and what the limits are - they run scared and wave a memo from their superiors telling them that a passenger who has any relationship with Optiontown cannot be helped by them (not true in this case- I was not seeking an upgrade in class, just a change in day of  travel).
qwuub: Think twice before using Optiontown for EgyptAir upgrades!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We flew EGYPTAIR for a recent vacation to Egypt. We had 6 flights with EGYPTAIR in total, and the issues started before our vacation.

One of our flights was canceled, causing us issues, and leaving no good flight times to get home on the day we'd originally planned. We were rebooked, but the new flights put us getting home around 3 a.m. on a workday. We had to cut our vacation one day short to make it work for us. Luckily, EGYPTAIR was helpful in getting this rescheduled for us. We also had a scheduled flight delay that put us behind schedule.

Of our flights that were at the originally scheduled time, only one of them managed to take off without a delay.

On one flight, we were waiting in the gate for a long time, obviously delayed because of the time but we were given no announcement, then asked to follow an employee to a totally different gate. You go through security at the gate and there is nothing, not even a vending machine, there. So we went through security twice that time.

No priority boarding was offered with children. We had a lap infant and were never offered a safety belt for him, as has been done on every other airline we have flown with him on (Lufthansa, KLM, Turkish, Olympic Air, Bangkok Airways, Gulf Air). I buckled him up with me and was told to unbuckle and just hold him.

We flew economy but there appeared to be no benefit to business class besides priority boarding (seating looked exactly the same).

On almost every flight, we smelled someone smoking in the cabin (maybe this is the benefit of business class??).

The food was among the worst airplane food I've had.

In-flight entertainment was an Egyptian movie in Arabic (English subtitles).

The plane definitely wasn't as nice as other airlines we've flown. The domestic planes were much better than the one we had for our international flight (though we always seem to get not as nice aircrafts coming out of DMM).

Almost every flight required you to board a bus to board/exit.

Customer service was mixed. Some of the advance customer service we received was really good, but we also had some rude employees during our travel.

One good thing I can say is, it was cheap. Definitely, the cheapest option to fly to/from Egypt. If you have the ability to avoid, though, I would.
crvsd: Jennifer H wrote a review Mar 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This was our first time flying EgyptAir and we were very pleasantly surprised.

It was only an hour and a half flight, however we got a meal and drinks served, which was quite unexpected. And I am not talking about a packaged croissant or some pretzels - see picture. The meal was an actual meal - plentiful and delicious.

All of EgyptAir's staff that we encountered was pleasant and friendly - from the ground staff, to the air stewards and stewardesses. Service was fast and efficient and accompanied by a smile.

The seats were comfy and not tiny, as one would expect on such a short flight. There were also a pillow and a blanket on each flight - some of the airlines nowadays charge extra for that, so although we did not use them, we appreciated that they were available free of charge.

We looked forward to our next flight (Cairo-Rome) with EgyptAir which was booked for March 8. Expedia changed our itinerary and because of their employees' incompetence we were stranded at Cairo airport . The Expedia agent tried to pass the responsibility onto EgyptAir and made me run between terminals to talk to a live person at EgyptAir's desk.

We dealt with Ibrahim, who was professional and knowledgeable and really wanted to help us. His colleague and supervisor came over and tried to see how they can get us on another flight. Since Expedia booked the itinerary (and issued e-tickets belonging to EgyptAir on an AirItalia flight...), Ibrahim and his supervisor were not able to amend our booking, so we ended up stranded for over 24 hours. However, they demonstrated that they genuinely cared about us and the predicament Expedia put us in, more than Expedia did. And that meant a lot to us.

On March 9, we made flight 795 to Rome on EgyptAir and were once again impressed by the service, food and efficiency of our flight experience from start to finish.

Would definitely fly with them again and strongly recommend them!
crvsd: Jessica D wrote a review Mar 2018
qwuub: Comfy seats, great customer service, hearty meals

Title: We flew from Heathrow to Cairo with Egyptair at the end of February 2018 and then from Hurghada to Cairo and then back to London with the same carrier at the beginning of March.Here are some thoughts.Baggage check-in was very efficient, as was embarking and dis-embarking on and off the plane.The London to Cairo was in a Boing 777 and the return from Cairo was a smaller 737.  Both planes seemed relatively new and the seating areas were clean.  The cabin staff were all helpful and friendly.The on-board entertainment was a little limited, with a somewhat narrow choice of films and television programmes.Also disappointing was the quality of the in-flight catering.  Having flown economy with a number of other carriers, I know that the bar isn’t set that high when it comes to food and drink.   However,  Egyptair do not serve alcoholic drinks at all, so in that sense there was not even a bar.  Other Islamic country based carriers, such as Emirates and Qatar do serve wine and spirits, so this was something of an unwelcome surprise.  In addition, soft drinks such as Coca Cola were served out of large bottles, rather than individual small cans and the fruit juices were heavily sweetened.  The main meal served was rather bland, with a nondescript starter and an over-sweetened pudding.All this sounds rather critical of Egyptair.  However at the end of the day, most people want to get from A to B as cheaply and safely as possible and arrive on time.  Egyptair fulfilled all these criteria. To have used a rival carrier would have cost the best part of an extra £50 per leg.  Personally I am happy to forgo an alcoholic drink and put up with a so-so meal, if it saves me a hundred pounds.  You pays your money and you takes your choice.
crvsd: Malcolm H wrote a review Mar 2018

Title:
This is the first time that I flew by this airline.
The check in took a lot of time as the airline had put a number
of apprentices to man the counters. But the staff were very good
and helpful. They will improve with experience.
The plane was old but good. It was rather sad to see that
inspite of operating on an overnight international sector , this
airline did not have sufficient pillows and blankets for all passengers.
A number of passengers went on complaining but to no avail.
Similarly for the food there was a lot of confusion about the Hindu Meal passengers being served non vegetarian dish. I think this was not the airline's
fault. The passengers need to clarify while booking whether they prefer Hindu
Meal vegetarian or non vegetarian. The food was ok.
The number of toilets for the economy class was too insufficient.
The idea of showing a common movie for all is quite outdated now.

We subsequently travelled by this airline from
Cairo to Abu Simbel,
Abu Simbel to Aswan
Luxor to Cairo
Cairo to Mumbai.

We faced problems in almost all the sectors in the
check in process. It was taking a lot of time.
As you enter , you are required to pass your baggage through security.
Again within a few minutes and in most cases after just a few paces , we
had to pass the baggage through another security check.
This process needs to be stream lined.
crvsd: kc j wrote a review Mar 2018
qwuub: An airline that needs to improve

Title:
Our group to 11 traveled from Cairo to Aswan by Egypt Air in March 2018.

Our group arrived about 2 hours prior to the departure. The Business Class check in was open and the service was efficient and friendly. The check in was quick. Security Check was a hassle but once we crossed to the other side, we found the lounge to be small but stocked with water, croissants, fruits, espresso and a TV. The space is cramped but service was nice. The airplane was large and seats most comfortable. Again, the service by the hostesses in the air was just right. Recommend the airline for its good service. Bags came through fast and we were out of the small airport in Aswan quickly.

Title:
Flying domestic from cairo -luxor and back went fine.

The pilot from Jfk crashed the plane by clipping wings with a Virgin atlantic plane prior to take off.Very foolish to have tried to pass the other plane.

The pilot made an announcement stating that it was very busy and we would have to wait.All kinds of security and clean up people arrived .The pilot then announced that there was a problem with the wing and we would be returning to the gate.

The airline put us up in a hotel with 3 meals,yet never admitted to the crash or apologized.The next day luggage was all over the ticket area.Our seats were given to others,so we got middle seats.One seat was broken.Ticket agents were uninformed and did not want to give me my connection seat from Cairo -Luxor.

The airline next lost our luggage after leaving and arriving 2 hours late.I had to spend over 3 hours combined on 2 visits at the airport dealing with Egypt air.I received 200le compensation.

On the return flight i got another broken seat.Received an intrusic frisk from airline security.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I am going to do my best to be fair - our first flight from Cairo to Luxor was very good; on time, decent service even if the 'business class' lounge is nowhere near of any such class. But overall, the experience was good.

Now, our next flight was from Abu Simbel to Cairo and we were supposed to be in Cairo by 4 pm...in time for a sunset, camel ride at the pyramids or so we naively thought. On arriving at the ABS airport, we were met by an EgyptAir staff member who told us our 2 pm flight was delayed and will definitely , DEFINITELY, take off by 3 pm. He took our tickets (not sure why) and arranged for a car to take us to the Seti hotel. So far, sure these things happen and we found the Seti hotel quite nice although we were given just one drink and a pretty awful lunch.

Just after lunch, there was a flurry of activity and we saw many people grabbing their bags and heading to the airport. On asking an Egyptair staff member, we were told that they will go first and that we 'have been put on a later flight'. Utterly confounded as to why we would be bumped off the flight, we asked to be taken to the airport where we were told by the Station Manager that there was no space for us on the flight. BUT the plane sitting on the tarmac was being repaired and DEFINITELY will take off by 4 pm. DEFINITELY.

This went on to 5 pm, 6 pm. Then told that we should have stayed at the hotel or gone to see the temple like other passengers. At no point did they explain that SEVERAL flights were delayed and that the flight which took off was not ours. That we were not being bumped off and that OUR flight was the one on the tarmac being repaired. The station manager clearly did not grasp how anyone, let alone a woman could question his information and got quite aggressive. We had to call our tour company (who had nothing to do with the airline) and only after they spoke to the airline were we given some decent information.

When asked, they just shrug saying all airlines do this...all airlines have delays. So what.

We understand there are delays, but staff need to communicate sensibly. If there are several flights delayed, they need to have flight numbers displayed at the hotel to tell people which flight is leaving. You don't tell people, you have been put on later flight!

It was a nightmare...stuck in a smoky airport lounge with no fresh air for more than 6 hours. With random reasons being given...some were told delay was due to fog in Cairo! Also, if there are no smoking signals put up, then the senior staff sitting in their rooms and puffing away should just remove these signs. Or go smoke in your homes...don't make your passengers sick.

To finish, if you have an international flight from Cairo/Luxor...make sure you are back in that city a day early. DO NOT depend on EgyptAir to get you there on time and definitely not without your heart/lungs significantly weakened.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Both flights went smoothly and arrived and departed more or less on time.  On board services were fine, meal was quite tasty but it was worth ordering a special meal ie vegetarian as it arrived 30 minutes before everyone else's.  Security was excellent with bags being search several times before as adding the plane.  In flight entertainment was OK if you were sitting in the right seat but unfortunately they were flip down screens from above rather than back of seat screens so I would advise you download some films onto your tablets and watch those instead.  Blankets were provided and regular drinks. Both flights were packed as they were direct flights in/out Luxor and mainly filled with cruise travellers aged 65+.  Return flight was approx £340 so excellent value.  Duty Free and shops at Luxor were pretty basic so don't depend on them. Toilets at Luxor were very clean, likewise on board.  Plane's ceiling shook a little on landing but nothing to be unduly concerned about!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: This was our first time we were traveling by EGYPT AIR. We chose this airline as it was our first trip to EGYPT and the air fare we got on the EGYPT AIR website was very reasonable. We had a round trip ticket from NY to Cairo and Medina, Saudi Arabia to NY, with an interim flight from Cairo to Jeddah, also by EGYPT AIR.   The service in general was very poor, with very rude, arrogant and often lazy air stewards who were more in a rush to serve the food and vanish for hours together rather than answer any other needs of the passengers. When we asked if we could get any PEPSI with the food, the steward rudely told us that the only drink he could offer was 7UP, which was fine but the tone of his speech was very disrespectful.    In a span of 3 weeks , we used EGYPT AIR 4 times, and we were very disappointed with the service right from the check-in till the arrival at our destination.  The icing on the cake was when we arrived from Medina to Cairo, enroute to our flight to NY. We had a 10 hour lay over in Cairo and the Customer service at Cairo airport was treating the TRANSIT passengers with total lack of courtesy . They we laughing and joking among themselves. When we asked any questions, they were very rude. When we asked for  hotel accommodation for our overnight stay, it took them more than 2 hours to arrange for a hotel for us and they gave us a poor quality 1-star hotel in Cairo airport. Overall, it was a very disgusting experience with EGYPT AIR all through for myself and my wife during our travel .I would not even give it a 1 star for the level of service we got. we do not recommend this airline to anyone who travels to Egypt or the Middle east. It would be more preferable to pay a little bit more and get a more reputed airline such as EMIRATES or ETIHAD for your travel needs to the Middle East or Egypt from NY. STAY AWAY FROM EGYPT AIR.....
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I was hesitant to book with Egyptair; I often fly with Air Algerie and I thought it would be a similar government-run awful airline. But the tickets were the cheapest and I went for it...I was shocked to find a very new, super-clean plane, with comfortable seats, pillows and blankets provided, and personal TVs in each seat. The staff were courteous and helpful, and even the in-flight food was pretty good. The flights were on-time. We had a 12 hour layover in Cairo, which I expected to be miserable, but we arrived to find that Egyptair would provide us with hotel vouchers for the day, as well as vouchers for a buffet breakfast and lunch, with no additional cost. We even booked a short tour of the pyramids through their company Karnak Tours, who specialize in transit tours, and they took care of the visas for us. It was a very enjoyable experience, and I can say I will definitely be booking with them in the future if the opportunity arises!

Title:
Let me mention that my review doesn't have to do with one trip but with several since I am using this company to travel from Greece to Uganda - my wife's country - and back.
The company doesn't have a bad service at all. They even offer two suitcases per person. Very good! The staff is trained and nice, also the airport in Cairo is neat and interesting.
But, in 50% of their flights there is a big delay, more than half an hour and all of them are unjustified. They do not even bother to announce the reason they delay. I can't forget that last year I was traveling with my old father and getting back from Uganda to Greece the flight in Entebbe airport delayed so much that we had to rush really hard in Cairo to catch up our next flight.
This year's trip also pissed me off because I was traveling with my wife and during check-in in Athens airport they said they couldn't find seats for us to sit together in neither of the two legs of the journey. However in both flights there were seats available. And of course the delays were always there.
Something else, not exactly about Egypt air but connected to it. I don't understand why in Cairo airport when you are transiting you have to be screened twice, once you land and once you depart again. This is only done there. Normally the screening is only done when you depart. This is so frustrating and I am sure it can make people think twice before choosing Cairo for their intermediate stop.

Title:
Egyptair; possibly the worst customer service in the World. Appalling check in at London Heathrow Terminal 2, with rude, abrupt staff with little customer service skills, hardly acceptable as the “front face” of the business. We flew business class to Cairo and onwards to Sharm el Sheikh. Unfortunately, there were no business class upgrades available from Cairo to Sharm el Sheikh, so the most uncomfortable and unsafe in flight safety terms flight in economy ensued. I was seated next to a 200kg plus fat man, a man so fat he needed a seat belt extension and he invaded half of my seat. I requested to be moved and was declined. When I pay for a full seat, I expect a full seat whatever the class of travel. This issue although being a very uncomfortable flight, also raises flight safety issues, has there been a requirement to evacuate the aircraft in the event of an emergency this would not have been possible due to this mans size and his inability to move quickly. I raised the issue with the flight purser on departing the aircraft at Sharm and she was totally unhelpful.
Would I fly Egyptair again, definitely no, never.
Would I recommend Egyptair as an airline? Not even to my worst enemy.
Advice, pay a little more and fly with an airline that actually provides a customer service.

Title:
Egypt Air is generally an average airline, the problems I have found with African flights is that the planes are fairly small and prone to be affected by turbulence so maybe uncomfortable at times.
The crew are helpful but generally not cheerful.
Planes are old but fairly well maintained, however occasionally the seas will malfunction (hydraulics) and will not return to upright position.
Meals are good by comparison to most European airlines.
Entertainment systems on African flights are almost non existent, there are some audio channels and a pre-selected movie is played on center screens with no input from passengers.
Overall experience, will get you where you need to go but delays are frequent however not generally very long and overall experience is average to good.
crvsd: Ahmed D wrote a review Feb 2018
qwuub: Good overall airline at a reasonable price

Title: The reason this did not get 5 stars is because the check in process and transfer on the ground. I originally flew from Marrakesh and had my boarding passes printed by the hotel (hopefully to save time). Upon getting to the airport, I waited 30 minutes to check baggage and then was told that I would need to have my boarding passes printed by them anyway, and that in Casablanca I would also need to have them printed for the second leg of the trip.  Why? Because I did not have this super-duper-special-tearable paper that they NEED you to have so they can rip off part of it. Then why in the world do you offer the option of printing boarding passes at home?  Anyway, after dealing with the ridiculously long wait to check baggage (I think they were using cellphones instead of computers because the network was down), at least they were able to check my baggage all the way to Cairo - and it ARRIVED!  The transfer in Casablanca was confusing as we had to figure out which desk person was going to print our second boarding passes. At least we had enough time to do that and make it through security.  I was soooo glad. The flight itself was great and the stewards were very, very nice. The captain had a great landing, and the airplane was clean and as comfortable as you can get in economy.

Title:
Okay so lets start at the beginning, Egypt air is not the best airline in the world, I can safely advise you accordingly. However sometimes 2nd best or even 3rd best are not too bad.

I've flown with Egypt air twice now and each and every flight was half full, which means empty seat for all my flights, this is always a bonus and I always board last to keep the agony of sitting there and hoping that you will be lucky (face your fears head on ;) ).

The food on egypt air in my opinion really are top notch, They give you decent portions and will not have issues if you ask for more or extra drink etc...

They are always reasonably priced when you buy a ticket especially to europe. The nice thing about Cairo is that it is only short hop to Europe. Keep in mind that the fly with Boeing 737-800 aircraft and the inflight entertainment dates back to the 90's, the food is still good and flight rarely longer than 4 hours.

Lastly what makes Egypt Air better than lets say Ethiopian and Kenya airways, the answer - Cairo Airport - it is not state of the art, but if you need to kill time I guess this is the best airport to do it at., There is no wifi however Addis claims they have but it seldomly works.

So in a nutshell, Try Egypt Air, it is no Emirates, Qatar or Lufthansa, but really not bad, book that flight if it is cheap and explore.

P.S. I won't pay money for their business class especially given that you will probably fly a 737.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
With an all regret and disappointment, I am writing this e-mail to your esteemed company for a major complain that left me all in regret resorting to Egypt Air on my last trip to Germany.
I am a frequent Flyer # MS 4004787286, and a regular loyal customer with a decent flights record on Egypt Air as I appreciate your emphasis on value and excellent service. Yet, a recent episode with one of Egypt Air Officers has happened that made me question my loyalty.

On my way back with my wife from Frankfurt to Cairo, on January 14th 2018 and at the Frankfurt Station, I was inquiring at the gate about the Business boarding with one of your officers as he never bothered to even look at me while talking to him. To make matters worse, I repeated myself - making sure he heard me – Hence, he totally ignored me … and left with a very arrogant way stating he’s going to get back to me which never happened.

Such a disrespectful attitude is not accepted, especially that I am flying with a group of 40 of my top clients to Bangkok via Egypt Air on January 16th 2018. Such a hefty usage shouldn’t be rewarded with a universal disgrace. I hate having my positive feelings about your company ruined by one officer! It is extremely distressing for a loyal, frequent traveler to experience such a poor service despite the politeness of the Station Manager and his assistant.

I urge you to take the necessary action towards Officer Yasser El Rayes at Frankfurt Station, otherwise I will re-consider my upcoming trips on Egypt Air.

Title:
I purchased 2 tickets with Egypt Air from Cairo to Paris return in September and Travel for late December at a cost of 14 120LE. The rules of the ticket were very clear that a FULL REFUND IS PERMITTED if a Visa is denied provided that the embassy letter of denial is sent to the airline; and the cancellation fee on a normal basis I think was 700LE (I do stand to be corrected here, but for sure it wasn’t more than this) So only the one traveller had a Visa refusal, however both tickets needed to be cancelled as we were traveling together. I submitted an online refund and shortly after you receive a Confirmation email of cancellation and an email address to send any supporting documentation, in which I immediately sent the Visa refusal letter to onlinerefund@egyptair.com with reference to my two tickets. However I received only a partial refund, only 12 830LE back!!
A 1 290LE difference...????
I immediately queried this- maybe there was a possibility I didn’t understand something. Also I never read of any extra charges for OnlineRefund’s - EgyptAir is VERY happy to take your money and keep it... so I don’t how they calculated this!! So my fury and utter irritation is the complete lack of customer service, in fact no service whatsoever... you call in but they won’t help because it’s the online department; I have sent email upon email to ask for the breakdown of my refund received (ie. how did you calculate this?), I have facebooked msgd them too and NOTHING since 4December 2017; absolutely useless like their actual aeroplanes and standards on their flights. They don’t read the simple email I send and just say “ah, your money has been paid” I know it’s been paid!!!! That’s not what I’m asking!!!!! Why don’t they want to explain and respond, what do they have to hide?! #pissed!
qwuub: Incompetent customer service and they STEAL YOUR MONEY!!!!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I have used Egypt Air several times and I can tell that their customer service is extremely inconsistent where some attendants are very nice and attentive while others are really rude and lacking proper training. This could even happen on the same plane. During my last flight from Cairo to Toronto there were two female attendants who has never smiled even once while other attendants were really nice and smiling. It was so odd that during the long flight (more than 12 hours) most passengers were really quiet while loud noise was coming from the galley at the back of the plane where attendants were talking to each other very loudly.

A serious matter is when I asked for a cup of hot tea and I was really shocked when the attendant brought the tea in a disposable water cup made out of Polystyrene plastic. When I told the attendant that Polystyrene plastic is not made for hot drinks since the heat makes it carcinogenic, the attendant told me that she KNOWS ABOUT THIS but the company does not provide cups for hot liquids!

Title: I flew Egyptair, Flight MS 668 on the 6 Jan 2018. The leg rooms in the economy class is spacious. The plane itself is not so bad. However, I was pretty disappointed with the service of one particular cabin crew, Ms Sara Ali. I wasn't feeling well when boarding the plane. I was coming down with flu. The air-conditioner was blowing at almost full blast. Right after the Fasten the Seat Belt sign was turned off, I requested for a blanket from Ms Sara, who responded by saying "I'll check" which to me was a weird as I saw  another cabin crew on the other side of the isle was distributing some to other passengers. However, she never came back to me. I thought she had forgotten about my request. I asked for the blanket again from Ms Sara after the she had finished serving the lunch which she responded "OK". But again nothing happened. I was practically shivering due to the cold temperature & the flu. She passed by me after the captain announced that we would be landing in 30 minutes. I reminded her again about my request. She knew I was upset & she quickly opened the overhead compartment which was located a few seat away from mine & pulled out a fresh blanket. Finally I got the blanket 30 minutes before the plane landed! I didn't requesting for a blanket is a complicated process in Egyptair!
qwuub: Good Leg Rooms but Poor Service

Title: The flight to Cairo from JFK (New York) is a great flight alternative to going through Europe when flying to Egypt from the states. The only issue I had was dehydration.  The attendants did not bring water around very often, or give you anything other than a small cup of water at a time.  These are 10 to 11.5 hour flights, so they need to provide more water.  I had to get up several times and walk to the back and ask for water.  From New York you can take a bottle of water with you for the flight, but due to security, I was not able to do that on the Cairo to New York flight.  If you take an empty water bottle with you, the attendants will fill it up for you.

Title:
We went to daytrip from Hurghada to Cairo. Our trip was fixed by Egyptian Excursions Online. So - no any worries. Everything was perfect from the begging to the end of day. Company representative picked up us at hotel reception at 4 am and took us to airport. Domestic part of airport terminal in Hurghada isn't big, but cozy. With possibly to buy not expensive snacks, warm and cold drinks. Both ways - arrival and departure were in time. They serve food (tasty cookies and juice), price is included in flight, even flight was so short! Seats were comfortable, enough space for legs, airlaine crew was very kind and helpful. At airport company guide Ahmed Ali met us, spent whole day with use and in the evening delivered to airport safely. Quick and easy flight back, we were picked at airport again and taken to the hotel reception!
Thsnks to Egyptair company, and specially to Egyptian Excursions Online for this service!

Title:
4 days before departure on my Christmas trip to Kenya I received a cancellation of the flight. Since I had booked the rest of the vacation I had to go and book a new flight. The agent informed med that Egypt Air could not offer an alternative flight so I would receive the full retur of payment within 2-8 week.
The problem was that a new ticket was twice as expensive and cost me more than $1000 extra.
Before booking the new expensive ticket, I tried to contact both the agent and Egypt air for help but help, without any luck.
I also send a complaint to Egypt Air but got the answer that changes happens and they were not responsible for my extra cost. Fact is, that I did not get what I booked and now have an extra cost of $1000 due to the cancellation done by Egypt Air.
I will not book Egypt air again – and I advise you to stay away.

Title:
We booked a group package and Egypt Air was the recommended airline for our entire trip.
The plane is outdated - our charging ports were broken.
We requested an extra blanket and was told that they don't have any extras.
We had taken 4 flights with them and on all the flights, at least one toilet was broken.
The food is really bad - lots of improvements are needed in this department.
The Air Hostesses are quite old and very rude - not welcoming and definitely not helpful in their responses.

On a positive note, we had a 16 hour layover on our way back home, and Egypt Air did arrange for free transfers, hotel accommodation and visas.
During this layover, one is allowed to travel in Cairo - visit the Pyramids etc.
We waited for about 2 hours at the airport before being transferred to the hotel as the airport team had to get the documentation ready.
The hotel was very nice.
Hotel check in was quick.
The hotel provided free breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Most passengers carried hand luggage for the long layover and those that chose to collect their luggage at Cairo Airport, had to wait till all the necessary formalities were done (2 hours) and then they got to collect their bags - during this time your bag is just going around the carousel - so maybe just take hand luggage and check your main luggage direct to your final destination.
crvsd: Experience Editor wrote a review Jan 2018

Title:
I try to avoid Egypt air as much as I can, but sometimes for business trips it’s the only viable alternative. Every flight is a disaster. The planes are out of 1950s with gold buckles and uncomfortable seats. The food is bad, and the staff is not great to say the least.
During one red eye flight I kept waking up because I was smelling smoke. I told the flight attendant, thinking someone is smoking in the bathroom. I was assured that they checked, no one is smoking and it’s all in my head. Then another person in business class complained of smoke. Turns out, EGYPT AIR ALLOWS THE PERSONNEL TO SMOKE IN THE COCKPIT !!! Wtf?! Not only is it a serious hazard, but it also stinks up the whole plane, and particularly business class.
Another time while boarding, I watched the flight attendant help a passenger put his bag in the overhead bin right above my seat. It was the last available space in business class, and the passenger then walked to the back of economy. The same flight attendant then told me I have to either check my bag (with computer and valuables inside), or put it rows and rows behind me in economy. When I suggested he takes the economy bag back and stores it next to the passenger who it belongs to, he told me that all the bags there belonged to the business class passengers, and refused to budge. Other passengers were also flabbergasted, and they observed the same situation, and finally the purser resolved it.
But really - wtf?!
crvsd: N R wrote a review Jan 2018
qwuub: Avoid like the plague that it is, unless you want to be smoked on (in the air!!!) and disregarded
