Title: We had two legs of travel with Egyptair. The first from Toronto to Cairo, the next from Cairo to Bangkok. The first leg was a 10 plus hour flight, so business class made it a more comfortable trip. Everything was excellent, the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The seats fully reclined and there was lots of room. The aircraft was a 777. The food presented was very good, fresh and not stodgy. We didn't have any complaints at all.I will write about our 17 hour layover in Cairo after first describing the next leg of the flight. We departed Cairo very late evening with  9 plus hour flight to Bangkok. The aircraft used this time was an Airbus 320- 200 series. It was less roomy, the seats didn't fully recline ,  in fact my seat, the leg portion was not working properly so my legs were never quite elevated enough to afford a comfortable position. The food for some reason wasn't as good either and halfway through the flight one of the washrooms stopped working so 30+ people had to use just the forward toilet.  However, again I couldn't complain about the staff for they were as friendly and accommodating as the first leg. I think that aircraft needs to be retired, or used on short haul flights only., it has seen better days. Please note that Egyptair, because it is based in a Muslim nation, offers no alcohol on board. I like my glass of wine with dinner, but I didn't miss it at all.Because our layover was so long we had a complimentary hotel room and meals at the Meridian Hotel attached to the airport. This was great, as we could shower, change and relax in between. We were met at the Cairo airport, at the in transit area for passengers staying longer than 6 hours. (The airport itself is chaotic and there is no order to anything. Queues form where people are trying walk through, the signage is not clear and everyone is pushing and cutting into line. But that's just Egypt, and you accept it. After queuing up in the wrong line 3 times we finally got to the right place. At this point the fabulous representative from Egyptairs tour arm took charge and told us our options for the day. If you are in transit in  Egypt and you stay in the hotel they offer and don't leave you  don't need to pay for a  visa. However if you wish you can book a tour (for a cost of course) and purchase a visa in the airport for $25.00 U.S. We have been to Egypt before, but we decided to check out the pyramids again. We booked a 4 hour tour which still gave us plenty of time to relax. The representative helped us get the visa purchased, facilitated a quick exit out of the airport and to the hotel.  A few hours later a driver picked us up at the hotel and we had a tour of the pyramids and Sphinx with a guide we picked up on the way. It was casual but perfect for us. Of course there is always the ubiquitous stop at a shop, but this one was very good. It was an essential oil shop and we rather enjoyed it. Our guide didn't force anything, he was very good and asked permission to stop.  We could have extended the day further but traffic was becoming shocking and we were still a bit tired so we returned to the hotel for a lovely buffet dinner and then returned to the airport for our flight.I wouldn't be honest if I didn't state that for those who are looking for upgraded amenities, quality wines and liqueurs,  and other things may be disappointed in Egyptair but we found it to be ,  for the most part a good experience.Just a side note, the Business class lounges in Cairo (there are several ) are not up to much. We checked out 4 and found the one in Section F to be the cleanest,  most well stocked. The first one we went in lacked both cleanliness and comfort, we left quickly. We found the better one must near our departure gate and enjoyed the atmosphere there much more.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

As soon as we arrived I left as soon as I can and unfortunately, being sleep deprived and hungry, I left my reading glasses on my seat....went back to the airport 3 times to try and locate them....that was a joke, they told they’d check and call me, no one ever calls back and one person direct you to another...the airline says not our responsibility check with security and security tells me the airline should look after that....nonetheless, I lost my $600 glasses...pricy trip, this ended be and awaful customer service

Title: I had a good experience on the way from Aswan to Abu Simbel, and the return flight.  We sat in business class and were fortunate to sit beside the Egyptian Governor of Aswan Governorate.  Once we arrived at Abu Simbel, business class deplaned first.  My friend and I followed the governor to the VIP shuttle while the rest of the plane waited for another shuttle to arrive, it was one of the best flight experiences I’ve had traveling in a foreign country.  However, we also experienced flight rescheduling a couple of times at the start, which really disrupts our travel itinerary and we had to move things around to accommodate our transportation needs.  The Egyptair website and online support needs some upgrading, as the website will not take Star Alliance frequent flyer numbers, even though there is a field for the number.  The online support got my name wrong, sent me incorrect data, and responded to an issue that I didn’t raise.

Title: We had a dreadful experience at Cairo Airport. After getting through security with my 84-year-old blind mother, finally getting to the ticket counter with our itinerary in hand including our flight booking, we were told we were not on the flight. Instead, Egypt Air had apparently transferred us to Nile Air which was in a different terminal. We had not been informed of the change nor had our tour company which arranged the flight been informed. We had to struggle with our luggage, no wheelchair, backwards through security (not an easy feat), try to find help to get to Terminal 1, got through Security there and to the baggage counter only to be told we were 10 minutes late for the flight they had transferred us to on Nile Air ... and there was no other flight that day. Our tour company then rebooked us on a later Egypt Air flight so we had to get back through security at Nile Air terminal, into a filthy taxi with a broken windscreen to get back to the Egypt Air terminal, struggle through security again, then the ticket counter and finally made a flight but were too late arriving in Luxor to meet up with our organized tour for the day. A horrible morning, no assistance from Egypt Air, no apology ... awful. we had to fly Egypt Air three more times during out tour of Egypt. The good was that when we did have a wheelchair, the airline arranged for elevator life into the aircraft for my mother -- so much easier than the climb up and down the stairs. They were great about this on all the follow-on flights. The flights were all very short so no meal service but there was always an offer of a drink and snack cookies. Overall my advice to travellers would be to continue to contact the airline in advance of their flight to make sure they had not been transferred to another airline at their convenience.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We have travelled a lot and have flown with many airlines. Bit have never had such fantastic service as we got from Egypt Air. There was a 3 hour delay on our way from Cairo to Tel Aviv. They gave us breakfast and made sure we could contact the hotel to arrange a different time for pick up. We knew about their policy for free hotel accommodation if you have a long stop over in Cairo. We told them that we wished we could rather have a tour of Egypt on our way back but we have no visums. Well they made our dream come true. We just landed and Cairo when they called us that we must bring our passports they made a plan for all 7 of us. They gave a guide and with 13 other people they took us out and stopped at the Nile River. We got a tour of the pyramids and the sphinx. We drove through the streets of Cairo and to top it all off they even stopped at a perfume oil shop and showed us how paper was made and our names were written in hieroglyphics. Then we had a lovely traditional Egyptian dinner before heading back to the airport. Wherever we fly again if Egyptair has an option to take us there we will definitely choose them.

Title: I’ve flown with Egypt Air numerous times, but it never seems to change. The service is consistently terrible on all its flights, but especially so on long haul flights. It has the pricing of a “regular” airline, but the quality of a very basic, low-cost carrier. The flight attendants treat passengers with a mixture of contempt and neglect. Asking for a glass of water will earn you a glare, a look of disgust and the flight attendant will make sure you wait a few hours till you are almost faint with dehydration. On most of the flights I’ve been on, the flight attendants rarely had more than a rudimentary knowledge of English, a word or two of French, and even their Arabic (supposedly their mother tongue) was poor! I would say the only advantage to flying with Egypt Air is that they have a very generous luggage allowance, around 46 kgs on longer flights.

Title: We flew Toronto Cairo return on a direct Egypt Air Boeing 777. The seating format is 3 on the left, 3 in the middle and 3 on the right. We chose an aisle and an aisle in the middle group and, both ways, had no-one in the middle seat so we had more room. Neither plane was full. Tourism in Egypt is down 80% although we felt perfectly safe for our 10 days there. The food from Toronto to Cairo was good but the breakfast coming back wasn't the best. The movies are ones you've likely never heard of and they're the same in both directions. It was 10 hours and 40 minutes going and 11 1/2 hours coming back. Washrooms were getting a bit funky near the end of the flight. They don't clean much during the flight. Altogether, a reasonably good flight experience.

Title:
I booked Egyptair flight MS 778 on 20 November 2017 from London Heathrow to Cairo International airport.
The good point about choosing this airline was the non-stop flight between the two airports.
British Airway is a direct flight too but was fully booked for my return date.
The flight departure was delayed for over half an hour. The apologetic public announcement referred the delay due to the late arrival of the plane from Cairo.

The leg room was uncomfortable. The inflight entertainment was limited. The food was tasteless and the staff uniform was poor.
The staff was polite but they did the job mechanically without interest.
The captain announcements were limited and lacked humour.

The flight itself went on smoothly and the luggage arrived intact but had to wait almost 45 minutes to get it.
Going through immigration was very crowded and cuticle.
The whole experience was boring and the fare was expensive.
Alan

Title:
This is a good airline which communicates any delays well to passengers and take care of their refreshments etc even with just a two hour delay. Seats and baggage handling is good but in-flight entertainment is lacking.
The biggest reason for ranking this an average is that its in-flight crew behave weirdly when asked for anything extra. I heard the stewards denying passengers any extra meals and then saw them sit at the back of the aircraft with large numbers of full meals, cherry picking things they wanted to eat from multiple food trays and even pack some of these items to take home with them!
Surely the airline pays them well enough not to indulge in this kind of petty behaviour.

Title: I traveled with Egypt Air from Paris to Baghdad, via Cairo(about 10 hour transit) on 31/7/2017.  It was one of the worst trips I have made and am still regretting my decision to travel with them. Let me start by the unfriendliness and very bad manners of the staff both at the Paris booking office and at CDG airport. The flight itself was nothing out of the ordinary: simple meal, not enough blankets , noisy and unruly passengers ...   all that was to be expected and tolerable , if it wasn't for the great damage my luggage suffered at the hands of  Egypt Air ! A damage I've never seen before , it even looked  deliberate . My bags were damaged beyond repair, and it wasn't the scratches that passengers normally end up with after flights . One of them had both handles completely smashed , as if someone smashed the bag on the ground several times. Another one had a very big dent ! A sac that i was forced to buy at CDG by  Egypt Air staff (to decrease the weight of a bag) was completely torn and taped together !!!  I was , and still am , very angry, when i saw the massacre of my luggage. I reported it but had no response , when i did it again the answer  was : " you should have reported it earlier". I strongly advise my fellow travelers to think twice and look for other options before booking on Egypt Air.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
really cant fault the service. We were offerd free newspapers and head sets. There was a film to watch and a meal provided. The food was as good as any other flight I have been on and they came round offering drinks on several occasions. please note as this is a Muslim airline there is no alcohol and after the safety video there is a short prayer video.
My only complaint was that the plain itself was quite old and very small. We got extra legroom seats so no problem there but the seats were very narrow as well. There is a first class that looked like the regular premium economy you get on other airlines. The seats were leather and wider ( two across instead of three} And you had your own screen in the back of the seat. To book this in the uk was very expensive around £800 each. We emails Egypt air from Luxor and the price had fallen to 600 each. We asked again at the airport and the price had fallen yet again to 200 each, worth bearing in mind if you fancy an upgrade.
At the time of writing this was the only direct flight from London to Luxor departing on a Monday so the flight is full and gets booked up quickly.

Title: Travel by scheduled flight certainly beats package trip. For the price you get meal and baggage, plus more leg room. Also if put together with hotel booking by your travel agent, it gets you the atoll protection you will not get if you book all bits of holiday separately. This trip involves a change of planes in Cairo, but no reply al trouble except a fairly long walk between gates. Egyptair officials at Cairo also well aware of the transfer, and geared up to ensure no passenger or luggage missed the connection. One minor irritation, and cost. Because you are ( obviously) arriving in Egypt when you get to Cairo, you have to buy an entry visa, whereas if you had arrived direct in Sharm el Sheikh you don't need one for stay in immediate vicinity. The transfer between flights is not considered to be external to the country. However  Plus side is you arrive as an internal traveller at Sharm el Sheikh so formalities are minimal and swift.
crvsd: Antony S wrote a review Dec 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I have flown on Egypt Air a few times now, and have continued to be impressed by the friendly, professional on-board service and fantastic landings.  The food is acceptable as airline food goes, but to be honest, I have had better on a few other airlines.There seems to be more leg room between the seats, which certainly helps on long flights.The Arabic incantations at the beginning of the flight were a little annoying, but I used the time as a reminder to pray as well. :-)The only real issue that I have with Egypt Air is their 'hub' airport of Cairo.  It has been an unpleasant experience every time (even just in transit) so unpleasant, and is seriously making me reconsider traveling Egypt Air again.  (And listening to the murmurings of fellow passengers, I am not the only one considering this).  * The airport staff do not contribute to a pleasant trip.  (Perhaps being frowned at by everyone is a standard employee expression towards travelers?)*  Lack of adequate signage makes finding the international departures very difficult. (It is tucked away in a corner, behind some service desks).*  The chaotic system that the airport has in place to pass international travelers through security is really not in any way pleasant.   *  The first of the two careful and thorough security checks is most unpleasant and certainly below the standard of what one would expect from an international airport, which handles the large number of international travelers that this airport does.  *  There is only one security scanner and this security check point is tucked into a tiny hall space in front of the lifts and stairwell.  Due to the inadequacy of the area and equipment, the staff try to rush things and end up damaging passenger's hand luggage items when they search through.  (I had purchased mobile phone camera lenses for my sons for Christmas, and components went flying when the official ripped (yes ripped - he didn't even try and open the box carefully or gently) open one of the boxes. This was done, after he'd asked me what it was and I'd explained, I also pointed out that it was clearly indicated on the box which was still sealed, and offered to open the box for him.    It was a scramble trying to prevent more damage, as I tried to pick up pieces off the floor before they were trampled!  It is just plainly chaotic and while one appreciates the need for the security checks in today's climate, at least the check could be done professionally.  The second security check  on the 2nd floor (also before you enter the international departure area) had 2 scanners, and polite, professional officials.  *  One must also note that Cairo Airport does not accept binoculars packed into your hand luggage - even though there is no prior warning,of binoculars being a non allowed item, on any website.  (In fact the sign indicating banned items, right at the security scanners, stipulates binoculars with cameras are not allowed on board - but the officials confiscate all binoculars).  Egypt Air is certainly not  going to benefit due the unpleasant travel experience at Cairo Airport.  A pity, as I have enjoyed the flying with them.
qwuub: Great flight experience, but certainly let down by Cairo Airport
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Sunday the 26th of November, at 12:50am, on my return flight from Bangkok to Lagos, the Egypt Air plane developed a faulty just when the pilot was accelerating for take off. He heard a loud sound and the plane suddenly decelerated. The flight was cancelled. For the next 4 hours we were in limbo not knowing what exactly happened apart from the "technical difficulty". Credit to Egypt Air for feeding and eventually accommodating us at Ambassador hotel around 7am.

My wife and I eventually go assigned an Emirates flight from Bangkok to Dubai at 8:30pm, before being ferried by Egypt Air from Dubai to Cairo and Cairo to Lagos. I came back home needing another holiday.

This was the real cost to buying a cheap ticket. On my way to Bangkok from Lagos via Cairo, none of the planes had personal entertainment. From Dubai to Cairo and Cairo to Lagos, same boring flight. The most pleasurable part of the trip was on the Bangkok to Dubai leg on Emirates. It was like breathing fresh air after wading through smog. Worse case, internet service aboard Egypt Air was $15 for 13mb of data. That's gotta be the most expensive data in the world.

The food on the flights weren't too bad, but far from the quality and presentation other airlines give.

Will I fly Egypt air again? Dunno... But sure the health of their planes will be a major consideration for me before attempting to.
crvsd: Reginald B wrote a review Dec 2017
qwuub: UNPLEASANT TRAVEL EXPERIENCE WITH EGYPT AIR
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I travelled with my husband and we booked business class flights on all 3 legs of the internal flights in Egypt - Cairo to Abu Simbel, Abu Simbel to Aswan and Luxor to Cairo. The planes that are used are very small and there is really no difference between business class and economy class in relation to the seating. We were offered drinks in plastic cups. The meals/snacks were very disappointing. Poor quality ingredients. The bread was dry and just had a piece of dry cheese on it. I wonder what the passengers in economy class received.if we got what we did. At least the chocolate cake on the flight from Luxor was tasty and fresh. There is only a business class lounge in Cairo.
The staff were friendly and did the best they could. The flights were all on time and it was a pleasant journey generally. Our bags were all in good condition.It is the best option for quick internal travel in Egypt.

Title: We were a little unsure about taking Egypt Air for the long haul portion of our trip.   We were considering a hop through Europe.  However the price with Egypt Air US$550 was too good to turn down.  We're glad we flew them.Unlike many airlines EgyptAir had a modern Jet good inflight entertainment and a USB charging port to make it easy to use our own electronics.The crew were professional and courteous unlike USA airline crews and the plane was spotless.  The toilets were constantly being cleaned which is usually not the case on most EU and USA long haul carriers.  They also served real meals on board.  Flight was on-time as were all our internal EgyptAir flights.  They check you in automatically and email you your boarding pass.  That is a nice innovation. Title: The great advantage of flying Egyptair between New York and Cairo is that you can get a direct, non-stop flight, without having to change planes in some nightmarish European airport like Frankfurt-am-Main.  Also, the comfort level on these long-distance flights is considerably greater than on the connecting Europe to Cairo flights on most other airlines.  Another advantage is that the flights leave and arrive at decent hours at both ends.  Check-in at Kennedy as well as in Cairo can be a bit chaotic, but the service on board is fine, the business-class seating comfortable, and the food is good.Although alcohol is served on many other airlines operated by predominantly-Islamic countries, such as the UAE's Emirates Airline, no alcohol is served on Egyptair.  But. if you find it impossible to fly without the aid of strong drink, then stop at a duty-free shop and pick up a few mini bottles on the way to the gate.  Internal flights within Egypt are reasonably comfortable, and passengers with handicaps are treated very well.
crvsd: Rand C wrote a review Dec 2017
qwuub: Non-stop flights from NYC-Kennedy to Cairo

Title:
We paid extra for an International Airline as opposed to a budget one as we had a 5hour flight with 4 children travelling with us. We hoped that the aircraft would be an up to date one with broader walkways and up to date entertainment.

Just before boarding our gate we were told that we need to go to a different gate number as the aircraft is waiting there. We arrived at our gate and boarded our flight to realise that the aircraft was a early 1990s one with no entertainment and a seat setting of 2 by 2. It was a small aircraft, tight and cramped something that should be used for domestic flights not 5 hour international flights.

There was no apologies from captain or staff or any explanation as to why we were all cramped up in the dated aircraft just a vague explanation of safety and then up in the air.

The children drove us crazy as 2 of them had to sit alone due to the seating arrangements.

Everyone was unhappy and complaining. Will never use Egypt Air again!!!!

Title: Recently flew on 4 Business Class flights in the past month.  Chose Egyptair on the good value of the Business class fare to get to my destination, which was half the price of other airlines.  Because of the long flying distance, I was mostly looking for the seat space and flat seat.  The Business Class seat on the long-haul flight was overall rather spacious and could lay down to sleep, so this was good.  However, their entertainment system was extremely limited, cabin cleanliness could be improved, onboard service mediocre and not friendly, and onboard food very basic.  Cairo airport is very smokey from cigarette smoking airport employees, despite the no smoking signs.  So it's not a pleasant environment to be in for a non-smoking traveller, and the people work very slowly and inefficient.  The Cairo business lounges are very basic with very few amenities, so not worth getting to the airport early to enjoy.  The access to the Business lounges in the other international countries outside of Egypt have much higher standards and are true Business class lounges.  I flew not expecting much in terms of service and amenities, and that's what I received.
qwuub: Good value, but not known for great quality or service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flight 23.10.17 Heathrow - Luxor
On check in we made sure that the seats were where allocated where what we were happy with so we could change them if need be. We were happy. One of us is a nervous flyer and needs to be seated next to a window so we can see everything happening outside. When we got on the plane we were told in no uncertain terms that they had changed our seats because a mother and son were sat across an aisle and they weren’t happy with that. I’m not unsympathetic but surely if you’re travelling alone with a child you would rectify this at check in like we did with the nervous flyer? We refused and the air hostess tried making me feel guilty by reiterating it was a mother and son. Again we refused and told them we had ensured we were happy with our seats at check in and wouldn’t change. We were then told we could have our seats but would have to leave our hand luggage in business class and were not allowed to come back for anything out of it. Again I told her this was unacceptable because my inhalers and other items I would need in flight were in there. Again the hostess disappeared and eventually came back ad told me we could if we needed to. The one time I went through for something I was ushered out quickly by the host on that cabin. The food by the way was appalling.

Flight 04.11.17 Hurghada – Cairo
We were business class on this flight which I s different world from economy but due to the early time were up I wanted to get a little sleep. No chance. No sooner than you were up they whipped the table out in front of you and started service you a cardboard breakfast and by the time they were done it was time to descend. Generally a good flight but the prayer on the screen prior to take off is disconcerting.

Flight 06.11.17 Cairo – Heathrow
We checked our seats and were seated happy with our allocation. Much better plane, we were able to watch a film with the screen on the seat back. When the food came around we opted for chicken because we don’t eat red meat. The smarmy male host wet to see if there was any left because we were in seats 40 and came back and told us they only had beef because we are at the back. The man in the middle seats though who was Egyptian was allowed chicken even though he was asked after us. Preferential treatment me thinks? So we got the beef and just ate the veg which was vile and the bread roll. He then came around with coffee and I got half a cup, no apology just “ah it’s because you’re last again” and then he was gone. After that he went around with tea. Not acceptable service. I kept asking for water because I get really thirsty during the flight and the water I purchased in duty free to get on the plane with was taken off me at the gate (crazy when bought in the airport for the flight). I swear the hostess hated me because he would only give me half a plastic cup each time and filled everyone else’s.

I would not recommend Egyptair to anyone.
qwuub: Rude staff, vile food & terrible service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Today I finished my first travel with Egypt air... and would like to share with you a few comments.

Flight MUC X CAI X BKK

Munich x Cairo... new airplane... but service SOOO SLOW!!! It took 1 hour for them to pass even with water. I don't mind not having glass... but did you see the quality of the plastic cup?!?!? and One cup per person!

The service is very slow and food is average. The staff was nice, but slow.

Lounge experience at the airport in Cairo: NEVER NEVER NEVER!!! The lounge is dirty! yes... DIRTY!!! The restrooms are disgusting and I went to 3 different ones. Food... I saw more employees eating the food than clients. food appearance horrible... and I did not even taste.

Lack of information for the gate... i was informed to check at 22:40 and I decided to check early... at 22:20 they were calling last call! LAST CALL!!!

Last... A330 CAI X BKK
Dirty, outdated, uncomfortable... and this time I decided to check... THE FIRST SERVICE... was after 1 hour and 30 minutes! Many clients were sleeping! Seriously?!? What service is that?

And to close... I arrived and my luggage was broken! Yes... Broken! Oohhh and airport staff said that someone from the company will call me in 2 WEEKS!!!

2 WEEKS?!

CONCLUSION: PAY MORE AND STAY AWAY FROM EGYPTAIR.

Title: I booked the cheapest flight to Amsterdam to visit my daughter. Having flown Egyptair before, I knew what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. The plane, an Airbus A300 to Cairo was a later model than last time. The flight was empty, so I slept across a middle seat. Cairo Airport wasn't bad. I spent my 5 hour layover at the airport lounge. The Boeing 737 to Amsterdam was a late model plane. Quite full, but for some reason I was alone in my row. Food was basic, but flight was pleasant enough. Left both Johannesburg and Cairo on time. If the flights back are different, I'll update this review.
crvsd: David L wrote a review Nov 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I was flying from Johannesburg to Cairo, the business class seats were overbooked, and consequently I was bumped down to an Economy seat, albeit a comfortable one. The ground crew was sincerely apologetic and without any prompting from me, the manager appeared and immediately created a written official record of what had happened. By the time I had reached the final leg of my journey (London to Toronto), my economy seat had been upgraded to business class with the boarding pass waiting for me. In addition, I received other travel perks and my travel points refunded. Also, I have received an email confirming the events.

I understand that mistakes can happen, some situations cannot be changed but despite hearing about recent events where some airlines were not treating their customers with the expected courtesy, I was very appreciative of EgyptAir's immediate response in trying to fix the problem and the way they handled the situation.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Having arrived at Hurgharda airport early to avoid rushing around I put my bag on the system first and asked 'will they be transferred to our Heathrow flight from Cairo?' 'Yes no problem' I was told......
When we arrived at Cairo international I watched as one of our bags was THROWN onto the waiting luggage cart and I mean thrown! The cart literally bounced, now as we had been on a diving holiday and some of our expensive kit was in these bags I was horrified!
The trouble didn't stop there, after arriving at Heathrow and waiting nearly an hour I found that My bag the first one of 5 that was put onto the system hadn't made the same flight as I had but the other 4 had, how can in a modern airport with scanning equipment a bag that is labelled Heathrow not make the same flight as 4 other bags that funny enough all have the same thing on them?
When I went to baggage lost and found and reported it they couldn't even find the tag on their system!! And again I ask how can a piece of luggage that has a bar code for LONDON NOT make the flight?
I am now still awaiting a response and a we have found your luggage.... I am now loosing money as I am a diving instructor and the kit I need to teach is lost somewhere in the Egypt air system!!!!
If I don't have to use these people again I won't and I would recommend that if you can get a direct flight with another airline that you do it!!!!!!
crvsd: Mark R wrote a review Oct 2017
qwuub: Can't organise a simple baggage transfer

Title:
First of all the flight was late by 45 minutes we where lucky our connection flight was also late, upon arrival one of our baggage is missing we reported the missing bag at the airport and they promised to deliver the bag for us after 2 days, we called at least 100 times and no answer after one week someone called and said the bag went by mistake to South Africa and we will receive it after 2 days, it has been more than 2 weeks and no news at all.
We left Iraq and few days ago without our bag and we have no idea what is the status of the bag, We went to the same office that issued the lost bag compliant and they were so rude and not helpful at all.
On our trip back to Toronto we had 13 hours overlay at Cairo airport. and they said that since the overlay is more than 6 hours Egypt air provided us with accommodation inside the airport, it was more like detention centre with no water, very dirty room with broken bed with blankets full of hair and smells like urine.
we could not use the room and we spend the 13 hours siting in the transit terminal, which did not have any resultant, the Egypt air provided us with lunch which was plane food left overs and cold small bread and bottle of water.
The flight was delayed by one hour. at that stage we were so tried. the flight from Cairo to Toronto was acceptable comparing to what we have been through in the transit terminal.
We asked Egypt air in Toronto about our bag and we showed the report and the representative said that he can not track it and he gave us a number that no one can reach, and when i called the main office they gave me different number but again no one answer the phone number and no mail box to leave a message,

This airline doesn't care at all and they don't have any costumer service.

Title: This is by far the worst trans-atlantic flight I have taken in Business class.Given that this is a dry airline (which I feel should be more prominently displayed on their website) I expected the service and experience to be top notch.  It was anything but.  In fact ghetto is a word I would use.  Especially compared to Air Canada business class.  Here are the major disappointing highlights.  And trust me I don't often write such bad reviews.  This is deserving:- check-in is passe with a paper envelop for your ticket and other unnecessary paper.  -The seats are NOT lie flat-no drinks were offered until lunch was served.  (Air Canada has likely done 3 runs with the drink cart by this time)-I asked for extra cheese with lunch - and was told no-Drink options:  Pepsi, tonic water, orange & some other juice, coffee & Tea.  Don't think soda water is a hard request...-when I asked for more water I was told I had a bottle at my seat and not given more-Flight attendants barely serviced the floor. I got up numerous times to ask for more water and was at one point to do it myself as she was busy putting lip liner on.-no snacks were available.  After 5 hrs I was hungry - this was a HUGE inconvenience to them.  I have NEVER flown and been hungry and not been able to have a snack.-TV's are very far from where you actually sit - so if your vision isn't 20/20 - forget about it. And POOR selection of entertainment.-amenity kit had: socks, toothbrush, eye mask.  No ear plugs, hand moisturizer,  lip balm-Pillow was flat and the pillow case was pilled.  Blanket likely came from the dollar store - felt? again terrible material-bathrooms: small and again only hand soap - on a 10 hr flight your hands get dry....it would just be nicePoor service, poor food, poor non-alcoholic drink options and overall totally dated plane.
qwuub: Terribly Disappointing Airline and overall experience
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Despite being shown as 'on time' consistently from two hours before scheduled departure, the flight was an hour late departing. The only information received was an announcement on board that the flight was 'delayed due to boarding passengers'. Well, you can hardly blame them for that then, that doesn't normally happen!

So, having transferred from another Egyptair flight several hours previously we had eaten nothing for seven hours, expecting as usual to receive something on board (the Egyptair 'business lounge' offered nothing remotely appetizing, mostly appearing to have been on display for a considerable time, and not replenished). Sadly the first meal offered was breakfast another seven hours later. The only choice available was between two identical looking omelettes, which despite not being a big fan I had to try. Unfortunately even in my starving state I was unable to eat more than a few mouthfuls.

Title:
Had there been other alternatives I would have taken them. This was my second flight with this airline and they don't improve. Boarding was late and chaotic so the pushy make their way to the front and are allowed through, fill the overhead bins and plonk themselves in seats. At Sharm El Sheikh Airport you are told to be there for additional security checks at least 2 hours before departure. One hour is plenty enough. Rude individuals will keep you from getting near departures, it will suddenly be announced and a scrum will ensue. Cairo Airport is not much fun either. One scanner will say you can't have something in hand luggage but it isn't on any list. Insist on the supervisor being called and he will soon back down. On to the next one - and a further three - all of whom say you can't have a different item. By the time you are through you're very cross.

Screaming infants are placed throughout the aircraft so they cannot be avoided at all. Food awful. Entertainment worse. Do I want to spend a few hours watching some badly acted Egyptian soap opera? Certainly not.
crvsd: Judith F wrote a review Aug 2017

Title:
I live in Cairo Egypt, I find that Egyptair is the most convenient air carrier.
First, humane departure times from Cairo, mostly between 9 & 10 am (versus other airline departure times of 1 & 4 am), meaning that you reach the airport after a good sufficient night sleep, arrive to your destination 4-5 hours later in due check in time in your hotel (versus arriving too early after a sleepless night to wait in a hotel lobby till your room is ready).
Second very convenient departure times from you destination mostly between 2 & 4 pm meaning a good night sleep, enough time for a relaxed breakfast, checking out at leisure & reaching the airport relaxed.
I believe that this outweighs any claims of possibly marginal superiority in cuisine or whatever else
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Very comfortable flight with individual TV sets which was fab for our 2 children ( their too small to see the normal ones )
Our flight was delayed by 2 & 1/2 hours which was a pain, they said our connecting flight from Cairo to Luxor would wait but it did not ! So we were stuck in Cairo over night and all the next day ! They did put us up in a hotel with food included but no drinks except water, soft drinks would have been nice but we had to pay for them.
As we have outer own appt in Luxor paying for hotel soft drinks did cost more than would have done in our own place ( 3 adults and 2 children )
The airline staff friendly, we use Egyptair a lot over the years.
We got a good price this time as booked almost a year in advance but they now are very expensive if not. More people would go to Egypt if the prices were more reasonable (last year it cost over £600 per person !
Meals also very good,
Will use again as normally very good and not normally delayed, but hope they do direct to Luxor again !

Title:
My experience with EgyptAir, the first time ever, was a great one! The stewards were very friendly and helpful. The plane was clean and the service was very good. I particularly enjoyed the deserts and the salads, as these can be neglected easily, but not on EgyptAir.
I booked the seats behind the toilets in the middle of the plane and there was so much space. I recommend these seats if you have an issue with leg space.
The staff at Cairo airport were slightly on the moody side, but so were the staff at Paris airport, so I would not say that Cairo was unique.

There is wifi on the flight, but limited to 15 minutes only at Cairo airport.

Can I just add, that arriving back in SA is always such an amazing experience - as we have the friendliest staff in the world!!! OR Tambo, you make me proud!

Title:
I fly twice a year, My comparison will be limited to the airlines are used previously to make it fair (Lufthansa - Nordic Airlines - British Airlines - Austrian Airlines - Egypt Air).
-Egypt air pilots were the 2nd best out of the 5, landing, take off and flights are usually smooth.
-Food on the plane was not delicious but edible, usually, you choose between chicken, beef or fish, definitely better than Lufthansa and Austrian Airlines but British Airways and Nordic are the best.
-Service is firm but do not expect more than that, not bad though, you will get what you as for but nothing extra.
- seats are ok but could get uncomfortable on 8+ hours flights. but thats in most airlines. just take a walk every few hours.
- Luggage, the best in all of them. usually 2 bags and a carry on while most other airlines allow just 1 bag and a carry-on. in some cases (like holding a CIB platinum credit card or a gold Egypt air card) you even get an extra bag for free.
- Rarely have I experienced delays with Egypt air, if it does happen, it's not more than 30 min max.
- Most of the planes don't have wifi but most of them have screens, movies, and entertainment.

Remember. it always depends on you too. be nice, smile and you will be handled very well no matter what ;)
crvsd: Amir F. wrote a review Aug 2017
qwuub: Better than others, But dont expect too much.

Title:
Let's just say that if your not of a certain nationality you don't get preferred service. The flight attendants will ignore your light for up to an hour. My father was very ill returning from Egypt and the light was on asking for an attendant to arrive. We were not supposed to be walking around and since we were dead center to the plane we are far from all attendant anyway. When they finally arrived it was to walk by instead of stop at which point my mother tapped him and said "excuse me, my husband is running a fever and needs to vomit but there are no bags". They finally send someone with medication and unlimited water. Water had only been served twice on a 12 hour flight.... only with meals. The food was ok. I didn't eat second time around for fear of getting sick like my father.

People stand and loiter near the exit doors which is nerve wracking. People duck behind the flight attendants curtains to take things like water and soda willingly too. So crazy! I have never in my life seen anything like this on a flight before.

The crew does not clean during flight or collect trash, the toilets run out of paper towels and toilet paper. When we alerted the attendant they still didn't bother to fill it.

The plane was a completed wreck upon deplaning. I have never seen so much trash or food ground into the carpet in any other flight. When we offered up our trash during the flight the attendant only took it with a frown on her face.

Overall I will only fly again if I have to. The flight was smooth and quick for what it was.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Okay, so we were going to Egypt to meet up with a bunch of South African friends to go scuba diving. After comparing the economy and business class prices we opted for business and the extra comfort and luggage allowance. The good stuff- check in, seamless. Managed to check in our luggage through to our final destination of Hurghada and not have to collect the luggage in Cairo. Actually disbelieving that this was possible but it was- and the Egyptair rep was on hand to help us collect our bags and clear customs at Hurghada. The seats and space, slightly strange Business Class configuration of 2/3/2 but the wife and I booked a 2 so we were together with no stranger present. Plenty of space, and a seat that almost folds to a flat bed. Certainly okay for a 10 hour flight but fairly hard compared to some of the prestige airlines. The blanket was okay- but the cabin wasn't really cool (not so nice) so I didn't need it. The food was actually pretty good, no complaints at all. You get a tray with your appetizer, salad and after dinner cheese(?) and once this was eaten, we had prawns on pasta which was delicious. This was followed up with cakes and coffee etc. We had brought some over priced wine at duty free which the hostess had no problem with us drinking- they brought us glasses but we didn't advertise the fact we were drinking out of respect for our fellow travelers sensibilities. The cabin staff were okay- I'm not going out on a limb to say they were great, however they were adequate and I had no complaints. Cleanliness- again not great and the toilets were turned into tips several time due to poor passenger hygiene, I felt sorry for the staff who had to clean up after people who clearly had no idea how to operate an airline toilet, or didn't care less. I can only imagine the economy class loos with a much greater passenger density. They also dis- encouraged the business class passengers from using the forward toilets which I found strange- staff only? Finally breakfast was more that sufficient from a quantity point of view but was again acceptable rather that exceptional. Final comments about the flight- if you're going to Egypt pay for the extra space and a reasonable level of privacy, comfort and hygiene. It was worth the extra $1000 pp return for this. However the final word is the routing and the crew- the return trip in business was horrible in just about every respect and quite honestly ruined the total experience of the flight to Cairo and back. But that is another review.
crvsd: Dave C wrote a review Aug 2017
qwuub: Business Class on Egyptair, NYC to Cairo
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Firstly the flight was cancelled without us even being informed and we get to the airport and go to customer care and no one is there. Now we have tried since the 12th of June to get confirmation from them that the flight was cancelled so our travel insurance can refund us for our connecting flights both myself and my husband have tried everything possible and we still haven't gotten a response. Also under EU law they are supposed to pay us 600 euros compensation which they are now arguing should only be 300 euros because the flight they initially put us on was only 3hrs 25 minutes later than their flight (although this was too cancelled later) so the delay was less than 4 hours which is nonsense because the flight was cancelled and putting us onto another airline doesn't count as a delay.

Title: I contacted the Egypt Air Toronto office this week regarding the fact I was inappropriately touched by a passenger on an Egypt Air flight last week and when I reported it to the  staff demanding to move seats they simply gossiped about it - suggested I “slap the man , toughen up and be  a strong woman”  The Toronto office ( Shoshana) said  it was my responsibility to call the police and file a written complaint and report it – none of these options were offered to me at the time I reported the man kissing my head and placing his hands up my sweater, on my skin  to grab my breast and rub my back while I was asleep.  The staff allowed him to exit the plane freely and wait for me just outside the aircraft since I had moved to a different seat. I was exhausted and cried when i saw the man waiting for me. Again asked for help  and went right back on the plane and refused to get off alone as they were instructing me to. At that point they had someone from the GTAA to walk me to immigration, he was kind enough on his own accord to ensure I got through , past the man and into a taxi. On the flight I was pretty shocked by how poorly Egypt Air dealt with the incident, the suggestion that I start a fight with a man who has 100 pounds on me IN AN AIRCRAFT   and dismiss me without any follow up or investigation. My discussion with the Toronto office today has left me further surprised that they complacently allow passengers to be assaulted, offer no help and then blame the passenger stating Egypt Air acted appropriately.  I said expect a review of their inflight incident protocols  and some sort of response from them She suggested I get a lawyer and call the police because they are totally satisfied with their actions.

Title: I took three Egyptair flights during our recent vacation:  Cairo-JFK, Cairo-Athens and Entebbe-Cairo.  All three flights were at least 1/2 hour late in pushing back from the gate.  The flight to Athens was nearly 90 minutes late.  Service on the 11 hour flight to JFK was dreadful.  I felt almost discriminated against because I am white.  While the Arab teenagers in the row next to me were given headphones right away, I was told to wait until after newspapers were delivered.  They never came so I asked again and was told to wait until after the meal.  They still didn't come.  I put on my call light which went unanswered even after meal service when the flight attendants had nothing to do.  After asking a third time, I was finally provided headphones.  So, Egyptair was unable to meet either big or little expectations.

Title:
We had booked seats on MS719 from Cairo to Amman for the 29th of May 2017 Dep at 06.45 AM.At around 01.00 AM a mail was sent to us regarding the cancellation of MS 719 and we were given seats on MS 701 which was at 16.55hrs.
Now who stays awake at 1 AM when you have an early morning flight.As can be expected we only got to know as we woke up early on Mon the 29th of May.All hell broke lose as we were tourists from India in a foreign country with itinerary planned for the day in another country.Later on while doing some investigation we learnt that 719 was cancelled due to insufficient bookings and it's a common feature during Ramadan.
My complaint is if they are aware of this phenomenon why did they have to wait for the last minute.
The in-flight service was also quite horrible.Its a very short flt an hour and twenty mins.They served us some cold sandwich n threw plastic bags in for carrying whatever we were unable to eat.
This is not the kind of service we expect from an international carrier and a member of the Star Alliance.
I hope I never have to use this airline ever again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
The most attractive thing for me was the time, flight was scheduled to take off at 10:30 PM which means you don't have to take the day off, you finish work then head to the airport and catch you evening flight, you arrive in Cairo at 5 AM which also means you the get the whole next day in Egypt (obviously you lose some sleeping time but that wasn't an issue for me).
Flight took off around 15 minutes late but we still landed on time so no problem there.
Even though the aircraft was a small one but it was relatively comfortable.
I was very impressed with the economy class food (check the picture) you wouldn't expect Salmon to be on the menu!
The only down side was when when we arrived to Cairo we had to wait for more than half an hour for our luggage to come out. The airport was almost empty at 5 AM with only our flight arriving at the time so it didn't really take any time to go through immigration, so we had wait for the luggage. other than than the staff was nice and we were over all satisfied.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Egyptair had some bad press. When I said I was flying with them, people discouraged me but I wanted to try for myself.

First of all, you get what you pay for really. It was a relatively cheap flight so I didn't expect a lot but I have to say I was impressed with the food on the flight first of all. Although I can't understand how you can serve that bread without any butter, it's so dry.

The staff were good and very patient. My major concerns are the basic standards for safety. Young children had no seat belts and weren't offered them so I was sat next to a lady with a child sat on her knee. If there had been an emergency, the child would have been crushed.

For me it's just the lack of attention to detail in some cases. So on the way out, we had access to films but I'd forgotten my headphones and asked to buy some and there weren't any. This was an opportunity for Egyptair to make a little more money but there was nothing.

On the way back from Cairo, there were no films at all just basic. Really it is what it is. The main thing that put me off was safety, I would have been ok but young children are in a lot of danger and that makes me uncomfortable.
qwuub: Not as bad as people had made out.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Operated by a narrow-bodied Boeing 738 (SU-GEI), this equipment was hardly suited to a five-hour flight when travelling as an economy passenger.  The aircraft was full, save about 6 seats, and the 3x3 seating with a centre aisle made for a fairly cramped environment.  Seat pitch was 31", I guess.  With only two washrooms at the rear end of the single aisle, one has to strategically plan one's visit(s).  With the usual late departure (and late arrival into London) - and no apology - we never heard from the Flight Deck and minimal information was given by the Cabin Crew.  Their safety application was interesting for they allowed a passenger to visit the washroom as we were about to line-up on the runway!  The seat-back entertainment did not work for the first 90 minutes and it took about 1 hour before the Purser apologised for the inconvenience and informed us of what was occurring.  A full hot meal was served about 1 hour after take-off (beef or chicken choice) and drinks were again served about 1 hour before landing.  Service was satisfactory.  If travelling on this sector, I would recommend taking the morning MS777 operated by the larger Boeing 773 (or  the morning British Airways service) and not this flight since, apart from what I have described already, the Immigratiion queue at LHR for non-UK/EU passport holders at the time of this flight's arrival is about on hour.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Rarely does this flight depart on time, if at all: up to an hour late is common, for a variety of reasons offered by the crew.  It does reflect Egyptair's questionable punctuality record.The wide bodied Boeing 773 was a pleasure to fly aboard: clean and modern; light and airy; sufficient leg room for a 6 foot male, seat back entertainment system with a wide choice of products; sufficient washrooms; and a fast aircraft which can save time over the Boeing 738, also on this route.Service was above the normal Egyptian offering with a Captain who gave regular updates to us all; and a friendly and engaged Cabin Crew who responded quickly to requests.  A full hot dinner (choice of beef or chicken) was offered about 1 hour after take-off and drinks were, again, served about 1 hour before landing.  Both were quite sufficient and satisfactory.British Airways undoubtedly win 'service-wise' on this route whilst Egyptair qualifies as an acceptable second.  However, the service on their Boeing 738 was somewhat different (as I experienced on the return sector).
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We were split on making a decision on whether to fly with Egypt Air, however as we like trying different airlines and giving each a chance of providing a quality service, we thought the same of Egypt Air.

Our flight was from Bangkok to Cairo to Madrid, Spain. What an epic journey, and one to forget.
The booking in process was the same for any other airline, smooth and fast, however, when booking the flight we couldn't reserve a vegetarian meal as there was no meal option available. We did ask the check in desk and they said for some flights, this isnt an option, so couldn't reserve any non-meat menu.
We ate before boarding as we knew there could be a small chance of receiving a non-meat menu on board. Boarding was pretty hectic with hoards of people boarding the plane like it was a free for all flight.

The initial part of the flight went well with everyone settled and pretty quiet, as we thought this would continue during the early hours of the morning, however then the passangers started shouting, getting into small groups around each other and having a great time at the expense of other passangers who were trying to sleep as it was around 3am. However the loud people thought it would be nice waking everyone up and making sure no one could sleep, the airline staff did nothing to seat the people even though the fasten seatbelt sign was on.

The staff were obviously under pressure as most of the groups were guys and the staff didnt want to have any potential problems, so the other passengers like ourselves had to suffer a long flight of noise and disgusting toilets that looked like they were used by a bunch of pigs with water all over the floor inside and outside the toilet.

Meal time was even better with the staff serving meals to everyone at such a slow pace because the noisy passengers were very demanding with ordering drinks and more food and trying to keep their small groups together blocking the aisles.

Recommendation
Fly Aeroflot or someone else, save yourself the sleepless flight and pay a little extra.
Egypt Air should control these situations and ensure quality is maintained for their clients, and ensure noisy groups are controlled and silenced. Quality and cleanliness of the toilets should also be maintained during the flight, as this is probably the most disgusting flight I have personally been on where the toilets have been unusable with the floor flooded with water.
Improvement is always good including constructive criticism.
qwuub: Probably the worst Middle Eastern Airline
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Great airline (understand that Egypt is proud of is national carrier). Already on the ground in Cairo very friendly greetings from staff. Security in Cairo is a bit over the top perhaps. But still, all done in good humour and that really does make a difference. Plane clean and all features of my business class seat worked perfectly. Welcome drinks and a nice menu. Good rest on the longhaul flight. Excellent food and service throughout. Arrived well rested. Ground security procedures at JFK also over the top, this time with no good humour at all. And that made me feel quite happy to return to Cairo. Egyptair is my first choice for flights from Europe/US to Africa. This is how travelling should be, and the ticket price was very competitive also.

Title:
I recently flew business class with Egypt Air from Bangkok to London, one of my reasons was an Egypt Air specially offer.

I must admit that I was a little apprehensive about the flight but was very pleasantly surprised at Suvarnabhumi Airport lounge which certainly matched my usual airline’s offering.

Boarding was easy and uneventful and the business class cabin was well appointed with comfortable chairs and large TV screens although the choice of entertainment was not as wide as it could have been. Of course, alcohol was not available but as I gave up alcohol many years ago this did not concern me at all, although I can appreciate that for many this might be a disincentive to flying with Egypt Air. The cabin crew were courteous and attentive. Food was acceptable and soft drinks were available on request.

There was a 2 hour-stop over in Cairo here the lounge was small but clean and well-appointed and two hours passed fairly quickly. I was disappointed that the duty free area seemed to be closed for the night.

The second leg from Cairo to London was just as comfortable even though the plane was an older model than the BKK to Cairo leg.

We arrived on time and went through the onerous London entry checks with tolerable ease.

I would use Egypt Air again and would recommend them to anyone.
qwuub: Comfort in the Skies with Egypt Air
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I travelled using Egyptair for 6 times " "Hurghada & Saudi Arabia" in the last 6 months.
I can say the overall experience is good the pilots were excellent , the rest of the flights crew were very good & helpful.
The food was very good on each flight i had "They only provide drinks in the internal flights which is good as some Airlines didn't offer anything for the internal ones".

My main concerns about Egyptair are 3 things:

1) The first one with the staff in the boarding, they are not professionals plus they lack of the communication skills & how to deal with customers as I had many problems to add my frequent flyer on the flights then I had to send emails later on to get an advise then i got a feedback that i have to wait for 15 days to add them using their portal which is another problem with the customer service agents who are responsible to answer & help anyone.

2) The second one when send them email & there was no one response for a while even when i was escalating & they responded to my requests only when I send them on twitter account asking for their help.

3) The third one maybe related to the first one which is the customer service team as you have to call them using cell phone no land lines & I called them twice asking for help & i didn't get anything from the two representatives.

Title:
I Flew Economy Class last days of June 2017, going from Athens to Bahrain. You stop at Cairo and change planes, holding about 4 hours at Cairo before on to Bahrain. This starts as an about 7PM depart ATH, and ends in Bahrain about 3 AM. As in most "red eye" flights the air crew feeds the passengers early and the plane flights are mostly "lights out".

The good: The airline baggage policy is liberal for an economy class flyer. The seating arrangement is adequate with none of the nasty "pay more for 4 CM of extra leg room, or a 2 CM wider seat, passenger fare gouging charges" that far too many airlines have concocted lately.

The food was edible and recognizable - a decent standard for red eye flights anywhere.

Crew cabin service was professional, prompt and alert.

The only actual "not so good" is NOT about Egypt Air, but specific to this flight. There is a not much for anyone, what-so-ever to do with hours on your hands at Cairo Airport. Food services are scarce and pretty much bottom of the barrel, with limited seating while you wait. At late night the airport is mostly just closed up shops.

Summary: The flight(s) were fine, service professional. Because it was the best (shortest delay) set of interconnections available on ATH to BAH I have used this flight several times. It is a decent value.
qwuub: Decent Flying Value for The Price
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The best way to fly to Egypt these time is taking Egypt Air. The service is fair and the flights are mostly in time. Title:
Going from Toronto to Cairo I found the flight not bad, tbh. The food was excellent and piping hot! The staff were nice and I did not require their help at anytime during the flight, and I saw that they were always available to help other passengers. The seats weren't the best and I was lucky that the person in front of me didn't recline. As for in-flight entertainment, there weren't screens at every seat; just some scattered around the cabin. There 8 music channels, and 1 was in English.

On the way from Cairo to Toronto, I was very pleased to see that we were on a Boeing 777, which made for more comfortable seats. As before, the food was very good and I was happy to see screens for every seat! There wasn't a large selection of movies, but it was a damn sight better than what was available on the flight from Toronto to Cairo!

Still, I would not hesitate to fly with them again!

Title:
Unfortunately I have to fly with EgyptAir quite a lot as this is the only decent connection I have to places I have to visit for work. I have experienced a lot of airlines, from top-end to low-cost, and this must be one of the worst airlines I have ever flown with.

1. Leaving aside the rudeness of staff at Cairo Airport, staff on board of several flights I have taken were very unfriendly. One episode concerned being ordered(!) by a flight attendant to close the window blind. When asked why (in a friendly manner) the answer was "because you must". I have also never experienced having to wait for 20 minutes for the washroom because 4 flight crew members needed to use them for own needs and cut in line without an apology.

2. EgyptAir is the first and only airline where I have experienced the plane starting driving towards the runway while passengers were still finding their seats - again flight crew was clueless.

3. If you are a StarAliance member and want to claim your miles - be ready not to get them.

4. Finally, I understand this is not everyone's priority, so this is a last comment - this is a dry airline with only choice of Pepsi or juice on board. Last flight I took - there was only choice of apple juice or water on board.

If you have a choice, do not fly with EgyptAir and it is a shame for StarAliance to have such an airline spoil their reputation.
qwuub: Not sure how this airline is a part of Star Alliance
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I always find the customer service to be the best thing about Egyptair. The crew are always friendly and professional, and the main reason why I would prefer to use Egyptair over BA on the same route.

My only criticisms would be that Egyptair seem to have put the 737 aircraft on the Cairo to London route. Although the aircraft is ok it is far less superior than the 777 aircraft which used to be used on the route. Four and bit hours is a little long with limited in flight entertainment and no electronic devices.

Also Cairo airport isn't for the faint hearted. Airport security is intense and a bit of a scrum though I guess this is out of the airlines control, maybe allow plenty of time to clear all the security hurdles though.

This was my first long flight and I was worried about the leg room and comfort specially that I have back issues and I was flying economy class but I was surprised by the comfort of the flight.
Flight took off 30 mins late due to heavy traffic in CAI but arrived at the exact arrival time.
Take off was good, landing was bumpy (will talk about it in a bit), crew members are very friendly in a way that made me thank their supervisor for their efforts. The crew members kept checking on the passenger from time to time, and I personally needed medication that they provided me instantly. Also during the flight a passenger had a medical issue and all of the sudden I found almost half the crew helping her including the captain. And not only that but also after she was treated and everything was OK they kept checking on her from time to time and they were well prepared and well trained in handling this case.

Entertainment system was up to date and found most of the new movies on the plane, along with the classics. However the series section (Arabic and English) needs to be updated cause you find only 2 or 3 episodes of each series.

Bathrooms was clean during the whole flight which was a concern to me in such long flight.

Meals are good not the perfect meal but it's OK.

Check-in process took a little bit of time but was acceptable in CAI and the online check-in saves you a lot of time.

One of my bags were damaged and I opened a complaint with Egypt Air through their website and they have contacted me the next day to check for the damage and the needed compensation, and they kept updating me with all the steps of the compensation till I received the bag value back in Cairo.

Another note, boarding at the gate itself takes a lot of time due to the security check (again) that they do before entering the gate. With such huge plane and large number of passengers it takes a lot of time.

Overall experience is good and I will definitely fly on Egypt Air again specially that this is a direct flight which I prefer the most.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
It was first time for me to fly by EGYPTAIR. On 8April 17 our flight was at 8 pm, so we came to the airport at 5 pm. The Air port authority did not allow us to enter the Airport. We came to know that due to Haboob (sandy wind) the flight is delayed for unknown time. Then we had been waiting outside the airport. When we contacted the Information desk they said still they dont know when the flight will fly. Finally they said us to come at night 3 am. We came at 3 am and could checked in with the next day morning flight. Our boarding card was changed. During this period they did not provide us any water or food or accommodation. They finally started 8:30 am on 9 April 17. 12 hours time wasted for nothing.

While coming back from Cairo to Khartoum, the same misfortune happens. This time it was 18 hours delay. But in Cairo, they provided us some food, drinks and water.

Very bad experience. It seemed to me that they save their money by combining their two flights together.
qwuub: They did not value the customer
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I traveled with my elderly parents business class on Egyptair business class to have a comfortable flight as I just had a heart issue. The three business class seats were defective and the flight attendants tried to help but in vain! They explained that the plane used to travel to the gulf and kids played with seats and no money to repair.... Unacceptable excuses of course. They handed me a form to complain which I have filled and handed back but of course no response back! I wrote emails to the "we care" costumer service who responded asking for more details and finally responded after few weeks saying "the flight attendant reported that they changed your seat" imagine 3 seats are not working and we talked to 3 different attendants including the chef and they come back with such a response not even a sorry!!!! I travel frequently and never met such situation on any other airlines. In a normal airline, they compensate you and apologize with Egyptair they lie and not even say sorry!!! I canceled my return ticket and will never travel or recommend it for sure. Also on business after few hours I needed to take my medication so asked for snack and the flight attendants looked to each other as if I am asking for mysterious object and handed me a small piece of cake after internal discussion on what a snack:). Really an experience that I never had before on economy not business!!!!

Title:

Several words about meals on board - over roasted oily potatoes full of cholesterol not a healthy meal for breakfast. Stewardess was old - around 60 years old, always chewing gum, may be because of that she made lots of mistakes during announced stuff. Toilet on board was not hygiene.

Title:

Title:
This route and airline was chosen at very short notice and essentially on price, whilst remaining within the Star Alliance group. The experience was surprisingly good.
As a regular business flyer with Etihad it fell down on some aspects of what I consider my yardstick. The food was not planned when I wanted it, the food service was all at once and not course by course and the flight is dry...but the question is did this matter?
At £600 less than Etihad, the food was acceptable and tasty, the range of juices perfectly acceptable and the most important reasons for business class, the space and the bed, were OK. By using early on-line check-in it was possible to ensure we both had aisle access seats, and the space was perfectly acceptable to provide an pleasant flight. The beds sadly do not recline, only to about 170 degrees, but the comfort of the seats was excellent, which somehow overcame the lack of a flat bed.
Business cabin staff are older than most airlines, but very pleasant and helpful.
One concern...my partner had ordered gluten free food which was supplied by the airline, but was not at all inspirational, being three identical G/F salads at one meal. The staff clearly did not understand the significance with a gluten free meal and the medical issues surrounding thev condition. The continual offers of bread rolls (despite G/F bread having been provided) was surprising, and there was clearly no understanding of the risks which contamination may cause.

In Cairo we had a significant stop-over and a hotel with no charge for visa was immediately provided on demand, with a limo transfer promptly arranged. We liked this with a tour of the pyramids and Sphinx...quite a memorable extra to the trip.

Overall they were good and, given the price, I'd certainly use them again.
crvsd: Dave S wrote a review Feb 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Checking in Toronto, smooth. He did not mention use of lounge in Toronto. Flight to Cairo was smooth. The plane is old but sleeping was comfortable as the length of extended seat was quite adequate. Dinner/Breakfast was good. Took about 2 hours after arrival to get transport to Hotel, as we were transit. Novotel was not a good choice but it is nice to have a transit visa done by Egypt Air. Flight to Mumbai was uneventful. The Business Class seats are like premium economy seats. Flying back from Mumbai was terrible. There was a used blanket on our seat and a request to get blanket was initially ignored. She came back saying no blankets from Business Class section. She got them from Economy Class. Very unprofessional. Service was at its best terrible going to Cairo. Again a long transit stay. Hotel accommodation at Triumph Hotel was nice but cold and uncomfortable room. Took one hour to make temperature comfortable. Getting back to Toronto was fine. Nice lounge in cairo. No major issues.  I would not take Business class from Cairo to Mumbai in future. Waste of extra money.

Title: This was my first time travelling with Egypt Airways, and to be honest I was not expecting much as it is known to be an economy airlines. I was flying transit from Amman to Cairo and then from there to Sharm El-Sheikh. Both flights were late. The flight from Amman to Cairo was not too full and so there was a lot of space since there was nobody in the exact seat next to me. The plane was really clean and the staff were very nice. I was sleeping and they woke me up to eat. The food is simple , no hot cooked meals. On the flight back to amman, it was cold pasta. It would be nice if the meals were hot especially in the winter. There was not on-board entertainment, but I did not mind as I needed to catch up on sleep. The flight from Cairo to Sharm was an hour late as we were on the 8 PM flight and they had merged the 8PM flight and 9PM flight together as they called the other passengers to come to our gate. This was inconvenient as we were a whole hour late, so that the Airways would not have to send out two planes that were not entirely full, but I guess that is how they keep their tickets cheap and affordable. The staff were very helpful and I would fly with them again, but I hope they improve in terns of timing.
crvsd: Lama Obeid wrote a review Jan 2017

Title:
EGYPTAIR demanded that all luggage was wrapped in plastic foil before accepting customers for check-in at OR Tambo airport. For safety reasons they said...
Anyway, I advise to check-in 24 hours in advance online. It'll make the process at the airport a bit shorter(not much though)
Flights never leave on time so calculate a delay on arrival (watch out for your connecting flights !).
No alcohol on board (at least not in economy), food's not great, breakfast really sucks.
In flight entertainment isn't impressive and lots of seat are broken(don't stay up-right). Crew isn't very strict about passenger behavior so prepare for chaotic situations.

Title:
After taking several flights with EGYPTAIR I've experienced that they never depart on time. There's always someone late, wanting to change seats, etc ... crew apparently accept this behavior so flights get delayed...
Apart from that you get most of what you can expect from flying in economy these days.
Food wasn't great (but I guess that's subjective, as always).
Be sure to have your luggage wrapped in foil at the airport before check-in . EGYPTAIR frequently demands luggage to be wrapped ...it'll save you time during check-in.
Oh yes : no alcohol available on EGYPTAIR flights (at least not in economy).
