Title:
This airline seems a bit old-fashioned but that's exactly what's great about it. They don't crunch as many seats as possible as it seems to be the new trend, but rather keep a very nice leg space. I'm 1.85 meters tall, and this has been so far the best flight I had in terms of room between the seats. I could seat without having my legs touching the next seat and sleep comfortably when the seat was reclined. Furthermore, the seats have these nice headrests consisting of two flaps on the side that you can bend and keep your neck straight when you sleep.
Food-wise, you have many meal options during check-in, including vegetarian, low-fat, kosher, halal, etc. I didn't pick any restriction and the food was decent. My girlfriend went for the low-fat one, which she found to be very good.
They also keep these nice little touches like giving you a bag with fly socks, toothpaste, sleeping mask, etc.
Perhaps the most negative part was the layover at Cairo, where things seem a bit too crazy. Even if we were taking a connecting flight, we still had to go through 2 more security controls that moved extremely slowly. Furthermore, on one of them they separated men from women, having the men going first, which was not pleasant to experience.
crvsd: German K wrote a review Jan 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I booked a ticket with them, on my way back to NY the flight was delayed for more than an hour causing me to loose my connection to Washington Dulles Airport. I had to rebook the connection and unfortunately the first available flight was the following morning. I had to spend the night in a hotel, I kept looking for their representative to get a hotel voucher from, but  no body was there. I had to pay for the hotel myself. I e-mailed them to get reimbursed, and they refused as the connection was not with their airline. It is the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard. Title: Flew Egypt Air within Egypt, and they are fine to fly. However, they did the baggage handling for Middle East Airlines, and lost my bag. It was a big problem for them since I had my boarding ticket but no baggage claim ticket. Finally found the office in another terminal, and they were really helpful. Someone sent me downstairs to this filthy part of the airport to make a claim, and then he abandoned me when I was down there. They did put in the information into their DOS computer, and I thought I'd never see my bag. Did get email 4 days later that it arrived, but I had no workable wifi and I couldn't abandon my tour. You have to call from 10-4 each day to check on the bag, but no one picks up. Can only retrieve bag from 10-2. Last day I got there early to get my bag. Had to give passport to a stranger, pay them 20 Egyptian pounds for the police, and then wait for our group of 7 to go look for our bags. One guys had been lost a week and it was still lost. I did find mine, and they took our bags and had the police search them. I don't know why since they'd had mine for a week. When I thought baggage handler was going to return my passport, I opened my wallet. There was a dollar sticking up, and he grabbed it. Guy stole a dollar from me. He had my passport so what could I do? Between losing my bag and injuring my foot chasing down the bag on the first day, I had a miserable vacation and won't be returning to Egypt.
crvsd: Lisa A wrote a review Jan 2017
qwuub: Flight was fine. Baggage handling terrible
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We flew from Bangkok to Budapest with a connecting flight in Cairo. We flew business class from Bangkok to Cairo but there is no business class from Cairo to Budapest. The seat on the business class was very uncomfortable. You can't really convert it into a bed because the legrest cannot be set to a horizontal position. It is a leather seat so you keep sliding down. The amenity kit is basically a plastic bag, and no ear plugs are provided. Staff is not helpful and rather cocky. When I asked for a coffee, I was told to wait for breakfast. When I got coffee later, it turned out to be tea. In Cairo we had to pay for the lounge regardless that no business class was availabe to our final destination, and we flew business class there. Staff was again impolite and unprofessional. They don't care at all. All in all they are nowhere near KLM or Air France or Alitalia business class services. We will not fly with them in the future.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
On both occasions that I flew on this airline the flights were delayed. The first time by more than an hour and the second time by over 2hours. The delays were not due to technical issues but because of them needing to load cargo and baggage. The second delay caused us to miss our connecting flight. When I explained to the hostess that the 2 hour delay would leave us very little time to make the connecting flight and asked for assistance to get us off the plane first, she was totally disinterested and in fact ignored the request.
What makes it worse is that they are aware that the flight will be delayed but still get you to board and then you sit on the plane waiting for the baggage to be loaded.
The seating on board is cramped and the crew serve the meal on board and coffee or tea as quickly as possible thereafter they switch off the lights and you are left in darkness until 2 hours before landing when they serve breakfast.The on flight entertainment is also limited and outdated.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flying Egyptair is really all bout the destination you fly to. Apprently, now that I flew to their Homebase, I have to adjust my earlier opinion. That was, flying to NBO quite OK. The experience I had last week isn't nice.
The evening before departure date I checked in online, printed boarding passes.
Everything packed in our 2 hiking bags and went to the console to print the luggage label
(only 1 piece 13kg luggage for 3 pax)
The security check is abolishing ! Eventhough w are experienced travellers and did NOT BEEP when passing the detector, somebody fysically had to touch our bodies, which feels you are treated like a criminal. WE DID NOT BEEP.
Having a boarding pass and labelled luggage I wanted to drop off quickly.Not working. I was forced to stand in line, because they wanted to check my passport.
Thus completely nullificating the of the checkin online + console printed luggage label.
Once aboard (which takes AGES because all travellers ignore HANDLUGGAGE size regulations) you are bathing in Moslim Prayers which is in my opinion completely NOT DONE for a Star alliance member. Other people around me felt uncomfortable, I was rather disturbed by this.
Friendliness of staff was OK. No entertainment aboard. It's a short flight so i didn't bother much, but than : please do not promote your inflight entertainment is you do not have any.
The seats were worn out on this 320.
Floors in toilets always super wet and sticky. Don't know what happens inthere....
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I have travelled with Egypt Air numerous times, however, my first experiences were bad but as I travelled with Egypt Air more the level of service I received gradually improved and I must say when I used Egypt Air in July, I was shocked as it was as if I was on a different Airline! The service was good as the crew was very friendly, the food was mediocre (the best food I have eaten was on a Saudi Airlines flight to Jeddah in 2015) - the food that was served on this flight was some rice with chicken which was juicy and tender and not like the dried up, overcooked remnants that you would find on other middle eastern airlines.

The cleanliness of the Aircraft was good and the crew was consistently made sure the toilets were kept clean. Even though it was a full flight the crew managed to tend to anyone need service and reasonably quick too! The in-flight entertainment was decent as they had the latest movies on selection.

Considering the food, service given and overall quality of the aircraft I would certainly travel with Egypt Air again and for this I rate this Airline a 7/10

Title:
I am deeply anguished with the attitude of Egypt Air and its insensitivity. I was travelling from Cairo to Mumbai on 27th Dec 16. We had earlier informed our tour operator to arrange for Vegetarian Meal or Hindu Non-Veg (Only Chicken and Fish allowed, but no Beef or Pork) food. However in the flight we were rudely told that they have limited stock of Chickens and can only provide Beefs. This is highest degree of insensitivity. Can they dare to ask Muslim passengers to eat Pork? One can easily imagine the reaction from Muslims if such a thing ever happen. Finally I managed to get Chicken meal. Food quality was of lowest order. But more than the food quality, I want to condemn the insensitivity towards religious feelings. This is unpardonable. I am seriously thinking of writing to the Civil aviation Ministry of Government of India to bar this airline from operating in India.
I have already filled up the feedback form with my experience in detail and handed over to the flight attendant. Waiting for their apology. If they don't apologize, will think of the next move.
qwuub: MOST INSENSITIVE AIRLINE ON EARTH. SHOULD BE BANNED.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We have flown 3 times but the very last one it was a nightmare.

The first two were ok, the seats were not that comfortable though but they were smooth flights in all.

Cabin cleanliness was good and lavatories were like any other airline I've flown.

The crew were polite and friendly.
Smooth take-offs and landings however Cairo Airport remains a dump as far as I'm concerned and leaves a lot to be desired, though I hardly think that's Egyptair's fault at all.

The third trip though, from Sharm el Sheikh to Cairo we left with a delay but that was minor compared to the rest of the trip.

The cabin was so hot and nothing could be done to have it fixed on air.

Throughout the flight we had the feeling that something was wrong and we could not enjoy the flight at all. There were times that it was so hot that we could not stand it anymore.

Everybody was worried and scared. Personally, I will never fly with them again. I don’t trust them!
qwuub: The third trip was a nightmare! Hot air in the cabin...

Title: I am a Canadian living in Africa and no had recently traveled from Uganda to London with Egyptair.  The flight was fine, nothing to write home about, but to problems.  Egypt Air is a points partner with Air Canada.  I gave Egypt Air my account number for Aeroplan points when I bought the ticket.  After my flights, I was only credited with the return flight, not the outbound one.  I contacted Aeroplan, who contacted Egypt Air and I received confirmation of my points being credited for the outbound flight.  One week later, I received another email telling me my request for points was denied because of the class of the ticket I bought.  In fact I still have the credit for the Inbound flight.  Communicating with Egypt Air about this is next to impossible.  I am not impressed with this so called "partner" of Air Canada.

Title:
I'd done a ton of research about flights to South Africa and at the end of the day it came down to a choice between Turkish Airlines and Egyptair. We chose Egyptair as it was cheaper by about £80 per person and we ended up paying £475 return each which we felt was pretty good. The layovers in Cairo were nice and short, just 3 hours maximum each time and the departure and arrival times were convenient too.

Flights themselves were pretty basic. Food was fine - I ate everything but the lack of alcohol was a bit tough. We did have some miniatures with us but as no ice or tonic was served the lukewarm gin and sprite wasn't that great.

There were no delays at all although there was some confusion at Johannesburg where the checking in staff insisted on us getting our luggage wrapped (due to thefts we assume) and this meant queuing twice for ages which was annoying.

In flight entertainment wasn't great but we both had books we wanted to read. One of the flights didn't have seatback screens.

I think next time I'd probably pay a bit more and we'd definitely think about direct flights although they are way more expensive. For this trip Egyptair was fine and no regrets about using them.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This was the first time that my wife and I had flown EgyptAir internationally and only did so as this was one of the options provided by Aeroplan for our trip from Toronto to Johannesburg.

We were both very pleasantly surprised. Our first leg, a 10-hour flight from Toronto to Cairo, was in business class on a Boeing 777-300. It's a 2-2-2 configuration and we had tons of space all around us. There was a couple flying with a baby on the other side of the cabin and they were able to put a small bed (provided by EgyptAir) on the floor in front of them, with space to spare. The plane was very clean, the seats were comfortable, and the food was good. The cabin crew were pleasant and quite efficient. They could be a little friendlier (don't wake me up to eat), but we had no real complaints whatsoever. Note, however, that this is a "dry" airline (which we knew prior to our flights), so one has to be somewhat creative if one wants to enjoy wine or other liquor during the flight.

Our second leg, from Cairo to Johannesburg, was an 8-hour overnight flight on an Airbus A330-300. This was also a 2-2-2 configuration, and while the seats were much closer together, we still had sufficient room to stretch out on the lay-flat seats. Again, the plane was very clean, the seats were comfortable, the food was good, and the cabin crew pleasant and efficient.

Overall, we had a very pleasant experience on both legs of our trip. All of their crew (airport check-in, cabin crew, pilots) were cordial and efficient. I would definitely fly with EgyptAir again and definitely in business class.
crvsd: Ralph M wrote a review Nov 2016
qwuub: Pleasantly surprised and would fly with EgyptAir again
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The Egypt air itself is not bad, the flight is comfortable and service is okay though no alcohol. Crews are nice as well. The people who are in that accommodation desk think us if we are travelling free or us if you are a illegal immigrants. They will let you wait for approx 2 hours for you accommodation and when you get the paper from there, they will take you out from the airport, hotel transport will pick you up, the transportation process is not bad. But when you arrive at hotel you have to wait for another 1 hour to get a room. The worse I faced was in hotel Novotel, when I went to have a meal they didn't allow you to buffet. They will ask you to sit in another sitting area and the waiter will put as much as rice and chicken and serve you, this is the worse part. I asked the waiter that how did you know that I eat rice and chicken because I am vegetarian. They said that it is a set meal for Egypt air passengers. I had a bad experience and I noticed they dealt very badly particularly with African passengers. I will never fly with this airline again and if you are not transiting in Egypt than its fine otherwise, avoid it. Fly by British Airways.

Title:
I almost took the business class upgrade for around $300 usd. However when I went online to make the purchase it was no longer available. Lucky me - since the flight was 3/4 empty.

I was able to secure the entire middle row - GREAT! I can lay down and sleep the 9hr route. Wrong.... Egypt Air fixes the arm rests in the center so you can't lay down. It must be the craziest thing I've seen... Makes no sense.

Additionally people were allowed to:

- Keep there legs out across the row so you effectively couldn't get to the bathroom
- Keep their window open at 'night' so you have bright light shining in

Add in annoyances like:

- No in-seat entertainment, just an Egyptian movie
- No water allowed on board - for 9 hours I had exactly three small glasses of water (and had to ring for one of them) - talk about dehydration
- Inability to adjust the headrest on the seats
- Totally average to sub-average food (I ate none of it, just picked a few pieces and went hungry)

I did my research beforehand (I thought) and they have a good safety rating (er.. except..) and I got a good deal on the flight. However I didn't understand I'd have to sacrifice basic / standard flying comforts and be treated like cattle.

Not to mention I had to go through no less than THREE full security checks to board the flight (meaning 3 x-rays, 3x opening suitcase, 3x taking off shoes and belt etc)... No water on the plane - really guys?

Never again.
qwuub: Don't pay alot, don't get alot
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We flew from LHR at 22-30 hrs on 07th September 2016 to Cairo and changed to internal flight to Luxor arriving at 0715hrs.
The aircraft was clean and the crew were excellent, we had a meal provided on board which we found adequate ( Seafood ) and plenty of tea/Coffee and soft drinks provided during the journey.
There were no problems with the flight itself and when we landed in Cairo the change to domestic flight and terminal went smoothly. We had pre purchased our visa`s so no problem there, BUT......Be prepared for extra stringent security , particulary before you board the internal flight, But it`s better to be safe than sorry and arrive safely.
We found the Legroom was sufficient and you were not cramped and the seats were comfortable and they also supplied small pillows and blankets for your convienence on all their journeys both night time and daytime.

Title:
First although not necessarily Egyptair's fault as with many airports outside the US and Europe you must pass through "security" before you even check in. However if they wanted to change the process being the airline of Egypt they could, but as with everything in Egypt it is just the way things are! It is disaster and actually unsafe if you are worried about flying on a plane with no security. Its also a giant scam that the Egyptian police take part in right in front of you! You pay the guys wearing light blue t-shirts and they will shove other people out of line and push their luggage off the X-Ray belts for you. So nice! If you go with that process while stressful you will get through sooner. They also totally block the lines with luggage carts and use their bodies to stop the majority of people not paying them right in front of the police this happens literally right up to the scanner.

However everyone's luggage is going though stacked on-top of one another, shoes, bags, people arguing, the police not paying attention or doing their jobs, and the guys supposedly watching the x-rays are reading or texting, so its all a bit of a scam that's a giant pain. Watch your things if possible coming out the other side as they just get dumped all over the floor and people are just taking things. You have to be aggressive or you wont get in!

We tried to avoid the fun above as we arrive from Luxor on Egyptair the same morning as our flight Egyptair Dubai flight departing in a couple hours. But unfortunately we had to collect our luggage in Cairo and re-check it as that's how Egyptair does things as told to us by the not friendly agent in Luxor for Egyptair, thus making the above "security" a giant pain thank you Egyptair.

Once we battled our way throught "security" we checked into our counter and unfortunately we were changing to Emirates in Dubai so Egyptair said we would have to get our bags again in Dubai and re-check them. So efficient. Anyhow fortunately it all worked out.

But that experience and my previous days experiences getting to Luxor from Cairo which takes 1hour was not so pleasant so I am not in love with Egyptair. No one gives a s..t is their motto!

Enjoy!
qwuub: Beware of leaving Cairo on Egyptair!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I booked Egypt Air purely for the price as they were the cheapest airline flying to Johannesburg. The flight from London was comfortable and there were plenty drinks and as usual the food seems to be served after hours of waiting. Good meals and a choice of two, beef or chicken. The stop over in Egypt was only an hour and a half so not too bad. It's always strange how the airlines choose the planes for the connecting flights as my plane from Egypt to Johannesburg seemed to be and older model. The flight itself was comfortable but the service wasn't great. I had to buzz the steward twice and she still took her time to arrive. The food was late, and after a period of time the staff disappeared. I think they all went to sleep. The staff looked miserable and unhappy and it felt as if the passengers were more of a burden. I'd rather they pretend to be happy, as their unhappiness was pretty obvious. And how about employing younger ladies, presentation is everything. If you after cheap prices and don't mind crappy service then it's worth booking Egypt Air, but if there was a choice of cheap prices with some of the top airlines, I would certainly book that.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flew Egyptair roundtrip from London to Sharm El Sheikh, with a layover in Cairo. The whole experience from booking the flights to getting on the plane was unpleasant - customer service is terrible. About two weeks before my flight, I get an e-mail saying that our flight from LHR to CAI was cancelled and we would be moved to an earlier flight - 8 hours earlier! This became an issue with my hotels, as we now had to book an extra night, which normally wouldn't be a big deal, but we had bought air & hotel together in a package. When I tried to change my flights to a day later or at least get them to cover a night hotel, I was told "This is not our problem, do not call here again with this issue.". I tried to sort it out again when I got to London (we were coming from the US), but I was told again "This is not our issue." Eventually, it got sorted, but it was extremely unpleasant.

As for the actually flights, the first was ok. We flew on an A330 from London to Cairo, which seemed to be in good conditions. The flight attendants were slightly more pleasant then they were on the phone, but I guess you cant expect more. The food was decent when compared to US airline food (but that is a low bar to leap over), and the inflight entertainment was pretty good. Our second flight from Cairo to Sharm was on a very old 737. The interior was faded and browning, seats didn't work, and it smelled. Our flight back from Sharm back to Cairo, we were on a poorly maintained regional jet. I am shocked we actually made it alive. The plane would rattle every time we hit a bump, there was a crack in the exterior window at my seat, and like the first plane, many seats didn't work. Our last flight with Egyptair was from Cairo back to London, on the same A330 that we took going - so it was ok.

All that said - try to avoid if possible, but not the worst if you can't. Just know what you are getting into.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I am a frequent traveller who travel every 3 to 4 weeks to different locations,

I have used the following airlines during my flights and will recommend them based on my preference:

1- Egyptair

They provide two pieces of luggage in Economy, they usually fly on time
travelling in the morning from Cairo and returning afternoon planes are really big comfort with proper entertainment.

The Food is not the best, I will rate it as average however I use a trick to book special meet e.g. seafood from London, then the food is amazing as it seems they have to cater it in heathrow not egypt.

2- BA my second favorite:

the seats are not as comfort as Egypt Air but the food is better, also they take complains seriously not like Egyptair, e.g. my luggage was replaced once due to damage in heathrow and I was once compensated money for delay more than 4 hours.

3- Lufthansa

I got it more than once in short durations to Europe, e.g. Dusseldorf through frankfort
it is fine, just fine and no entertainment.

4- Turkish

they didn't do anything wrong, but I just didn't like it

Title:
After the total loss of MS804 in May we were apprehensive about the reliability and maintenance of Egypt's national airline; in fact we wished that we'd chosen another airline with a better safety record.
However, we were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the planes and the efficiency of our transfer to Johannesburg via Cairo; our luggage arrived on the carousel at our destination without a hitch, which is more than I can say for the appalling American Airlines. Furthermore, the cabin crew were polite and professional (unlike AA who are extremely rude and arrogant) and the quality of the in flight refreshments was excellent and very tasty. There was ample leg room even in economy and the seats were comfortable. The choice of in flight entertainment was a bit limited when compared to other airlines, but on a 'red-eye' flight this was hardly an issue. The Muslim prayer for a safe journey that was played on the seat-back screens just prior to take off didn't inspire much confidence, but in retrospect I would definitely fly with Egyptair in the future.
qwuub: Better than expected; much better than American Airlines!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: London to  Cairo with Egyptair. It seems completely ok continue using your phone during take off, play the safety video while you are taking off (which I couldn't hear due to noise of engines), have your seat reclined etc. They even let passengers get up and go to the toilet when the plane is queuing for the runway. I joined the plane as a business class passenger, sat in my seat and was asked to check my ticket - not sure why, nobody else was asked to prove they were in the right seat. We then sat for nearly an hour (including 30 minutes delay) where no refreshments were offered. When they were finally offered, by the time they got to me, there was just an orange juice and it was as if I was expected to take this drink when the other guests were offered choice The plane was ancient for a 5 hour flight and the seats even had ash trays as well as broken seats and TV screens. Really average flight, zero customer service and not something I'd repeat. I've had better economy experiences

Title:
Egyptair are a GREAT airline to fly with and I would very HIGHLY recommend them every time.
OK, their prices may be a little higher than flights on Thomson, Thomas Cook etc but when you add up all of the 'extras' Egyptair actually works out quite reasonable.
Firstly, the price of your luggage allowance is INCLUDED and you get a fantastic 46 kg allowance (2 bags @ 23 kg each).
Secondly, leg room is a lot more spacious and comfortable.
Thirdly, all drinks are free, although Egyptair only serve soft drinks, no alcohol at all.
Fourthly, you et a free meal and a choice, usually, meat, chicken or fish and vegetarian option can be pre-booked.
Finally, the service on board is efficient, staff are friendly and accommodating and each seat is provided with a pillow and blanket to ensure the passengers comfort throughout the flight.
I have flown with Egyptair on many occasions and have always had a comfortable, stress free journey.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: When friends heard I was flying on Egypt Air they were a little surprised. Unfortunately, Egypt Air has had some bad publicity of late. But if you want to get to Egypt and fly about inside Egypt, this is the way to go.  We were on a huge wide body from New York to Cairo.  Tons of movies to watch and there were enough empty seat so that we could spread out and nap.  In any event, the meal were better than most, the service was better than most and the security at Cairo was the tightest of any I have ever witnessed at any airport.  I also took two small flights within Egypt.  One to Luxor and then from Abu Simbel to Cairo.  Smaller planes, but same great service.

Title: I only flew this airline on a roundtrip from New York to Cairo.  On the way there, it was packed to the gills - there were people everywhere.  The plane was very animated (people were talking loudly, but they were not arguing. I think they were just excited).  There was a meal, but I cannot recall what it was.  I stayed awake the entire flight (I never sleep on flights).  When we landed, it was a little unusual as we got off on the side of the runway.  On the way back, the plane was basically empty.  I had a whole row to myself and again I stayed awake.  Even with the few people that were on there, the flight was still kind of loud (but not enough to annoy any one - I hope).  There was one child that was screaming but she soon calmed down and fell asleep... probably from pure exhaustion.  We experienced a lot of turbulence and the staff was very nice.  The landing however, made me a little wary of using them again.  We came in at a steep decline (I literally had my feet on the floor to prevent me from sliding forward). When we actually landed we landed at an angle (I am not kidding we landed left side first and then the right - I felt like we were riding K.I.T.T. from Knight Rider).I have not used the airline since, but I might.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Title:
When flying as an expat from Cairo to Brussels with all our stuff and 5 cats ... yes we had 5 cats with us and it is totally normal and possible ... we had a very poor experience at Cairo Airport, this is probably the worst airport I have ever been, altough Jeddah was also disastrous ... but as soon as we boarded the flight these horrors seemed like a bad dream.
Egyptair is right up there in the rankings with all other major national airlines and they offer great service to their guests, food was server nicely on time and clean, no hassle to sell and multiple visits to ask if we needed something to drink from water to tea or coffee, free of charge, a very nice break from the constant hassling for tips that we were used to when living in Cairo, even Security staff at the airport was more chasing foreigners for tips than actually perform the tasks of a real Security Officer.
The flight seemed pretty normal and despite the fact that a few weeks later an Egyptair A320 like the one we flew crashed I still believe Egyptair is an overall SAFE company that follows international laws and standards. Relieved to see this when everything else in Egypt doesn't!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
At check in, we were informed of about 40 minutes delay, which ended up into being 1 hour and 40 minutes delay - as usual without apology or explanation.

The sound system was totally out of service (no radio, no music...).
The movie displayed was the same as the flight from Cairo to Barcelona (Batman vs Superman).
There are no blankets available on the plane, and the pillows were not enough for passengers who requested it.
Being the only airline with direct flights to Barcelona, I had to take it. It was not cheap; Cairo-Paris-Barcelona-Cairo was cheaper, but with more connections.
Only advantage is weight; they are very generous if your bags have extra weight.

Title:
The tickets were VERY CHEAP, but I cold have had similar rates with QATAR or ETHIAD.
The crew was friendly, the food was not bad at all, but the condition of the plane was unacceptable: many seats not working (leaning back because they could not block in upright position), a overhead compartment door would pop open every now and then as it could not lock shut, the bottom of one or our seats was worn out creating a hole. The plane was near full, so there were no options to move to. At the back there were a few rows of fee seats, but the crew told me this is reserved for "tour" passengers... Whatever that means? Later I found that people where using 3 seats to sleep there. Good for them, but not so good for the passengers who had only one seat and it was defective. And last but not least: in 2016 an intercontinental flight with no individual screens...
For the connecting flight to Paris (MS799) the airplane was newer and they had the screens, however only one of the 4 seats we occupied had a working entertainment system, the other 3 would freeze every few minutes requiring restart of the movie/music: so basically unusable.
Sadly we have to fly back with the same airline, but that will be my very last time with EGYPTAIR.

Title:
Previously I have had no complaints when travelling with Egypt air, however, on this occassion, Egyptair have gone down in my estimation. Probably because of the low demand in Egyptian tourism, they are now putting on smaller aircrafts which have shabby worn seats many of which do not sit properly in the upright positions and they have a very nasty odour. The company seem to have no problem letting Egyptian passengers take on copious amounts of hand baggage thus filling up all the overhead lockers before 50% of the travelers have boarded. My friend and I were seated to the rear of the plane and we slowly made our way to the back of the plane whilst being held up by passengers trying to squash large amounts of luggage into small spaces. Finally, we made it to our seats only to be told that we would have to make the journey back to business class in order to store our one bag each. Needless to say, we were not offered seats near our luggage so we then had to proceed on the slow journey to the back of the aircraft once more. During this time the aircraft was unbelievably hot and stuffy, however, as soon as we took off the cabin instantly became very cold. Being a night flight most carriers offer blankets but not on this plane. The only evidence we saw of a blanket was wrapped around two members of staff who were sleeping across the three back seats on each side of the isle!!!
Of the guests on board there were just a handful off foreigners (maybe ten at most) and the rest were Egyptian. We noticed that the cabin crew were helpful to their own whilst we were left to struggle reaching into the overhead compartments to retrieve our bags.

In conclusion, I paid £411 for this one way flight and I truly believe I did not get value for my money. Based on this experience I would certainly think twice about traveling with Egypt Air in the future!!!
crvsd: Doreen H wrote a review Aug 2016
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Egyptair is another airline that has room for improvement. As a National Airline they should have higher standards both concerning their flight attendants and service.

The crew themselves were not 'on the ball' when it came to the safety procedures on take off and landing. Having been crew myself for 4 years for a British airline, I am quick to notice anything not done, ie: not checking seats in upright position and window blinds up for take off and landing,
The main meal service was edible, but the crew were not that friendly on most flights I took with them.

Title:
This review will not go into details and mention names, but it will just stick to the facts. On December 2016 I traveled from Athens, Greece to Bangkok, Thailand via Cairo with my wife. We returned early the next month.
When we arrived at the Eleftherios Venizelos (Athens International airport), we could not find one of our four suitcases. We had made a stop at the Cairo Airport and from there our suitcases where supposed to be transferred to the next airplane along with us. They told us that they were lost for some reason and that we had to fill out a specific form. Our trip was long and exhausting and now we had to stay standing in some line, who knows for how many hours, in order to do the “proper” paper work.
We canceled the transfer we had arranged from before, since we didn’t know how long this would take. Till now this seems something ordinary which happens almost every day to some airlines. Well, I am convinced that this is not the case, and that our suitcase was left behind on purpose, in order to facilitate some “function” which only this specific airline knows about. I am absolute positive that they left our suitcase behind on purpose since: a) I wasn’t the only one that lost my suitcase that day, the same thing happened to about 40 other passengers and b) miraculously ALL of the suitcases were found and send to our homes the very next day, each and every one of the 40 passengers! There’s no way that all of them were lost and found the next day, but nevertheless this is the “official” story from the airlines representatives on the destination airport that evening.
My problem was that I had forgotten inside the lost suitcase my homes’ door keys. Since I couldn’t know how long it would take to retrieve my suitcase and keys (there was no guarantee from the airline’s side), I rushed to find a lock smith as soon as we reached our home (by the way, it was getting very late). Thankfully we did find one but we had to spend about 3 hours in the cold staircase with all our other suitcases and of course we had to pay him a considerable amount of money for his services and our new lock and keys.
I consider this airline fully responsible for my adventure, so during the following days I wrote and send a letter (via email) to the airline’s head offices in Cairo. I got the proper email address after I contacted their offices in Athens first and requested initially an official explanation about my lost suitcase incident and furthermore I also requested a compensation for my expenses (locksmith-lock). I also forwarded copies of all the official documents (luggage handling documents and locksmith’s invoice) in order to explain my case in a clear manner. I have waited for one entire month, but there was no reply. I forwarded the email once more just to be sure and I waited for 10 more days. But still nothing from the other end. As a final attempt I called their Athens offices again and requested to speak with the “one in charge”. So I spoke to a lady and she just suggested to forward my email to her so she could have a look at it. She also assured me that she would try to do her best, although she mentioned that she “didn’t think that anything would happen” and eventually it would be very hard to get my money back. It was worth the try, but it turned out to be true, so nothing happened and I never got my money back, nor received an official explanation or apology. This is what bothered me the most, no one didn’t even bother to call me back for what happened that day.
If I hadn’t placed my keys in my suitcase (the first and last time I did this foolishness), I wouldn’t have bothered perhaps to write this review. I guess things like this happen to low prestige (and not only) airlines all the time. It’s the fact that they ignored me that made me still remember this unfortunate incident (after 8 months) and not to the fact that we had to pay 16 USD for a fast-food burger at the Cairo airport. But that again is another story…

Title:
I recently flew from LHR-CAI return. I would really advise allowing a lot of time at the airport before your flight. The check in was pretty chaotic at LHR with very long queues, in fact the queues were so bad people were cheering when they called the next person in the queue forward for checkin and despite arriving two and a half hours before my flight I only had 15 mins in the departure lounge before my flight was called.

The plane itself was very nice with better in flight entertainment than you would normally find on a similar medium haul flight. The cabin crew on both flights were absolutely amazing. They were very friendly and really worked hard to make everyone feel welcome, chatting and exchanging jokes with passengers. Definitely one of the most friendly crews I've seen with any airline.

A major issue was the time taken for luggage to arrive in Cairo. We waited around 1 1/s hours for our luggage to arrive, which meant I arrived at my hotel very late and didn't get much sleep before business meetings the next day. My hotel's shuttle driver suggested the delay could have been caused by the fact I was travelling on a public holiday and that though the wait is normally long, it is not normally that long.

The checkin for my return flight in Cairo for the return flight was much smoother than at Heathrow. Again though I would allow plenty of time at the airport though as security is very tight and it took me around two hours to pass through all the security and immigration checks. I didn't really mind as I would prefer to be safer.

I would definitely fly with Egyptair again in the future!
qwuub: Excellent service but allow plenty of time for the extra security checks!

Title:
This is my second trip with Egypt Air and I am very disappointed with the lack of service. We were travelling with a 2 month old infant and were never offered to board the plane early. The airline staff at the gate made announcements very late and did not board passengers in an orderly fashion (by row # or zone). The gate was chaotic to say the least. Once we departed late and were in the air, the staff never informed us which washrooms had a change table, or even set up the bassinet for us (we had a bulkhead seat). We had to ask for both.

There were plenty of kids on this flight and mid-way two of the washrooms ran out of soap and paper towel. Kids had made a huge mess in the bathrooms with toilet paper everywhere and the staff did not attend to it, clean it up, or restock the bathroom. One child even vomited in the aisle and the flight attendants did not clean it up. The smell was absolutely terrible.

The staff did not come by often to offer even water, and did not attend to the call button when pushed. During taxi-ing, a couple of the flight attendants were busy texting on their phones instead of helping the passengers get buckled up.

I will not be travelling with this airline again. It's worth it to pay a bit more for better service and efficient check-in and boarding.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew in to JFK on American Airlines and they were late, so I missed my international flight on a Friday. I ended up being stuck in NYC over the weekend, waiting on the next flight out on Monday. Thankfully, I have family and friends in the area, so I didn't go broke on hotel fees (American Airlines refused to cover anything).

When I realized I wasn't going to be at JFK in enough time, I called EgyptAir to explain and to find out if there was anything they could do to help. Unfortunately, because of my baggage being on the incoming flight with me, they let me know there was nothing they could do. But, they told me I should come to customer service and try to make sure I could get on the next flight out. I was also made aware of the $300 change fee (that I maintain American Airlines should have covered) that I would be expected to pay.

I got there too late on Friday and called back (not customer service's number by the way). I was told a window of hours to come during the next day to change my flight and I did. Once the customer service guy heard me say I missed my flight with them because my American Airlines flight was late, he looked up the flight and told me he would talk with his supervisor to try to decrease the change fee. I ended up being charged $150, which was awesome.

Two days later, I returned to the airport 3 hours early. I had my baggage wrapped with plastic ($15 per piece) and then went to check in. At the counter, I heard the EgyptAir employee say something about window seats to another customer, so before I left, I asked about mine. I'd marked window seats, but hadn't been given them. The woman helping me quickly made the change for both flights and with a smile.

Boarding the plane was painless and the flight was smooth. I had a 12 hour layover in Cairo (which I took full advantage of) and boarded my second flight with the airline, this time headed to my final destination. This time, I had the great luck of getting on with the Egyptian national soccer team and meeting their players (including one that plays professionally). Since I'm a soccer fan, this was an awesome bonus for me. The team was actually headed to play Tanzania's national team.

The attendants on both flights were very nice and the food/drinks were pretty good. However, the plane for the first flight was a better plane as I was able to charge my devices while we were flying. Not the case with the second flight (which seems to be the norm on intercontinental flights) and is the ONLY negative I have to say, which isn't much of a negative. :-)

Overall, I would definitely recommend this airline to others and because of their awesome prices, will also fly with them again myself.
dmrsr: New York City - Dar es Salaam
qwuub: Great Flight & Awesome Employee at JFK

Title:
We took 2 flights connecting at Cairo, both were delayed, one was delayed for 1 hour and the other for half hour, both for no announced reason.

At the check in, we were asked to change the check in desk several times, because of system issue, and they were playing games without respect to anyone, as if travellers are sheep that are being herd.

The on flight entertainment systeme is as none, the seats were old, hence they were wide enough and somehow comfortable.

The transit time at Cairo was terrible, we had to wait for immigration officer as he was sleeping somewhere, and we were connecting from domestic to international, after he came, he asked us to fill some forms which we were not told about, extra delay.

The service men in the airport are acting like beggers, they ask you for money and help after you use the toilet or any other service, even when they clean the garbage.

The food court area, are dull and smelly, we went for one of the branded fast food restaurant to ensure cleanliness and standarisation, but we were mistaken for sure, the taste was not nice, and despite we were hungry, we couldn't finish our food.

The questionable safety record of EgyptAir is definitely due to this kind of behaviour, will I use this airline, definitely not in the near future, people learn from their mistakes, luckily we didn't learn the hard way!!!

Title:
I usually prefer Egyptair for a number of reasons, being located in Cairo, Terminal 3 (the home base for Star Alliance) is much better than the older Terminal 1, it's my country's carrier and it's generally convenient.

I travel to London on business on regular basis, Egyptair has two flights one is on 737 the other, which I took is usually on a 777 or an Airbus A340. This was the first time to try the 777 and I was more than happy with everything.

The in-flight entertainment content was really up to date, the music selection was simply surprising, given that I'm very picky when it comes to music. Food variety and quality have improved dramatically and for the first time in a few years, an amenity bag in business class in Egyptair and it was very adequate and Chopard, wow!

All I can say is keep up the good work and I know that more can be done and that the magnificent experienced people at our flag carrier can do it.

Title:
This is a collective review for the last several international & domestic flights, over the course of 2013 - 2015, all of which were in Business Class.

Having read other contributors' reviews, I reckon I must be extremely lucky, in that, I've actually had excellent experiences on all of my recent flights with Egyptair and their domestic subsidiary, Egyptair Express.

Whilst the outside of the windows may, inevitably be scratched (I wonder if this is a result of abrasion caused by sand?), the cabins themselves have been clean &, generally, well maintained.

Legroom in international, short - medium haul - J-class puts most European airlines to shame; I'm not that short at 5' 9", but I struggle to reach the footrest on the back of the seat in front (all recent international flights have been on their Boeing 738s), whilst the seats themselves have been of ample width (proper business class seats rather than normal seats with the middle blocked off).

In-flight entertainment, whilst not on a par with that offered by 5 star airlines has offered a more than adequate selection of films & documentaries for whiling away a 4 - 5 hour flight.

Food is a vast improvement over that offered, even 6 years ago, & is served on proper crockery, with knives, forks & glasses - nice white table linen & all. Sure, it's not up to the standard of, the excellent, catering found on their Star Alliance partner, Turkish Airlines, but they knocked Lufthansa into a cocked hat in recent years.

Even on the, very short, domestic hops to Upper Egypt, you no longer get just a cheese sandwich and a cake, served on plastic trays, but a 3 course snack (salad, open sandwiches & desert), served on the same diner service as used by mainline flights.

Admittedly, the food, welcome drink & extra 10kg baggage allowance are, pretty much the only extras gained for flying domestic business. The seats are exactly the same for both classes on domestic flights and there's no IFE, but this follows the increasing trend amongst European carriers & is no real issue for a flight that lasts only about 1 - 1.5 hours.

Crews have been much more attentive than many report, doing regular water runs & not just disappearing to the galley for the whole flight; many have been smiling & seemed anxious to make a fuss of what seemed to be the only foreign passenger on some domestic flights.

As for it being a dry airline, much though I do like the occasional drink, I'm not going to get up in arms at having to endure a few hours making do with, rather pleasant, fruit juices.

I also quite like the reading of a verse from the Quran that is played before international take-offs, which sort of puts you in the mood for where you're going.

Baggage allowances, with the exception of the, newly introduced, "economy light" fares, referred to elsewhere, is generous in the extreme, at 2 X 30kg for international J-class, but do be aware that, if you break your journey, for a stopover, this is reduced to 1 X 30kg, for the domestic flights. However, it is possible to prepay for an additional bag, online, at a reduced charge to that due when paying excess baggage fees at check-in.

I don't criticise airlines for delays, as these are often the result of factors outside their control, related more to airport operations, than the fault of the airline.

Customer service, certainly from their Kensington office, has always been most helpful and efficient.

The only problem I've actually had in recent years is that of flight consolidations, due to low domestic PAX numbers, resulting from the dearth of tourists. Whilst often causing last minute changes in pre-booked transfers, at the destination airport, which can be frustrating, I'm realistic enough not to expect an airline to operate a near empty flight.

Overall, I would recommend Egyptair as a carrier for those visiting the country.
qwuub: Multiple Flights with no Issues & Notable Improvements
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We're used to it now, but after take-off, the cabin crew seem to have a seat at the back and are not seen for the first hour or more, so we buy water etc. after security to take on board.
This was economy - I wouldn't pay for business, which I've done two or three times -not worth the price differential
The overhead screens are quite far away if you get the Emergency Exit rows.No seat-back video here
The B737's are getting a bit tired, the youngest in the fleet being at least 4 years old and others, up to 10 years, but it is the only direct flight to Luxor.
We also discovered we had a new class of ticket "U" which didn't give us the 2x23kg each we have had for the last 10 years. Fortunately we had flown BA down to LHR so only had one case each along with hand-baggage anyway.
If I had a choice of airline, I would use the other choice, but it's a monopoly.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Title:
Well Ive flown this terrible Airline several times, unfortunately cheap skate Companies now only use cheap Airlines.
The business class seats are probably the worst I have ever sat in, backrests that fall back when you try to recline; tray tables that are damaged loose and unsafe.
Entertainment system is from the Ark and the sound quality is atrocious.
Food!! Best take your own!
Drinks!!! Why an earth in this day and age do you have an Airline that dosent serve alcohol.(please no-one say its for religious reasons)
The best is still to come!
They make you listen to a prayer before you take off "Are you Serious"
Then to top it all they want you to roll up your blanket and place it behind you back for Landing, for anyone thats not aware! Thats the crash position OMG
Good Points!!! 'It Landed"
Top tip, get to an Airport Bar and spend a lot of money, before you subject yourself to this Airline.

Title:
First time trying this route via CAI from FRA to CAI. Was really better than I thought and the price tag was half of a direct flight at time of booking.
Aircraft was full on the leg from FRA to CAI but then from CAI to JNB it was only half full. Obviously due to off-peak season.
Anyhow the plain was OK in condition and the service plus food good for economy class. The entertainment program had a lot of choices also in German language.
Stopp over time in CAI was OK in terms of duration not to be in a hurry and be sure that the luggage does stay back.
Only make sure that you do the leg from FRA to CAI also with Egyptair and not with LH to have two pieces of free luggage which is quite nice for economy class.
Service personnel was OK, nothing special.
All in all very good value for money. Will do it again.
crvsd: Volker K wrote a review Mar 2016
qwuub: A real alternative to South Africa from Germany

Title: We flew to Nairobi for a safari, 4.5 hours flying time either way.  There was no in-flight entertainment or power plugs.  The seats were small, and many, including my wife's, were broken and would not stay up. The flight crew was good, and the food was also good, however the pilots flew in a way I described to a friend as "Fly it like you stole it."  A lot of hard banks, sharp climbs and descents and heavy heavy brakes.We didn't pay a lot, and didn't expect a lot, and low and behold got what we paid for.  Just be aware before you book.

Title: I travel to Egypt from London quite regularly and if there is a choice of airline, generally take Egyptair as the times of the flights are more convenient (not too early in the morning or too late at night).  Seats and service fine.  Food is hot although not spectacular it is generally edible (which is what you need).  Plenty of juice, tea or coffee (I'm not a drinker of alcohol myself so don't miss it at all).  Free headset and cushions and blankets provided at every seat before you board.  My last two flights have departed incredibly late (hey, thanks President's wife earlier this week for keeping us trapped in the departure lounge for an extra hour....) but been able to make up the time en route so that we arrived as planned.

Title: Modern terminal, lots of security, courteous check-in, modern plane, attentive staff, true to schedule--what's not to like? One might quarrel with the absurdly long bus trip to the plane in Cairo but that's unimportant.

Title:
Small Embraer 170 plane was probably half full. Good legroom in economy altho seating laterally a bit tight - minimal elbow room for two people esp if you wanted to read or work. Cabin crew were efficient getting the food and drink around but unhelpful with passenger enquiries - e.g. which type of immigration card was required.
Limited soft drinks selection. Food was largely worst kind of airline food outside budget airlines - rubbery chicken, some sort of salami concoction, plastic cheese and tasteless breads.
In-flight information from cabin and crew almost non-existent.
Prompt departure from LCA and arrived on time. But plane stood on tarmac at Cairo for 15 mins until the door was opened as the bus to transport us to the terminal had not arrived - maybe more the fault of the airport authorities than the airline, but no explanation given by the crew which just frustrated people.
Not an experience I'd be in a hurry to repeat, other than the prompt take-off and arrival

Title: We had the same size plane flying to Luxor and flying back from Cairo to London, it is totally unsuitable for a 5 hour flight, seats are very small, and extremely uncomfortable. Flying to Luxor all staff were courteous and helpful, unfortunately on the return trip from Cairo to London it was a very different story, the plane was almost full in economy and about 6 people in business/first class. I needed the toilet and there was a queue of around 10 people for the toilets at the back of the plane, because I have Crohns disease, I went to walk down the plane to use the one at the front as no one was waiting to use this one. I was stopped by a member of the crew that was not working but a passenger on this flight, he told my husband we had to use the toilets at the back as the one at the front was for the 6 people sat in first class, I had my need a toilet card but the crew member wouldn't even acknowledge I was even talking, he just kept saying use ones at back. He was rude and aggressive, even the Egyptian gentleman sat next to us said we should complain, they then tried to lie saying the toilet at the front had a queue, when you could clearly see there was no one using it . The aircon above the seats didn't work so it was over hot and a lot of people felt dizzy, a few asthmatics on board had to use their inhalers as the staff sprayed the cabin. It a shame that this is the treatment people get from Egypt air, it doesn't exactly make people want to visit the country. I for one will not be using Egypt air again. On a good note, the food was very good, and the female crew were polite.
crvsd: Paula C wrote a review Feb 2016

Title: I booked online & found it easy to do, receiving fast & clear options throughout. A couple of days before my flight i received an email confirming the flight details & giving me the option to check-in online, I did this as i thought it would save me time at Heathrow.... however i don't think i would bother with this again as everyone else had the same idea & it would have been quicker just to go straight to the desk. The booking had a generous 23kg baggage allowance included at no extra charge. The hand luggage was 8kg instead of the normal 5kg (also helpful ). Food is also included free...amazing! The food was lovely, hot and enough of it ,including hot & cold drink. The seats were comfortable for both myself & daughter who is 6ft ( we didn't book extra leg room seats ). In flight films were played......another nice touch as some of the flight companies ceased showing films a few years ago! The staff were polite ,helpful & considerate throughout. All in all i would recommend this flight company without reservation.
crvsd: Marian W wrote a review Feb 2016

Title: This flight was on an A330 from London to Cairo.  It was a very pleasant flight experience with comfortable seats, good seat pitch, and a decent entertainment system.  The plane was relatively new, clean, and everything worked well.  The food was of decent quality and taste and the flight attendants were friendly and generally had a smile.  Their baggage service seems to be pretty good; they were able to make a quick transfer of my luggage when my flight arrived late.  I should note that it's pretty easy to connect flights at the Cairo airport; the signs are in English and the different gates are well-marked.  In addition, there are several places to eat and grab a beer at all hours while waiting for a flight.
